description: SCHWETZINGER, West Ger many The names of Teresa Berganza, Janos Starker, Phil ippe Entremont, Benita Val ente, the Tokyo String Quarter, the Mainz and Prague chamber orchestras, and four theater groups, including the Piccolo Teatro, Milan, glittered from the billboards announcing the 20th anniversary andfor the time being  last three  week festival in the beautiful halls and gardens of Schwetzingen Palace, near Heidelberg.

title: Planning Body Opens Citywide Hearings
description: Like latterday Daniel Boones heading out Wilderness Road, the entire City Planning Com mission opened a new frontier last night, going to Long Island City for the first of 62 com munity public hearings through out the city.

title: Halliburton Co.
description: Net income of the Halli burton Company advanced to $11,002,165, or 64 cents a share, in the quarter ended March 31, the company an nounced yesterday. In the com parable period a year ago Halli burton, an oilindustry service concern had profits of $9,613, 546, or 56 cents a share. Reve nues rose to $290,435,899 from $208,237,019.

title: CITY SCHOOL AUDIT ASSAILED BY STATE
description: ALBANY, May 4The New York City Board of Education's audit bureau has been given a failing grade by a team of state and Federal auditors who examined its methods of re viewing some of the $123.5 million the city received in the 196869 fiscal year for special programs for the educationally deprived.

title: Griffith Outpoints Lopez In Las Vegas 10Rounder
description: LAS VEGAS, Nev., May 4 (UPI)Emile Griffith, the for mer middleweight and welter weight champion, preserved his chance for a shot at a sixth world title last night by scor ing a 10round decision over Ernie (Indian Red) Lopez of Los Angeles.

title: Old Pacific Battleground Wins SelfGovernment
description: SYDNEY, Australia, May 4 The tiny Gilbert and Ellice Is lands, a string of idyllic green atolls where the United States launched its successful offensive against Japan in the Central Pacific in 1943, have been grant ed almost complete selfgovern ment by Britain.

title: Jersey Officer Dead in War
description: WASHINGTON, May 4 (AP) The Defense Department said today that Capt. John F. Dugan of Roselle, N.J., of the Army, had been killed in the war in Southeast Asia.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: SOVIET CONCEDES A COMPUTER GAP
description: MOSCOW, May 4A high planning official conceded to day that Western countries were substantially ahead of the Soviet Union in the production of advanced computers, but said that his country was seeking to narrow the gap by concen trating on the development of a few standardized models, thus sharply reducing production costs of data processing equip ment.

title: U.S. CITIZEN ADMITS HE SPIED ON POLES
description: WARSAW, May 4 (AP)A weeping naturalized American pleaded guilty today to spying on Poland, telling his military jurors amid sobs I have al ways felt a Pole.

title: Kennecott Payout Cut Hit;
description: Sales, earnings and dividends of the Kennecott Copper Cor poration almost were lost from view at the concern's annual meeting here yesterday, while the ecology and other social matters stole the spotlight in a series of questions and state ments from minority stock holders.

title: BOND YIELDS RISE TO PEAK FOR 1971
description: Highgrade bond yields climbed yesterday to the high est levels they have reached so far in 1971.

title: SOVIET STRESSING BETTER U.S. TIES
description: MOSCOW, May 4Top So viet officials have told Ameri can diplomats here that they have been ordered to try seri ously to negotiate agreements with the United States, reliable sources said today.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
The Dance: Judith Jamison's Triumph
description: For years it has been obvious that Judith Jamison is no ordinary dancer. She looks like an African goddess and her long body has an unexpected gracefulness to It, but it moves in a manner almost more elemental than human. Her face is fantastic.

title: 3 Italians Score FirstRound Upsets In Tennis at Rome
description: ROME, May 4 (UPI)Young Italian players were the sur prise today in the first round of the Italian international ten nis championship.

title: Mediators Intervene in Gasoline Strike; Violence Flares on 4th Day of Dispute
description: Federal mediators intervened yesterday in the fourdayold strike that has reduced gasoline supplies in the city and sub urbs.

title: Mayday Tribe Introduces New Element to Protests
description: WASHINGTON, May 4 They came into the dawn like a ragamuffin army, handker chiefs around their necks for the gas, uniformed in a motley of dungarees, field jackets and hiking boots, most of them with long hair.

title: VIEWS ARE MIXED ON BANK REFORM
description: WASHINGTON, May 4 Richard W. McLaren, head of the Justice Department's anti trust division, said today that there is such a mixture of ad vantages and disadvantages in permitting officers and direc tors of other corporations to be directors of banks that he does not believe a categori cal law should be written on the subject.

title: Injured Ankle to Keep Unconscious Out of Preakness
description: BALTIMORE, May 4 (AP) The field for the $150,000add ed. Preakness was reduced by one today when Unconscious was withdrawn because of an injury.

title: Legislated Arbitration Urged in Public Disputes
description: The president of the Ameri can Arbitration Association, Donald B. Straus, proposed yes terday the use of legislated arbitration to help meet what he described as the crisis in collective bargaining in public employe disputes.

title: Nixon Praises Workers Who Stayed on the Job
description: WASHINGTON, May 4 (AP) President Nixon repeated today his commendations of the police authorities for their handling of the antiwar pro testers and praised Govern ment workers who stayed on the job.

title: Expansion Predicted
description: WASHINGTON, May 4 (UPI) The man generally regarded at President Nixon's chief economic adviser said today the recent bull market on Wall Street probably means a smartly expanding economy over the next two years.

title: Pintos Vegas Skip Two Five Challenge
description: About Motor Sports

title: PEKING CHARGES U.S. INTERFERENCE ON TAIWAN ISSUE
description: HONG KONG, May 4Com munist China accused the Unit ed States Government today of hostility to the Chinese peo ple and of brazen interfer ence in their affairs by con tinued support of the Chinese Nationalist regime on Taiwan.

title: St. Joe Minerals Corp.
description: A sharp decline in net income was reported by the St. Joe Minerals Corporation for the quarter ended March 31. The company reported earnings of $4,303,641, or 51 cents a share, compared with $9,646,035, or $1.12 a share, a year earlier. Sales eased to $47,636,903 from $50,336,113.

title: S.E.C. INQUIRY ASKED ON ABBOTT TRADING
description: Representative Charles A. Vanik charged yesterday in a House speech in Washington that there was insider trading in Abbott Laboratories stock on March 12, the day before the Food and Drug Administration announced it was ordering Ab bott to halt most shipments of intravenous solutions until a contamination problem was cleared up.

title: PANTHER DEFENSE CALLED A FAILURE
description: The prosecutor at the trial of 13 Black Panthers here said yesterday that evidence intro duced by the defendants them selves bolstered the charge that they had conspired to bomb public places and kill po licemen.

title: RECITAL ON VIOLIN BY HIROKO YAJIMA
description: Hiroko Yajima, a petite, Japa nese girl, strode on the stage of Town Hall Monday night, all business, smiled shyly, and then proceeded to play the varnish off her violin.

title: ROCKETS AGAIN HIT U.S. BASE AT DANANG
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Wednesday, May 5 (AP)  Enemy gunners launched their third rocket attack in 12 days on the sprawling United States air base at Danang before dawn today and shelled several other United States and allied instal lations in South Vietnam.

title: Track Tickets on Sale
description: Tickets have gone on sale at Ticketron outlets here for the Dr. Martin Luther King Inter national Freedom Games May 16 at Franklin Field, Philadel phia. The feature of the track meet is a mile race matching Jim Ryun and Marty Liguori.

title: WASHINGTON
description: WASHINGTON, May 4What the latest spring madness in Washington proves, if anything, is that the people are sick of violencethe violence of the war and the mob action of the antiwar demonstrators as well.

title: Undistilled Retrogression
description: A backsliding little bill, which New York City Consumer Affairs Commissioner Bess Myerson correctly called undistilled pricefixing, was signed into law by Governor Rockefeller yesterday. The new law provides for the setting of liquor prices, allowing no retailer to charge less than 12 per cent above wholesale costs.

title: Phelps Leaves Fordham, Accepts Notre Dame Job
description: Dick (Digger) Phelps, who guided Fordham to its best basketball record last season in his first attempt as a college head coach, was appointed head basketball coach at Notre Dame yesterday.

title: Two Indicted as Suppliers of Heroin Mixing Materials
description: A Federal grand jury indict ed two Harlem businessmen yesterday on charges of sup plying heroin peddlers with es sential mixing and packaging material.

title: Pan Am Cites Savings;
description: MIAMI, May 4The 24 giant Boeing 747 jetliners that Pan American World Air ways, Inc., now is flying are being operated at a savings of about 23 per cent, com pared with the 105 smaller Boeing 707 and 727 jets that the international carrier in cludes in its fleet, according to Najeeb E. Halaby, chair man and chief executive of ficer.

title: Ballet: Cranko's Shrew
description: Strange as it may seem, most story ballets, whose principal function is to tell a story onstage, require a program note. Plotless ballets, once called abstract and therefore presumed diffi cult, do not.

title: Lockheed Loan Request
description: WASHINGTON, May 4 (AP) Republican legislative leaders said today that President Nixon was expected to recommend shortly that the Federal Gov ernment guarantee $250million in loans to the financially pressed Lockheed Aircraft Cor poration. If he does, strong Congressional opposition is expected.

title: Zapata Norness, Inc.
description: Net income of Zapata Nor ness, Inc., climbed to $6,945, 000, or $1.29 a share, on sales of $113,945,000 in the first six months of 1971, the company reported yesterday. In the com parable period a year ago Za pata had a loss of $2,818,000, including an extraordinary item of $1,045,000.

title: Advertising:
description: Buchen Advertising, a 47 yearold Chicago shop which got its first New York foot hold by acquiring an agency here in 1963, has just ac quired another New York agency, Handman Sklar Becker.

title: Advertising:
description: About 65 friends of Rich ard V. Benson gathered for lunch at the National Demo cratic Club here last week to help him celebrate his 50th birthday. But it was more than that, really, it was a farewell to New York and that's why Dick Benson was throwing the party.

title: When the Diagnosis Is Depression
description: NEW HAVENBlue. Sad. Down in the dumps. These are some of the words used to describe depression, a disabling emotional affliction that can turn fami lies upside down and cause havoc in the office.

title: Fiazel Scott, Pianist, At the Rainbow Grill With Oliver Group
description: Oscar Peterson was supposed to be playing his piano at the Rainbow Grill for the next three weeks. But when he became ill last weekend and was unable to fill the engagement, an emer gency booking brought in Hazel Scott and Sy Oliver's Orchestra, a pairing that normally might not have occurred but has proved so felicitous that they will continue at the grill through May 22.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: HOUSE UNIT VOTES TO BAR JOB BIAS
description: WASHINGTON, May 4The House Education and Labor Committee approved today a bill to give a Federal commis sion the power to enforce non discrimination in employment.

title: Juilliard's First Outdoor Sculpture Is Agam's Tree
description: With words of approval from Bess Myerson, the city's commissioner of Consumer Affairs, and Isaac Stern, the violinist, the Juilliard School at Lincoln Center unveiled its first piece of outdoor art yesterday.

title: Sharp Rent Rises In City Predicted Under State Plan
description: Rents in currently rentcon trolled apartments here would go up an average of $50 a month, and, in some cases, by as much as $150 a month, if Governor Rockefeller's plan to phase out rent control went into effect, according to the New York City Rand Institute.

title: Shattuck Describes Dissidents as Front For ExPresident
description: The Shattuck Denn Mining Corporation, a building prod ucts concern, charged in a let ter to shareholders yesterday that a stockholders' protective committee attempting to seize control of the company was nothing but a front for the company's former president, Willard La Morte.

title: French Barley and Syrup Hit by Special U.S. Duties
description: WASHINGTON, May 4The Treasury announced today the imposition of special coun tervailing duties on imports of barley and molasses from France, on the ground the products are benefiting from special export subsidy by the European Common Market.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: COSMOS AND DARTS IN SOCCER REVIVAL
description: After a threeyear absence, professional soccer will return to Yankee Stadium in a major league format tonight, without any overpaid players, without television or radio exposure, without unlimited budgets, but with the backing of at least the New York ethnic soccer com munity.

title: Hawks Win in 2 Overtimes, 21
description: CHICAGO, May 4Picking himself off the ice after he had been hacked down by two Mon treal defensemen, Jim Pappin rushed the net, stood his ground and rapped home Stan Mikita's pass for a 21 Black Hawks vic tory in double overtime tonight as the Stanley Cup final playoff series began.

title: U.S. War Dogs Begin Return From Vietnam
description: WASHINGTON, May 4  The Air Force began bringing home its dogs from Vietnam today.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Dayan Charge 28 Overflights
description: JERUSALEM, May 4. (Reu ters)Defense Minister Moshe Dayan said today that Egypt had violated the Suez Canal ceasefire by 28 overflights of Israeli positions since Nov. 22. Mr. Dayan was answering questions in the Knesset (Parli ament).

title: ROGERS IN EGYPT; LACKS ISRAELI BID
description: CAIRO, May 4Secretary of State William P. Rogers ar rived here tonight with no con crete Israeli offer to present on the question of reopening the Suez Canal.

title: Cerro Loses $1.3Million
description: The Cerro Corporation, a major producer and fabricator of metals, announced yester day a firstquarter net loss of $1.3million, the first quarterly loss without extraordinary charges in at least a dozen years.

title: RCA TV Sales Up
description: The RCA Corporation has noted two particularly en couraging developments in recent weeks, Robert W. Sarnoff, chairman and presi dent, told about 700 persons at yesterday's annual meet ing in the Felt Forum at Madison Square Garden.

title: Union Head Accuses A.T.&T. Of Looking for Strikebreakers
description: The president of the 500,000 member Communications Work ers of America asserted yes terday that the American Tele phone & Telegraph Company had told Bell. System, member companies in a letter to re cruit strikebreakers.

title: Honecker Speech Lauds Role of Soviet
description: BERLIN, May 4  Erich Honecker, In his first speech as leader of the East. German Communist party, has praised the Soviet Union as the lead ing power in the international revolutionary process of our epoch.

title: Violence Brings a Change in Tactics of Capital Police
description: WASHINGTON, May 4To the heightened violence of the Mayday demonstrators, law en forcement here has responded with new tactics that modify perhaps purposelythe picture of the District of Columbia police as unfailingly genteel hosts to the nation's dissenters.

title: New Table for Paris Talks
description: PARIS, May 4 (AP)A table tennis set shipped here by Michigan couple in an effort to get the Vietnam peace talks rol ling has arrived and is expected to be delivered to the con ferencesite Thursday. Mr. and Mrs. John Reid of Whitehall, Mich., said they hoped that the gift would be a step toward peace, in line with the apparent thaw after a United States table tennis team visited China.

title: April Car Sales Rose
description: DETROIT, May 4Newcar sales in the final third of April trailed the year before, and while sales for all April topped the 1970 month, the size of the gain wasn't impressive, it was learned today.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: RICHMOND PROPOSES LOTTERY FOR BUSING
description: RICHMOND, May 4 (AP) Richmond's school board pro posed today a plan for a lottery to select children to be bused to classes to achieve racial balance.

title: Bridge: Equitable Life's Victory Ends Commercial League's Season
description: The Metropolitan Commer cial Bridge League ended its 197071 season last week with a pair championship won by Ruth Block and Andy Lohan, representing Equitable Life. Earlier in the month a two session open team contest was won by Ebasco Services.

title: CURRENCY TRADING BUFFETS EUROPE; DOLLAR IS TARGET
description: PARIS, May 4Europe's fi nancial centers were buffeted today by the greatest wave of currency speculation in two years. Corporations, banks and others who control large sums of money exchanged unwanted dollars for West German marks, Swiss francs, Dutch guilders and other strong European currencies.

title: Police Tear Gas Disperses War Foes at Wisconsin U.
description: MADISON, Wis., May 4 (AP) The police used tear gas to night to disperse an antiwar rally at the University of Wis consin after they said burning objects were hurled at a cam pus construction project.

title: TV: A Dazzling Isadora
description: It's not on until tomorrow evening, so don't complain about not having sufficient notice. Cancel all engage ments for dinner, mahjongg or whatever and, at 8:30, tune the television set into Channel 13 and the latest in stallment on the NET Play house Biography series. It's called Isadora Duncan: The Biggest Dancer in the World. It was directed by Ken Russell. And it's smash ing.

title: HILLMAN AWARDS GO TO 4 IN MASS MEDIA
description: Sidney Hillman Foundation ??wards for outstanding achieve ment in mass communications during 1970 were presented yesterday to a national televi sion network, a reporter for The New York Times, a maga zine writer and a former United States Attorney General.

title: DR. ESTHER HARDING, A PSYCHIATRIST, 82
description: Dr. M. Esther Harding, a psychiatrist who studied with Dr. C. J. Jung in Zurich and came to the United States to spread his concepts of psychol ogy, died yesterday in London while, returning from a visit to Greece, according to associates here. She was 82 years old and lived at 88 Morningside Drive and in New Milford, Conn.

title: EDWIN JAY GEIGES
description: MIDDLETOWN, Conn., May 4Edwin Jay Gelges, associate director of alumni relations at Wesleyan University, died Mon day of a heart attack in his car in Worcester, Mass. He was found by a passerby. He was 36 years old and lived in nearby Portland.

title: Nuclear Plants in Atlantic Projected by Jersey Utility
description: NEWARK, May 4New Jersey's Public Service Electric and Gas Corporation is con sidering the construction of at least two nuclearpowered gen erating stations off the Jersey coast within the threemile limit.

title: Mexico Urges the Nonaligned at Geneva To Press Arms Plans Shelved by Big 2
description: GENEVA, May 4Mexico to day urged the 11 other non aligned countries represented at the Disarmament Conference here to revolt against United States and Soviet leadership of the meeting.

title: To Join This Club You Measure Up: To 510, at Least
description: Bad moments can turn up at any time for people who are exceptionally tall. Beds are too short, doorways are too low, and there's always the wag who wonders how the air is up there.

title: Books of The Times
description: THE LIVELY COMMERCE. Prostitution in the United States. By Charles Winick and Paul M. Kinsie. 320 pages. Quadrangle Books. $8.95.

title: ESTIMATE IS GIVEN ON OIL RESERVES
description: Robert O. Anderson, chair man of the Atlantic Richfield Company, told the annual meet ing in Philadelphia yesterday that the company's net proved reserves in the original discov ery reservoirs of the main Prud hoe Bay Field of Alaska held an estimated 1.9 billion barrels of oil and 7.4 billion cubic feet of natural gas.

title: FOREIGN AFFAIRS
description: PORT LOUIS, MauritiusThe name of the game in the Indian Ocean is: The Russians are coming. From South Africa to Australia and from the Persian Gulf to the Malacca Straits there is increasing obsession with So viet gunboat diplomacy. If, as is tra ditional, the purpose of such diplo macy is to unbalance an adversary, Moscow is succeeding.

title: Sperry Rand Corp. Says Profits Fell
description: Sales and earnings of the Sperry Rand Corporation fell in the quarter and fiscal year ended March 31, the company reported yesterday.

title: Strongly AntiRed South Vietnamese Faction Raising a Political Stir in Hue
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, May 2A resurgence of deep anti Communist feeling in Central Vietnam and impatience with what is considered to be lenien cy in rounding up Communist sympathizers are causing politi cal repercussions in the old imperial city of Hue.

title: A President Is Named At Brigham Young U.
description: PROVO, Utah, May 4 (AP)  A 38yearold University of Chicago Law School pro fessor returned to his home town today to take over as president of Brigham Young University, succeeding Dr. Ernest L. Wikinson.

title: ... Depolluting Madison Avenue
description: Any idea that promises to improve the condition of urban life deserves a fair hearing. This includes Mayor Lindsay's proposal to turn part of midtown Madison Avenue into a pedestrian mall, free of automobile traffic and exhaust fumes.

title: Guards Aid Protester
description: WASHINGTON, May 4 (Reu ters)A teenage antiwar dem onstrator arrested by the Wash ington police found help today in raising his bail money from an unexpected source  his guards. The youth had only $4 instead of the $10 needed for bail when he was arrested yes terday. But members of the Na tional Guard contributed the rest of the money.

title: Satellite Launching Put Off
description: CAPE KENNEDY, Fla., May 4 (AP)The Air Force postponed today an attempt to launch a satellite intended to monitor Soviet and Communist Chinese missile launchings. The infor mation came from reliable sources, who reported a techni cal problem. No information was available on a new launch ing date.

title: Greenway Photo Collection Is Sold
description: Signed photographs of the great or famous were auc tioned yesterday, and the re turns testified to the unremit ting zeal imaginative ploys devised by a leading collector for the fruits of this partic ular chase.

title: Chinese May Get Asylum
description: PARIS, May 4 (Reuters) France will not return to Com munist China a technical ad viser detained by the police during a struggle last Wednes day with Chinese diplomats at Orly Airport, informed sources said today. The man, Dr. Chung Shijung, was re ported to have sought asylum at the French Embassy in Al giers before a group of Chinese officials tried to get him aboard a Shanghaibound airliner in Paris while he was under seda tion.

title: Plant Fined for Pollution
description: Federal Judge Walter R. Mansfield fined the Elk Piece Dye Works of Garnersville, Rockland County, $2,500 yes terday on five counts of a 50 count indictment charging the concern with polluting a Hud son River tributary, Minisce ongo Creek.

title: DePugh in Atlanta Prison
description: LEAVENWORTH, Kan., May 4 (AP)Robert Bolivar DePugh, founder and a leader of the Minutemen organization, has been transferred from the United States penitentiary here to the Federal prison in Atlanta. DePugh is serving a fouryear sentence for jumping bond and nine 10year sentences for violating the Federal Gun Con ?? Act.

title: Bronx Student Teacher Attacked By 2 Youths in a Rape Attempt
description: A 21yearold student teacher was the victim of a rape at tempt by two teenaged youths yesterday at Public School 63 in the Morrisania section of the Bronx, according to a Board of Education spokesman.

title: Pakistani ExAide Plans Bangla Desk Office Here
description: A. H. Mahmoud Ali, who resigned last week as Paki stani vice consul here and pledged allegiance to the separatist Bangla Desh re gime proclaimed in East Pakistan, said yesterday he was setting up a Bangla Desh mission in New York.

title: Jersey Routine Goes On Dully
description: TRENTON, May 4Yester day's United States Supreme Court decision rejecting two major challenges to capital punishment hardly disturbed the daily monotony among the 22 condemned men on New Jersey's Death Row here today.

title: CocaCola Company
description: ATLANTA, May 4 (AP)  Earnings of the CocaCola Company for the first quarter of 1971 were the highest of any first quarter In the company's history, said Paul J. Austin, the companys chairman and presi dent, today.

title: Market Place:
description: If you were a major bank operating in a foreign coun try, you might maintain low profile, as they day, just to keep the natives from get ting restless about your role in their economy. And so the giant United States banks have traditionally kept quiet about how much business they do abroad.

title: The F.B.I. Homes In and Gets Its Man
description: WASHINGTON, May 4  There was a note of surprise in an F.B.I. agent's voice as he reported on a Justice De partment radio frequency this afternoon that John Froines was speaking to thousands of antiwar demonstrators  right under Attorney General John N. Mitchell's office window.

title: Sports of The Times
description: Ernie Banks was 40 years old last January; Willie Mays will be 40 tomorrow; Henry Aaron just turned 37. This some what superannuated trio forms the homerhitting aristoc racy among big Ieague ballplayers because they hold the three top positions among all active swingers for distance.

title: State Department Aide Sees Continued Threat by Peking
description: WASHINGTON, May 4 (AP) The State Department's leading official on Asian affairs said to day that Communist China's support of insurgencies and wars of liberation remained a threat to United States in terests despite hopes for im proved relations.

title: Births
description: GOLUBPaul and Marione (nee Jacobson) announce the birth of Gregg and Jay's brother, Mark Adam on Tuesday, May 4th 1971.

title: Ceylonese Report 40 Insurgents Killed
description: COLOMBO, Ceylon, May 4 The Ceylonese Government re ported today that more than 40 rebels were killed and that more than 1,700 surrendered during the fourday amnesty period, which ended this after noon.

title: WALLACE DEFIED BY LEGISLATORS
description: MONTGOMERY, Ala., May 4 Gov. George C. Wallace suf fered a major legislative de feat last night when the Legis lature ended a special session without approving most of the money he had sought for his programs.

title: 9 Senators Ask U.S. Pressure On Pakistan to Spur Relief Effort
description: WASHINGTON, May 4  Nine Senators told Secretary of State William P. Rogers today of their growing concern over what they view as inertia in the Administration on aid to Pakistan.

title: POLICY OPERATOR DESCRIBES BRIBES
description: A former policy operator in the Bronx who said he once employed 35 numbers runners and sometimes personally cleared as much as $5,000 a week testified yesterday that he had paid the police $1,550 a month to insure against the arrest of his wife and himself.

title: A Geoecology Walk in the Park
description: An unseasonably cold wind whipped along under heavy gray skies as Mrs. Peter Bienstock waited, a little nervously, at 67th Street and Fifth Avenue yesterday morning to guide her first ecology walk into Central Park.

title: Notes on People
description: In the midst of explaining that California was so short of cash that it would have to expand its borrowing greatly, Gov. Ronald Reagan said yesterday that he had paid no state income tax last year. (There is no withhold ing tax in California.)

title: HANOI COOL TO PLAN OF U.S. ON PRISONERS
description: PARIS, May 4 (AP)North Vietnam today in effect reject ed a United States proposal that prisoners of war from both sides be held in a neutral coun try.

title: Cardinal Reiterates View on ExGerman Territory
description: VIENNA, May 4Franz Car dinal Knig the Archbishop of Vienna, reiterated his view to day that the Poles in former German territories of postwar Poland had acquired a right to live there by having rebuilt the areas from the ruins of war.

title: CHARLES M. BARNES
description: LOS ANGELES, May 4 (AP)  Charles Wt. (Pat) Barnes, former president of the Dayton. Tire and Rubber Company, died today in a hospital here at a heart ailment. He was 67 years old.

title: YOUTH PENALTIES HELD TOO SEVERE
description: WASHINGTON, May 4A I6yearold boy told a Senate subcommittee today that he had been committed to an Indiana state reformatory for stealing 75 cents, and a 17yearold girl said she had been sent up for carrying dean of beer down a smalltown main street on a Saturday night.

title: EINAR MIKKELSEIV, ARCTIC EXPLORER, 90
description: COPENHAGEN, May 4 (AP) Capt. Ejnar Mikkelsen, Dan ish erotic explorer and Author who joined his nest expedition at age 19, died last night at his home in Copenhagen. He was 90 years, old.

title: Even Flag Is Berkeley Issue
description: BERKELEY, Calif., May 4 (UPI)Berkeley's new City Council was seated today with its three newly elected radical members refusing to recite the Pledge of Allegiance to the flag. Other members of the nineman council and the city's new black activist Mayor, Warren Widener, did recite the pledge, as radicals in the audience shouted Power to the people over their words.

title: NEW BODY SOUGHT IN POLLUTION WAR
description: PRAGUE, May 4Delegates to a United Nations conference on environmental pollution moved today toward establish ment of an international body that would collect, analyze and distribute information and rec ommendations on pollution.

title: Antiwar Move Defeated in Assembly
description: ALBANY, May 4The As sembly took up the issue of the war in Vietnam today, and few members walked out In disgust, some fidgeted rest lessly and most sat mute.

title: 4 YOUNG PIANISTS WILL VIE ON WQXR
description: Four young high school pianists will compete for cash prizes Saturday in the grand finals of the sixth annual WQXR Young People's Com petition. The event will be broadcast that evening at 8:06 over WQXR, the radio station of The New York Times.

title: SCRIBNER OPPOSES VOUCHER SYSTEM
description: WASHINGTON, May 4  Dr. Harvey B. Scribner, Chan cellor of the New York City public schools, announced his opposition today to a proposed experimental voucher program under which parents could buy education for their chil dren in public or private schools.

title: JAMS A. ZINN
description: DETROIT, May 4 James A. Zinn, executive vice president of the National Bank of Detroit, died today of a heart attack. He was 58 years old.

title: SPURS TO ECONOMY URGED BY JACKSON
description: Senator Henry M. Jackson urged immediate measures yes terday to stimulate the national economy with tax cuts and public works and antipollution pgrams to reduce unemploy ment.

title: VIJA VETRA OFFERS DANCES AT CUBICULO
description: Vija Vetra's art is dependent greatly on the precise place ment of scraps and whisps of movement. It is an art of sug gestion and intimation rather than one of blatant or strident assertion.

title: DEMOCRATS HERE TO ASSIST EVERS
description: Several prominent Demo crats were among the New Yorkers who vowed yesterday to raise funds and to conduct a massive volunteer opera tion in Mississippi in support of the gubernatorial candidacy of Charles Evers, the first black man to run for Governor of that state.

title: Placenta Secretion Analyzed in a Study At Boston Hospital
description: BOSTON, May 4 (AP)Re searchers at Boston's Beth Is rael Hospital have announced that they have determined the chemical structure of a secre tion from the human placenta. They say that the discovery could speed the synthesis of the human growth hormone.

title: Most Suburbs Raise School Tax
description: Voters in Nassau, Suffolk and Westchester Counties voted on school board mem bership and budgets yesterday, as well as library budgets and a handful of local propositions.

title: Louisiana Panel Denies Mafia Influence
description: NEW ORLEANS, May 5 The Louisiana Legislative Ma fia Investigating Committee de nied today that the underworld dominated the state government but said there was suspicion of some corruption.

title: Dow Chemical Announces A 3for2 Split of Its Stock
description: MIDLAND, Mich., May 5 The Dow Chemical Company declared a threefortwo stock split today and increased its cash dividend at an annual rate of 10 cents a share.

title: I.M.F. Leaders Discuss Crisis
description: WASHINGTON, May 5The executives directors of the In ternational Monetary Fund met twice today on the new mone tary crisis in Europe, but no ac tion was taken or required.

title: HARLEM PLANT GETS VIOLATION DEADLINE
description: The Fire Department said yesterday that the National Economic Growth and Recon struction Organization (NEGRO) had until May 18 to meet fire regulations on a Harlem fac tory it uses for manufacturing underwear.

title: 4 CITIES ARE TO GET RACIAL HIRING PLANS
description: WASHINGTON, May 5 (AP)The Nixon Administra tion will soon impose racial hir ing plans on construction un ions and companies in Chicago, St. Louis, San Francisco and Atlanta, Similar action may fol low in 15 other cities.

title: Bonn Says It Will Decide By Tomorrow on Action
description: BONN, May 5  The West Germait Government today or dered the foreignexchange markets to close until Monday and it suspended all official dollar dealings in an effort to turn the incoming tide of specu lative money.

title: Awami League Accused
description: KARACHI, May 5 (Reuters) The Pakistani Government said today that news of slaughter carried out by Awami League members in East Pakistan be fore March 25 has been kept strictly secret for fear of re prisals in West Pakistan.

title: Kahane and Defense League Curbed in Brooklyn Dispute
description: Rabbi Meir Kahane and the Jewish Defense League were temporarily enjoined yesterday from violence or the threat of violence on the Brooklyn Col lege campus. The school was the scene of a clash Tuesday between Black and Jewish stu dents after the militant rabbi spoke.

title: What Is a Woman? Teenalters Have Their Own Definitions
description: What is a woman?

title: WILLIAM J. CURTIS
description: William J. Curtis, former vice president and sales man ager for Catskill Craftsmen, Inc., manufacturers of library equipment and a subsidiary of Grolier, Inc., publisher of en cylopedias, died on Friday at his home here. He was 74 years old and lived at 300 East 46th Street.

title: LISBON ASSAILED ON POLICE CURBS
description: LISBON, May 5A large group of prominent Portuguese citizens has publicly denounced continued political repression by the police and the increas ingly grave condition of politi cal prisoners.

title: Eddie Conwell, Sprinter, Dies; Held World Titles at N.Y.U.
description: PHILADELPHIA, May 5Ed ward L. Conwell, who was world champion sprinter while a student at New York Univer sity, died on Sunday. He was 48 years old.

title: BIG LIQUOR STORES ATTACK NEW LAW
description: The head of the Retailers Alliance, an association of 21 major liquor storees in the metropolitan area, said yester day that the group was ex ploring the possibility of filing suit to block the minimum price liquor law Governor Rockefeller signed on Tuesday.

title: U.S. Survey Puts World Outlay For Arms at $204Billion Peak
description: WASHINGTON, May 5The world's military spendingin flated by continuing price in creasesreached a peak of about $204billion last year, the United States Arms Control and Disarmament Agency said to day.

title: Market Place: Memorex Loses On Accounting
description: The Memorex Corporation, a computer peripheralequip ment maker, has had its problems in accounting for its leasing activities.

title: Magnavox Company
description: The Magnavox Company's di versification into new fields is intended to increase participa tion in growth areas, R. H. Platt, president of the Magna vox Company told shareholders at their annual meeting in Fort Wayne, Ind. He said that the company had tentatively achieved a consent settlement with the Federal Trade Com mission involving the compa ny's marketing of consumer electronic products.

title: THOMAS F. MORIARTY
description: WARE, Mass., May 5Thom as F. Moriarty, a copy editor for Newsday, the Long Island newspaper, died yesterday of lung cancer at Mary Lane Hos pital after a long illness. He was 53 years old and lived at 17 North Carll Avenue, Baby lon, L. I., with another home here, where he was born.

title: Slush Slows Traffic in Locks
description: SAULT STE. MARIE, Mich., May 5 (AP)  Traffic through the Sault Locks continued at a slow pace today because of slush 8 to 10 feet thick. A light fog added to the problem. Some 20 vessels were in the upper St. Mary's River awaiting pas sage through the locks.

title: ZIOBRO CAPTURES DODGE GOLF LEAD
description: DENVILLE, N. J., May 5 Billy Ziobro, a 22yearold as sistant pro at Tammy Brook, and 42yearold Babe Lichardus of Shackamaxon took charge of the $26,000 Dodge open golf tournament today.

title: Consecration Held For an Episcopalian In a Catholic Church
description: OMAHA, May 5  An Epis copal bishop was consecrated today in a Roman Catholic cathedral.

title: White House Service Set
description: WASHINGTON, May 5 (UPI) The Rev. John Harper, pastor of St. John's Episcopal Church, across the street from the White House, will conduct Mother's Day religious services Sunday in the White House East Room.

title: The Unconstitutional Budget
description: To all the other opprobrious adjectives that outraged critics have used to describe this year's state budget don'tgiveadamn because it ignores urban needs; doubledon'tgiveadamn because it also relies heavily on borrowed money; dishonorable because it runs out on a promised revenuesharing formulathe State Supreme Court yesterday added another: unconstitu tional.

title: WELFARE REFORM SURVIVES ATTACK
description: WASHINGTON, May 5 The welfare reform legislation nearing committee approval came under fire today from conservatives who want to emasculate the plan and liber als who want to enrich it.

title: Muskie Proposes Revenue Plan With a Greater Share for Cities
description: WASHINGTON, May 5 (AP) Senator Edmund S. Muskie, Democrat of Maine, proposed today an alternative to Presi dent Nixon's revenuesharing program.

title: Room at the Top in Football
description: HOUSTON, May 5 (UPI)  John W. Breen, the Houston Oilers' first employe 12 years ago when he was hired as di rector of player personnel, was named general manager of the football club today.

title: North American Phillips
description: The North American Philips Corporation expects substantial improvement in 1971 earnings over those of last year and is also looking for an improve ment in sales, Pieter C. Vink, president, told the annual meeting In Wilmington, Del. For 1970, the company earned $8,790,000, or $1 a share, on sales of $547,102,000.

title: A 1,198Mile Dinner Date for Less Than $30
description: PORTLAND, Ore.  Kevin Chadwick took his girl friend, Dena Shorey, on an 1,198mile dinnerdate Saturday. They traveled 1,190 miles by jet from San Jose, Calif., to the airport here and eight miles by limou sine and the whole day cost Kevin less than $30.

title: TWINS TURN BACK YANKS AGAIN, 53; CARDENAS EXCELS
description: BLOOMINGTON, Minn., May 5 Stan Bahnsen's back and Leo Cardenas's bat presented the Yankees with two serious problems tonight as they lost to the Minnesota Twins, 53, for the fourth time in five games this season.

title: Books of The Times
description: AMERICANA. By Don DeLillo. 388 pages. Houghton Mifflin. 6.95.

title: REMAINS OF PALACE OF HEROD ARE FOUND
description: JERUSALEM, May 5 (Reu ters)  The first remains ever found of King Herod's palace in Jerusalem  built nearly 2,000 years ago  have been uncovered in the Old City, it was announced here tonight.

title: E.E.C. MEETS TODAY ON DOLLAR CRISIS
description: BRUSSELS, May 5  The Common Market's monetary committee is scheduled to meet here tomorrow to discuss the crisis caused by West Ger many's decision to stop inter vening in foreignexchange markets to support the price of the dollar and to close the foreignexchange markets in Germany.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: N. P. BARABASHOV, 77, SOVIET ASTRONOMER
description: MOSCOW, May 5Nikolai P. Barabashov, a Ukrainian astron omer known for his studies of the moon and the planets, died last Thursday in Kharkov. He was 77 years old.

title: B52 Raids Increased
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, May 5 (AP)  An increase in B52 raids was reported today against targets in the north western corner of South Viet nam and the Ho Chi Minh Trail in Laos.

title: Connecticut Soldier Killed
description: WASHINGTON, May 5, (UPI) The Defense Department an nounced today that Specialist 5 Christopher J. Neale, of the Army and from West Haven, Conn., had been killed in action in Southeast Asia.

title: Nixon Proposes New Legal Aid Unit
description: WASHINGTON, May 5  President Nixon called on Con gress today to immunize the Federal legal services program against unusually strong po litical pressures by reestab lishing it as a new, independent public corporation.

title: Dowdy Resigns as Head Of House Subcommittee
description: WASHINGTON, May 5 (AP) Representative John Dowdy, Democrat of Texas, who is fac ing briberyconspiracy charges, has asked and been permitted to give up his duties as chair man of a House subcommittee, an aide said today.

title: Metcalf Hits Policeman Barring Entry to Capitol
description: WASHINGTON, May 5 (UPI) Senator Lee Metcalf, Dem ocrat of Montana, punched a policeman in the chest today when he stopped him from crossing a police line during antiwar demonstrations at the Capitol.

title: Stars Defeat Colonels, 138125, Lead Series, 20
description: SALT LAKE CITY, May 5 (AP)Zelmo Beaty scored 40 points tonight to spark the Utah Stars to a 138125 victory over the Kentucky Colonels and give the Stars a 20 lead in their four of sevengame Amer ican Basketball Association championship playoff series.

title: Cosmos Turn Back Darts, 10, On Stritzl's SecondHalf Goal
description: The New York Cosmos of the North American Soccer League made their local debut at Yankee Stadium last night and defeated the Washington Darts, 10, before 3,476 fans.

title: Cubs Down Mets, 54, on 4 Runs in 5th
description: The charmed life of the New York Mets suffered a reverse at Shea Stadium last night when the Chicago Cubs scored four times in the fifth inning and rolled on to a 54 victory.

title: DEAL IS CHARGED AT BRIBERY TRIAL
description: The lawyers for two detec tives accused of taking a $200 amonth bribe from a Bronx gambler raised questions yes terday about the Police Depart ment's investigation of the case and the credibility of the wit nesses who testified against the detectives.

title: Court Outlaws the State Budget; Albany to Fight LumpSum Bar
description: ALBANY, May 5A State Supreme Court justice ruled today that the state's $7.7 billion budget, passed last month by the Legislature, is unconstitutional.

title: OBSERVER
description: WASHINGTON, May 5Early in the first act of The Peace Freak Follies of 1971, a piece of street thea ter which mercifully selfdestructed here this week before the second act could begin, that familiar old bore, Irate Motorist, jumped from his stalled car on Pennsylvania Avenue and, waving a long club, began chasing a batch of Youthful Demonstrators. One of them fell and Irate Motorist closed upon him for mayhem, or so we thought.

title: Murphy Oil Co.
description: The Murphy Oil Co. poration expects to have capital expendi tures of about $75million this year, C. H. Murphy Jr., told the annual meeting in El. Dorado, Ark. This would be somewhat less than the record $80,564, 000 spent in 1970 but would be about double the normal rate of recent years, he said.

title: Saturday Feature At Roosevelt to Be A Nonbetting Race
description: WESTBURY, L.I., May 5 The United States Harness Rid ers Association Trot will be a nonbetting race at Roosevelt Raceway Saturday night.

title: Jews in Soviet Fear Emigration May Be Slowed
description: MOSCOW, May 5  More than 60 Moscow Jews have ex pressed concern that a special police commission set up to expedite the issuance of exit visas to Israel might cease its work next Monday, in effect slowing the pace of emigration to the level that existed before the recent upsurge.

title: More Suburban Communities Vote on Their School and Library Budgets
description: Residents of Nassau, Suffolk, Westchester and Rockland Counties voted again yesterday on school budgets and school board membership, as well as on such related issues as library budgets.

title: Most Rallies in U.S. Peaceful; Sporadic Violence Mars Three
description: Most antiwar demonstrations held across the nation yester day were peaceful, but sporadic violence marked those in San Francisco and at the University of Wisconsin and the Univer sity of Maryland.

title: Heath Welcomes French View Of Future of Common Market
description: LONDON, May 5Prime Min ister Heath said tonight that the future of the European Economic community must be based on friendship among France, West Germany and Britain.

title: Front Page 1  No Title
description: EVERY week, more than 26,000 jobs are advertised In The New York Times. See, the Employment Columns today. Advt.

title: The Dollar Crisis
description: The longbrewing crisis for the United States dollar has hit sooner and harder than anticipated. Central banks across Europe, led by the West German Bundesbank, have suspended trading in dollars in order to halt the massive rush of speculators out of American currency into German marks in anticipation of an upward revalua tion of the mark.

title: Extraordinary Role of U.S. Dollar in World Monetary System Illustrated in Crisis
description: WASHINGTON, May 5  The extraordinary role of the United States and its dollar in the world monetary system has never been better illustrated than during this week's new flaring of an international mon etary crisis.

title: GROUP WAS SET UP TO PROTEST CUTS
description: An organization named the Black Coalition, which called yesterday's Funeral March and Strike demonstration in Brownsville, was established 12 days ago to protest cuts in the state budget.

title: IN THE NATION
description: NASHVILLE, Tenn.There will be several more state Presidential pri maries in 1972 than the nation has been accustomed toin Rhode Island, New Mexico and Maryland, for in stance. But the most interesting may well be held here in Tennessee on May 4, just about one year from now.

title: U.S. Savings Bond Sales Scored a Gain in April
description: WASHINGTON, May 5 (UPI)Sales of United States savings bonds totaled $463 million in April, the largest volume for the month since 1945, the Treasury said to day.

title: STATE DESCRIBES PANTHER TACTICS
description: Three attempted bombings and a shootout with two police men near the Harlem River Drive on Jan. 17, 1969, were part of a wellcoordinated plan by New York Black Pan thers, an assistant district at torney declared yesterday.

title: Brothers Apart 50 Years
description: PORTLAND, Ore. (AP)  Sigfrid Olson, 66 years old, showed up unexpectedly at the home of his brother, Oscar, 70. I don't know you, Oscar told the man at his door. I know you? said Sigfrid. It was their first meeting in 50 years.

title: Swiss Expect Revaluing Of Franc if Mark Climbs
description: GENEVA, May 5The Swiss franc would probably follow the upward course of the mark should West Germany decide to revalue its currency, private Swiss banking sources said to day. It's a foregone conclu sion, one Zurich banker said emphatically.

title: Chief Predicts Climb to $800Million in Sales for 1971
description: The nontobacco business of American Brands, Inc., the na tion's second largest cigarette manufacturer, will approach $800million this year with a combined operating income in the neighborhood of $70mil lion, shareholders at the an nual meeting were told yester day by Robert K. Heimann, president and chief operating officer.

title: CASO BIDS U.S. EASE L.I. UNEMPLOYMENT
description: MINEOLA, LI., May 5Nas sau County Executive Ralph G. Caso asked the United States Department of Labor today to declare Long Island a jobdis aster area.

title: Hawaiian Legend Provides Clue to a Deadly Poison
description: By following up an ancient Hawaiian legend and ignoring a local taboo (with seemingly dire consequences), scientists from the University of Hawaii have isolated one of the most potent poisons ever found.

title: Soviet Chess Aides Protest Conditions Set by Fischer
description: A lastminute obstacle to the Bobby FischerMark Taimanov chess match scheduled to start in Vancouver, British Columbia, on May 13 was threatened briefly by the Soviet officials yesterday when they learned that no spectators were to be present during playa condi tion set forth by Fischer.

title: PROTESTERS FAIL TO SLOP CONGRESS; POLICE SEIZE 1,146
description: WASHINGTON, May 5  Antiwar protesters massed on the marble steps outside the House of Representatives to day to demand that Congress ratify a people's treaty with North Vietnam to end the war in Southeast Asia.

title: Soviet Said to Send More Aid, for Ceylon
description: COLOMBO, Ceylon, May 5 Wellplaced, unofficial sourc es said today, that the Soviet Union was sending Ceylon 20 armored cars and two helicop ters to help the Government put down the rebellion that broke out early last month.

title: Court Frees One of 6 Tried For Plot to Kill Policemen
description: Justice Arnold Freiman of Manhattan Supreme Court yes terday dismissed charges against one of six defendants on trial for allegedly conspiring to kill policemen in May, 1968. The court acted after the prosecution rested its case.

title: White House Planning $75,000 Farm Display
description: WASHINGTON, May 5 (UPI)At a cost of $75,000, The White House's back lawn is being transformed into a fairground to help President Nixon salute American farm ers this Friday.

title: Police Remove Black Group In Rhode Island U. Protest
description: KINGSTON, R. I., May 5 (AP) Twentyfive riotequipped po licemen, wielding clubs to force their way through a crowd of white students, cleared the University of Rhode Island ad ministration building of 35 black members of the Afro American Society tonight.

title: Connally Cancels Appearance
description: WASHINGTON, May 5 (Reu ters)  Mr, Connally has can celed a scheduled appearance on Friday at the business coun cil meeting in Hot Springs, Va., according to authoritative sources.

title: Bridge: Kaplan and Eisenberg Rivals As World Play Opens Tonight
description: Two experts wellknown on the metropolitan bridge scene will compete in the world championship begin ning tonight in Taipei.

title: Robinson Is Appointed To Athletic Commission
description: ALBANY, May 5 (UPI) Jackie Robinson was appoint ed to the State Athletic Com mission today by Governor Rockefeller. He was named to succeed Raymond J. Lee of Lockport, N. Y., who had re signed.

title: S.E.C. WILL EXTEND STOCK SURCHARGE
description: WASHINGTON, May 5  The Securities and Exchange Commission believes that the emergency $15 surcharge on smaller securities transactions will need to be continued for at least two more months. The commission has also informed the New York Stock Exchange that it finds a large number of defects in the accounting meth ods that the exchange has used to support its claim that its members must have the sur charge or lose money.

title: Tourists Surprised As Crisis Impairs Travelers' Checks
description: GENEVA, May 5Ameri can visitors here found to their surprise that dollar bills and travelers' checks, which have long been accepted automatically in every coun try of the world, had only limited usefulness when they turned them in today for Swiss francs.

title: 5 CENTRAL BANKS IN EUROPE CEASE DOLLAR SUPPORT
description: PARIS, May 5  Five major central banksthose of West Germany, Switzerland, Belgium, the Netherlands and Austria withdrew their support for the dollar today and closed down their foreignexchange markets in one of the gravest mone tary disturbances since World War II.

title: Labor Difficulties Point to Delay In Fall Opening of Paris Opera
description: PARIS, May 5The Paris Opra, closed since June 30 of last year, may not reopen in the fall as had been scheduled. An announcement to that effect was published today by the Culture Minis try, which runs the Opra.

title: 7 Arrested in Theft of $2.6Million in Stock Certificates
description: Seven persons were accused yesterday of the theft of $2.6 million in stock certificates one of the largest thefts in the history of Wall Street.

title: Personal Finance
description: Buy now, save latermuch later, hopefully. That is the quintessence of advice about an interesting kind of Gov ernment security. Since it can save money sometimes upon the death of its owner, bond dealers call this type of Gov ernment issue the flower bond.

title: Wood, Field and Stream: Wilderness
description: WEST BRIDGEWATER, Mass.  Some 70 canoeists visited Hockomock Swamp in southeastern Massachu setts last Saturday, hoping that their action would aid the effort to keep the re markable 10 square mile area as it is.

title: Blue Box Is Linked to Phone Call Fraud
description: MINEOLA. L. I., May 5 A 19yearold Great Neck youth described by a faculty member of the New York Institute of Technology as a boy genius has been ar rested with eight upstate stu dents on charges of using electronic devices to make longdistance telephone calls free.

title: Charlie Brown to Start New Run at the Golden
description: You're a Good Man, Char lie Brown, the Off Broadway hit musical based on Charles M. Schulz's Peanuts car toon, will resume its run on Broadway at the Golden The ater, 252 West 45th Street, May 19.

title: Elizabeth Journal, Printed Since 1779, Is Shut in Strike
description: ELIZABETH, N. J., May 5 The Elizabeth Daily Journal laid off its 225 employes today because it has been unable to print a paper since Friday ow to strike by pressmen.

title: Understanding Reached On Florida Bank Purchase
description: The Southeast Banking Cor poration, a Miamibased holding company, announced yesterday a general understanding for the acquisition of five central Florida banks in the Combanks Corporation system.

title: Samuel M. Livingston, 79, Led TV Firm in Far East
description: A funeral service will be held in Tokyo today for Samuel Maurice Livingston, chariman of the Far East Television Cor poration since 1962, who died there on April 29. He was 79 years old.

title: Rogers Meets Egyptian Aides On Details of Their Suez Plan
description: CAIRO, May 5  Secretary of State William P. Rogers con ferred for more than six hours today with Egyptian leaders over the specifics of the Egyp tian proposal to reopen the Suez Canal.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: South Korean Killed in Clash
description: SEOUL, South Korea, May 5 The Government announced today that a South Korean policeman was killed and an other seriously wounded in a battle last night with a North Korean spy boat off Inchon, 20 miles west of Seoul. The boat, disguised as a fishing vessel, fled after a brief ex change of fire with a police patrol craft, an official state ment said.

title: Notes on People
description: Two experts have been hired by the White House to help improve President Nixon's television image.

title: The Challenge of Confrontation
description: News Analysis

title: 2 Sanitation Policemen Suspended on Charge of Drinking on Duty
description: A study on the productivity of Sanitation Department em ployes led yesterday to the sus pension of the head of the de partment's 44man police force in the Bronx and a sergeant under his command on charges of drinking while on duty.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Advertising:
description: The Rolling Stone may not be gathering moss, but sure is picking up money. And in order to pick up more, the national San Franciscobased biweekly aimed at the rock loving young, has added what might loosely be called a New York regional edition.

title: Looting and Clashes With Police Erupt in Brownsville
description: Fires large and small, includ ing at least a score described by fire officials as largesized raged throughout the Browns ville section of Brooklyn last night and early today after a day of widespread clashes be tween youths and the police. The disorders followed massive demonstrations by community residents against state budget cuts.

title: Nicklaus, Palmer Eager to Renew Duel Today
description: DALLAS, May 5  One thing Jack Nicklaus would rather do than win golf tour naments is to beat Arnold Palmer head to head. And Palmer? I'd just like to tie again with Nicklaus and beat him in a playoff.

title: BIG THEFTS MARK GASOLINE STRIKE
description: Thefts of gasoline were re ported yesterday as the strike by 1,600 gasoline truck drivers and warehouse employes con tinued through a fifth day in the city and suburbs. No prog ress was reported toward set tlement.

title: Bank Caters to Special Interest
description: News of Dogs

title: Tobacco Interests Appeal In Move for Free Air Time
description: RICHMOND, May 5 (AP)  Tobacco interests argued today that they were entitled to free broadcast time to present the other side of the health mes sages against cigarette smoking.

title: U.S. Unable to Cite Precedent in Berrigan Case
description: WASHINGTON, May 5The Justice Department, which said yesterday that it was not an uncommon practice for the Government to release evidence like the letters in the Berrigan case, said today it was unable to cite another case in which the Government had released such material.

title: STUDENTS PROTEST AT FRANKLIN K. LANE
description: A group of 25 to 50 stu dents carrying a black libera tion flag marched and chanted in the corridors of Franklin K. Lane High School on the Brook lynQueens border yesterday morning, but dispersed under orders of the principal, Morton H. Selub.

title: Foreign News Reports Criticized by Pakistan
description: KARACHI, Pakistan, May 5A spokesman said today that the Government re gretted the inconvenience caused newsmen by censor ship but he sharply criticized foreign reporting of events in East Pakistan. He said cen sorship was necessary to preserve internal security.

title: Solomons Brings Glamour of Dance To Judson Church
description: The dances of Gus Solomons Jr. usually titillate the mind at the same time they caress the eye with a flow of long limbed and neatly phrased images, by turns athletic and provocative. Tuesday evening at Judson Me morial Church Mr. Solomons added an unexpected element to his work, glamour.

title: Engelhard Minerals
description: NEWARK, May 5Milton F. Rosenthal, president and chief executive officer of the Engel hard Minerals and Chemicals Corporation, told the concern's annual meeting here today that earnings in the second quarter will probably continue to re flect the economic slowdown but that the longterm outlook is excellent.

title: Governor's Plan Assailed
description: ALBANY, May 5The rank ing minority members of the Senate and Assembly Housing Committees today said that Governor Rockefeller's pro gram to decontrol New York City apartments as they are vacated would have a disas trous effect on the city's housing situation.

title: Fabrication, U.S. Says
description: WASHINGTON, May 5The State Department rejected to day allegations that McKin ney H. Russell, United States cultural counselor in Moscow, was engaged in intelligence activities. A department spokesman called the allega tions a fabrication.

title: Profit of Pittston Tripled in Quarter
description: Net income of the Pittston Company tripled in the first quarter of 1971 to $15,498,000 from $5,039,000 in the year earlier period, the hardcoal company announced yesterday.

title: Cry to Be Repeated
description: Cry, a new work by the Alvin Ailey American Dance Theater, will be given three ad ditional performances at the City Center. Judith Jamison will dance the solo tonight, Satur day matinee and Sunday night. Consuelo Atlas will dance it in the previously announced per formance Sunday matinee.

title: California Control of U.S. Park Urged
description: WASHINGTON, May 5The National Park Service has de veloped a plan for California to administer the Redwood Na tional Park.

title: Behind the Dollar Crisis: U.S. on Credit for Years
description: PARIS, May 5In the United States credit is a way of life, but Americans normally pay their bills. If not, they lose their credit rating, and this is one of the worst things that can happen.

title: Israel Wins Soccer Title
description: Tokyo, May 5 (AP)Israel, threetime champion and twice cochampion, won the 13th Asian youth soccer champion ship today, defeating South Ko rea, 10.

title: The Right to Breed
description: SANTA BARBARA, Calif.Is it wise to maintain that the decision with regard to the size of the family must irrevocably rest with the family itself"? That's what the United Nations says. We would like to believe it. Having given up so many freedoms already it is natural to resist giving up this additional one, the freedom to breed. We remember Nazi Germany; we fear 1984.

title: Schoharie Officiais Upset
description: ALBANY, May 5 (AP)Offi cials in Schoharie County re acted with dismay today to the announcement by Governor Rockefeller that a site had been selected in the Town of Fulton as the best site for a new pow er reservoir.

title: Corn Blight Rumors Scored
description: WASHINGTON, May 5 (AP) The Agriculture Department warned today against un founded rumors of corn blight spreading into this year's crop, which is still being planted. The department urged farmers and grain traders to keep in proper perspective local and unconfirmed reports concern ing the development and spread of Southern corn leaf blight, adding that it was much too early to judge with any cer tainty the extent to which the disease may affect the 1971. crop.

title: TV READY TO FIGHT CRITICS, SAYS FRANK
description: COLUMBIA, Mo., May 5 (AP) Reuven Frank, president of N..BC. News, said today that television newsmen have had enough of apologizing to their critics and from now on will fight back.

title: Capital Gallery Shows Plan for Wing
description: WASHINGTON, May 5  The National Gallery of Art has unveiled the design for its $45million East Building, a functional marble structure that will serve as exhibition arena and home for a pro jected center for advanced study in the visual arts. A groundkeeping ceremony will be held tomorrow, along with the first public exhibition of the plans.

title: Sports of The Times
description: The 1920 Yankees, tenants in the Polo Grounds, outdrew the Giants, prompting John J. McGraw to rage: The Yankees will have to build a parkin Queens or some other outoftheway place. Let them go away and wither on the vine. The Yankees soon bought some acreage in the Bronx and built The House That Ruth Built, a marvel of its day, which apparently is over. According to the Yankees and the football Giants, Yankee Stadium is no longer ade quate for their needs. Not long ago, Mayor Lindsay announced that the city would purchase the ball park, renovate it, improve surrounding access roads and parking facilities and lease it back to the Yankees under terms that would make the structure a direct revenue loser for the city, as is Shea Stadium. Among the figures mentioned were $24million, said to be the basic cost of purchase and improvement, and $300,000, the annual loss. City officials claim, however, that the loss in indirect revenue would be far greater if the two teams, particularly the Yankees, were allowed to leave. Since then, however, at least two alter nate proposals have been made, each with enough merit to deserve consideration.

title: Newcombe, Ashe, Laver Struggle to Tennis Victories
description: ROME, May 5 (AP)  The two topseeded players, Austral ia's John Newcombe and Ar thur Ashe of Gum Spring, Va., were hardpressed by Italian foes before advancing to the third round of the $45,000 Ital ian open tennis championships today.

title: A Pianist Who's a Virtuoso at German Cooking
description: If we were in the market to have a party catered a la Deutsch, we know precisely what we'd do. We'd contact a young woman named Anneliese von der. Cron, a kitchen genie from Bavaria whose stewed veal and pork, German salads and goulash are justly famous among her friends.

title: Man In the News
description: When a news conference called by a power authority ends in a blackout, that's news.

title: VIOLIN RECITAL GIVEN BY GRZESNIKOWSKI
description: Edwin Grzesnikowskl, a pro fessor of violin at the Univer sity of Michigan, gave a recital at Town Hall on Tuesday night that was never less than respec table and often technically im pressive. Mr. Grzesnikowski's mastery of the instrument ap peared clearly in pieces written purely as violin music, such as Wieniawski's Capriccio Valse, Paganini's La Campanella, SaintSans's Sonata in D (Op. 75) and Vieuxtemps's Ron dino.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Sabry Is Said to Have Accused Sadat of Exceeding His Power
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, May 5A weekly magazine here with close connections to Cairo said today that Aly Sabry, the ousted Egyptian Vice President, had ac cused President Anwar elSadat of exceeding his authority in agreeing to bring Egypt into a federation with Libya and Syria.

title: Syracuse Told of Layoffs
description: SYRACUSE, May 4 (AP) Mayor Lee Alexander, who has announced plans to dismiss 250 city employes this year, said that 500 more would be dis charged and the city library system closed in 1972 if state aid was not fully restored. The city now employs 2,600 work ers.

title: CHIEF PROSECUTOR OF PALERMO SLAIN
description: PALERMO, Sicily, May 5  Unidentified gunmen shot and killed Pietro SongBone, the chief prosecutor of Palermo, to day as he was being driven to a cemetery to lay flowers at the tomb of his wife.

title: Jersey College Names Head
description: NEWARK, May 5 (AP)Dr. Stanley S. Bergen Jr. of Engle wood, N. J., has been named the first president of the Col lege of Medicine and Dentistry of New Jersey at Newark.

title: CITY HOUSING UNIT BACKED IN AIBANY
description: ALBANY, May 5The Sen ate approved a bill today per mitting New York City to es tablish a housing finance agen cy with power to raise $700 million through bond sales. The funds would provide mortgages for the construction or rehabili tation of housing.

title: American Sterilizer Co.
description: The American Sterilizer Company expects to continue its growth In the hospital and health care market, despite cur rent shortterm uncertainties, Henry E. Fish, president, told stockholders at the company's annual meeting in Erie, Pa. Earnings in the first quarter, he said, were 25 cents a share, up from 22 cents a year ago.

title: Canadian Pacific
description: Canadian Pacific shareholders at a special general session fol lowing the company's annual meeting in Montreal, authorized the company to split its com mon shares on a fiveforone basis and to issue new cumulated redeemable preferred shares. The shareholders, also adopted a resolution to change the name of the company to Canadian Pacific Ltd.Canadian Pacifique Ltee in Frenchfrom the Canadian Pacific Railway Company.

title: Advertising:
description: Industrial advertising agen cy executives from hither and thither and even a couple from yon, began a threeday conference yesterday at the Barbizon Plaza.

title: Indians and Pakistanis Disagree, on Plan to Return Diplomatic Staffs
description: NEW DELHI, May 5  A tentative agreement between India and Pakistan on repatria tion of their diplomatic staffs In Dacca and Calcutta has bogged down over a Pakistani demand that India considers unreasonable.

title: West Germany's Reserves Show an Increase in Week
description: FRANKFURT, West Germany, May 5 (Reuters)  West Ger many's net monetary reserves rose 100,000,000 marks to 59, 900,000,000 marks in the week to April 30, the Bundesbank said today. The West German mark is currently quoted at 27.32 cents.

title: Chess:
description: Fifty years ago this spring the Cuban chess immortal. Jose Raoul Capablanca, won the world championship from Dr. Emanuel Lasker in a match played at Havana, by the score of 40, with 14 draws. Lasker, then 52 years old  19 years older than Capablanca  had come to Havana from his native Ger many apprehensive that the sultry climate of Cuba in the late spring would work to the advantage of the challenger, and so it proved: Lasker in this match played nowhere near his full strength, and the are disappointing.

title: NEWAUTO SALES PACED BY IMPORTS
description: DETROIT, May 5  Sales of imported cars continue to climb with foreign carmanu facturers moving toward capturing onesixth of the new car sales in the United States.

title: 5 Die, 26 Are Missing in Quebec; QuarterMile of Town Caves In
description: ST. JEAN DE VIANNEY, Quebec, May 5 (Canadian Press) The earth caved in under part of this village late last night, engulfing 35 houses, several ears and a bus. At least five persons were known dead to day, and 26 were reported missing.

title: Protester Pleads Guilty
description: CHICAGO, May 5 (AP)  John J. Phillips, 27 years old, pleaded guilty in United States District Court today to partic ipating in a raid on a draft office and destroying records as an antiwar protest. Judge Edwin A. Robson set June 22 for sentencing.

title: U.S. Weighs Policy On Chinese Trade
description: WASHINGTON, May 5The Nixon Administration was re ported today to he planning to grant China roughly equal treatment with the Soviet Un ion and Eastern European coun tries in licensing the export of American products.

title: WERTHEIM & CO. GETS COUNTER SUSPENSION
description: WASHINGTON, Nov 5 (UPI) The Securities and Exchange Commission today suspended for 10 days the overthecounter brokerage activities of Wer theim & Co. of New York, on charges of violating stock registration laws.

title: SCHOOL MUSIC CHIEF DIES DURING CONCERT
description: Benjamin S. Chancy, music director of the city school sys tem, died backstage last night of a heart attack between numbers at Philharmonic Hall, where he was conducting the AllCity High School Orchestra and Coral Concert. He was 62 years old and lived at 84 Church Road in Morganville, N. J.

title: France Submits Proposal
description: BRUSSELS, May 5France today presented her Common Market partners with her long awaited proposal on Britain's share of the Common Market financial contributions during a fiveyear transition period for Britain. But the French pro posal was so constructed that observers in Brussels fear that it is designed to slow down progress among the six mem bers on reaching a common position to put to the British Government.

title: Insiders' Stockholdings
description: The American Stock Exchange yesterday issued its latest report of changes in share holdings by major stockholders, directors and officers of its listed companies. The New York Stock Exchange did not issue a list yesterday.

title: He Is to Be Shown Memorial to Jews Slain by Nazis
description: JERUSALEM, May 5When he arrives in Israel tomorrow, before any official engage. ments, Secretary of State Wil liam P. Rogers is to be taken to Yad Vashemthe stark and sobering shrine in Jerusalem to the memory of five million Jews exterminated by the Nazis.

title: Dance: Child of Earth
description: Temperature readings over at the City Center are some what higher than in most places in town currently, thanks to the feverpitch finale, with which Alvin Ailey's Revelations winds tip every evening. Yet there is more to Alvin Ailey Ameri can Dance Theater than just a smashbang marvelous su perlative surefire favorite that sends an audience sing ing into the street.

title: Forward Gal Captures $34,100 Comely by Four Lengths
description: Forward Gal used the $34,100 Comely at Aqueduct yesterday as a prep for the $50,000 Acorn a week from Saturday. Abraham Savin's champion fil ly opposed seven rivals in the sevenfurlong Comely, and she had no trouble finishing ahead of all of them. With her regu lar rider, Michael Hole, guid ing her, Forward Gal had the margin of four lengths over the runnerup, Sea Saga, at the finish, with Deceit next.

title: Malaysian Drink Is Sought
description: KUALA LUMPUR, Malaysia (AP)A liquor industry spokes man said three Asian countries and some European nations were interested in importing Malaysian toddy, a liquor dis tilled from the bud of the coconut tree.

title: Clashes Get Attention Abroad but Little Comment
description: LONDON, May 5  This week's antiwar demonstrations in Washington have attracted wide but not overwhelming at tention in Europe. Press com ment has been relatively muted, though with some criticism of the Washington police for their mass arrest tactics.

title: Cape Kennedy Recalls 10 Years in Space
description: CAPE KENNEDY, Fla., May 5In the mircrosecond, escape velocity world of the space age, it can take only a decade for nostalgia to set in. And it focused here today on Launch ing Pad 5, the site from which the first American was launched into space on May 5, 1961.

title: Foe Recaptures Town in Laos At Flank of Ho Chi Minh Trail
description: VIENTIANE, Laos, May (UPI)A Laotian town, on the western flank of the Ho Chi Minh Trail network has fallen to North Vietnamese troops aft er two days of heavy fighting.

title: East Germany Stresses Power Shift's Smoothness
description: BERLIN, May 5  Erich Honecker, the new chief of the, ruling Communist party, re mained isolated from the East German populace today, as he has ever since he replaced the 77yearold Walter Ulbricht three days ago.

title: PENSION PACT CURB SOUGHT IN ALBANY
description: ALBANY, May 5Republican legislative leaders have quietly drafted a major revision of the Taylor Law to require state and local governments to provide immediate funding for pension agreements and to restrict the areas. that can be negotiated between government and Civil Service labor unions.

title: Big Social Events Lure Variety of FunSeekers
description: The Upper East Side was the setting last night for four big social events. Three were for charity. One was for Norton Simon.

title: Goodbody Heir Helps Open Firm
description: Harold Pim Goodbody, the former managing partner of Goodbody & Co., is back in business on Wall Street, five months after the brokerage firm founded by his grand father was absorbed in an emergency takeover made necessary by stock  market losses.

title: Penn Central Sets Proposals Designed To Cut Labor Costs
description: The Penn Central Transporta tion Company is preparing a set of manpower proposals de signed to move the bankrupt concern into a breakeven po sition by mid1973, the trustees announced yesterday.

title: Issues in the Gasoline Strike
description: THE PARTIESThe Petroleum Trade Employes Union, representing 1,200 drivers, mechanics and warehouse em ployes of the Mobil, Texaco, Gulf, Getty and American Oil Companies. Also the independent Industrial Employes Asso ciation, which bargains for 400 employes of Esso (Humble Oil Company).

title: Shares on Amex Down Slightly As Volume Moves Up a Little
description: Prices and trading volume moved in opposite diredtions yesterday on the American Stock Exchange.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: CONTINENTAL PHONE SETS PROFIT MARK
description: The Continental Telephone Corporation and subsidiaries re ported yesterday a new high in net income for the first quarter. Total revenues and sales rose to $93,51,378 from $84,948,861 a year earlier. Net income rose to $8,783,174, or 30 cents a share, from the $8,392,851, or 29 cents a share, reported in the first three months of 1970. It was noted that telephone operating revenues rose by 16 per cent to $63.6million and net Income by 12 per cent to $8.1million.

title: HOPE OF 2 CHINAS HELD DIM AT U.N.
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., May 5Many Western and Eastern diplomats here are now convinced that the United States will have very little margin for maneuvering if it tries to prevent the expulsion of Nationalist China from the United Nations this fall.

title: BLACKS WIN POSTS IN NORTH CAROLINA
description: CHARLOTTE, N. C., May (AP)Negroes were elected to city councils in several com munities yesterday for the first time in years, and Howard Lee, who two years ago became the first black Mayor of a North Carolina city, was reelected in Chapel Hill.

title: City Plan Defended
description: The cost of the controversial pension plan the city has worked out with one of the major public employes unions should be manageable, the city's Budget Director said yes terday.

title: STOCKS RETREAT AS TRADING EASES
description: The stock market closed low er in slower trading yesterday even though an afternoon re covery erased some of the ear lier losses.

title: William Brown Meloney Dead; Author and Stage Producer, 69
description: William Brown Meloney, the atrical producer, author, lawyer, publicist, editor and professor, died of a heart attack on Tues day evening at his home in Kent, Conn. He was 69 years old on Tuesday, having been born on May 4, 1902, in Paw ling, N. Y.

title: Labor Disputes Imperil OTB Operation
description: Swamped by more horse players than it can properly service, the city's Offtrack Bet ting Corporation faces the prospect of being derailed by a lack of horses.

title: No Place on the Sidelines
description: The United States employer delegate to the Inter national Labor Organization, Edward Neilan, has put into focus the selfdefeating element in this country's con tinued refusal to pay its share of the I.L.O. budget. Congress cut off the money last year, primarily at the instigation of George Meany of the A.F.L.C.I.O., who charged that the world labor group was being turned into a transmittal belt for Soviet propaganda.

title: Executive Changes
description: The Copper Range Company, the nation's fifth largest producer of primary copper, announced that Chester O. Ensign Jr., president, was elected chief executive officer.
