description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Friday, May 14 (AP) Ells worth Bunker, the United States Ambassador here, said today that North Vietnamese acceptance of Saigon's offer to free 570 prisoners was an en couraging sign. He said that he hoped it would be the first step leading to the release of American and allied prisoners. There was no immediate com ment from the South Vietnam ese Government.

title: British Opponents Of Market Angered By Gains at Talks
description: LONDON, May 13The breakthrough in Britain's nego tiations to join the Common Market brought angry reactions today from opponents of mem bership here.

title: INTEREST RATES RAISED IN FRANCE
description: PARIS, May 13  French interest rates were increased today in a move signaling Gov ernment concern over what France considers to be a de teriorating international mone tary climate.

title: Court Backs Youth Vote in L. I. Primary
description: MINEOLA, L. I., May 13 A State Supreme Court justice ruled today that voters between the ages of 18 and 21 must be permitted to vote for Demo cratic committeemen in next September's primary election in Nassau County.

title: Heinie Manush Dies at 69
description: Heinie Manush, the Hall of Fame outfielder and onetime batting champion, died Wed nesday in Sarasota, Fla., at the age of 69. An obituary appears on Page 44.

title: Merger News
description: The Pacific Lighting Corpora tion said it has agreed to buy Blue Goose Growers, Inc., fruit packer and marketer for about $22,600,000. Pacific Lighting said it would acquire the group of 28 growers, packers and marketers for about $3.6million in cash and the balance in notes and assumption of debt. In cluded in the purchase are land holdings in Arizona, California, Florida and Maryland, six farm management companies and 12 packing houses. The acquisition is scheduled for completion June 1.

title: City College Alumni Elect
description: The election of Stanley Lowell, member of the class of 39 of City College, as pres ident of the college's Alumni Association was announced yesterday. Mr. Lowell, who had been first vice president of the alumni body, succeeds Charles Orenstein, class of 24. Mr. Lowell was Deputy Mayor under Mayor Robert F. Wagner from 1958 to 1960.

title: Works of 10 Coast Filmmakers Shown at the Whitney
description: The current movie pro gram at the Whitney Muse um consists of 10 short works by West Coast film makers. The films date from 1968 to a few months ago, and the filmmakers range from the almost famous (Kenneth Anger) and the highly reputable (Jordan Bel son) to the virtually un known (everybody else), at least among local audiences.

title: Article 3  No Title
description: Article 3  No Title

title: WALLBOARD PRICES RAISED $2 PER TON
description: The GeorgiaPacific Corpora tion announced yesterday that it would raise its price for gypsum wallboard by about $2 a ton per 1,000 square feet, effective June 7.

title: Notes on People
description: In an action hailed by Senator Jacob K. Javits as a historic breakthrough for women, the Senate yester day set aside 150 years of tradition and agreed to per mit the appointment of girl pages.

title: Lindsay Says House Welfare Bill Slights the City
description: Mayor Lindsay warned yes terday that the city would re ceive relatively miniscule addi tional Federal welfare funds under legislation proposed by the House Ways and Means Committee.

title: New Police Press Official Named
description: Polce Commissioner Patrick V. Murphy announced yester day that Robert Daley, a freelance writer and former correspondent of The New York Times, would replace Wilfred N. Horne as the Po lice Department's deputy commissoner in charge of press relations on June 11.

title: SCIENCES ACADEMY UNDER NADER STUDY
description: WASHINGTON, May 13 (UPI) Ralph Nader has begun a study of the National Academy of Sciences and its affiliates to determine how well they have performed as advisers to the Government on public issues and to what extent they have served the public interest.

title: MESSENGER PACE DRAWS 13 ENTRIES
description: WESTBURY, L. I., May 13 Albatross? Who's he? John Chapman wanted to know this morning, as he dropped the name of Tarport Skipper into the entry box for the 16th edi tion of the Messenger Stakes to be presented at Roosevelt Raceway on closing night, May 22.

title: Wood, Field and Stream
description: Many years ago there was a story of an advertisement in a magazine which an nounced that a surefire tech nique for killing all forms of nasty insects had been de vised.

title: Jurors Join Happy Victors After Trial
description: For eight months, they gath ered as strangers in the same courtroom, divided by the bar rier separating the jurors from the judged, but yesterday they finally met to exchange hand shakes and congratulations.

title: British Trade Surplus Is Reported for April
description: LONDON, May 13 (Reu ters)Britain showed a trad ing surplus in April of $33.6million, it was an nounced today.

title: Pakistani Officials Say China Has Offered $20Million Loan
description: KARACHI, Pakistan, May 13 Pakistan Government sources reported today that China had offered an interestfree loan of $20million not tied to the pur chase of Chinese products.

title: Woodstock, Vt., Convicted
description: WOODSTOCK, Vt., May 13 (AP)The town of Woodstock was convicted in District Court today on a charge of polluting the Ottauquechee River. Judge George Ellison ordered a con tinuance to May 24, however, to allow the town time for filing motions.

title: METALS FUTURES CONTINUE GAINS
description: Futures prices of precious and semiprecious metals rose again yesterday in fairly active trading.

title: Nationalizing Viewed
description: ROANOKE, Va., May 13 The possibility that the Penn Central Transportation Com pany may yet have to be na tionalized was raised here to day by John P. Fishwick, pres ident of the Norfolk & Western Railway, the biggest money maker from transportation of any of the nation's major rail roads.

title: City Clears Ship Terminal Alter 5 Years of Planning
description: Under an agreement approved by the Board of Estimate yes terday, the drafty, cavernous barns that served oceangoing travelers in the heyday of steamships will at long last be superseded by a modern terminal on the Hudson.

title: Reactions to the Verdict: Joy, Surprise and Silence
description: Where reactions to the ac quittal of the Black Panthers were freely offered around the city and the country, they were generally ones of joy and surprise.

title: U.S. Eases Rules on Pollution Reports
description: WASHINGTON, May 13 (AP)  Federal officials have decided to permit an indefinite delay in the reporting of 51 types of industrial waste dis charge into waterways, Nixon Administration sources said to day.

title: CONKLIN PROPOSES RESCUE FOR WNYC
description: State Senator William T. Conklin, Republican of Brook lyn, has proposed a plan by which state educational funds could be channeled into the financially threatened city owned radio and television sta tions.

title: Community Board Working as Mediator
description: Tolerance for community disputes and similar challenges to established authority has decreased in the nation since the late nineteensixties, ac cording to the independent Board of Mediation for Com munity Disputes.

title: Nixon Firm in Fight to Bar U.S. Troop Cut in Europe
description: WASHINGTON, May 13The White House ruled out today any compromise in its fight to defeat a Senate move to halve American troop strength in Western Europe.

title: Judge in Baby Lenore Case Orders a Plan for Transition
description: A State Supreme Court jus tice here ruled yesterday that a babysitting interval must take place as a transition phase in the return of Baby Lenore from her adoptive parents to her natural mother.

title: While Captive in Cambodia, War Reporter Kept Diary
description: Following is another article by Kate Webb, chief of United Press International's Pnompenh bureau, on her ex perience during 23 days as a prisoner of Vietnamese Com munist troops in Cambodia. Captured on April 8 with a Japanese newsman and four Cambodians during heavy fighting southwest of Pnom penh, she and her companions spent more than a week on the march and two weeks in a camp undergoing interroga tion and engaging in con versations with the officers and casual chats with our guards.

title: Honeywell Wins Contract
description: Honeywell, Inc., said yester day that its marine systems center at West Covina, Calif., had been awarded an $18mil lion Air Force contract to build 52 ground training stations for navigators at Mather Air Force Base, in Sacramento, Calif.

title: Moderate Is Named New Lisbon Patriarch
description: LISBON, May 13  A 42 yearold Bishop was named Patriarch of Lisbon today, succeeding Manuel Cardinal Gongalves Cerejeira, who is R2 and who has been the Roman Catholic spiritual leader of Portugal since 1929.

title: 378232 Wins in Jersey
description: TRENTON, May 13 (AP) This week's winning number in the New Jersey lottery is 378232. Holders of tickets with all six numbers win $50,000; with the last five numbers, $4, 000; the last four, $400; the last three $40, and the last two, a free ticket in the millionaire lottery. Today's drawing was held at the State Fairgrounds here.

title: Taylor Walks Out on Royals, Burns His Britches Behind Him
description: KANSAS CITY, May 13 (UPI)Carl Taylor, the Kan sas City Royals outfielder who removed himself from last night's game in Balti more and then burned his baseball equipment in the locker room, notified the Royals today that he was in Sarasota, Fla., where his mother was ill.

title: Sports of The Times
description: The Super Bowl Game returned to the television screen Wednesday night in living, breathing color and once again a field goal in the final five seconds gave the Baltimore Colts a 1613 victory over the Dallas Cowboys. Sounds exciting, eh? You should have seen it in the telescoped, halfhour version. Wow!

title: Virginia O Hanlon, Santa's Friend, Dies
description: VALATIE, N. Y., May 13 Virginia O'Hanlon Douglas, who as a child was reassured that Yes, Virginia, there is a Santa Claus, died today at the age of 81.

title: Illinois Honors Hoover
description: SPRINGFIELD, Ill., May 13 (AP)By one vote the Illinois Senate approved today a resolu tion honoring J. Edgar Hoover, director of the Federal Bureau on Investigation, for his long career and public service. The resolution passed 26 to 25.

title: 40 F111'S CLEARED AFTER CORRECTION
description: WASHINGTON, May 13 (UPI)The Air Force cleared 40 F111's jets today to fly again after their main para chute compartments had been fitted with new ejection ex plosives.

title: COMPANY RECALLS 80,000 AUTO TIRES
description: WASHINGTON, May 13 (AP) The Department of Transpor tation said today that the Mansfield Tire and Rubber Company of Mansfield, Ohio, was recalling 80,000 fiberglass belted tires because they could be hazardous under stress.

title: Horse Theft Charged To 2 in an Apartment
description: LONG BRANCH, N. J., May 13Skeptical policemen re sponding to complaints about a horse living in a ground floor apartment found their quarry and warned two men they were violating a sanita tion ordnance.

title: Missile Sites Attacked
description: SAIGON, Friday, May 14 (Reuters)Two United States Thunderchief fighters fired mis siles at two North Vietnamese missile sites yesterday, in the 37th such attack this year, a United States military spokes man said today.

title: Mrs. Court. Virginia Wade Gain Semifinals in London
description: LONDON, May 13 (UPI)  Mrs. Margaret Court of Aus tralia, grandslam champion of women's tennis in 1970, dropped the first set of her claycourt quarterfinal match today, but battled back to defeat Julie Heldman of Houston, 26, 64, 63.

title: DYING MAN TELLS OF FIVE MURDERS
description: BRIDGEPORT, Conn., May 13 The Federal Bureau of Inves tigation said today that John Russel Pardue Jr., the 29year old man accused of bank rob bery and bombing who was fatally wounded trying to escape the Federal courthouse here on April 8, had made dying declaration admitting his involvement in five murders and five bank robberies since 1968.

title: Mrs. Crimmins Gets Life Term for Son's Murder
description: Mrs. Alice Crimmins was sen tenced yesterday to spend the rest of her life in prison for murdering her 5yearold son, Edmund Jr., in July, 1965.

title: Man In the News
description: One of the first character istics friends mention when asked about Dr. Merlin K. DuVal Jr. is his appearance. He is tall and handsome, handsome, handsome, one former colleague said. The appearance, however, seems to be just a part of a general manner exuding attractiveness, discipline and effectiveness that has brought him from a young surgeon in New York, through more than a decade as a medical educator in the Southwest, to President Nixon's nominee as the na tion's chief health officer Assistant Secretary for Health and Scientific Affairs in the Department of Health, Education and Welfare.

title: Pleasure Boat News
description: William D. Ruckelshaus, administrator of the Environ mental Protection Agency, has announced the proposed Fed eral standards for perform ance of marine sanitation devices, and they are high enough to eliminate all avail able devices except holding tanks.

title: Theater: Poor Antigone!
description: That the Antigone of Sophocles is a great, imper ishable play, is happily in no serious doubt. Such doubt as it might be In was put very much to the test last night by its execrable staging by the Lincoln Center Repertory Company at the Vivian Beau mont Theater. The scenery was splendid: The produc tion's basic and irremediable fault came when they brought on the actors.

title: Cost of Panther Case Reached Over $750,000
description: The eightmonth trial of 13 Black Panthers that ended yes terday was one of the costliest in the state's history, as well as the longest. Even at a rough estimate, the costs exceeded $750,000.

title: Anaconda Chief Planning To Relinquish Top Post
description: The Anaconda Company, one of the world's largest copper producers, announced yester day that C. Jay Parkinson, 61 years old, planned to elinquish the post of chief executive of ficer. He will be succeeded by John B. M. Place, vice chair man of the Chase Manhattan Bank.

title: Lunokhod Photographs Seal
description: MOSCOW, May 13 (UPI)  The Lunokhod moon robot has climbed a 45foot hill between three craters and taken stereo scopic photographs of the lunar Sea of Rains, the officail press agency Tass said today.

title: 24 Buses in Test Will Use Liquid Natural Gas Engines
description: PITTSBURGH, May 13 (UPI) Twentyfour buses in four cities will be converted to run on liquid natural gas in an ex periment designed to eliminate smoky exhaust fumes.

title: Canonero II Draws Post No. 9 for 11Horse Preakness
description: BALTIMORE, May 13  rare thing happened at thel draw for the Preakness this morning. The names of 111 horses were entered for Satur day's event; and after the rac ing secretary, Larry Abbundi, had finished picking them out for post position, everybody was satisfied.

title: Sunrise in Brussels
description: There is light at last at the end of the symbolic tun nel under the English Channel through which Britain for ten years and despite two crushing setbacks has been groping its way toward Europe. Hard bargaining remains; but a climactic breakthrough has just been achieved at Brussels. With luck the negotiation will be completed by July 1 and Britain will meet Prime Minister Heath's target of membership in the European Economic Community by Jan. 1, 1973.

title: TITLE CHESS MATCH DELAYED BY DISPUTE
description: VANCOUVER, British Colum bia, May 13 (Canadian Press) A dispute over playing condi tions has forced postponement of a world chess championship quarterfinal match here be tween Bobby Fischer of the United States and Mark Tai manov of the Soviet Union.

title: Front Page 1  No Title
description: Front Page 1  No Title

title: Display of Judd Art Defines an Attitude
description: PASADENA, Calif., May 13 the radical transforma tion of ascetic values that has overtaken American art during the last decade, the sculpture of Don Judd has exerted an important influ ence. Mr. Judd has been a leading figure in the minimal art movement. His remorse less reduction of sculptural form to unembellished box shaped structures and other highly simplified devices has had the effect of revising, or at least challenging a great many values traditionally as sociated with the threedi ynensional medium.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today May 14, 1971
description: GENERAL ASSEMBLY

title: Four Concerns Deny Guilt
description: PITTSBURGH, May 13 (AP) Three big steelmakers and chemical concern, brought to court on water analyses com piled by two citizens, pleaded not guilty today to 73 counts of polluting the Ohio and Mon ongahela Rivers.

title: 2 HOSPITALS ALLY WITH COLUMBIA U.
description: Roosevelt Hospital and St. Luke's Hospital became fully affiliated with Columbia Uni versity yesterday.

title: World Parley on Quakes Set
description: WASHINGTON, May 13 (AP) Representatives of 18 na tions will meet in San Francisco May 20 to 25 to exchange infor mation on earthquakerelated problems and ways to lessen the social and economic effects of major quakes.

title: U. S. Aides Voice Hope
description: WASHINGTON, May 13 State Department officials voiced cautious hope tonight that reports of a North Viet namese agreement to accept ailing prisoners held in South Vietnam would lead to the re lease of sick and wounded Americans held by Hanoi.

title: Abortion Referral Agency Declared Illegal by Court
description: The State Supreme Court ruled yesterday that the oper ation here of a commercial abortion referral agency was illegal. In a decision that could have widespread effects the multimilliondollar refer ral business that has sprung up since the liberalization of state abortion law last sum mer, Justice Sidney H. Asch declared:

title: G.N.P.'S ADVANCE TOPS ESTIMATE
description: WASHINGTON, May 13The nation's total output of goods and services rose a little more in this year's first quarter than the preliminary estimate month ago had indicated, the Commerce Department report ed today.

title: Miss Donna Robinson Wed on L.I.
description: GREAT NECK, L. I., May 13  The marriage of Miss Donna Robinson, daughter of Mrs. Irving B. Robinson of Port Chester, N. Y., and the late Mr. Robinson, to Thomas Divine, son of Mr. and Mrs. Harold S. Divine of Great Neck, took place here today. The ceremony was performed in Temple Israel by Rabbi Mordecai Waxman.

title: PERSICHETTI SONGS ARE GIVEN PREMIERE
description: A new cycle of songs by Vin cent Persichetti entitled A Net of Fireflies was given its first performance by Carolyn Reyer, mezzosoprano, at Tully Hall on Wednesday night.

title: Dining Out in a Japanese Farmhouse
description: The restaurants reviewed on this page on Friday are rated four stars to none, based on the relationship of food and service to cost. Credit cards are honored where indicated.

title: Foe Attacks Near Pnompenh
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, May 13 (Reuters)  Enemy guerril las launched two attacks on the northern approaches to the Cambodian capital last night, a spokesman for the high com mand said here today.

title: Soviet Says Some Defendants In Leningrad Express Regret
description: MOSCOW, May 13Several of the nine Jews on trial in Leningrad on charges of organ ized antiSoviet activity were reported today to have ex pressed regret for their actions.

title: DELAY IN ELECTION IN CITY IS SOUGHT
description: ALBANY, May 13  A bill that would postpone until next year district leader elections in Manhattan, the Bronx and Staten Island has been quietly introduced in the State Senate.

title: Moose Bill Dies in Maine
description: AUGUSTA, Me., May 13 (AP) A proposal to legalize moose hunting in Maine died in the Legislature today when House Senate conferees reported they could reach no agreement.

title: Bronx Tenants Get $16,000 City Loan To Buy a Building
description: A Bronx housewife, who shoveled coal for the furnace of her 20family apartment house after the landlord aban doned the building, accepted a $16,000 check from Mayor Lindsay yesterday.

title: DEFENSE FINISHES IN THE SEALE CASE Panther Does Not Testify Huggins Case Also Rested
description: NEW HAVEN, May 13The defense tested today in the trial of Bobby G. Seale, the Black Panther leader on trial for his life on charges that he helped kill Alex Rackley, without call ing Mr. Seale to the witness stand to testify in his own behalf.

title: SOVIET HAILS CZECHS ON NORMALIZATION
description: PRAGUE, May 13  Soviet Communist leaders congratulat ed Czechoslovak leaders to night on having overcome a grave political crisis in 1968 and having achieved normali zation.

title: $3.64BILLION IS SET TO CURB POLLUTION
description: American business plans to spend $3.64billion this year for air and water pollution con trols, an amount that is only 20 per cent of the investment needed to bring their facilities to current ecological standards, it was reported yesterday by the McGrawHill Publications Company.

title: Johnson's Memoirs Due in November
description: Former President Lyndon B. Johnson describes his forth coming White House memoirs as a book reflecting his own personal and political point of view rather than as an attempt at a complete and definitive history of my Presidency.

title: Big Board Appoints Aide
description: The New York Stock Ex change said yesterday that. Gerard P. Lynch had been ap pointed vice president of the exchange's Stock Clearing Cor poration and director of its di rect clearing department. He will oversee the previously an nounced consolidation of the direct clearing departments of the New York Stock Exchange and American Stock Exchange.

title: 3 POLICEMEN SHOT; 4 HELD IN CHICAGO Panther Literature Is Found at South Side Building
description: CHICAGO, May 13 (UPI) Three policemen were shot to day by gunmen who opened fire from a South Side apart ment building described as stocked with Black Panther literature.

title: Offtrack Bettors Here Establish Canonero II as 3to1 Favorite in Preakness
description: Neglected in the Kentucky Derby, Canonero II is drawing the most attention here in off track wagering on Saturday's Preakness Stakes.

title: HEARING DELAYED ON CON ED PLANT
description: CROTONONHUDSON, N.Y., May 13A citizens group won a postponement today of safety hearings on. Consolidated Edi son's nearly completed second nuclear power generating plant at Indian Point until July 13 to 18.

title: Henry Ford Pessimistic on Foreign Autos
description: DETROIT, May 13Henry Ford 2d warned today that the assault on the American mar ket by imported cars was just beginning and said, I frankly don't see how we're going to meet the foreign competition.

title: Europe's Dollar Tea Party
description: NEW HAVENThe explosion on the European currency markets is essen tially a speculative outburst. It will be quelled, at a heavy cost, by the combination of limited exchangerate readjustments and controls on capital movements hurriedly put together at Brussels.

title: Australians Are Looking to an Expansion of Contacts With Chinese Communists and the Soviet
description: MELBOURNE, Australia, May 13Prime Minister William McMahon outlined proposals tonight for expanding contacts between Australia and China, including the possible establish ment of an office in China to assist Australian travelers there.

title: Trial Date Set for Soldier Accused of Killing Officer
description: DANANG, South Vietnam, May 13 (UPI).The trial of a soldier charged with murder and attempted murder in the shooting of two United States Army majors after a dispute over a loud phonograph was set today for June 5.

title: Article 2  No Title
description: Article 2  No Title

title: Boston Protesters Cleared
description: BOSTON, May 13 (AP)  The cases against 29 persons charged in an antiwar demon stration last week outside the John F. Kennedy Federal build ing were dismissed today in Boston Municipal Court.

title: Brooklyn Bus Strike Ends
description: Division 1181 of the Amal gamated Transit Union voted last night to accept a new con tract with the Pioneer Bus Cor poration, ending a strike that had affected 6,000 residents of Brooklyn's Mill Basin area for 74 days. Edward Vallone, pres ident of Pioneer, said some employes would work through the weekend to prepare buses for operation on Monday.

title: Department Store Sales Up
description: WASHINGTON, May 13.  The Department of Commerce reported today that department store sales for the week ended May 8 totaled an estimated $839,000,000, an increase of 10 per cent above the $766,000,000 sales for the corresponding week of last year. Total retail store sales for the latest week totaled an estimated $7,702, 000,000, an increase of 6 per cent above the $7,249,000,000 sales for the same period last year.

title: Abbie Hoffman Is Indicted On U.S. Antiriot Charges
description: WASHINGTON. May 13 (AP) Abbie Hoffman, the Yippie leader, was indicted today on Federal antiriot charges stem ing from his alleged participa tion in the Mayday antiwar ac tivities in the nation's capital last week.

title: Paint Company Sued
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio, May 13 (AP)Ohio's Attorney General, William J. Brown, has filed suit in Cuyahoga County Com mon Pleas Court to keep the Sherwin Williams Paint Com pany from polluting the Cuya hoga River.

title: Advertising: First Woman Joins 4A's Board
description: WHITE SULPHUR SPRINGS, W. Va., May 13 Mary Andrews Ayers, who has been in the agency business for 25 years, today became the first woman on the board of directors of the 54yearold American Association of Ad vertising Agencies, the most prestigious organization in its field.

title: ExPolice Chief in Bergen Gets Suspended Sentence
description: HACKENSACK, N. J., May 13 (AP)A former South Hacken sack Police Chief, Angelo De Rosa, was given a suspended twotothreeyear prison term today on a conviction of con spiring to obstruct justice.

title: Teamsters Grant Hoffa a Delay To Decide on Reelection Bid
description: HOLLYWOOD. Fla., May 13 The teamsters union exec utive board acceded today to James R. Hoffa's request to give him until the end of the month to decide whether to run for another term as pres ident.

title: FULBRIGHT IS SAID TO REBUFF ROGERS
description: WASHINGTON, May 13 Secretary of State William P. Rogers was reported today to have tried unsuccessfully to arrange a public hearing by the Senate Foreign Relations Com mittee that would, in effect, have publicized Pakistan's ap peal for more assistance from the United States for economic development.

title: Support in New England
description: BOSTON, May 13 (UPI)The New England Joint Council 10 of the teamsters has voted unanimously to reelect Hoffa. Leaders of 33 local unions voted in Hoffa's favor yesterday, pledging complete loyalty, come hell or high water to the present international executive board headed by James R. Hof fa, wherever he may hang his hat.

title: SAIGON SAID TO HOLD 100,000 IN PRISONS
description: WASHINGTON, May 13 (Reu ters)Don Luce, who helped uncover the tiger cage prisons in South Vietnam, testi fied today that the Saigon Government held at least 100,000 political prisoners.

title: Treasury Bills Prices Plunge;
description: Prices in the Treasury se curities market fell sharply yes terday.

title: City Paid $5,620 Per Trainee In H.R.A. JobSkills Program
description: The city's biggest jobtrain ing program cost $5,620 for every trainee who stayed on the job at least three months, officials testified yesterday.Mr. Sadowsky said the testi mony indicated to him that the agency, by offering a referral point in city neighborhoods for people who needed jobs, was providing a necessary service. But he was sharply critical of the cost of training.

title: A'S DOWN ROYALS WITH 5 IN 5TH 63
description: KANSAS CITY, May 13 (UPI) Joe Rudi and Mike Epstein drove in two runs each tonight as the Oakland Athletics rallied for five runs in the fifth inning and defeated the Kansas City Royals, 6.3, Jim Hunter, who allowed six hits, posted his sixth straight victory.

title: Wissel Is Named Fordham Basketball Coach and Given FourYear Contract
description: Hal Wissel, who rebuilt La fayette's basketball team into a tournament contender during the last four years, was named yesterday as Fordham's head basketball coach. His first com ment was: I intend to honor my fouryear contract at Ford ham.

title: A WELFARE CURB ON ADDICTS URGED
description: WASHINGTON, May 13 Two New York Representatives began pressing today for a bill that would cut off welfare benefits from addicts or former addicts who refused medical treatment or regular testing to ascertain that they had given up drugs.

title: Obituary 1  No Title
description: Obituary 1  No Title

title: NEW JUDGE NAMED IN THE DAVIS CASE
description: SAN FRANCISCO, May 13 (UPI)Superior Court Judge Richard E. Arnason, 49 years old, was appointed today to take over the Angela Davis conspiracy case. He is the sixth judge to have it.

title: Live TV Ruled Out for Nixon Nuptials
description: WASHINGTON, May 13 (UPI)  Tricia Nixon's wed ding will not be televised live, in keeping with the pri vate, sentimental occasion. But the nation's viewers will have a chance to see some of the highlights of the June 12 Rose Garden wedding on TV news shows following the ceremony.

title: Bridge: Aces and French Team Qualify For Finals Starting Tomorrow
description: TAIPEI, Taiwan, May 13 The world champion Aces and the French champions of Europe will meet for the 1971 world title in a match of 128 deals beginning here Saturday night.

title: Lamont Denies Joining The Communist Party
description: Corliss Lamont, chairman of the National Emergency Civil Liberties Committee, has made public a statement saying that although it is no disgrace to belong to the Communist party, I have never even dreamed of join ing it.

title: TALKS ON ARMS RECESS IN GENEVA
description: GENEVA, May 13The 25 nation disarmament conference ended its winter session today. The cochairmen, James F. Leonard of the United States and Aleksei A. Roshchin of the Soviet Union, expressed cau tious hope that it would be possible to complete work on a treaty prohibiting biological weapons when the conference reconvened June 29.

title: Hotel Plan Seen as Threat To the Beauty of Florence
description: FLORENCEPlans for a 200 room Hilton Hotel that a group of local developers wants to build in the hills south of this lovely city are stirring contro versy both in Italy and abroad.

title: Bus Depot Manager Named
description: The Port of New York Au thority Bus Terminal, which handles more than 215,000 pas sengers a day, yesterday named Barry M. Mayer as manger. Mr. Mayer, a civil engineer, was manager of the Lincoln Tunnel since 1964.

title: Yankee Stadium's Fate Is on the Line
description: The fate of Yankee Stadium and its neighborhood of some 200,000 people may be decided in the State Legislature next week, with indications mounting that the Bronx will win.

title: NOTRE DAME MERGER WITH ST. MARY'S SET
description: SOUTH BEND, Ind., May 14 Trustees of the University of Notre Dame and neighboring St. Mary's College agreed today to merge into a single coeducational university. The two schools have been exchanging ?? and programs for several years.

title: NATO Proposals Similar
description: MOSCOW, May 14 Leonid ?? Brezhnev, the Communist party leader, called on the Western powers today to begin exploratory negotiations on reductions in military forces and armaments in Central Europe.

title: PACKAGING COSTS CONDEMNED HERE
description: Slate Attorney General Louis J, Lefkowitz contended yesterday that unnecessary plastic and pasteboard packaging on food, razor blades, proprietary drugs and other consumer items add unjustifiably to the items cost.

title: DON SHIRLEY PLAYS TASTEFUL CONCERT
description: Don Shirley was back in Carnegie Hall Thursday night with a popular program of American music, all of which the pianist had transcribed and arranged for himself, two cellists (James Boyd and Jun Taht) and bass (Ken Fricker).

title: 5 Promoted to Detective
description: Four New York policemen and a policewoman were promoted to detective yesterday for their campaigns against police corruption. Among those honored by Police Commissioner Patrick V. Murphy with the presentation of the gold badge of a detective was Frank Serpico.

title: 4Way Merger Forming A $65Million Company
description: A fourway merger of the Equity Corporation, the Bell Intercontinental Corporation, the Wheelabrator Corporation and Frye Indrustries, Inc., was approved yesterday by directors. The transaction involves in excess of $65million in an exchange of securities. The purpose of the merger is to simplify the corporate structure of Equity and its subsidiaries and to concentrate the capital resources of these companies in environmental controls and serviceoriented manufacturering activities.

title: Miss Chi Breaks 2 Marks In Gaining College Finals
description: CHENEY, Wash., May 14 (AP)Chi Cheng, world titleholder, toppled two meet marks and easily advanced to the finals today in the National Intercollegiate track and field championships for women.

title: Turner Pleads No Contest To Charge of Tax Evasion
description: ALEXANDRIA, Va., May 14 (UPI)Carl C. Turner, a retired major general who was sentenced Monday for making personal use of guns confiscated by the Chicago police, has pleaded no contest to another charge of evading $14,417.19 in Federal income taxes for 1968.

title: Negotiator Optimistic
description: BRUSSELS, May 14The European Common Market's chief negotiator in the talks on British entry, JeanFrancois Deniau, said today that there are no really difficult problems left.

title: Mayor Upheld on Job Cut
description: Mayor Lindsay was upheld in State Supreme Court in Manhattan yesterday in his move to reduce the city payroll by 2,800 parttime and fulltime jobs.

title: EARL SANDMEYER, A BANK PUBLICIST
description: Earl C. Sandmeyer, a specialist in financial public relations, died yesterday at his home, 45 Tudor City Place, after a short illness. His age was 60.

title: HARM FOR YOUTHS FOUND IN SMOKING
description: Three Yale Medical School physicians have reported what they say is the first documented evidence of lung damage in teenagers who have smoked cigarettes for just a few years.

title: BASEL BANK SETS CREDITOR ACCORD
description: LOS ANGELES, May 14 (Reuters)  The United California Bank of Los Angeles said today that its subsidiary, the United California Bank in Basel, Switzerland, has filed with a Swiss court a proposed settlement agreement with creditors.

title: BERNARD ABRAMSON, A SECURITIES EXPERT
description: PASSAIC, N. J., May 14 Bernard Abramson, a former special deputy attorney of New York State, who retired as principal securities accountant of the New York State Law Department in 1967, died today at his home, 215 Passaic Avenue. He was 68 years old.

title: SUIT IS PLANNED ON POLICE SPIES
description: The Federal courts will be asked to enjoin the city's Police Department from future use of undercover agents in political organizations, such as the kind that supplied most of the evidence against 13 Black Panthers acquitted Thursday of an alleged bomb conspiracy.

title: Baptist Convention Elects Seattle Woman President
description: MINNEAPOLIS, May 14 Mrs. Ruth Swanberg Rohlfs of Seattle was elected president of the American Baptist Convention here today without opposition.

title: Dangerous Wave Proves Safe Gamble
description: WESTBURY, L.I., May 14 There are five men on horse at Roosevelt Raceway.

title: Magaddino's Son Acquitted
description: LOCKPORT, N. Y., May 14Peter A. Magaddino, the son of the man the Federal Government calls the head of all organized crime in western New York, was acquitted yesterday on the charge of possession of a loaded weapon.

title: Tests Mark Columbia Eleven's Drill
description: The 40yard dash is often used to evaluate football players in practice, mainly because that's the average distance a player might have to run on any given play.

title: Canada Records a Surplus In Her Balance of Payments
description: OTTAWA, May 14 (Canadian Press)Canada recorded another $70million surplus in her international balance of payments during the first quarter of 1971, the Dominion Bureau of Statistics reported today.

title: BlackOwned Concern Is Brewing Success
description: OSHKOSH, Wis., May 14 (AP)When the going gets rough, I send me.

title: 450 Israeli Bond Employes Out on Strike Across U.S.
description: About 450 employes of the organization that sells Israeli bonds throughout the country went on strike at 12:01 A.M. today in a contract dispute.

title: DOW INDEX DRIFTS TO LOWER GROUND
Senate to Vote Wednesday On Bid to Revitalize SST
description: The Senate agreed yesterday to hold its first vote next Wednesday on the unexpected new effort to resurrect the supersonic transport program.

title: The Panther Acquittal
description: The acquittal by a New York jury of the 13 Black Panthers who had been charged with conspiracy to bomb police stations and department stores should put to rest the unfounded but frequently heard comment that is impossible for a black militant to get a fair trial the United States. The outcome of this trial in New York State Supreme Court also exposes as a fraud the Panthers noisy and noisome oratory about the fascist nature of justice in America.

title: Austin Officials Upset
description: AUSTIN, Tex., May 14 (AP) Austin school officials reacted sharply today not to the principle of the Administration plan, but to the manner of its presentation.

title: NIXON UNIT BACKS A 12% WAGE PACT
description: WASHINGTON, May 14President Nixon's Construction Industry Stabilization Committee issued its first formal opinion today, approving a contract settlement in Little Rock, Ark., that provides an average wage increase of 12 per cent a year over three years.

title: I.L.G.W.U. Reelects Stulberg And Adds 3 Vice Presidents
description: MIAMI BEACH, May 4 Louis Stulberg was unanimously reelected today as president and secretarytreasurer of the International Ladies Garment Workers Union.

title: PRICES DIP AGAIN IN BOND TRADING
description: The credit markets, which have been afflicted with varying degrees of gloom ever since the international currency commotion began, sagged further early yesterday.

title: First Girl Page's Job: Water for a Senator
description: WASHINGTON, May 14 (AP)Paulette Desell, 17 years old, nervously fetched a glass of water, without spilling a drop, for the Senate's presiding officer.

title: RUSSIANS REPORT HIGH ENERGY GAIN
description: MOSCOW, May 14  Soviet nuclear physicists reported today that they had achieved an energy of two billion electron volts by colliding beams of electrons and positrons head on. This is the highest energy achieved so far in such collisions.

title: Executive Changes
description: Jerome Zelin has been promoted from vice president to the executive vice president of Unishops, Inc., discount department store. Benjamin Jackson and Seymour Brown, who were vice presidents, have been elected senior vice presidents. Mitchell. W. Rabin, the company's general counsel, has been elected secretary.

title: 2 Girls Found Drowned
description: ELLENVILLE, N. Y., May 14 (AP)The bodies of two girls were recovered today from Ulster Lake near here. The girls had been missing since their boat apparently capsized last night. They were Tyrice Allen. 12 years old, of Ellenville, and Jennifer Barnes, 10, of the Bronx.

title: TariffUnit Shift Results in Denials Of Workers Relief
description: WASHINGTON, May 14 The new shape of the Tariff Commission with the absence of a key member began to emerge today in several cases involving adjustment assistance for groups of workers.

title: Art:
description: Now that spring is in full flush and the weather is headily balmy, it might be in the mind of some New Yorkers to hole themselves up in a museum. No matter how bright the sunshine or how tempting the outdoors, no one should miss the two exhibitions that opened this week at the Pierpont Morgan Library. Not only is a visit to this gem of a museum a special pleasure at any time of year, but the two exhibitions also offer very special pleasures, too.

title: Louisville Beckons to G.O.P.
description: WASHINGTON, May 14 (AP) The Republican National Committee announced today that Louisville, Ky., had invited their party to hold its 1972

title: Bejeweled Town Rising In Australia's Wastes
description: NHULUNBUY, Australia A $38.6million modern town, completely airconditioned and with real gems embedded in the walls of every home, is rising here on the hot red earth of the remote Cove Peninsula of Arnhem Land.

title: Bomb Kills Athens Policemen
description: ATHENS, May 14  One Greek policeman was killed and another injured early today in the explosion of a time bomb planted at the statue of Harry S. Truman here.

title: They're Working Up From Rock Bottom
description: LOS ANGELESIf rock lyrics put women down, it's because they deserve it, Nickey Barclay said during a break in a recent recording session.

title: Rogers Enjoying Job These Days as Never Before
description: WASHINGTON, May 14Whether he was sipping boiled coffee in Saudi Arabia, speeding through Amman at midnight with King Hussein at the wheel, or arguing across the negotiating table with Premier Golda Meir in Israel, Secretary of State William P. Rogers conveyed a single, unmistakable impression last week to the reporters traveling with him on his Middle Eastern tour: He is enjoying his job these days as never before.

title: Carol Bankerd Wed to Playwright
description: PRINCETON, N. J., May 14 Miss Carol Bankerd was married to Richard Olson, a playwright, this afternoon in the Princeton University Chapel by the Rev. Dr. Ernest Gordon, Presbyterian minister and dean of the chapel.

title: ColomboKahane
description: Have Rabbi Meir Kahane and Joseph A. Colombo Sr. outsmarted themselves? The question arises inevitably in the wake of their muchpublicized alliance announced the other day. This incongruous marriage must startle many of their followers. It seems unlikely that members of the ItalianAmerican Civil Rights League are really exercized about the plight of Soviet Jews, while the most fanatical adherents of the Jewish Defense League can hardly regard the efforts to ban the word Mafia from the English language as a cause to stir them to action. In both camps, the readiness of the respective leaders join forces must raise questions in their followers minds about those leaders purpose and strategy.

title: SANS MARQUE WINS OPEN JUMPER EVENT
description: FARMINGTON, Conn., May 14Sans Marque, with his new owner, Barney Ward, riding, won the first open jumper class today in the opening session of the Children's Services Horse Show.

title: BOULEZ CONDUCTS THE PHILHARMONIC
description: The New York Philharmonic's final subscription program of the season is characteristic of Pierre Boulez, who was conducting it and who will take over the musical direction of the orchestra next season. It offered neither a big climactic work nor a cushioning, comfortable array of the familiar. It was a striking, even instructive, combination of old, new and inbetween pieces.

title: ROCKEFELLER ASKS MEDICAID RELIEF
description: ALBANY, May 14Governor Rockefeller has asked the legislature to restore some of the services for Medicaid recipients that were eliminated when it cut back the Medicaid program in enacting the 197172 budget.

title: Soviet Supersonic Jet To Be Shown in Paris
description: MOSCOW, May 14 (UPI)The Soviet Tupolev TU144 supersonic plane will be flown from the Soviet Union for the first time to be exhibited at the International Air Show in Paris May 27, the Soviet press agency, Tass, said today.

title: Calley Denied Freedom Pending Review
description: WASHINGTON, May 14 (AP) The Army refused today to let First Lieut. William L. Calley Jr. go free while his conviction for murdering at least 22 South Vietnamese civilians at Mylai is reviewed all the way up to President Nixon.

title: To the Editor: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Queens Apartment Blast Kills Fireman, Injures 60
description: One fireman was killed, two were critically injured and at least 60 other persons received less serious injuries last night in a gas explosion and fouralarm fire in an apartment building in Jamaica, Queens.

title: PROF. ADAM ABRUZZI, INDUSTRIAL ENGINEER
description: ATLANTA, May 14  Dr. Adarn Abruzzi, professor of industrial engineering at the Georgia Institute of Technology, died of a heart attack last Friday. He was 55 years old.

title: Earl G. Holmes Weds Mrs. Foote
description: TENAFLY, N. J., May 14Mrs. May Strangfeld Foote of Englewood, widow of Dr. Charles Cauldwell Foote, former medical director of General Motors in New York, was married today to Earl Gladstone Holmes, also of Englewood, a retired vice president of the Bank of New York. The ceremony in the chapel of Presbyterian Church of Tenafly was performed by the Rev. Harry E. Chase, assisted by the Rev. Edward S. Prevost, soninlaw of the bridegroom.

title: 4 Soviet Jews Convicted in 70 Are Said to Testify at Trial of 9
description: MOSCOW, May 14  Four Soviet Jews convicted last December after an unsuccessful attempt to hijack a plane were reported to have taken the stand today as witnesses at second Leningrad trial connected with the incident.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: British Laborites Sweep Local Voting
description: LONDON, May 19Labor party candidates made large gains in local elections throughout England and Wales yesterday.

title: Repeating a Pattern
description: With one pattern created by Moisha Kubinyi, a little sewing skill and a touch of imagination, a woman can whip up an entire summer wardrobe these days. In fact, the one $1.50 pattern can be used to turn out at least 140 different pieces of clothing — blouses, dresses,

title: Nation's Industrial Output Up for April
description: WASHINGTON, May 14Industrial production rose a little in April as further evidence of a gradual recovery of the economy from last year's recession, the Federal Reserve Board reported today.

title: Resumption of ATests In Nevada Is Approved
description: LAS VEGAS, Nev., May 14 (UPI)The United States will resume underground nuclear testing the first week in June after a fivemonth suspension owing to a radiation leak, it was announced today.

title: Soviet Gymnast Triumphs
description: MADRID, May 14 (AP)Vikogor Klimenko, 22 years old, of the Soviet Union won the European allround gymnastics championship today. He compiled a total of 56.90 points for the six events.

title: Jackson State Remembers in Anger
description: JACKSON, Miss., May 14It was near 10 P.M. and they walked slowly through the quiet Mississippi night holding candies that flickered in the dark ness.

title: West Germany's Exports To U.S. Hit Peak in Marcit
description: COLOGNE, West Germany, May 14 (UPI)West Germany's exports to the United States reached a record in March this year, totaling $343.3million, the Federal Industry Association announced today.

title: AMEX PRICES OFF; VOLUME EDGES UP
MonetaryPolicy Reform Set by Bank of England
description: LONDON, May 14 (AP)The Bank of England announced today plans for a major reform of its monetarypolicy tools with the aim of introducing greater competition and innovation in British banking and improving controls over credit conditions.

title: ROGERS OPPOSES WARPOWER CURB
description: WASHINGTON, May 14Secretary of State William P. Rogers told the Senate Foreign Relations Committee today that proposed legislation to restrict the President's war powers was impractical, probably unconstitutional and would weaken the President's ability to act in a crisis.

title: Green Light for Rail Progress
description: Even with a maximum of governmental prodding, breakthroughs toward greater efficiency are a rarity railroad labormanagement relations. Ancient rules and manning requirements hang on long after any justification for them has vanished. That bleak history makes particularly significant the agreement just reached by the railroads and the Brotherhood of Locomotive Engineers on abandonment of some of the most wasteful traditionencrusted practices.

title: NEW SCHOOL FETE ENDS ITS SEASON
description: Of the four works given first New York performances in the last of the Composers Theater May Festival concerts at the New School on Thursday night, Hubert Howe Jr.'s Interchanges for Tape seemed to this listener to he the most personal and arresting in its expression.

title: Chapman, Schleif, Dober and Bisconti Reach Semifinals in Richardson Golf
description: HEWLETT HARBOR, L.I., May 14Reginald Chapman of Greenwich, Conn., a golfer at Duke University in his undergraduate days, helped to revive interest in matchplay golf today as he gained the semifinal round of the William D. Richardson Memorial tournament.

title: Getting Women Better Jobs
description: The voice of industry, outlining current programs on equal opportunity for women and some of the problems still to be faced, was heard yesterday at the final session of a twoday conference on equal pay and promotion for women.

title: Power System Contract Set
description: The Babcock & Wilcox Company announced yesterday the receipt of a contract to build a $5million power generation system for the Savannah Electric & Power Company. The unit will be capable of generating 1,2 million pounds of steam an hour as part of an expansion program aimed at raising electrical production capacity by 176,000 kilowatts. It is scheduled for operation in March 1974.

title: Proposals Welcomed
description: LONDON, May 14 (Reuters)  The financial community here generally welcomed the proposals put forward today by the Bank of England to increase competition for credit and lift the quantitative ceiling controls that have borne heavily on the major British banks since the early nineteensixties.

title: 24 Letters by Charles II Turn Up at Yale
description: Twentyfour letters written in exile by the youthful Charles II before his ascent to the British throne in 1660, reveal he had a concern for amorous adventures that anticipates the ebullient mood of the Restoration.

title: FLINT GROUP IS SET IN SUPPORT OF G.M.
description: FLINT, Mich., May 14 (UPI) Support for the General Motors Corporation against vicious attacks from questionable sources and disruptive forces was announced today by group of influential citizens of this city where the giant auto company was born.

title: Fateful Drama on the Nile
description: It is not surprising that the disparate coalition that inherited and attempted to share the power of the late Egyptianand Arabrevolutionary hero, Gamel Abdel Nasser, is undergoing a major shakeup less than eight months after President Nasser's death.

title: Party Pays Farewell Tribute to Daphne's
description: The night they raided Daphne'sit was June 19, 1968a detective on the scene said the goingson were like a Roman orgy. According to the printed reports of the police raid, there were naked girls in the swimming pool, customers in the sauna bath and pandemonium in the rosewallpapered bedrooms.

title: Green Takes Stroke Lead With 137 in Houston Golf
Mahmoud Fawzi
description: Became Premier of Egypt last October after a 45year diplomatic career... known as a political neutral of dignity and unwavering calm, more of a technician than an architect of foreign policy speaks fluent English, French, Italian, Spanish, Greek, Japanese... born Sept. 19, 1900, in Shubra Bikhom, northwest of Cairo... after earning law degree in Cairo in 1923, went to Rome to obtain doctorate while working as clerk in the Egyptian Embassy. was assigned to consular duties in the United States in 1926, in Japan in 1929... later served as diplomat in Athens, Liverpool and Jerusalem... sent to the United Nations in 1946 as representative on the Security Council... after overthrow of King Farouk in 1952, he served briefly as Ambassador to Britain, then became Foreign Minister for 12 years, until 1964, when he was named a Deputy Premier for Foreign Affairs... lives in a Cairo suburb and pursues hobby of making finely patterned mosaics of colored sand... a widower, he is the father of two daughters and a son.

title: Down in the East Village
description: The East Village a stop for sightseers. For leadwriters, moralists and columnists, the contraction of an entire world. What sort of world?

title: Market Place: Offer by LTV For Debentures
description: There is a wealth of information in the 175page red herring that LingTemcoVought has prepared in connection with its forthcoming exchange offer for its 5 per cent debentures.

title: Art:
description: Any time you can't make up your mind what you think of an artist's work, you can always murmur, very interesting. Or if you are puzzled beyond measure, very, very interesting. By this standard of critical judgment, James McGarrell's new exhibition, The Quincy Inventions, at the Allan Frumkin Gallery, 41 East 57th Street, should make him just about the most interesting American painter at work today.

title: U.S. Daclines to ??
description: WASHINGTON, May 14The State Department declined to comment today on the Cabinet changes in Egypt. Charles W. Bray 3d, a State Department spokesman, said that it would be inappropriate for the United States to comment on Egypt's internal political affairs.

title: Fillol Reaches Final
description: LONDON, May 14 (UPI) Jaime Fillol of Chile reached the men's singles final today in the BioStrath London hardcourt tennis championships by beating Adrew Pattison of Rhodesia, 86, 63.

title: Jim French Is Favorite In 96th Preakness Today
description: BALTIMORE, May 14  The 96th running of the Preakness Stakes, the middle jewel of the Triple Crown for 3yearolds, will take place tomorrow with a field of 11 listed to compete for first money of $137,400 out of a gross purse of $189,900. Although he is not the favorite on the overnight line, the Venezuelanowned Canonero II appears to be the main magnet for the expected crowd of 40,000 at the Pimlico race track.

title: Books of The Times
description: Just keep it up and see where it gets you: this is the message of the futuristic novel. It takes our present behavior and carries it to its logical conclusion, which almost invariably turns out to be a reductio ad absurdum. The futuristic novelist is more interested in ideas than people. His characters are merely manikins for moral; they wear it like an illfitting suit or dress. In Love in the Ruins, Walker Percy has worked hard to avoid this d e h u manization. His hero, Thomas More, is almost redundantly human. To demonstrate that he exists, the author has given him satyriasis, psychosis, lapsed Catholicism, large bowel complaints, alcoholism and hives. He fairly itches with humanity. All the same, he is charming fellow, an appealing tragicomedian who is closely related to Percy's hero in his first novel, The Moviegoer, which won the National Book Award 10 years ago.

title: PRICES ADVANCE FOR NEW ISSUES
description: The newissue market, where shares of companies that have never previously had public owners are traded, posted another strong advance on moderate trading this week.

title: 53 MURDER CASE ON LI REVERSED
description: The seconddegree murder conviction of a Long Island potato picker imprisoned since 1953 was overturned yesterday and his release ordered by Federal district judge in Brooklyn.

title: April Business Up At Seaboard Line; L. &
description: While several railroad executives in the East have complained this week about business being soft so far this year, W. Thomas Rice, chairman of Seaboard Coast Line Industries, Inc., told stockholders yesterday at the company's annual meeting in Richmond that April's business had continued the trend of the March quarter.

title: Early Birds Get Rare Look at Canonero
description: BALTIMORE, May 14The backstretch at Pimlico was bathed in sunlight at 7:30 this morning, more than enough light for the curious and the rival trainers to look at and wonder about Canonero II, the Kentucky Derby winner from Venezuela who isn't even the favorite for tomorrow's $189,900 Preakness.

title: Man Pleads Guilty After Jury Deadlock
description: Less than half an hour after a State Supreme Court jury, reported yesterday that it was deadlocked, but while it was still deliberating at the judge's order, the defendant in the case pleaded guilty to murdering a police sergeant during a Harlem gun battle last November.

title: War Foes Charged in Plot To Be Arraigned May 25
description: HARRISBURG, Pa., May 14 (UPI)A Federal judge today set May 25 for the arraignment of eight antiwar activists charged in an alleged plot to undermine the Selective Service system and kidnap a Presidential adviser, Henry A. Kissinger, to protest the Indochina war.

title: 15 Soviet Trawlers Damage Gear on American Boat
description: BOSTON, May 14 (DPI) About 15 Russian fishing trawlers ran through the fishing gear of an American lobster boat in international waters off Nantucket Island tonight, the seventh such incident in 10 days, the Coast Guard reported.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Student Smoking Increases
description: A threeyear study of 23,724 students in 62 Illinois junior and senior high schools indicates the percentage of students who smoke cigarettes has probably increased in the last 10 years, the American Cancer Society reports, according to The Associated Press.

title: Papal Letter Seen as Pragmatic On Social and Political Issues
description: ROME, May 14The Vatican officially made public today an apostolic letter by Pope Paul VI advocating a search fora new kind of free society.

title: Frog Jump Set on Coast
description: ANGELES CAMP, Calif., May 14 (AP)Two thousand frogs and about 30,000 people are expected here over the weekend for the 44th annual Jumping Frog Jubilee. The feature event of the Calaveras County Fair was inspired by Mark Twain's 106yearold tale about a champion frog who failed because gamblers fed him buckshot.

title: Saigon Force Reported Making New Sweep in East Cambodia
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Saturday, May 15 (AP)A new South Vietnamese sweep with United States air support is reported under way in eastern Cambodia.

title: Bill to Seek Stay of Executions
description: WASHINGTON, May 14 Legislation will be introduced in Congress next week to impose a twoyear stay on state and Federal executions.

title: THAI RADIO ATTACKS ON CHINA ARE HALTED
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, May 14  The Thai Government instructed all Government radio stations to cease propaganda attacks against China yesterday as Foreign Minister Thanat Khoman announced that prospects for a real dialogue between the two countries had developed.

title: Notes on People
description: John D. Rockefeller 3d will retire June 30 from the board of trustees of the Rockefeller Foundation, after 40 years of service, nearly half of them as board chairman.

title: Czechoslovakia Moves On
description: Jan Kodes and Jan Kukal carried Czechoslovakia to the European Davis Cup Zone A semifinals yesterday by defeating the Portugese doubles team of Paul Peralta and Alfredo VazPinto, 60, 62, 61.

title: Art:
description: Preoccupied as it is with big league building plans and lavish acquisitions, the Metropolitan Museum, mirabile dicta, still has a place in its heart for Little Red Riding Hood. The evidence lies in Once Upon a Time a Selection of Fairy Tale Drawings, Prints and Illustrated Books, drawn mostly from the museum's own collections and mounted in its Prints and Drawings Galleries.

title: HOMER M. ROCKWELL, MAGAZINE OFFICIAL
description: Homer M. Rockwell, a former New York advertising man and magazine executive, died Monday in Sarasota, Fla., after a brief illness. He was 68 years old.

title: Foe of Paternalism
description: NEW BRUNSWICK, N. J., May 15  Administering a college today is like playing chess on the open deck of the sinking Titanic; to make matters worse, the chess rules seem to be changing as the game proceeds.

title: PRESS STRIKE HITS PITTSBURGH AGAIN
description: PITTSBURGH, May 14Union printers walked off their jobs early today, forcing this city's two daily newspapers to cease publication. The strike was the second to shut down newspapers here this year.

title: WARRANT AWAITS MISS BACON HERE
description: A warrant charging Leslie Bacon with complicity in the attempt to firebomb a New York banks last year was obtained yesterday by the local office of the Federal Bureau. of Investigation.

title: Patrolmen Are Still Unpenalized 4 Months After Illegal Walkout
description: Four months after the fiveday, wildcat walkout by the city's patrolmen, the Lindsay administration has yet to dock the pay of the striking patrolmen or place them on a year's probation, in accordance with the mandatory provisions of the Taylor Law.

title: Prisons Curb Brutal Discipline
description: WASHINGTON, May 14 The nation's prisons are moving away from the most severe and physically punishing forms of discipline, and the sternest measures remaining are often imposed with increasing restraint.

title: U.S. Files Suit to Dissolve TandyAllied Radio Merger
description: WASHINGTON, May 14 (AP) The Government filed suit today to require the Tandy Corporation of Dallas to sell the electronicsproducts business it acquired from the Allied Radio Corporation of Chicago more than a year ago.

title: 5 AT NAVAL ACADEMY OUSTED FOR DRUG USE
description: ANNAPOLIS, Md., May 14 (AP)The United States Naval Academy has conducted its fourth drug raid in as many years, this one resulting in the expulsion of five midshipmen for the use of marijuana. Three other cases are under investigation.

title: Husak, in Warning on West, Assails Top Singer
description: PRAGUE, May 14  Gustav Husak, Czechoslovakia's Communist party chief, lashed out today against the nation's leading popular singer in an attempt to warn his people against what he termed the influence of Western propaganda.

title: Lighter Side of Currency Crisis
description: PARIS, May 14All Paris is flocking to see the latest hit Western, The Massacre at Fort Knox, starring Richard Nixon and WillyMark, according to France's leading satirical newspaper, Le Canard Enchaine.

title: New Cabinet Chiefs Take Oath of Office In Cairo ShakeUp
description: CAIRO, May 14President Anwar elSadat swore in a new Cabinet tonight to fill posts that fell vacant last night in a political challenge that led to five resignations and one Ordered resignation.

title: REDISTRICTING PLAN IN MISSISSIPPI BARRED
description: JACKSON, Miss., May 14 (AP)  A threejudge Federal panel threw out Mississippi's legislative reapportionment plan today on the ground that it did not distribute seats on a population basis.

title: RCA Raises Prices On Color TV Sets An Average of 5%
description: The RCA Corporation said yesterday that the RCA line of 1972 color television receivers to be introduced to distributors next week will reflect a price increase averaging 5 per cent.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Casey Visits Floor of Exchange
description: William J. Casey, the new chairman of the Securities and Exchange Commission, dropped in on the floor of the New York Stock Exchange yesterday and got a cordial reception from the men working at the seat of American capitalism.

title: SADAT DECLARES HE FOILED A COUP; INSTALLS CABINET
description: CAIRO, May 14  President Anwar elSadat declared in a broadcast to the Egyptian people tonight that an attempted coup d'etat was behind the resignations last night of six (leading members of his Government and three top officials in the Arab Socialist Union, the country's only political organization.

title: Long Island Marine Faces Trial As First to Aid Foe in Vietnam
description: WASHINGTON, May 14 (AP) The Marine Corps ordered today a general courtmartial for a young sergeant accused of desertion and aiding the enemy while a prisoner of war in Vietnam.

title: President Flies to Florida
description: HOMESTEAD, Fla., May 14 (AP)President Nixon flew to Florida today to spend the weekend at his villa on nearby Hey Biscayne. He was accompanied by the White House chief of staff, H. R. Haldeman, and by his chief speechwriter, Raymond Price. The President was expected to return to the White House Monday.

title: URBAN GROUP JOINS AN ETHNIC ALLIANCE
description: The Urban Coalition and a group of ItalianAmerican organizations announced last night that they had formed an alliance to bring ethnic Americans and minority groups closer together.

title: Six Cite Gains in Foreign Policy Talks
description: PARIS, May 14  This is the springtime of Europe.

title: Court of Appeals Rejects Challenge to State Budget
description: ALBANY, May 14  The State Court of Appeals today rejected a challenge to the constitutionality of the state's 19711972 budget.

title: Arab World Appears Stunned by Crisis
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, May 14The Arab world seemed stunned today by the political crisis in Egypt. Supporters of Cairo's policies expressed deep concern, while more conservative Arab groups appeared pleased.

title: OGDEN BIGELOW, 71, CONNECTICUT BANKER
description: STAMFORD, Conn., May 14Ogden Bigelow, former president of the Connecticut Bankers Association, died today. He was 71 years old and lived at 1 Putnam Hill, Greenwich.

title: F.C.C. Will Review Its Doctrine On Fairness and Public Access
description: WASHINGTON, May 14 (AP)The Federal Communications Commission announced today that it would review its fairness doctrine and other policies on public access to radio and television airwaves,

title: 3 Turnpike Employes Held. In Greenwich, Conn., Inquiry
description: HARTFORD, May 14 (AP)Three Connecticut Turnpike toll station employes were arrested at their posts in Greenwich this morning in the investigation into thefts of turnpike collections.

title: Laird Will Visit Japan Some Time This Year
description: WASHINGTON, May 14The Pentagon said today that Secretary of Defense Melvin R. Laird would visit Japan this year. It would be the first such visit by an American Defense Secretary.

title: Smallpox Gains Noted
description: ATLANTA, May 14 (AP) Today was the 175th anniversary of the first smallpox vaccination, and an official of the National Center for Disease Control predicted that the disease will be eradicated throughout the world by 1974, Dr. William Foerge, head of the Smallpox Eradication Program, said only eight countries reported cases of small pox last December. He believes only six Sudan, Ethiopia, India, Pakistan, Afghanistan and Nepalwill be affected by the end of this year.

title: Levitt Lists Plan to Protect Public Employes Pensions
description: State Controller Arthur Levitt told a conference of pension fund officials here yesterday that he was urging an amendment to the State Constitution to improve the protection of members of retirement systems for public employes.

title: ANTHONY FREDERICK, MOVIE STUDIO AIDE
description: Anthony J. Frederick, vice president of personnel and labor relations for Universal Studios, died of a heart attack here yesterday. Mr. Frederick, who was 53 years old and a resident of Pasadena, Calif., was in New York on a business trip.

title: INSURANCE CONCERNS IN INDIA ARE SEIZED
description: NEW DELHI, May 14Prime Minister Indira Gandhi's Government, apparently to demonstrate its commitment to the socialist platform on which it was elected last March, has taken over the management of all private general insurance companies in India, including the 42 foreign ones.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: A recent letter from John H. Slack indicating the need for freedom from the press at first inspired in this reader an anticipatory vision of other novel freedoms similarly derived from transubstantiation of the Bill of Rights.

title: Hosea Williams Is Freed In Preachin at Cathedral
description: A Manhattan Criminal Court jury of four women and two men yesterday found Hosea Williams, Southern Christian: Leadership Conference program director, not guilty of disorderly conduct charges filed after he and 15 supporters allegedly disrupted a Palm Sunday service at St. Patrick's Cathedral.

title: Susan Potts Bride Of Charles Bloom
description: STRAF'FORD, Pa., May 14 Miss Susan Halsey Potts and Charles Joseph Bloom were married here this evening at the home of the bride's parents, Mr. and Mrs. Robert Henderson Potts. The bridegroom's parents are Mr. and Mrs. Isaac C. Bloom of Washington.

title: GEORGE R. NEVIUS
description: SOMERVILLE, N. J., May 14 (AP)George R. Nevius, chairman of the board of a chain of Central Jersey department stores, died today at Somerset Hospital. He was 82 years old.

title: ALCOA IS DROPPING A SMELTER PROJECT
description: The Aluminum Company of, America said yesterday in Pittsburgh that it had abandoned plans to spend $60million or More for a smelter and refinery on Okinawa, part of the Ryukyu Islands.

title: Incident on the A Train
description: He sat alone, halfway down the car near the middle doors, on the other side. He and I and perhaps six or eight otherspassengers speeding northward from Columbus Circle toward the George Washington Bridge and beyond. It was late. He would get off in Harlem. I'd walk underground from 175th Street and hope to catch the last bus for north Jersey.

title: Ordeal Recounted in Book
description: In the book he wrote while on Death Row, Brief Against Death, Edgar H. Smith Jr. had this to say about his ordeal:

title: Trumbo's Johnny Got His Gun Is Screened at Cannes Festival
description: CANNES, France, May 14 Luis Bufiuel, who rarely attends his own conferences at film festivals, astonished everyone here today by coming to one held by Dalton Trumbo, whose first film, Johnny Got His Gun had just been screened.

title: INDIANS ASK HALT OF STRIP MINING
description: WASHINGTON, May 14  A band of Hopi Indians asked the United States District Court today to halt the strip mining of coal on their ancestral grounds in Arizona.

title: Upstate Phosphate Ban
description: GOSHEN, N. Y., May 14 (AP)The Orange County Legislature voted 127 today to ban the sale of phosphate detergents. The effective date will be decided later.

title: COASTAL GAS CITES GAINS IN EARNINGS
description: The Coastal States Gas Producing company reported yesterday gains in revenues and net income for the nine months ended March 31.

title: Nuptials for Jean D. Cook, Editor
description: The marriage of Miss Jean Davis Cook, managing editor of Town & Country magazine, to Henry Charles Barkhorn, a vice president and treasurer of Mutual of New York, took place here yesterday. Abbot Martin Burne of St. Mary's Abbey in Morristown, N. J., performed the ceremony in the Roman Catholic Church of St. Thomas More.

title: Nixon Urged to Visit Peking
description: WASHINGTON, May 14 (UPI) Senator George S. McGovern, Democrat of South Dakota, proposed today that President Nixon visit Communist China. The President, Senator McGovern said in a statement, has perfect chance now to move the United States closer to normal relations with the People's Republic of China. Statements just yesterday in Peking are a sure sign that the Chinese are anxious to expand their relations with this country.

title: Rail Labor Talks Pressed As Monday Deadline Nears
description: WASHINGTON, May 14 (UPI) Negotiators for the railroads and the Brotherhood of Railway Signalmen continued to talk separately today with Federal mediators, but the president of the 13,000member union said, I'm not too optimistic about the prospects of averting a strike Monday at 6 A.M.

title: Buy American in New York
description: The New York Stale Assembly has passed a bill that would require all state agencies, public authorities and local governments to refuse bids in excess of $2,000 from any foreign firm or corporation. The only exceptions to this outright prohibition against public buying of foreign goods or services would be for products not available in this country, goods of a quality unobtainable from an American supplier, and products using foreign materials that are substantially manufactured in the United States.

title: Councilman Sworn With Eight Others To New Taxi Unit
description: The chairman and the eight members of the new Taxi Commission were sworn in yesterday by Mayor Lindsay, who directed them to bring about a degree of order to a vast industry.

title: AT HOME ABROAD
description: LONDON, May 14For once it was right to use that overworked newspaper adjective, historic. That was the way it felt in Brussels this week as the latest round of negotiations on Britain's application to join the Common Market ended at daybreak.

title: DONNA CAPONI GAINS GOLF LEAD BY SHOT
Gains Against Dollar Slight As Week Here Ends Quietly
description: Foreign exchange markets here were quiet yesterday as major European currencies trading at floating or revalued rates finished the week with relatively modest gains against the dollar.

title: BILL SEEKS RIGHT FOR U.S. COURTS TOWITHHOLD BAIL
description: WASHINGTON, May 14The Administration submitted to Congress today legislation that would allow all Federal courts to detain certain defendants in prison before they have been tried.

title: BONN WARNS U.S. ON TROOP CUTBACK
description: BONN, May 14The West German Government cautioned today that an abrupt reduction of American troop strength in Europe would seriously upset the balance of power there, threatening not only Western Europe but also the United States.

title: After 14 Years on Death Row, a Victory
description: NEWARK, May 14A Federal judge today set aside the murder conviction of Edgar H. Smith Jr., who has been on Death Row for 14 years. The judge ruled that Smith's confession was invalid because it had been coerced.

title: U.S. Welcomes the Move
description: WASHINGTON, May 14The Administration welcomed today the Soviet proposal for negotiations on reducing troops and armaments in Europe.

title: ARA Services Shows Rise in Earnings for 26Week Period
Cecil Taylor's Mendota Players Heard in Hunter Jazz Concert
description: Cecil Taylor, the jazz pianist, who is rarely heard here in concert, was scheduled to give one Thursday at 8:40 P.M. at the Hunter College Playhouse. But he did notnot then. Instead, he turned the program over to the Mendota Players, 17piece ensemble he has been directing since last September while he has been artistinresidence at the University of Wisconsin.

title: KENTUCKY ENSEMBLE IN TOWN HALL DEBUT
description: The Kentucky Chamber Orchestra made a pleasing first impression at Town Hall Thursday night under the direction of its 28yearold founderconductor, Yoav Talmi. The program, a benefit for the scholarship fund of the AmericaIsrael Cultural Foundation, also included three young Israeli artists who, like Mr. Talmi, had been recipients df earlier foundation grants: Sergiu Luca, violinist, John Gabriel Spiro, baritone, and the conductor's wife, Erella Talmi, flutist.

title: Bennington President to Head Rutgers
description: NEW BRUNSWICK, N.J., May 14Dr. Edward J. Bloustein, the 46yearold, president ofl Bennington College, Benningington, Vt., was named president of Rutgers University today.

title: U. S. Official Tells the Council of Europe Greek Regime Has Wide Public Support
description: STRASBOURG, France, May 14 (AP)The United States told the Council of Europe today that the fouryearold Greek militarybacked regime received broad support from the people despite what the United States called disappointingly slow progress toward greater democratic freedom.

title: Bridge: Aces Called Slight: Favorites Over France for World Title
description: TAIPEI, Taiwan, May 14The world champion Aces finished as comfortable winners of the qualifying stage here in their attempt to retain their title.

title: Waiting for My Friend
description: Sally J., aged 14 years, school dropout and a dropout of life itself.

title: The Liveliest Place On the Playground
description: SCARSDALE, N. Y.Nestled near some young saplings on a broad field outside the Quaker Ridge School is a festivelooking play structure. It is painted red, yellow and blue, has two slides, a climbing platform and a fire pole and during school recess is covered with a blur of rapidly moving children.

title: Washington: For the Record
description: Activities. The President met with representatives of major senior citizens organizations. Later in the morning he met with his advisory committee on voluntary foreign aid. The President planted a threefoothigh sequoia tree from the Forest Service nursery in California on the White House south grounds the seventh tree planted by a President since John Quincy Adams planted one in 1826. The President then flew to his Key Biscayne, Fla., home for the weekend.

title: Crime Figure Defends Life
description: ROCHESTER, May 14 (UPI) Frank J. Valenti, reputed boss of gambling and organized crime in greater Rochester, won a standing ovation from the ItalianAmerican Civil Rights League when he declared last night that he has lived as clean as a priest for the last 35 years.

title: Gas Leaks Sealed by Injection
description: WASHINGTON, May 14A Florida engineer has invented a method of sealing gaspipeline leaks without any digging, He injects into the pipe a gas compound that reacts with outside air or water wherever it escapes, plugging the cracks or holes. Joseph J.

title: PRICES ADVANCE IN CORN FUTURES
description: Corn futures prices rose yesterday on speculative support that pushed the May corn delivery price up more than 3 cents a bushel on the Chicago Board of Trade.

title: The Governor's Maneuver
description: Governor Rockefeller has long since abandoned principle in his advocacy of increased public support for churchrelated schools. Fiscal and political expediency now appear to be his sole guidelines on that crucial issue.

title: Roundup: Siebert Gives Orioles Nine O's
description: Sonny Siebert, who once batted 400 as an outfielder in a College World Series for the University of Missouri, kept the corner of Jersey Street and Brookline Avenue in Boston rocking last night.

title: MAUDE SHONGO HURD
description: IRVING, N. Y., May 14Mrs. Maude Shongo Hurd, one of the national leaders in the movement to preserve Indian heritage, died in this Chatauqua County community yesterday. She was 87 years old.

title: Excerpts From the Apostolic Letter
description: ROME, May 14Following, as made public today by the Vatican, are excerpts from the official English version of the apostolic letter by Pope Paul VI on social and political questions:

title: Lawyer in the Harlem 5 Case Sees Vindication
description: The lawyer for four young men found guilty Thursday night of possession of weapons and bombs in the Harlem Five conspiracy trial said yesterday that his clients would appeal.

title: Philanthropist to Close
description: The Philanthropist, a comedy by Christopher Hampton, costarring Alec McCowen, Jane Asher and Victor Spinetti, will end its Broadway engagement after tonight's performance, the 72d, at the Ethel Barrymore Theater.

title: Woman Member of J.D.L. Is Declared a Fugitive
