description: SANTIAGO, Chile, May 20 The Chilean state copper com pany announced today that in spectors and auditors were be ing assigned to investigate ir regularities in the operations of the El Tenente Mine, partly owned by the Kennecott Cop per Company.

title: New Rabbi at Columbia Gets BroadBased Support
description: A 28yearold rabbi at Co lumbia University has become a symbol of a restructuring of the university community that has followed the campus dis orders of 1968.

title: U.S. Challenges Law Against Miscegenation
description: WASHINGTON, May 20 (UPI)  The Justice Depart ment filed suit against the state of Georgia and a county official today over refusal to issue a marriage license to a white Army lieutenant and his black fiance.

title: Nixon Nuptials To Use Prayers Of 3 Churches
description: WASHINGTON, May, 20 (AP)  The Rose Garden wedding service for Tricia Nixon, a Quaker, and Ed ward Finch Cox, an Episco palian, will be ecumenical with traditional prayers chosen by the couple from Episcopal, Methodist and Roman Catholic marriage services, the White House announced today.

title: Wood, Field and Stream
description: The six American delegates from the Committee on the Atlantic Salmon Emergency (CASE) who visited Denmark recently in an effort to per suade that country to end its high seas fishery for Atlantic salmon in the Davis Strait off Greenland believe that they are no closer to their goal. But they also feel that the coverage given their visit by Denmark's news media helped to inform the people of that country that their govern ment has embarked on a voyage that is encountering stormy sailing in foreign waters.

title: SPEED DEFENDED ON DUMPING CURB
description: Eugene T. Rossides, Assistant Secretary of the Treasury, as sured importers yesterday that stricter and swifter enforce ment of the Antidumping Act will not be made an instru ment of protectionism.

title: Chou, at a Dinner, Describes Birth of Rift With Soviet
description: PEKING, May 5Premier Chou Enlai said today that Ste split between Moscow and Peking developed because Ni ?? S. Khrushchev took the road of revisionism and peace ful coexistence rather than continuing vigorous revolution after he came to power in the nineteenfifties.

title: Warning on Mercury in Fish Eased for Some State Waters
description: Earlier warnings against the eating of any fish taken from certain New York State waters because of possible mercury contamination were eased yes terday by state officials.

title: Jersey Lottery621384
description: WILLNGBORO, N. J., May 20 (AP)The winning number in this week's New Jersey lottery, drawn today, was 621384.

title: SCHOOL UNIT SPLIT ON EXAMINER BILL
description: The Board of Education divided yesterday on whether to support a bill, already backed by Chancellor Harvey B. Scribner, that would abolish the Board of Examiners.

title: British AvantGarde In 100Work Show
description: In an endeavor to bring the avantgarde art of other countries to New York, the New York Cultural Center, Columbus Circle, initiated earlier this year a series of avantgarde exhibitions. The first offering was devoted to what was considered the most recent artistic achieve ments of the Swiss and for next year the center has planned exhibitions for the avantgarde of France and South America. The British avantgarde, a selection of approximately 100 works by 17 English artists, is current ly occupying two floors of the center.

title: Franulovic Defeats Cox, 60, 98, 62, to Gain British HardCourt Final
description: BOURNEMOUTH, England, May 20 (UPI)  Zeljko Franu lovic of Yugoslavia, troubled only in the second set, beat the British lefthander, Mark Cox, 60, 98, 62, today to reach the men's singles final at the $36,000 British hardcourt ten nis championships.

title: Guerin Agrees to Coach Hawks for Another Year
description: ATLANTA, May 20 (AP) The Atlanta Hawks of the Na tional Basketball Association announced tonight that Richie Guerin would coach the Hawks next season.

title: John J. Hogan, 77, Owned Funeral Home in Queens
description: John J. Hogan, former owner and president of the Fogarty Funeral Home, Flushing, Queens, died on Wednesday of cancer. He was 77 years old and lived at the funeral home, 13625 41st Avenue.

title: Janacek's Jenufa Is Welcomed in Prague
description: PRAGUE, May 20,Opera in Prague is looking up a great deal, thanks to last night's performance of Jana cek's Jenufa at the Na tional Theater.

title: Market Entry May Curb Reserve Role of Sterling
description: PARIS, May 20 If Europe is at the historic turning point that Prime Minister Heath mentioned yesterday on his ar rival in Paris for talks with President Pompidou, one of the many things that could change is the role of the pound.

title: Harold Metcalf, ExChief Of Colonial Rope Company
description: AUBURN, N.Y., May 20 (AP)  Harold G. Metcalf, former president and board chairman of Colonial Rope Company, died at Auburn Memorial Hospital last night after a long illness. His age was 88.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Israeli Panthers Freed
description: JERUSALEM, May 20, (Reu ters)The last 20 of the more than 100 Israelis in a group called the Black Panthers were released this morning. The Panthers, from oriental Jew ish communities, mainly from Morocco, were detained here Tuesday after rioting. They con tend there is discrimination against them and delays in dealing with poverty among the oriental communities.

title: Senate Resumes Draft Law Debate and Plans a Vote on Pay Rises
description: WASHINGTON, May 20  Having disposed last night of the issues of American troop strength in Europe and the su personic transport plane, the Senate returned today to what is expected to be a protracted debate on the draft law.

title: Strike Cuts Deliveries Of Parcels
description: Operations of the United Parcel Service in the metro politan New YorkNew Jer sey area were brought to a halt yesterday by a strike of 5,500 teamsters after nego tiations for a new contract collapsed.

title: Cape Cod Tenants to Fight Tourism
description: HYANNIS, Mass., May 20 As long as anyone here can remember, many of Cape Cod's poor families have run like tideout of winter homes by Memorial Day, back into winter homes after Labor Dav.

title: AsameraControlled Group Finds Oil in North Sumatra
description: The Asamera Oil Corpora tion, Ltd., announced yesterday that a group in which it holds a majority interest has made an oil discovery in North Sumatra.

title: Move to Open Road
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, May 20 (AP)The govenment an nounced the brgining of a new effort to open an alternate supply route from Pnompenh to the sea.

title: Front Page 1  No Title
description: NEW WEEKLY BIOGRAPHICAL SERVICE The New York Times Biographical Service. Write: The New York Times. Library Services, Bra FP.480, 229 West 43d street. New York. N. Y. 10036 Advt.

title: NIXON URGED TO ACT ON DOMESTIC NEEDS
description: WASHINGTON, May 20 (AP) The Democratic Policy Coun cil has called for a shifting of financial resources from pri vate to Government channels to try to meet growing na tional needs in health, welfare, employment and other domes tic problems.

title: Class 44: A Dip Into the Joys of Poetry
description: The time came this week for Class 44 at Public School 198 to write letters of  hail and farewell to its departing student teacher, Mrs. Gabri ella Corrigan. You are my fourth best student teacher, Fred Fiandaca wrote.

title: West Fights East on Brecht Works
description: A group of international publishers has made known its determination to block any attempt by the East German Government to control world rights to the literary estate of Bertolt Brecht.

title: New Offer by Western Electric Is Made to C.W.A. Installers
description: The Western Electric Com pany made a new and im proved offer yesterday to the Communications Workers of America, which represents the 29,000 workers in the com pany's nationwide installation unit.

title: Executive Changes
description: Investors Diversified Services announced yesterday the election of Charles R. Orem as president and a director of the mutual fund company which man ages asseta of nearly $8billion. He succeeds Stuart F. Silloway, who. has been elected vice chairman. Mr. Silloway, who remains as chief executive. offi cer, has been president since 1964. He will retire in November. Mr. Orem, 54 years old, who resigned as president of Armour & Co., last week, will join the fund Which is controlled by the Alleghany Corpo ration on July 1.

title: Phils'Wise Hands Mets 5th Loss in Row, 10;
description: PHILADELPHIA, May 20  The New York Mets' losing streak rose to five games to nighttheir worst slump since last Julywhen Rick Wise pitched the Philadelphia Phillies to a 10 victory in Veterans Stadium.

title: 2 Punished on Term Papers
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., May 20 (AP)Harvard has meted out university discipline to two history students who turned in identical term papers written by a commercial concern, Dean Archie Epps said yesterday. A graduate student was suspend ed for one year, Dean Epps said, and an undergraduate was dismissed.

title: Streisand in Marital Pact
description: Barbra Streisand and her hus band, Elliot Gould, have entered into a private separation agree ment, it was disclosed yesterday in State Supreme Court. The agreement filed with the court clerk was dated Feb. 10. After two years of separation either the wife or the husband may file for divorce.

title: House Panel Links Communists to War Protests
description: WASHINGTON, May 20The House Internal Security Com mittee heard evidence today that members of the Socialist Workers party and the Com munist party were among the leaders of the recent antiwar demonstrations here.

title: LENINGRAD COURT SENTENCES 9 JEWS
description: MOSCOW, May 20  A Len ingrad court today found nine Soviet Jews guilty of organized antiSoviet activity and sen tenced them to prisoncamp terms ranging from one to 10 years.

title: Experts See Soviet and U.S. Nuclear Arsenals in Rough Balance
description: WASHINGTON, May 20  As the United States and the Soviet Union seek to halt some elements of the arms race, their respective nuclear arsenals are viewed by most American anal ysts as being in rough balance.

title: Fanny May Raports Earnings
description: WASHINGTON, May 20 (AP) The Federal National Mort gage Association reported today that earnings for April were 27 cents a share. In the first three months of the year the asso ciation earned 53 cents a share. Comparable earnings for April, 1970, were not made available.

title: Printers Reelect Officers
description: Bertram A. Powers, president, and other top officers of Typo graphical Union No. 6 were re elected yesterday to twoyear terms starting June 20. Mr. Powers defeated Nicholas Va genas by a vote of 6,365 to 2,023, according to a union spokesman. David W. Crockett kept his post as vice president, and Thomas W. Kopeck was re elected secretarytreasurer.

title: 2 Patrolmen Are Indicted In a Narcotics Case Here
description: Two New York City patrol men were indicted yesterday on charges of taking two bags of heroin and a hypodermic needle from one of two alleged narcotic users on May 4, then releasing them without making an arrest.

title: Market Place: Listen to This, You Little Guhys
description: Let's hear it from an old research hand. William R. Grant used to be head of research at Smith, Barney & Co., Inc. Now he's president, and in that capacity he re cently told a television audi ence a few things be had learned about the fine art of getting and spending in Wall Street.

title: CANADIAN GETS LIFE IN LAPORTE MURDER
description: MONTREAL, May 20 (Cana dian Press)Francis Simard, a 23yearold student, was sen tenced today to life imprison ment after having been found guilty of noncapital murder in the death by strangulation of Pierre Laporte, who was Que bec's Minister of Labor and Im migration.

title: Peace Talks Session Put Off
description: PARIS, May 20 (UPI)To day's session of the Vietnam peace talks was put off until next Thursday to allow French Government employes at the conference center to observe Ascension Day, a Roman Cath olic holiday.

title: KENNETH L. WILSON, EXASSEMBLYMAN, 63
description: STEWART, Fla., May 20 (AP)Kenneth L. Wilson, a for mer New York State Assembly man, died here yesterday. He was 63 years old.

title: Store Sales Increase
description: WASHINGTON, May 20  The Commerce Department to day estimated last week's de partment store sales at $764 million, up 9 per cent from the yearearlier $698million.

title: Front Page 2  No Title
description: EVERY week, more than 26,000 jobs are advertised. In The New York Times. See the Employment Columns today.ADVT.

title: NEW BILL LIMITS CAMPAIGN COSTS
description: WASHINGTON, May 20  Legislation to limit campaign spending on radio and televi sion and in ncwspapers and pe riodicals was proposed today by the chief sponsor of a more limited bill vetoed last year by President Nixon.

title: PIPING ROCK WINS IN WOMEN'S GOLF
description: RIVER VALE, N. J., May 20 Piping Rock of Long Island won the Women's Metropolitan Golf Association intersectional interclub team competition to day by defeating Round Hill of Westchester and Somerset Hills of New Jersey.

title: Wells Fargo Bank Unit
description: The Wells Fargo Bank, N. A., San Francisco, a unit of Wells Fargo & Co., yesterday dis closed that it filed papers last month with the Federal Re serve Board for the establish ment of an Edge Act sub sidiary, to he situated in Miami, to transact international busi ness, principally in Latin America. The bank, to be called the Wells Fargo InterAmerican Bank, will have a capital base of $2million.

title: SEALE JURORS WEIGH CASE FOR SECOND DAY
description: NEW HAVEN, May 20A jury of seven whites and five blacks ended its second day of deliberations in the SealeHug gins murder trial this evening without giving any sign that a verdict was near.

title: G.M. Will Face Its Critics at Its Annual Meeting Today
description: DETROIT, May 20The Gen eral Motors Corporation, the major business target of to day's social critics, faces those critics again here tomorrow afternoon.

title: Johnson Library Doors To Open on Everybody
description: AUSTIN, Tex., May 20 There are going to be faces from Jim Farley to Richard Nixon, and that's a long stretch, Elizabeth Carpenter said today.

title: Activist Denies Any Role
description: NEW HAVEN, May 20 (UPI)  Stewart Albert, an antiwar activist, said today that he spent the night of the Capitol bombing in Washington with Miss Bacon and that neither of them had been involved in its planning or execution.

title: 9th Midshipman Dismissed
description: ANNAPOLIS, Md., May 20 (AP)The United States Naval Academy announced today that it had dismissed another mid shipman for using drugs in con nection with the most recent investigation. This brings to nine the number of midship men expelled for using mari juana. He was identified as a sophomore. Two of the original eight midshipmen dismissed for drug use were in the top 15 men of this year's graduating class.

title: Molloy Takes Seven Events To Win School Track Title
description: Archbishop Molloy won the team title and John Owens of St. Francis Prep was a double sprint winner yesterday in the Athletic Association of Private Schools track and field cham pionships at Mount St. Michael Field, the Bronx.

title: Hospitals Chief Questioned on Cutbacks
description: Despite persistent question ing by City Councilmen, Dr. Joseph T. English refused yes terday to disclose which of the city's 18 public hospitals might have to be shut down because of the budget crisis.

title: City's Pension Units Will Vote To Require G. M. Policy Report
description: Mayor Lindsay announced yesterday that the city's pen sion systems will vote their 350,000 shares of General Motors stock in support of a proposal requiring G.M. to dis close its progress on antipollu tion control, automobile safety, and minority hiring and fran chising practices.

title: 21 and Biltmore Accused Of Bias Against Women
description: The 21 restaurant and the Biltmore Hotel were accused yesterday by the City Commis sion on Human Rights of dis criminating against women de spite a city law forbidding it.

title: MORTGAGE INTEREST DECLINED FOR APRIL
description: WASHINGTON, May 20 (AP) Effective interests costs of conventional home mortgages declined sharply for borrowers last month, reaching the lowest level in almost two years, a Federal official said today.

title: A Place Where Food Is a High Art
description: The restaurants reviewed on this page on Friday are rated both for their food (four stars to none) and for their service and ambiance (four triangles to none), based on relationship to cost.

title: Commodity Price Index Off 0.1 From WeekAgo Level
description: The commodity spot market price index of foodstuffs and industrial materials slipped to 108.8 from 108.9 last week.

title: Forest Hills Homeowners Seize Control of a Planning Hearing
description: Homeowners angered by the city's refusal to cancel plans for an 840unit public housing project in Forest Hills seized control of a Queens public hearing last night and reviled the City Planning Commission for 45 minutes.

title: Gateway Areas Await Their Fate
description: On Sandy Hook, a 6mile long finger of white sand peninsula seven miles pointing up from the New Jersey Coast into the glisten ing, darkblue waters of the Lower Harbor, an osprey brought a live fish for his mate to eat in their nest atop a telephone pole abandoned by men.

title: Manhattan Politicians Criticize Condemnation Plan for Projects
description: A Lindsay administration plan to prevent owners of small parcels of land in the Manhattan business district from delaying big projects by refusing to sell was denounced yesterday by Manhattan polit ical leaders.

title: A Clarification
description: The USLIFE Corporation an nounced on May 10 its acquisi tion of the Columbia Savings and Loan Association, a promi nent thrift institution in South ern California. Another thrift institution of the same name in Woodhaven, Queens, was not involved in the transaction.

title: Dance: Premiere by Sanasardo Troupe
description: Certainly, one of the most highly trained and polished groups in contemporary dance is the Paul Sanasardo Dance Company, which opened last night at the Brooklyn Aca demy of Music for a three night engagement.

title: Hunt On for 2 WouldBe Cop Killers
description: With more than 100 de tectives already assigned to the investigation, Police Commis sioner Patrick V. Murphy vowed yesterday that the men who shot and seriously wound ed two patrolmen Wednesday night will he hunted with ev ery resource of the department.

title: Merger News
description: The ClevelandCliffs Iron Company and the Diamond Crystal Salt Company an nounced yesterday the signing of a letter of intent to merge Diamond Crystal into Cleve landCliffs. Under the letter's terms, ClevelandCliffs will ex change one share of its common stock for each three outstanding shares of Diamond Crystal common.

title: Mrs. Larkin's 80 Leads By 3 Shots on Long Island
description: SANDS POINT, L. I., May 20 Mrs. Vincent de Paul Larkin of Nassau posted a 40, 4080 to take a threestroke lead to day in the Women's Long Is land Golf Association 36hole medalplay tournament at the Sands Point Golf Club. The second round will be held at Nassau in Glen Cove tomorrow. Par for the 5,695yard course is 36, 3672.

title: 2 Eavesdropping Arrests
description: NEWTON, Mass., May 20 (AP)  Two Boston College students were arrested today in connection with alleged eavesdropping on a college board of trustees meeting in February. Thomas J. Sheehan, 22 years old, of New York City, a senior, and Michael Berkey, 20, of Baltimore, a junior, pleaded, not guilty in Newton District Court to charges of conspiracy to il legally intercept private con versations and conspiracy to possess an interception device.

title: 2 U.S. Scientists Leave Peking for Southern China
description: TOKYO, May 20 (AP)  Two American scientists left Peking by air today for a visit to southern China on their way home, a Peking broadcast re ported.

title: Pennsy Says Rate of Loss Slows, but Peril Remains
description: The trustees of the bankrupt Penn Central Transporta tion Company said yesterday that things were no longer getting worse at the same rate as they were during all 1970. Reporting a $107.6billion loss for the first four months this year, the trustees said:

title: Women's jail in Village May House Men Inmates
description: Mayor Lindsay is considering turning the Women's House of Detention in Greenwich Village into a minimumsecurity prison for men after the women in mates are moved to a new fa cility on Rikers Island next month.

title: Intercity Truck Tonnage Up 25.4% From '70 Week
description: WASHINGTON, May 20  Intercity truck tonnage in the week ended May 5 was 25.4 per cent above the volume in the corresponding 1970 week.

title: 2 Stocks' Trading Halted
description: The New York Stock Ex change halted trading yesterday in FAS International securities while the American Stock Ex change halted trading in Wal tham Industries common. Both moves were at the request of the companies. FAS said it was unable to issue secondquarter results yet. Waltham said talks with creditors for new financing had become stalemated.

title: Woman Confectioner, 93, Slain in W. 72d St. Apartment House
description: A 93yearold woman who made and sold candy in her Confectionery shop was found strangled yesterday morning in her West Side apartment.

title: CRITICISM OF OTEPKA RENEWED AT HEARING
description: WASHINGTON, May 20 (UPI) Liberal spokesmen revived a twoyear fight today by con tending that Otto F. Otepka should be denied a seat on the Subversive Activities Control Board because of his alleged rightwing allegiance.

title: State Reports Rise In Those Drawing Unemployment Pay
description: ALBANY, May 20State Con troller Arthur Levitt reported today that 5.5 million unem ploymentinsurance checks were issued in the first four months of this year compared with 3.4 million in the same period last year.

title: French Good Morning Indicates Mood of Talks
description: PARIS, May 20Instead of the usual bonjour, the French national radio net work went on the air today with the words good morn ing. That eyeopening use of English was symptomatic of the mood surrounding the Heath  Pompidou meeting here.

title: POMPIDOU REPORTS HE AND HEATH FIND BASIC AGREEMENT
description: PARIS, May 20  President Pompidou said tonight, follow ing a day of talks with Prime Minister Heath, that Britain and France were basically in agreement on the future of Western Europe.

title: Man In the News
description: Before last winter, Bruce McDuffie loved swordfish broiled. But a remark by graduate student changed all that. Dr. McDuffie, an analyt ical chemist at the State Uni versity of New York at Bing hamton, conducted studies and found unsafe levels of mercury in some tuna and in most swordfish. He found dispro portionately high levels of mercury in a group of avid fish eaters. Yes terday, he testified before a Senate subcommittee that striped bass was also con taminated with mercury.

title: Senate Confirms 6 Judges For Courts in Local Area
description: WASHINGTON, May 20  The Senate confirmed today the nomination of six Federal judges for courts in the New York City area.

title: TV NETWORKS SCORED BY GARDNER GROUP
description: Common Cause, the citizens' lobby whose antiwar television program was denied network presentation, yesterday accused the three commercial television networks of trying to stay out of trouble rather than pre sent a full range of views on the nation's problems.

title: Canonero II Here on a Crown Mission
description: Canonero II, the Venezue lanowned colt who has gen erated as much interest in the Triple Crown for 3year olds as Majestic Prince did two years ago, but for dia metrically opposite reasons, arrived at Belmont Park yes terday.

title: Eban Denounces Verdict
description: JERUSALEM, May 20 (UPI) The Israeli Foreign Minister, Abba Eban, charged today that the sentences by a Leningrad court against nine Soviet Jews were a complete distortion of justice and truth. Basically, the defendants were not being tried for the hate of the Soviet Union but for the love of Is rael, he said at a meeting of the Labor party executive.

title: Baldwin, Ferrell, DeMane, Huckaby Pace L.I. Open at 72
description: HEMPSTEAD, LI., May 20 New faces were among the leaders as the old guard faded today in the Long Island open golf championship. Four players shared the top spot at 72.

title: Campaign Notes
description: WASHINGTON, May 20 The agreement among Demo cratic Presidential candidates not to attack one another, which is only a few months old, already shows signs of coming apart.

title: RESERVE PUSHES MONEY EXPANSION
description: The Federal Reserve System pressed its stimulative mone ary policy during the last two weeks, banking figures pub lished yesterday showed.

title: Woman, 69, Is Critically III 2 Days After Death Ruling
description: LONG BEACH, Calif., May 20 (UPI)  A 69yearold woman who was pronounced dead of a heart attack but began gasping for breath one hour later at a mortuary was in very critical condition today.

title: Summit Accord on SALT
description: The SovietAmerican accord on the scope of a possible agreement to limit nuclear weapons is in itself a major forward step, but its real importance lies in the political decisions at the top that seem to be involved. It appears now that at the highest level of both governments the decision has been made to stop fencing and conclude limited, interim pact.

title: Hopes for Mariner 8
description: WASHINGTON, May 20 (AP) The National Aeronautics and Space Administration said to day that it hoped to launch the next Mariner rocket to Mars before June 6.

title: Estimate Board Approves $420Million Sewage Plant
description: Plans for a $420million sew age treatment plant were ap proved yesterday by the Board of Estimate.

title: Advertising:
description: The Silver Anvil Award is the most prestigious distinc tion in national public rela tions, and 23 of them were distributed last night at the Plaza by the Public Relations Society of America.

title: New Jersey G.I. Dies in War'
description: WASHINGTON, May 20 (AP)  The Defense Department an nounced today that Specialist 4 Christopher M. Winters of Rutherford, N. J., of the Army, had been killed in the war in Southeast Asia.

title: Knicks Sign Meminger for 3 Years
description: Dean Meminger, Mar quette's allAmerica play maker and the top draft choice of the New York Knicks, signed a threeyear contract with the Knicks yes terday for an estimated $250,000 and fringe benefits.

title: Faculty Resignations Intensify Dispute at U. of Texas
description: AUSTIN, Tex., May 19  About a halfdozen or so na tionally known scholars and several other professors have resigned from the University of Texas in the last few months in a continuing dispute that has stirred concern among some faculty members and students about the school's future as major center of academic re search.

title: News Analysis
description: WASHINGTON, May 20In a briefing yesterday at the White House to explain the Ad ministration's 115page re sponse to more than 60 demands set forth by a cau cus of black members of the House, George P. Shultz, the Presidential adviser, was asked why many Negroes continued to regard President Nixon and his poli cies as essentially antiblack if the Ad ministration's rec ord on civil rights was as good as Mr. Shultz rep resented it to be. I don't know, he said with more than a trace of weariness. The rec ord doesn't jibe with the ac cusation. The record is one of great strides to achieve equal ity. Why there is opposition, I don't know. But the record is there.

title: The Screen: West Coast Filmmakers
description: Two charming films by the late Oskar Fischinger, Sil houettes, made in Berlin in 1925, and Radio Dynamics, made in California in 1942, plus a crazy cartoon parody of 2001 and a lovely, an drogynal nightmare called The Liberation of Mannique Mechanique are the good reasons to catch Part II of the Whitney Museum's two part program devoted to films from the West Coast. The show opened yesterday and runs through next Wednesday.

title: Advertising:
description: At the request of the White House and the American Red Cross, the Advertising Coun cil will prepare a massive advertising campaign to focus the attention of the nation on the plight of our troops who are prisoners of war or missing in Southeast Asia.

title: A Calm Family Life That's Lived Amid a Diplomatic Whirlwind
description: CHEVY CHASE, Md.I suddenly realized that I was going to raise my children with the same standards by which I was raised. Some body has to hand on the old values; somebody has to hang on when everything is breaking down. I think it's the lack of courtesies that is driving people up the wall.

title: Old Line Life Co.
description: The Old Line Life Insurance Company told shareholders at its annual meeting in Milwau kee that 1971 profits should be about $1.75 a share, compared to 1970's $1.56. Franklin P. Graf, vice president, said based on a firstquarter earn ings rise of 11.9 per cent and April and May activity, that in crease should be maintained the rest of the year.

title: Mrs. King Is Jeered
description: HAMBURG, West Germany, May 20 (Reuters)  The top seeded American, Mrs. Billie Jean King, was booed and jeered by spectators for holding up play today during her quar terfinal match against Heidi Orth of West Germany in the Hamburg open tennis tourna ment.

title: Allied and Enemy War Deaths Decline
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, May 20 (UPI)  A decline in battlefield deaths in Indochina last week was reported today for both allies and the enemy.

title: HEARING TRANSCRIPT ALTERED, NADER SAYS
description: WASHINGTON, May 20 (UPI) Ralph Nader gave the Senate today documents that he said indicated that the General Mo tors Corporation and Senate committee staffers altered the transcripts of auto safety hear ings in 1966 to protect top G.M. officials.

title: Rensselaer Picks President
description: TROY, N. Y., May 20 (AP) Dr. Richard J. Grosh, dean of the Schools of Engineering at Purdue University, has been named president of Rensselaer Polytechnic Institute. He will succeed Dr. Richard G. Folsom, who two years ago indicated his intention to retire. Dr. Grosh, 43 years old, will also he the president of Rensselaer Polytechnic Institute of Con necticut, the university's grad uate center in Hartford.

title: Queen's Money Plea Gains
description: LONDON, May 20 (Reuters) Parliament agreed today to consider Queen Elizabeth's re quest for more money to run her household and support her relatives. The Queen, who did not specify how much more she wanted, said her $1.14mil lion annual allowance had not been changed since she became sovereign in 1952.

title: ESTIMATE BOARD DENIES RENT RISE
description: The Board of Estimate refused by a unanimous vote yesterday to allow the Metropolitan Life Insurance Company to increase rents on Stuyvesant Town's 8,750 apartments.

title: Fairfield County Catholics Tell How They Feel About Reforms
description: Roman Catholics in Fairfield County, Conn., got a chance this week to express publicly their views on what is happen ing to their churchand they took full advantage of it.

title: Burchett Says Plotters Sought To Take Power in China in '67
description: HONG KONG, May 20Wil fred Burchett, the leftwing Australian journalist, has re ported that plotters in China attempted in 1967 to depose Lin Piao, the deputy Commu nist party leader, and to take power with Mao Tsetung, the party chairman, as a powerless figurehead.

title: Silver Futures Fall As User Forecasts Ample Metal Stock
description: Prices of silver futures dropped 2.1 cents an ounce yesterday on the Commodity Exchange here as an executive of the Silver Users, Association made a speech construed as bearish.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: SHORT INTEREST DROPS IN MONTH
description: Short interest on the New York Stock Exchange, con sidered a technical bellwether of stockmarket trends, de clined 451,448 shares in the month ended last Friday, the Big Board reported yesterday.

title: WASHINGTON
description: WASHINGTON, May 20 In his statement on the U.S.Soviet strategic arms talks, President Nixon noted that the compromise on how to proceed with the negotiations had been taken at the highest levels, meaning that he had personally decided on this course of action for the United States.

title: Clothes to Gladden the Hearts of Next Fall's Partygoers
description: Next winter's social season got the goahead signal yes terday. Sarmi's back. The man who makes the prettiest dresses for the prettiest par ties is designing again after a sixmonth hiatus. He has formed a new company using his full name, Ferdinando Sarmi. The purpose, he said is to make clothes that appeal to men and make women's lady friends jeal ous.

title: Australians Report Sales of $13Million To Chinese at Fair
description: SYDNEY, Australia, May 20 Australia sold China more than $13.6million worth of goods at the recent Canton trade fair, Trade Minister John D. Anthony announced today.

title: 2 CREWS ACCUSE SOVIET TRAWLERS
description: BOSTON, May 20 (AP)The crews of two American lobster boats reported today that So viet fishing vessels were endan gering their vessels and dam aging their fishing gear only hours after the commander of the Soviet fishing fleet and a United States delegation met to discuss similar complaints.

title: Long Canoe Trip Starts
description: KEY WEST, Fla, May 20 (AP) A 26yearold Allentown, Pa., canoeing instructor paddled a 17foot canoe into the Gulf of Mexico today to start a five month, 7,000mile journey to Los Angeles. Fritz Sprandel covered 1,300 miles in four month last year from New York to Key West, but that journey ended when his canoe was battered by rough weather and most of his equipment was lost.

title: Mrs. Jacqueline Riordan Wed On Coast to George F. Getty 2d
description: BEVERLY HILLS, Calif., May 20Mrs. Jacqueline M. Riordan, widow of Michael R. Riordan, founder and head of the Equity Funding Corpora ton, was married here today to George F. Getty 2d, oper ating chief of the Getty Oil Company and eldest son of Jean Paul Getty, the oil bil lionaire.

title: Stuyvesant Trackmen Win Manhattan P.S.A.L. Crown
description: Stuyvesant beat Franklin by 2 points yesterday to take the team title, in the track and field championships of the Manhat tan. Division of the Public Schools Athletic League at Ran dalls Island.

title: FRAUD IS CHARGED IN SHARON STEEL
description: WASHINGTON, May 20  The Securities and Exchange Commission charged today that three officers of the Sharon Steel Corporation fraudulently diverted millions of dollars from the company's employe pension funds to other com panies in which they had an interest.

title: Hearts of Scotland Play Cosmos Here Tonight in Soccer
description: Hearts of Scotland, one of Britain's best, known and most popular soccer teams, will be on view at Yankee Stadium to night in a game against the New York Cosmos at 8 o'clock.

title: MRS. C. L. BARBER
description: SANTA CRUZ, Calif., May 20  Elizabeth Putnam Barber, wife of C. L. Barber, vice chan cellor for humanities of the University of California at Santa Cruz, died here yester day. She was 58 years old.

title: Galaxy Clusters May Be Flying Apart
description: Observations of Xrays ema nating from two distant cluster of galaxies indicate, according to Navy scientists, that these gi ant clusters may be blowing themselves apart.

title: Assembly Votes Bill to Bar Phosphate Detergent Sales
description: ALBANY, May 20  The Assembly today passed a bill proposed by Governor Rocke feller that by June 1, 1973, would ban the sale to deter gents containing more than miniscule amounts of phos phates.

title: Vietnam: Steps Toward Reunification
description: PARISIn 1963, forty days before the end of the Diem regime, I urged my compatriots to seek a peaceful so lution in South. Vietnam through nego tiation. In my opinion this was insepa rable from a return to the 1954 Geneva agreements which foresaw among other things a halt in all foreign inter ventions and military neutralization of the two zones of North and South Vietnam.

title: Court Denies Parole Board Right To Curb Sobell's Political Dissent
description: Morton Sobell, who was con victed as a Soviet spy in 1951, won a Federal Court decision here yesterday permitting him to participate in demonstra tions of political dissent.

title: TURNPIKE PROTEST COMES UP IN COURT
description: BELLMAWR, N. J., May 20 (AP)Cases of 97 peace dem onstrators accused of blocking traffic on the New Jersey Turnpike for five hours April 25 were dealt with in a nine hour court session here today.

title: Stiller, 66, Scores a 79 To Triumph in Senior Golf
description: WHITE PLAINS, N. Y., May 20Paul E. Stiller of Leewood, a 66yearold retired electronics executive, playing in Class C, won the 37th annual West chester Seniors' Golf Associa tion spring tournament today with 37, 4279 on the par71 Knollwood Country Club course of 6,410 yards.

title: MURPHY TO SHIFT JOBS OF 200 TODAY
description: More than 200 policemen will be promoted, transferred, de moted or given new responsi bilities today as Police Com missioner Patrick V. Murphy seeks to tighten his control over the city's 31,000man de partment.

title: RENE M'COLL, WROTE FOR LONDON EXPRESS
description: LONDON, May 20Ren MacColl, chief foreign corre spondent of The London Daily Express, died today at his home in Crowborough, Sussex. He was 66 years old.

title: Amex Price Index Edges Up 0.05 As Turnover Registers Advance
description: The pace of trading quick ened slightly on the American Stock. Exchange yesterday, with volume moving up to 3,863,725 shares from 3,300,690 shares the preceding day. However, the rise in prices that went along with added volume was barely noticeable. The exchange in dex closed at 25.92, up 0.05.

title: 4 Arrested at Rally Here In Teachers' Budget Protest
description: Four persons were arrested outside Governor Rockefeller's office at 22 West 55th Street yesterday afternoon as several fist fights erupted on the fringes of a rally of 1,000 peo ple called by the United Fed eration of Teachers and District 37 of the State, County and Municipal Employes Union to protest state budget cuts.

title: United Fund Appeal
description: For its 1971 campaign the United Fund of Greater New York has asked 150, 000 volunteers in corporation, offices, unions agencies to con duct employedrives to help the fund and its affiliated com munity services.

title: VENICE INSPIRES MUSICAL SALUTE
description: Venice In peril is the ominous theme saddling this years New York Philhar monic Promenades, but it did not dampen the spirit of the opening of Venice Prom enade at Philharmonic Hall. There was no reason it should have. The grim reality of the Italian city's plight, the gradual sinking of its foundations, the pollution of its water, air, and, as a con sequence, its art works, was not depicted. The mini exhibition of Venetian art in the Grand Promenade referred only to the greatness and beauty of the city.

title: MARKET EDGES UP AS VOLUME RISES
description: General Electric and Com mercial Solvents ranked among the star performers yesterday as the stock market wove the same general design for the second straight day  prices slightly higher and volume sharply down.

title: House Accepts Fate Of SST, but Blocks SenateVoted Fund
description: WASHINGTON, May 20 The House gave up as a dead issue today its drive to revive the supersonic transport pro gram, but it then rejected $155.8million in termination payrments approved by the Sen ate.

title: A Soviet Reply on Jews
description: MOSCOWIt is with more than a little astonishment that I read tales in the American press about the plight of Jews in the Soviet Union. There is no freedom of religion, Jewish culture is suppressed, great masses of Soviet Jews clamor to leave their homeland for Israel and so on ad nauseam.

title: Governor Drops Plan for Belt Parkway
description: ALBANY, May 20  Gover nor Rockefeller has agreed to drop the controversial plan for constructing four truck lanes on part of the Belt Parkway in Brooklyn and Queens, legis lative sources reported today.

title: GIFT TAX RULING IN SOUTH STUDIED
description: Political fundraising in at least six states during the 1972 elections will be affected by an almost unnoticed Federal court decision stating that $60, 000 in campaign contributions is an economic investment exempt from the gift tax laws that have traditionally covered large political donations.

title: Muskie Gets Freedoms Award At Foundation's Annual Dinner
description: Senator Edmund S. Muskie received the annual award of the Four Freedoms Foundation, Inc., last night at a dinner in the Americana Hotel marking the organization's 20th anni versary.

title: BRIBE TRIAL OPENS FOR KENNY AND 8
description: NEWARK, May 20  The United States Attorney for New Jersey today accused John V. Kenny, the Hudson County Democratic leader, of master minding a conspiracy to extort more than $3million from busi nessmen and contractors.

title: BLANCAS, KNUDSON SHARE LEAD AT 67 IN COLONIAL GOLF
description: FORT WORTH, Tex., May 20 (UPI)Homero Blancas, the de fender, and George Knudson of Canada grabbed the firstround lead in the Colonial National Invitation golf tournament to day with threeunderpar 67's.

title: Senators Hear Mercury Is Peril to Fish Industry
description: WASHINGTON, May 20Various experts on environ mental chemistry told Congress today that the ecological harm caused by mercury and possibly arsenic pollution was so grave that it would be dec ades and probably centuries before the pollutants were dissipated.

title: Employer Subsidy for Strikes
description: Ever since New York State set up its unemployment insurance system nearly 35 years ago, controversy has surrounded an unusual provision in the law making strikers eligible for jobless benefits after seven weeks. Every other state except Rhode Island bars strikers from job insurance payments.

title: Johnson Ceremony on TV
description: All three major networks plan live television coverage of the dedication ceremonies Saturday of the Lyndon Baines Johnson Library in Austin, Tex., spokesmen for the networks said yesterday. The coverage is to begin at 12:30 P.M. and con tinue for 3 to 45 minutes, ac cording to The Associated Press.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Roundup: A Giant in Pinch
description: Fran Healy is probably the most destructive batter in the major leagues today for the amount of playing time he receives. Listed as a catcher, but relegated to a pinchhit ting role by Charlie Fox, the manager of the torrid San Francisco Giants, Healy is batting .875 this season. He has a career mark of .611.

title: COMPROMISE SET
description: WASHINGTON, May 20 The United States and the Soviet Union disclosed today that they had reached a com promise definition of the scope and shape of a possible accord to limit their nuclearweapons systems.

title: PROFESSOR SETTLES DISPUTE WITH CITY
description: Jay Schulman, a sociologist, who became a focus of contro versy after City College refused to renew his contract, will re ceive full pay through the 1973 academic year, under an agree ment reached yesterday be tween Dr. Schulman and the Board of Higher Education.

title: DIVIDEND IS CUT BYHARVESTER CO.
description: The International Harvester Company, the world's largest farm equipment producer, leading truck manufacturer and major producer of construction equipment and materials han dling, reduced the dividend yes terday for the first time since 1939, reflecting the lower half year results.

title: STEEL CHIEF ACTS TO SHARE BURDEN
description: WASHINGTON, May 20  At a meeting of 650 local lead ers of the United Steelworkers of America last month, I. W. Abel, the union's president, gave his gavel to one of the young dissident leaders who had ac cused the top union officials of losing touch with the rank and file.

title: FIXED MONEY RATE BACKED BY FRENCH
description: WASHINGTON, May 20 (Reuters)  France's Finance Minister, Valry Giscard d'Es taing, met for 50 minutes to day with Treasury Secretary John B. Connally Jr. and stressed the French view that the fixed parity system of inter national monetary exchange should be retained.

title: RUSKIN, PIANIST, IS HEARD IN DEBUT
description: What happens to child prodi gies? Well, contrary to folklore, a good number of them do not end up on the Bowery, but grow up to be adult prodigies.

title: FOREIGN AFFAIRS
description: CAIROThere is little doubt that President Anwar elSadat's emergence as Egypt's new strong man has im proved the chances of Middle East peace. However, if no interim settle ment on the Suez Canal and a partial Israeli pullback can be arranged this summer there will probably be an extreme nationalist reaction here and reversion to military priorities.

title: Bridge :Everybody Gets Into the Act And PostMotem Is Hilarious
description: The idea of being able to play in a tournament in one's own club proved popular last year, and the Greater New York Bridge Association is repeating it this weekend.

title: Volpe Warns on Loss
description: DENVER, May 20  Trans portation Secretary John A. Volpe said at a news confer ence here today that Congres sional refusal to revive the SST program might lead to the demoralization and possible loss of the airplane industry in I this country.

title: Trudeau Says Pact With Soviet Affirms an Independent Policy
description: MOSCOW, May 20  Prime Minister Pierre Elliott Trudeau of Canada today described his new agreement with the Soviet Union as part of an effort to affirm Canada's independent foreign policy in what he termed the overpowering presence of the United States of America.

title: ACF Industries
description: Stockholders of ACF Indus tries were told by Henry A. Correa, president, at the com pany's annual meeting here yes terday that 1971 will be a holding year, and there is little hope for a substantial pickup in freight car orders.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: SOVIET MAY TRY A MARS LANDING
description: MOSCOW, May 20A So viet astronomer said today that future investigations by auto matic space stations would yield actual information about the properties of the surface of the planet Mars.

title: U.S. Denies Knowledge of Talks
description: WASHINGTON, May 20 (AP) State Department officials said they had no knowledge about the reported contact be tween Xerox and Communist Chiria and, in fact, that they learned about it by reading news dispatches. That such con tacts existed was no surprise, the officials said, and they added that, as far; as the State Department knew, the Chinese have issued a number of visas to American businessmen. They declined to elaborate or to give names.

title: Pleasure Boat News
description: Bringing the joys of sail ing to the adult world is one of the toughest jobs we have, said George O'Day in a fore word to a new book on how to sail. However, if the num ber of ways to learn this happy sport continues to grow, adults may be adding more boatports than carports in the next dec ade.

title: William R. Peer, Wagner Press Aide
description: William R. Peer, executive secretary to Mayor Robert F. Wagner from 1954 to 1959, died Tuesday of a heart ail ment in Tangier, Morocco. He was 65 years old and recently was living in Mijas, Spain.

title: LongTerm Study Discontinues a Diabetes Drug
description: WASHINGTON, May 20 A dozen university medical centers and clinics involved in a longterm study of diabetes treatment have discontinued use of DBI, one of the drugs ordinarily prescribed for pa tients who do not require in sulin.

title: Xerox Reports It Is Holding Peking Talks
description: WEBSTER, N. Y., May 20 The Xerox Corporation is talk ing in a preparatory way with Communist China, C. Peter McColough, the company's president, said here today.

title: GOVERNOR, MAYOR HEAD CONFERENCE ON CITY FINANCES
description: ALBANY, May 20  In a setting worthy of an interna tional peace conference, Gover nor Rockefeller, Mayor Lindsay and 21 other city and state of ficials began the final round of discussions on New York City's proposed budget and tax pack age today.

title: WAGERING BANNED FOR $44,992 PACE
description: WESTBURY, L. I., May 20 Although it will boast the pro gram's richest purse as well as its largest field, tomorrow night's $44,992 Lady Maud Pace at Roosevelt Raceway will not be a betting event.

title: NASA Under Dr. Fletcher
description: Dr. James C. Fletcher, new head of the National Aero nautics and Space Administration, has taken office at a low point in that agency's fortunes. Even before the fiasco of Mariner 8, morale was poor as a result of seri ous budget cuts and firings, and also because of the very evident decline of public interest in space exploration. It is symptomatic of the changed atmosphere that public and legislative lethargy visvis NASA has not been shaken even by the recent signs of Soviet activity in exploring the moon, in beginning to assemble a station in space and, more recently, in launching a very large and heavy instrument package to Mars.

title: Gomulka Quits Seat On Council of State, Has Only One Post
description: WARSAW, May 20 (AP) Wladyslaw Gomulka, who was replaced as the Polish Com munist party leader after riots in December over the rising price of food, has resigned from the Council of State, the country's nominal ruling body.

title: Joseph Fennimore Makes Song Cycle Of Berlitz Method
description: A simple formula for com posing a surefire song cycle plight run as follows: As Semble groups of simple phrases from an elementary language textbook and set them to music with the skill and flair of Joseph Fenni more.

title: Theater: Training of Pavlo Hummel
description: David Rabe's play, The Basic, Training of Pavlo Hummel, at the New York Shakespeare Festival Public Theater, which opened last night at the Newman Thea ter, introduces a new and authentic voice to our thea ter. What Mr. Rabe is say ingwar is hell, especially when it is in Vietnamis not at all original, and this is the play's major defect, but he does have a persuasive way of saying things.

title: Decision Awaited On F14 Contract By Grumman Corp.
description: BETHPAGE, May 20 The Grumman Corporation will not know until perhaps Oct. 1 if the Navy will contract to buy more of the F14 Navy fighter planes, C. Clinton Towl, chairman and chief executive officer of Grumman, said in an interview before the annual meeting here.

title: Researchers Say Marijuana's Potency Varies Greatly
description: Four researchers who tested marijuana cultivated from the only large garden in the coun try that is legally growing mar ijuana reported here yesterday that they had found a variation of up to 400fold in the content of the plant's natural chemical potency.

title: Text of Announcement on Accord
description: Following is the text of an announcement made in Washington yesterday by President Nixon on United StatesSoviet talks on nuclear arms, as recorded by The New York Times. The Soviet Union made a simultaneous announcement.

title: Pact to Dilute U.S. Control of Intelsat
description: WASHINGTON, May 20 The United States has agreed to relax its monopoly control over the world's satellite com munications. This comes in re sponse to foreign demands for technological participation and to the fact that foreign use of the system is growing even faster than American use.

title: OTB Aide Sees Hope In Labor Discussions
description: Progress was reported yes terday in labor discussions in volving the start of offtrack betting at Yonkers Raceway.

title: Red Sox Top Yanks, 52, Lifting Lead to 3 Games
description: BOSTON, May 20Power hit ting again made the difference tonight as the Red Sox extend ed their lead in the American League Eastern Division to three games by downing the Yankees, 52, before a chilled crowd of 20,334 at Foggy Fen way Park.

title: Protest in Jerusalem
description: TEL AVIV, May 20The Min ister of Immigrants Absorption, Nathan Peled, said today that the penalties given nine Jews in Leningrad would not achieve the Soviet aim of suppressing the struggle of Jews to go to Israel.

title: 2 Pacific Quakes Recorded
description: BERKELEY, Calif., May 20 (AP)  Two strong. undersea earthquakes were recorded early today off the Oregon coast by the University of Cali fornia seismograph at Berkeley. Robin Adams, a seismologist, said that the quakes, centered 500 miles northwest of Berkeley and about 150 miles off the coast, occurred at 12:52 A.M. and 1 A.M. They registered 5.5 and 6, respec tively, on the Richter scale, he said.

title: Major Issues in StrategicArms Talks
description: WASHINGTON. May 20  These are the major issues in the talks on limiting strategic arms:

title: U.S. JURY IN GEORGIA ACCUSES POLICEMEN
description: WASHINGTON, May 20 (AP) The Justice Department an nounced today that a Federal grand jury in Savannah, Ga., had indicted four Georgia law enforcement officials on civil rights charges involving the death of a farmer and the beat ing of a Los Angeles man.

title: Books of The Times
description: CAPONE. The Life and World of Al Capone. By John Kobler. 409 pages. New York: G. P. Putnam's Sons. $8.95.

title: Sadat Accuses Leftists In a Report to Assembly
description: CAIRO, May 20President Anwap elSadat said today that a secret faction in the Arab Socialist Union, Egypt's only political organization, was behind last week's intrigue to bring about his downfall.

title: Ferre to Invite Castro
description: SAN JUAN, P. R., May 20 (UPI)  Gov. Luis A. Ferr said today that he planned to invite Premier Fidel Castro of Cuba to visit Puerto Rico with as many people as he liked for a personal look at the way of life in the commonwealth.

title: Kolton, on Staff of Amex, is Elected New President
description: Paul Kolton, a 47yearold staff executive, was named yes terday to become the new pres ident of the American Stock Ex change in a significant break with Wall Street tradition.

title: Murtaugh Kept in Hospital After Suffering Chest Pains
description: CINCINNATI, May 20 (UPI) Manager Danny Murtaugh of the Pittsburgh Pirates entered Christ Hospital .before today's game with the Cincinnati Reds after complaining of chest and arm pains.

title: Books of The Times
description: A RAP ON RACE. By Margaret Mead and James Baldwin. 256 pages. J. B. Lippincott. $6.95.

title: News Analysis
description: Throughout the continuing controversy over mercury and its possible hazards to man, all the experts have seldom agreed on more than one thing  too much mercury taken into the body can cause substantial harm and, eventually death. At present, there is disagreement on how much is too much, whether the en vironment is sub jecting few or many people to dangerous levels, and even how best to measure for mercury con tent. Also involved are different philosophies of how to act in a situation about which little is known, but which still may be dangerous.

title: Censured General Says He Is an Army Sacrifice
description: WASHINGTON, May 20 (UPI) Brig. Gen. George H. Young Jr., censured by the Army for failing to follow through ade quately on the Mylai investi gation, said today that he had been sacrificed to critics of the military.

title: Japan's Railroads Tied Up As Strike Cripples Service
description: TOKYO, May 20An allday strike by Japan National Rail way workers today crippled train services in many parts of the country, especially in the Tokyo area. Railway officials said that 2,290 passenger trains and more than 1,500 freight trains did not operate during the day. Eight and a half million people, including seven and a half million in the Tokyo area, were affected by the strike.

title: Finland Raises Discount Rate
description: HELSINKI, Finland, May 21 (Reuters)Finland today an nounced that she had raised her discount rate to 8.5 per cent from 7 per cent. The in crease is effective from June 1.

title: Nixon Hails Intelsat Shift
description: WASHINGTON, May 21 (Reu ters)  President Nixon wel comed today an agreement for an international takeover of communications space satellites run until now by the United States. In an unscheduled speech at a conference of In telsat, the International Tele communications Satellite con sortium, Mr. Nixon hailed the development, announced yester day, as a significant break through that would lead to greater understanding.

title: Sports of The Times
description: Over dinner one night last week, a very serious and introspective 29yearold businessman named Jim Iselin had a painfully honest thought: He wondered aloud if the prizefighters he managed really liked him as a person, or merely used him for his money and his connections, then snickered behind his back. He has been in boxing for about six years and his main fighter has been Buster Mathis, who is now back in training after dropping out for several years.

title: Florida Stay for Nixon
description: WASHINGTON, May 21 (UPI)President Nixon will fly to his Florida home for a long weekend tomorrow after help ing dedicate the Lyndon B. Johnson library in Texas tomor row. He will remain at Key Biscayne until Tuesday, when he is scheduled to fly to Mobile, Ala., to participate in the dedi cation of the TennesseeTom bigbee Waterway and then stop off on the way to Washington at Birmingham to participate in a briefing for editors and publishers from 12 Southeast ern states.

title: Rail Pension Bill Backed
description: WASHINGTON, May 21 (AP) A Senate Labor subcommittee approved today a bill increasing railroad retirement payments to more than 600,000 beneficiaries by 10 per cent retroactive to Jan. 1. The measure is designed to keep the payments in line with an increase voted by Con gress for Social Security re tirees.

title: Syntex Sets Profit Marks
description: Record sales and earnings were posted by the Syntex Cor poration in the three and nine months ended April 30, accord ing to results issued yesterday by George Rosenkranz, presi dent.

title: U.S. SAID TO PAY THAIS AIDING LAOS
description: WASHINGTON May 21 Senator J. W. Fulbright said today that 4,800 Thai troops, financed by the United States, were fighting in Laos in sup port of the Royal Laotian Gov ernment.

title: IrishAmerican Weekly Paper Honored Here on Its Centennial
description: With jigs and reels, the clamor of stubborn brogues and the hush of a few inspired toasts, 600 Irish  Americans gathered at the Commodore Hotel last night to mark 100 years of crusading journalism by The Irish World, the nation's oldest IrishAmerican weekly newspaper.

title: TEXT OF THE STATEMENT
description: Following, in translation, is the text of the statement and the names of its signers:

title: Ric Massengale Cards 68 To Lead Open With a 140
description: NORTH LITTLE ROCK, Ark., May 21 (AP)Ric Massen gale, who learned golf from brother Don, shot a fourunder par 68 today and took the sec ondround lead of the $25,000 Maumelle open tournament.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: The City's Budget Case
description: We will be heard in the clemency room, Mayor Lindsay observed as he flew from New York City to Albany, where he continued yesterday to plead the city's case for more fiscal assistance from the state and more taxing power so the city can raise needed revenues on its own. The room hasn't been used for this in years, the Mayor added, because the state hasn't scheduled any executions.

title: 5 Seized in Queens In Raid Turning Up $7Million in Drugs
description: A police raid on an alleged Queens policy operation yester day afternoon turned up a nar cotics factory with pure heroin and cocaine worth more than $7million at street prices, Dis trict Attorney Thomas J. Mack ell announced.

title: Charlie Was Here Delayed
description: The Off Broadway opening of Charlie Was Here and Now He's Gone, the play by Dennis Turner, has been postponed from tomorrow to June 6 at the Eastside. Theater. Previews will begin June 1. The cast includes Donnie Burks and Rosalind Cash.

title: Fleets Charge ExCabbies Work Illegally in Own Cars
description: Since the taxifare increase three months ago, a growing number of drivers of medallion cabs are leaving the fleets and taking their own cars out to cruise for fares, the Metropoli tan Taxi Board of Trade charged yesterday.

title: Erich Segal, at Cannes, Links Press to Departure From Yale
description: CANNES, France, May 21 Erich Segal, the United States jury member at the. Cannes Film Festival, says he would be enjoying a himself thoroughly here if his mind were not still obsessed with having been driven out of Yale by American news media. He explained how his treatment in the press had motivated his resignation from Yale last month.

title: Insurance Liability Stand Clarified by Anaconda Co.
description: The Anaconda Company said yesterday that it was not its intent to imply at the annual meeting in Anaconda, Mont., that the United States govern ment is irresponsibly denying liability under insurance con tracts with Anaconda with re gard to the company's interests in Chile.

title: Books of The Times
description: THE SCORPION or The Imaginary Confession. By Albert Memmi. Translated from the French by Eleanor Levieux. Illustrated. 244 pages. An Orion Press Book. Grossman Publishers. $8.95.

title: Dollar Hits 22Year Low In Trading Against Mark
description: FRANKFURT, West Germany, May 21 (Reuters)The dollar fell today to its lowest value against the Deutschmark since the West German currency was floated 10 days ago, foreign ex change market sources said. The level was also the lowest in 22 years, since September, 1949.

title: G.E. Chairman's Testimony
description: WASHINGTON, May 21 (UPI)Fred J. Borch, chairman of the general Electric Com pany, appealed to the Senate committee for a lower tax burden.

title: Price Rise Is Slowing Here;Index Up Less Than U.S.
description: Price increases paid by con sumers for goods and services in the New YorkNortheastern New Jersey area moderated last month, rising only two tents of 1 per cent, compared with sixtenths of 1 per cent in March, the Bureau of Labor Statistics reported yesterday.

title: Rail Halt Cuts Auto Output
description: DETROIT, May 21 (AP) The twoday rail strike this week kept about 30,000 new cars from being built at the na tion's domestic auto plants, the trade publication Automotive News said today.

title: Warning About Billboards
description: WASHINGTON, May 21 (UPI) Secretary of Transportation John A. Volpe told the Gover nors of five states today to expect a 10 per cent cut in their Federal highway funds for the fiscal year 1973 unless they enact adequate laws regulating billboard advertising. The states, Georgia, Indiana, Kansas, Mon tana and South Dakota, have 60 days to reply to his demand that they comply with the 1965 Highway Beautification Act.

title: O.S.S. Group Will Honor David Bruce for Service
description: WASHINGTON, May 21 David K. E. Bruce Will re ceive the 1971 William J. Donovan Medal at the annual Veterans of O. S. S. dinner next Wednesday.

title: Gaming Ring's Bets Put at $78Million; 7 Seized by F.B.I.
description: The Federal Bureau of In vestigation said yesterday that the arrest of seven men had broken up a $78millionayear gambling ring.

title: Confusion Reported In Model Cities Poll In Three Slums Here
description: Residents of the city's three poorest slums voted yesterday for local Model Cities commit tee members amid reports of widespread confusion at poll ing places.

title: FISCHER LEADING IN CHESS, 3 TO 0
description: VANCOUVER, B. C., May 21 Bobby Fischer of Los An geles, won two more games to day in his quarterfinals match with Mark Taimanov of the So viet Union. The score now stands at 30, with the fourth game to be started tomorrow.

title: CARLY SIMON SINGS AT THE BITTER END
description: Carly Simon is a tall girl with long, curly hair and a very spe cial way of singing and song writing who is appearing through Monday at the Bitter End, 147 Bleecker Street.

title: Pentagon Accused of Laxity In Buying StripMined Coal
description: WASHINGTON, May 21 (AP) Representative Ken Hechler, Democrat of West Virginia, ac cused the Defense Department today of violating Federal law by failing to submit environ mental statements when it buys coal for military bases and other installations.

title: Convictions in Leningrad
description: A Leningrad court has convicted the nine Jews who have been on trial there and sentenced them to terms one to ten years. This semisecret trialfrom which foreign observers were barredsheds light on the two pronged nature of the strategy Moscow has adopted to deal with what it regards as a complex and difficult problem.

title: New Orders Dipped By 2% During April On Durable Goods
description: WASHINGTON, May 21 (AP)New orders for durable goods fell by 2 per cent in April, the Commerce Depart ment disclosed today.

title: Prosperity, Then Pollution, in Montana
description: HUNGRY HORSE, Mont.  Prosperity of the kind most Americans take for granted is less than a generation old in the Flathead Valley and still has only a tenuous foot hold.

title: London Exchange Votes Not to Admit Women Members
description: LONDON, May 21The Lon don Stock Exchange today re jected proposals that would have opened the doors to mem bership by women and per mitted advertising by member firms.

title: Rise in Executive Crime Seen by Leary
description: Too much attention in busi ness fraud is being focused on the dishonest employe at the bottom of the ladder, while the main culprit is the man in the executive suite, in the opinion of former New York Police Commissioner Howard R. Leary.

title: Medal of Science Goes to 9, Including a Woman
description: WASHINGTON, May 21 (AP)  President Nixon presented the 1970 Medal of Science, the country's highest award for achievement in science, to eight men and one woman today, honoring them for exploring the unknown  for making progress possible.

title: EQUITY OPENS TALKS ON A THEATER PACT
description: The Actors Equity Associa tion and the League of New York Theaters opened negotia tions yesterday on a new con tract. The current threeyear agreement is scheduled to ex pire at midnight June 27.

title: Executive Changes
description: The I.T.T. Continental Baking Company, a sub sidiary of International Telephone and Telegraph Company, announced yesterday the appointment of M. Cabell Woodward Jr., 42 years old, as president. He replaces R. Newton Laughlin, who remains as chairman, and had been chief executive officer since 1951.

title: Jazzmobile Offers Summer Samplings In Tully Hall Benefit
description: A benefit for Jazzmobile, held Thursday night at Alice Tully Hall, mixed samplings of some of the music that may be presented on New York's neigh borhood streets this summer by Jazzmobile and a sample of an act that will be seen in some of the country's larger outdoor theaters and concert halls.

title: Soviet Continues Consumer Emphasis
description: MOSCOW, May 21The box score was 521,484,000 to night as Izvestia, the Govern ment newspaper, kept up campaign to publicize pledges from industry to increase the production of consumer goods.

title: Chico State Wins Golf Title
description: CHICO, Calif., May 21 (UPI) Greg Bean of Humboldt State won the medal with a 36hole score of 147 today, but Chico State took the Far Western Conference golf title with 11 points.

title: ExRanger Ingarfield Retires From Hockey
description: OAKLAND, May 21 (AP) Earl Ingarfield, Who missed 29 games the past National Hockey League season while a member of the California Golden Seals, announced to day his retirement from the sport. He had a knee injury during the 197071 campaign.

title: CONGRESSIONAL DATA AVAILABLE TO PUBLIC
description: The marketing of a new in dex to Congressional docu ments and a microfiche library of them was announced yester day by The New York Times Company and the Congres sional Service of Washington.

title: KNUDSEN SALARY $200,000 A YEAR
description: The White Motor Corpora tion disclosed yesterday in a proxy statement prepared for its annual meeting, scheduled for June 14, that Semon E. Knudsen is receiving an annual salary of $200,000 in his new post as chairman and chief ex ecutive officer.

title: F. A. A. Is Planning to Lift Quota on Kennedy Flights
description: The Federal Aviation Ad ministration said yesterday that air traffic congestion had eased enough at Kennedy Interna tional Airport to permit sus pension of the hourly limits on landings and takeoffs that it imposed two years ago.

title: Borek Takes L.I. Open;
description: HEMPSTEAD, L. I., May 21 Gene Borek, whose teaching theory is, to put my pupils' golf game together not tear it apart for analysis, solidified his own today and won the Long Island open championship by one stroke.

title: Subject Was Baby FoodBut It Wasn't Always Obvious
description: He stared down from the podium like Little Brother keeping a twinkling eye on some 50 professionals and reporters in the field of in fant diet. They were attend ing an afternoon seminar on baby foods at the St. Regis Hotel, sponsored by the Ger ber Products Company, the baby foods concern.

title: 2 T.V.A. Turbine Contracts Awarded to Brown Boveri
description: The Tennessee Valley Au thority has awarded the Brown Boveri Corporation, North Brunswick, N. J., a $59.5million contract for two steamturbine generators each rated at about 1.3 million kilowatts.

title: Plan to Cut Welfare Rents Here Gains in Albany Vote
description: ALBANY, May 21The Sen ate unanimously approved to day a bill backed by Mayor Lindsay measure designed to cut New York City's cost for housing welfare clients by per mitting its Social Services De partment to reserve apart ments for them.

title: BRITISH SOLDIER DIES IN BELFAST GUNFIGHT
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, Saturday, May 22 (Reuters) A British soldier was shot and killed and another was wound ed when gunmen ambushed an army patrol here early today.

title: Scribner Orders School Aides To Give Complete Drug Reports
description: Chancellor Harvey B. Scrib ner has directed public schools to report all available data on the use of narcotics among schoolchildren to reflect as true a picture as possible of the situation existing in our schools.

title: AT HOME ABROAD
description: PARIS, May 21 It is a pity that George Bernard Shaw is not alive to observe the mixed pain and hope of Britain's romance with the European Community. He might have seen ironic parallels to the history of his own country, Ireland, in the choice between being one's self apart and being part of something larger.

title: Chicago Banker in Belgrade
description: BELGRADE, Yugoslavia, May 21  The Nixon Administra tion, fearful of possible domes tic opposition, is not likely to take significant steps to liber alize EastWest trade before the 1972 elections, an influen tial Chicago banker said here today.

title: Court Upholds Bar On Incorporation Of Homosexual Unit
description: ALBANY, May 21A State Supreme Court justice has up held a decision by Secretary of State John P. Lomenzo to deny a certificate of incorpora tion to the Gay Activist Alli ance.

title: NEW AID CANCELS PATENT STOPPAGE
description: WASHINGTON, May 21 The Patent Office, which be cause of increased printing costs had expected to suspend issuance of patents for 12 weeks this summer, has sur mounted the crisis.

title: Mrs. Mildred F. Marshall, Volunteer Head at Mission
description: Mrs. Mildred F. Marshall, di rector of volunteers and a so cial worker in prisons for the Episcopal Mission Society in the diocese of New York from 1959 to 1968, died at St. Luke's Hospital on Thursday. She was 68 years old.

title: U.S. Officials Optimistic
description: WASHINGTON, May 21 United States officials tended today to take an ?? view of President ?? speech yesterday in ?? demanded that the ?? States squeeze Israel ?? sary for the sake of ??

title: Notes on People
description: The former Svetlana Allilu yeva, Stalin's daughter, gave birth yesterday to a 7pound, 9ounce girl in San Rafael, Calif. The baby, named Olga Margedant, and her mother, Mrs. William W. Peters, were reported in good condition at Marin Hospital.

title: GOVERNOR, MAYOR TALK TO NO AVAIL
description: ALBANY, May 21Governor Rockefeller and Mayor Lindsay failed today to reach agreement on the Mayor's proposed $892.4 million tax package despite 25 and a half hours of eating, rooming, negotiating and even flying together.

title: Board of Beck Industries Meets on Financial Woes
description: Beck Industries, Inc., a diver sified retailer of apparel and footwear, announced yesterday that its board met over the last two days and would meet again next week to consider various actions to deal with its serious financial diffi culties.

title: Jefferson Time Scores
description: Jefferson Time, driven by Ben Webster, captured the $44,992.50 Lady Maud Pace, a nonbetting race, Friday night. Bret's Blue Chip trailed the vic tor by half a length.

title: Study Urges Caution on Governor's Methadone Plan
description: ALBANY, May 21A special legislative study of the state's narcotics control program has cautioned against a rapid in crease in the methadone pro gram, as recommended by Governor Rockefeller.

title: Dryden, Canadien Goalie, Cited Here
description: Until March 7, Ken Dryden, the goalie of the Stanley Cup champion Montreal Cana diens, divided his time be tween McGill University's Law School and the Montreal Voyageurs of the American Hockey League.

title: Fight for Apparel Import Quotas Urged
description: DALLAS, May 21I can see very little growth of the apparel industry in the United States under the present circumstances.

title: $3,000 Annual Award Set Up for Composers
description: A $3,000 composers award to be given annually has been established at Columbia Uni versity by Mrs. Walter Hin richsen in memory of her husband, who died in 1969.

title: Beaches Open Today Under Financial Cloud
description: With high hopes for good weather but dim hopes for sufficient financing, the Parks, Recreation and Cul tural Affairs Department is opening the eight city beaches today.

title: Merger News
description: In its final step to divest itself of the remaining stock holdings of Braniff Airways, Inc., LingTemcoVought, Inc., announced yesterday terms of its exchange offering involving $182million. Under its pro posed terms, two shares of Braniff Class A special stock and two shares of LTV common will be exchanged for each $100 of 5 per cent subordinated deben tures of LTV due Jan. 15, 1988.

title: Vietnamese at Saigon Airport, in a Sharp Change, Intercept, Smugglers
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, May 21The airport here, long a smuggler's dream, is turning into a nightmare not only for smugglers but also for ordinary travelers, much to the delight of the American advisers who have been urging strict meas ures for months.

title: Police Building in London Is Damaged by Explosions
description: LONDON, Saturday, May 22 (UPI)A series of explosions ripped a police building along the Thames River in downtown London early today, and an anarchist organization that calls itself the Angry Brigade claimed responsibility.

title: How Fair Was My Newark
description: LITTLE FALLS, N. J.How serene and ethnically ordered it all was. The Brahmins in Forest Hill; the more suc cessful latterday Americans assimilat ing in Vailsburg; the Italians in the Branch Brook section; the Ginsbergs and Horowitzes and a smattering of Schmidts and McCloskeys in Clinton Hill; the achieving Jews in Weequahic (the cradle of Portnoy); the neighbor ly ItalianIrish German Polish Jewish amalgam of the Ironbound; stainless Roseville, pure North Newark; and the Negroes, safely penned up, shooting dice, razoring each other, eating pea nuts and watermelon, whiling away the years killing cockroaches and club bing rats in their warrens off Spring field and South Orange Avenues just above the courthouse where Lincoln sits.

title: Roundup: Red Sox Take Round One Over Orioles
description: Ask Eddie Kasko, the Bos ton Red Sox manager, why his pitching staff has sud denly blossomed into one of the toughest in the Ameri can League and he will quickly give a major share of the credit to Duane Joseph son, his catcher.

title: Okker and Riessen Gain
description: BRUSSELS, May 21 (AP) Tom Okker of the Netherlands and Marty Riessen of Evanston, Ill., defeated Phil Dent of Aus tralia and Cliff Drysdale of South Africa, 36, 63, 64, 57, 62, in a doubles semifinal in an open international tennis tournament today.

title: Vote at G.M. On 8 Proposals
description: DETROIT, May 21Of the eight stockholder proposals before the General Motors annual meeting, the three of the Campaign to Make Gen eral Motors Responsible and the one from the Protestant Episcopal Church were de cisively defeated, while the four brought forth by the traditional corporate gadflies did better, although all lost decisively.

title: Mirror to Add Sunday Issue
description: The New York Daily Mirror announced yesterday that it would publish a Sunday edition beginning this weekend. The publisher, Robert W. Farrell, said columns by Bob Considine and Harry Golden would be among the features carried in the edition, which will also in clude a color comic section.

title: 4 CALLED ROBBERS OF THE ELDERLY
description: Four men who allegedly stalked elderly persons in parks and on the street, then forced them at knife point to their homes and stole money, jewelry and furs, were indicted yester day in the Bronx on charges involving robberies totaling $17,000.

title: Victoria Anne Hodel Is Bride Of William Bair, Fellow Student
description: BECKLEY, W. Va., May 21 In St. Stephen's Episcopal Church here this afternoon Miss Victoria Anne Hodel and William Neil Bair, members of the class of '72 at the West Virginia University Creative Arts Center, were married by the Very Rev. Joseph Asher Rickards Jr., dean of the New River Convocation.

title: MISS PALMER, ON 68, LEADS BY FOUR SHOTS
description: BUENA PARK, Calif., May 21 (AP)Sandra Palmer, putting brilliantly, charged into a four stroke firstround lead today as 71 pros and 14 amateurs teed off in the $38,000 Suzuki inter national golf tournament.

title: 2 Airlines Show Losses;
description: The nation's two leading in ternational air carriers reported yesterday that their loss opera tions continued through April.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
Bonn Is Reserved
description: BONN, May 21The West German Government and press today treated with reserve the signs from Washington and Moscow that the two powers might be on the verge of an agreement to control and ?? sibly to reduce their huge nu clear arsenals.

title: New York News Elects
description: Bruce G. McCauley, general manager, and Michael J. O'Neill, managing editor, of The Daily News have been elected vice presidents of The New York News, Inc., it was announced yesterday. F. M. Flynn, chair man of the company, was re elected.

title: ROME OPENS INQUIRY ON MAFIA DRUG TIES
