description: MOSCOW, May 22The So viet press reported today that there was wide approval in the United States of the Soviet American agreement on steps to faciliate the limitation of strategic arms, which was an nounced on Thursday.

title: Expos Down Pirates, 52, As Stoneman Pitches 4Hitter and Strikes Out 14
description: MONTREAL, May 22 (UPI) Consecutive home runs by Rusty Staub and John Bateman in the third inning tonight car ried the Montreal Expos to a 52 victory over the Pittsburgh Pirates behind the fourhit pitching of Bill Stoneman.

title: Ban on Vietcong Flag Urged
description: WASHINGTON, May 22 (AP) Legislation has been intro duced in Congress to make it a Federal crime to display a Vietcong or North Vietnamese flag while the United States is fighting in Southeast Asia. The bill was introduced by two Ohio Republicans, Representa tives Clarence E. Niller and Frank T. Bow.

title: 14 KILLED IN BLASTS ABOARD CRUISE SHIP
description: VANCOUVER, British Colum bia, May 22 (UPI)At least 14 crew members of the Norwe gian cruise ship Meteor were killed today when two explo sions and a fire wracked the ship off the coast of British Co lumbia.

title: Incident At Hawk's Hill
description: Mr. Eckert's folk fable of a small boy who can talk to furred and feathered friends is part of an apocrypha that has intrigued chroniclers before Romulus met Remus. It is still intriguing if you are willing to check your skepticism at the prologue, and pad along behind a 6yearold named Ben Mac Donald, who lives on a Cana dian farm circa 1870. Ben's in terlude concerns his life with a female badger. A natural his torian (wellknown to zoophiles for such earlier titles as Cross breed, The Great Auk, and The Silent Sky), Mr. Eckert makes this formidable beast seem appealing, without re course to undue anthropomor phism. Ben is also a winsome protagonistand the two make elemental music together.

title: Israel Accused by Jordan Of Inhuman Deportation
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., May 22Jordan has accused Israel of forcible and inhuman de portation of Jordanians from territories occupied since June 5, 1967, adding 28 specific cases to a complaint made March 26.

title: North Bellmore Is Aroused by Plan for LowIncome Housing
description: HEMPSTEAD, L. I., May 22A federally assisted housing project that would bring 10 lowincome families into the middleclass commu nity of North Bellmore has created such a stir that the project is in serious trouble.

title: Suffolk Dismaying to Naturalist
description: STONY BROOK, L.I., May 22  Given a little more time and the exercise of man's present capacity to de stroy what sustains him, east ern Long Island can become en ecological slum of the same proportions that now obtain in western Long Is land.

title: Peterson, Kline Pitch Today
description: The Yankees, only half a game ahead of the Indians, will attempt to hold fourth place in the Eastern Division tomorrow in a double  header that ends the weekend series.

title: MADISON AVE.
description: Recruitment advertising has been increasingly in the news lately as the armed forces prepared themselves for zero draft and allvol unteer status.

title: HENRY W. ROWLEY
description: Henry W. Rowley, a retired music librarian at the Cathe dral Church of, St. John the Divine and a former singer in its choir, died Friday in Coo perstown, N. Y., where he lived. His age was 92.

title: Legend of Gael Is Best at Hempstead
description: HEMPSTEAD, L. I., May 22 The topwinning representative in the United States of the set ter breed from Scotland made famous by the Duke of Gordon in the 18th century, proved the top winner at the 65th show of the Ladies Kennel Association of America today.

title: Pioneer Atomic Scientist Honored by Soviet Union
description: MOSCOW, May 22A pre viously unpublicized pioneer of the Soviet atomic energy pro gram was honored this week with the Order of the October Revolution, one of the highest in the Soviet arsenal of decora tions.

title: MASSENGALE AHEAD IN MAUMELLE OPEN
description: NORTH LITTLE ROCK, Ark., May 22 (AP)Rik Massengale and Tom Ulozas turned the $25,000 Maumelle open, a Pro fessional Golfers' Association satellite, into a twoman show today.

title: Mayor to Meet Leone Somewhere on Bridge
description: Just as in foreign affairs the shape of a table may be a sticking point in negotia tions, so the relations be tween boroughs are some times complicated by moun tainous trifles. The birthday march across the Brooklyn Bridge tomorrow is a case in point.

title: INTERBORO ROUTE ANGERS RESIDENTS
description: Concrete block buster. Berlin Wall. Truckway. Pollution Pike. Something that's not wanted, not needed and of no benefit to our com munity.

title: Reader's Report
description: Growing up black in a city like Boston is the theme of this often moving novel. The home life of young Garner Hawkins is not auspicious: one older brother dabbles in armed rob bery, another is a pimp, and Garner tries both specialties be fore opting for a better escape from the slums. Mr. Smith does not allow his hero to make pat decisions or sudden con versions; he delineates with some subtlety the inertia that keeps the boy from moving out into mainstream America, as poverty, selfdoubt, and big otry chip away at his selfes teem. Both his brothers die violent deaths before the novel ends. Garner himself is finally salvaged by an athletic scholar ship and a couple of men bene factors. If Mr. Smith is overly declarative at times, his picture of the slow accretion of racial pride is utterly convincing.

title: Justifying God's ways to man
description: Let me tell you why God made the world.

title: Sparkman Boat Captures Y.R.A. Soling Class Race
description: GREENWICH, Conn., May 22 Palmer D. Sparkman sailed his Lu Lu to a third straight Soling Class victory on Long Island Sound today as River side Yacht Club ran the third Yacht Racing Association championship regatta of the season for fleets based East of Rye.

title: STONITSCH WINS MILE AND 3MILE
description: TEANECK, N. J., May 22 Running on what he termed ego strength, Ron Stonitsch swept the onemile and three mile runs at the Atlantic Coast regional track and field cham pionships today for the second consecutive year.

title: The World
description: WASHINGTONThe reference by Soviet Premier Aleksei Kosy gin was a trifle oblique, but the intent was clear. Much atten tion, he said last week, is paid today to the problem of troops and arms reduction. He obvi ously had in mind the debate in Washington over a proposal to withdraw some American troops from Europe, and he left no doubt about his Government's interest in the problem. The Soviet Union, he said, would do everything possible to reach agreement on reducing forces in Europe if the Western powers display real readiness to take practical steps in this direction.

title: SECURITY TIGHTENED IN ULSTER BY BRITAIN
description: BELFAST, May 22  The British Army imposed tight security measures in Belfast to day after two terrorist am bushes in which a soldier was killedthe seventh this year and two injured, one seriously.

title: Bridge
description: AN odd episode was reported last year by Edgar Kaplan, one of the American representatives in the world championship which has just been completed in Taipei, China. During a visit to Rome he played with his wife, Betty, in a duplicate game and elected to pass her open ing bid of one club. His opponents, horrified by this unheard of action, offered to let him retract his pass. It was clear that only their natural politeness toward a foreigner re strained them from calling the di rector and reporting him for im proper conduct.

title: Barbara Kay Gonzales Is a Bride
description: WILLIAMSBURG, Va., May 22Miss Barbara Kay Gon zales and John Southgate Burnett were married here today in the garden at the home of the bride's parents, Mr. and Mrs. Donald J. Gon zales. The Rev. Thomas E. Pugh of the Williamsburg Baptist Church performed the ceremony in the Robert Car ter HOuse on Palace Green in the Williamsburg Settlement. Mr. Gonzales is a vice presi dent of Colonial Williams burg.

title: Letters:
description: Rene Lecler's rundown of European gambling casinos (Travel section, May 2) stated that in some areas, like Switzerland, the Scandinavi an lands and Spain, gambling Is strictly verboten. Not in Sweden it isn't. You can play roulette in the leading hotels. But if you're looking for dra matic rejections of the wel

title: Volpe Sees U.S. Role In 2dGeneration SST
description: SAN FRANCISCO, May 22 (UPI)Transportation Secre tary John A. Volpe, conceding the United States supersonic transport program was dead, says he hopes the country will get back into the race for the second generation of fasterthansound airliners.

title: Order in the Courts
description: Chief Justice Warren E. Burger was concerned with something far more fundamental than etiquette when he called for a more effective disciplining of offensive or disruptive courtroom behavior by lawyers. His case for civility is nothing less than a plea to preserve the authority of the law. Without such authority, justice will ultimately be replaced by the rule of the jungle.

title: Color TV Sales Gaining
description: CHICAGO  Manufactur ers of color TV sets seem to have regained that rosy glow that comes from rising sales.

title: MARKET PARTNERS GET PARIS REPORT
description: PARIS, May 22 (Reuters) France informed her five Com mon Market partners today of agreements reached by Presi dent Pompidou and Prime Min ister Heath here yesterday that have cleared the way for Brit ain's entry into the Market.

title: Gordons Have Child
description: A daughter was born to Mr. and Mrs. Mort Gordon of New York on April 26 in the Lenox Hill Hospital. Mrs. Gordon is the former Miss Elaine Taylor Schneider.

title: COMMUNISTS STIR FINNISH POLITICS
description: HELSINKI, May 20Finnish political life has been unsettled by the recent withdrawal of the Communist party from the broadly based coalition Gov ernment after five years of participation.

title: DEMOCRATS SEEK QUEENS BALANCE
description: Something like ?? of the 560,000 enrolled Demo cratic voters in Queens are Of Italian descent, but not one of the eight City Councilman from the borough is an ItalianAmer ican.

title: COSMOS TO MEET OLYMPICS TODAY
description: The New York Cosmos, who Friday night suffered their first defeat of the season at the hands of Hearts of Scotland, will attempt to return to win ning ways when they meet the Montreal Olympics at Yankee Stadium at 2 o'clock today.

title: When We Committed Ourselves To Living in the City We Decided A Summer House Was a Necessity
description: FIRE ISLAND is for kids. And par ents. And people, singly or in groups. It's what you make it, your own thing. What we've made it is a summer home.

title: Negotiators Meet in Vienna
description: VIENNA, May 22  United States and Soviet representa tives at the strategic missile talks met today for the first time since the talks were re cessed two weeks ago because of a deadlock over the agenda.

title: Miss McCurdy Becomes Bride Of P. L. Wilson
description: DARIEN, Conn., May 22 Miss Carolyn McCurdy was married here this noon to Peter Langston Wilson, whose grandfather, the Rev. Jesse R. Wilson of Austin, Tex., a Baptist minister, performed the ceremony at the home of the bride's parents.

title: Y.M.C.A., in First Such Act, Calls for Total Withdrawal
description: WASHINGTON, May 22 (AP) The Y.M.C.A. called today for complete withdrawal of all military forces from Vietnam at the earliest possible time.

title: Bold Statement, $6.20, Takes Third Straight in Pimlico's Closing Stakes
description: BALTIMORE, May 22Frank E. Power's Bold Statement, under a wellrated ride by Bill Hartack, wound up Pimlico Race course's 30day spring meeting today by winning the $36,800 Survivor Stakes. It was the colt's third straight tri umph.

title: Czechoslovakia Appears Compliantly Indifferent
description: PRAGUE, May 18  Nearly three years after Warsaw Pact forces entered Czechoslovakia to end the liberal regime of Alexander Dubcek, the country appears to have settled into a state of compliant indifference.

title: The World
description: PARISIf some future historl an of 20thcentury Europe wants a single event to serve as a symbolic turningpoint, he could, well choose the scene in the Elysee Palace last Friday eve ning. In the Salle des Fetes, a great room hung with Gobelin tapestries, sat perhaps 200 jour nalists and diplomats. The Presi dent of France and the Prime Minister of Britain were together at the small table facing them. Mr. Pompidou spoke first, slowly and with emphasis. After 15 minutes he came to his conclud ing passage.

title: Bronx Immunizations Today
description: A oneday drive to immunize 15,000 preschool children against measles and polio will be conducted today by the De partment of Health in the Mor risania section of the Bronx. The immunizations, which are free, will be given between 11 A.M. and 3:30 P.M. at Public Schools 6, 20, 23, 35, 50, 75, 88, 132, 134 and 140.

title: ASTROS TRIUMPH OVER GIANTS, 21
description: HOUSTON, May 22 (UPI) John Mayberry, getting his first hit since being recalled from Oklahoma City yesterday, drove in the winning run with a two out single in the 12th inning to night to give the Houston Astros a 21 victory over the San Fran cisco Giants.

title: When Spooky Jennings Runs, the Records Wobble
description: If the track hadn't been so heavy with rainfall, Richard (Spooky) Jennings thought he might have run faster. Still, his time of 6 seconds for the 50yard dash and 8.4 seconds for the 75 weren't bad for a high school runner.

title: Fire Fighting Trainees Teach Safety to Students
description: Theron H. Jackson spent recent morning in a classroom studying for his high school equivalency diploma examina tion, his lunch hour preparing for the Fire Department en trance examination and his afternoon lecturing on fire pre vention to 200 schoolchildren at Public School ?? in the heart of Brownsville.

title: National Notes
description: Abortion Switch

title: Reagan Candidacy Backed
description: WASHINGTON, May 22 (AP) The Young Americans for Freedom plan to open a cam paign to publicize Gov. Ronald Reagan of California as a Re publican Presidential possibil ity. The group's national chair man, Ronald F. Docksai, said that national headquarters for the Reagan drive would be opened this fall in Houston.

title: COUGAR II RALLIES FOR COAST SCORE
description: INGLEWOOD, Calif., May 22 Mary F. Jones's Cougar II, masterfully hidden by Bill Shoemaker, won the $138,600 Californian Stakes today by ?? lengths at Hollywood Park as three top Eastern handicap performers finished far behind.

title: Lancers Top Tornado, 10
description: DALLAS, Tex., May 22 (AP) Francesco Escos, a helfback, leftfooted a 15yard shot through an open alley of the Dallas Tornado defense to give the Rochester Lancers a 10 victory tonight in a North American Soccer League game. Escos scored in the 54th min ute and the goal stood up when the Lancers goalkeeper, Dan ville Clark, smothered an pen alty kick by the Tornados Tony McLoughlin in the 70th minute.

title: GABON SEEKING FOREIGN CAPITAL
description: LIBREVILLE, Gabon, May 13 This rich little patch of jungle, astride the Equator on Africa's western coast, shows signs of trying to shake loose from the domination of France. But even the Government lead ers sponsoring the move do not expect a dramatic change.

title: Michael Davis Golden to Marry Miss Anne G. Barnes in August
description: BRANFORD, Conn., May 22Miss Anne Goodrich Barnes and Michael Davis Golden, son of Mrs. Ruth Sulzberger Golden of Look out Mountain, Tenn., chair man of the board and pub lisher of The Chattanooga Times, plan to be married here in August.

title: Drama Mailbag
description: To THE EDITOR:

title: Antigone Needs More Ambiguity
description: SOPHOCLES' Antigone need not be a moving play  both Antigone and Creon are much too sure of themselves to invite tears but it should be a dis turbing one. The one thing the new production at the Vivian Beaumont is not is disturbing. At the end of it one has the feeling that Creon  or perhaps a Messen ger if Creon shouldn't feel up to itis about to dust his palms, sigh with relief and mutter, Well, that's that, nearly everybody's dead, if someone will just clear away the bodies we can begin thinking of tomorrow's tasks. Indeed the evening is so unprovocative in spite of its de fiances and quarrels and multiple deaths that one only wishes to echo its flatness, go straight home and never say anything about it at all.

title: A New Lower East Side Envisioned in City Report
description: A threeyear study commis sioned by the city urges that more than half the apartments on the Lower East Side be re placed by new construction that would also utilize landfill along the East River shoreline and vacant park areas.

title: ABOMB FACES TEST FOR GAS PRODUCTION
description: MERCURY, Nev., May 22 (AP)The Atomic Energy Com Mission is getting ready to test the first nuclear bomb designed to be massproduced for peace ful use in the United States.

title: PRINCETON PRIZE TO MRS. STEPHENS
description: PRINCETON, N.J., May 22 Mrs. Lois Stephens of Ossining, N.Y., who started riding only five years ago in the hope of strengthening an injured knee, captured four classes including the prestigious Grand Prix to day at the Meadow Mouse dressage horse show.

title: Letters:
description: To THE EDITOR:

title: The World
description: CAIROAs Egypt. recovers from the shock of revelations of conspiracy against the Govern ment by an allegedly extremist group within the Arab Socialist Union, meetings of the Union's new leadership may seem more like Rotary Club luncheons or academic seminars than revolu tionary councils. The membership of the nineman provisional com mittee to head the 6million member political organization seems as good an indication as any of the respectforlaw society urged by Egyptian President An war elSadat.

title: Councilman Likes Present Job Better Than Position in Senate
description: A community group from BedfordStuyvesant had a problem to take up with their state legislators the other day. But the legislators were not in Brooklyn. They were in Al banylegislating.

title: First Ombudsman Selected By Queens College Senate
description: Joseph Drew, special assist ant to the dean of students, has been selected as the first ombudsman of Queens College by the studentfaculty Academic Senate.

title: Is El Topo a Con?
description: ONE of the most success ful films now playing in New York hasn't even opened here yet. That is, officially. It's a Mexi can film called El Topo (The Mole) and it's a two hourplus, surreal fantasy, which, since New Year's, has been playing midnight shows (1 A.M. on Fridays and Sat urdays) at the Elgin Theater, on Eighth Avenue near 19th Street. With a handful of re views in the underground press and none to speak of in the straight press, the film has been attracting capacity audiences, many of whose members are apparently re peaters who come back to turn on and to be turned on.

title: Late May
description: Early spring or late, by the last Week in May the woods and fields have begun to show the lushness that will be June. This has been a late spring, but the season is catching up with itself. The pale green of first leafing on maple and birch darkens toward the tones of summer. The pastel look is gone from the hillsides. Pastures are already grown tall enough to wave and ripple, sealike, in the breeze. Apple trees are, bursting into blossom, already shedding petals in early orchards. Daffodils fade and tulips flare.

title: Letters:
description: To THE EDITOR:

title: Montauk Lab Sets Cards Afloat To Trace. Pattern of Currents
description: MONTAUK, L. I. May 22 Strollers along I., beach searching for a message in corked bottle may be able to help an oceanographic study.

title: Letters:
description: Being married to a Belgian and having a taste for gam bling, I was surprised that Mr. Lacier did not mention that little Belgium has at least a halfdozen gambling ca sinos. I have personally en joyed the sport at Namur, Knokke and the famous town of Spa. I can assure readers that the casinos of Belgium are for the most part friendly, dignified and enjoyable.

title: LA SALLE VICTOR IN CATHOLIC MEET
description: La Salle Academy, tuning up for the city track and field championships next weekend, easily won the team title yes terday in the New York sec tional meet of the Catholic High Schools Athletic Associa tion.

title: Islands for today
description: All through the history of design the furnishings of a room have been an extension of the architectural style. What kind of furnishings, then, are suited to the contemporary highrise? The answer seems to be  those as simple and functional as the space itself. In this city coop owned by a bachelor business executive, designers Larry Durham and Barbara Greene of GU, Inc., didn't fight the architecture but used it as a cue for furniture com patible with their client's way of life. Comfort was of prime importance since the owner insisted that his older friends should enjoy the apartment as much as his contemporaries. The designers chose geometric pieces that separate the space into islands of use. Not only are the resulting rooms easy to main tain for a bachelorbut the apartment has a strictly 20thcentury identity.

title: 1970 BLAST CAUSE IS FOUND BY U.S.
description: A complex, explosive chemi cal reaction, lasting a second or less, caused the tanktruck blast and fire that killed two persons and injured 30 others near Brooklyn's Victory Memo rial Hospital May 30, 1970, ac cording to the National Trans portation Safety Board.

title: Quest for Share Buyers on Fire Island Is On
description: Hi! I'm Joel! Ready to swing this summer?

title: New York
description: Seven dead, 30 wounded. The toll of New York police men shot this year mounts ever higher: as many slain in five months as in all of 1970; twothirds as many wounded. Last week, in a new series of incidents, two officers were killed and two others crit ically wounded.

title: IN THE NATION
description: WASHINGTON  Senator Henry Jackson has ended the honeymoon period of the campaign for the Democratic Presidential nomination, and for what it may be worth he has done so precisely at the moment when Mr. Nixon's performance is look ing better than it has since 1969.

title: Stageberg Is Breathing on a Record
description: If Steve Stageberg wins an Olympic gold medal in Mu nich next summer, it may dispel notions that champions are made, not born.

title: A's Hunter Hurls 2Hitter and Beats Twins, 51, for 8th Victory in Row
description: OAKLAND, May 22 (AP) Jim (Catfish) Hunter allowed two hits today in recording his eighth consecutive victory as the Oakland Athletics trimmed the Minnesota Twins, 51.

title: Sadat Triumph Stirring Ironic Humor
description: CAIRO, May 20  Thou sands of years of foreign domination have developed defense mechanism among Egyptiansan acute sense of selfdepreciating humor.

title: The Nation
description: In the American economy to day the numbers grow so huge that they seem to lose their meaning. In the first quarter of this year, Gross National Prod uct  the nation's total output of goods and services  was running at an annual rate of $1,020,700,000,000 (that's over one trillion dollars), more than $30billion above the last quarter of 1970. In the current April June quarter, G.N.P. is likely to show another gain of $20billion or more.

title: Chippendale Highboy Sets $102,000 Auction Record
description: A carved mahogany highboy was auctioned for $102,000 yes terday, a price ParkeBernet galleries said was a world auc tion record for a piece of Amer ican furniture and a record for any piece of furniture sold in the United States.

title: OTB's Growing Pains
description: A formidablelooking woman steps up to a counter on the 15th floor of the Paramount Building and raps on the win dow.

title: NAVY, MARYLAND GAIN IN LACROSSE
description: An underdog Navy team stunned Virginia yesterday in the opening round of the first National Collegiate Athletic As sociation Lacrosse tournament. Navy beat the toprated Cava liers, 96, in Charlottesville, Va.

title: RESOLUTE CLASS SAIL IS WON BY MATKOVIC
description: PORT WASHINGTON, L.I., May 22Ivo Matkovic's Noni captured Resolute Class honors today as 37 boats sailed in the Cow Bay Area Yacht Racing Association of Long Island Sound competition.

title: Drama Mailbag
description: To THE EDITOR:

title: Tire Recall Law in Effect
description: WASHINGTON, May 22 (AP) A Federal law requiring tire dealers to record the names and addresses of buyers for notifi cation of safety defects went into effect today. Tires recall formerly relied on announce ments in news media.

title: LEFTIST FACTION ASSAILED IN CAIRO
description: CAIRO, May 22A mystery involving a secret group in the Arab Socialist Union, Egypt's political organization, deepened today with a dramatic account of how the group's documents Were taken outside Cairo and burned after the collapse of a challenge to the leadership of President Anwar elSadat.

title: Letters:
description: To THE EDITOR:

title: Et Al.
description: A commensensical, philosoph icaltype essay suggesting that death is merely a merging with the universe and shouldn't be feared. Though the quiet, rea sonable rhythms sound of the secular ministry, the author is capable of interrupting himself to make Reader's Digest cul tural observations.

title: Drama Mailbag
description: To THE EDITOR:

title: Letter to the Editor 4  No Title
description: To THE EDITOR:

title: PAPP'S PLEA FOE NO MORE NANETTES
description: To THE EDITOR:

title: 'For Days Nothing but the Sea, The Vast Atlantic'
description: FOR me, a trip to Europe must in clude the sea. It must include a time to live with the vast waters, to feel the movement of a deck beneath my feet, to see the ocean and its cresting waves in all lights, colors and moods. I am not a giant and I don't like to go from one continent to another in a single giant stride. In spanning an ocean I must get the sense of distance in my bones.

title: 77Day Meeting Will Open At Arlington on Wednesday
description: CHICAGO, May 22 (AP) With an added money program of nearly $1million, including four purses of $100,000 or more, the coordinated Arlington and Washington. Park Jockey Club 77day meeting opens at Arlington Park Wednesday.

title: TV Mailbag
description: To THE EDITOR:

title: Architecture
description: EVERYBODY knows about Gov. Nelson A Rockefeller's $1billion, Monumental Camp AI bany Mall, his bid for master builder immortality that sets some . kind of record for ludicrously grandiose planning and costs.

title: Et Al.
description: An account of the auto's pro liferation: by 1994 we will have more cars than people. Schneid er is a sociologist and cityplan ner; but he avoids stiff, heavily documented prose and offers in an anecdotal, punning, fast argument a proposal that streets be liberated and anti auto organizations be born. Light, not to say frivolous.

title: Et Al.
description: A pleasant enough, rambling account of the stresses and strains of MalletJoris's family life (children, Spanish maid, painter husband, lots of friends, hustle and bustle plus how to find time to write?). It was popular in France, where Mal letJoris is a personality.

title: South Korea Will Elect New Assembly Tuesday
description: SEOUL, South Korea, May 22  South Korean voters will elect a new National Assembly Tuesday in which President Chung Hee Park's Democratic Republican party appears cer tain to retain a solid majority.

title: Discounters Gear for '71
description: After a rugged 1970, dis countstore merchants are hoping that they are better equipped to cope with 1971's uncertain economy than are department stores with their higher operational costs.

title: Lis Homers as Phils Win
description: PHILADELPHIA, May 22 (AP) Joe Lis slammed a tworun homer and Willie Montanez rifled a tworun double tonight tolead the Philadelphia Phillies to a 53 victory over the Cin cinnati Reds.

title: The Drama of the Elyse
description: In a sense the press conference of President Pompidou and Prime Minister Heath at the close of their talks in Paris was an anticlimax. The breakthrough on difficult outstanding issues in the negotiation at Brussels May 11 and 12 had practically assured the success of Mr. Heath's trip to Paris. Yet, for those fascinated by the lore and drama of the long struggle to build a united Europe, the episode at the Elyse, rooted in history and rich in irony, will never be forgotten.

title: Eight Concerns Are Accused Of Polluting Illinois Waters
description: WASHINGTON, May 22 (AP) Eight companies operating in Illinois have been charged with violating the Refuse Act of 1899 by dumping oil into canals or rivers of the state.

title: BUSINESS LETTER
description: As noted in this space few weeks ago, the month of May often is a tough one for investors. This month has been no exception, with the bumpy going including about twice as many downdays as updays and with declines of 3.4 per cent or so in leading market indexes.

title: And Forello Read the Funnies
description: THE latest peril to the continuance of New York City's radio and television facilities, WNYCAM, WNYCFM and WNYCTV, acids another distinctive chapter to the haz ards of noncommercial broadcasting which in whole or in part is dependent on government funds.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: Recently, I took time to look at a very common $10 bill, it shows the United States Treasury, with plenty of improbable parking space around it, and a unique old auto of 1920 or 1930 vintage rolling undisturbed and solitary on the vast plaza in front of the Treasury.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: I am beginning to believe that the wanton attacks on the Federal Bureau of Investigation and its director, J. Edgar Hoover, are inspired by forces not entirely friendly to the United States. Whether the forces behind the adverse criticism be civil or legislative ly motivated, the whole thing reeks of an antiAmerican odor.

title: Toledo Wins Tennis Title
description: ATHENS, Ohio, May 22 (AP) Toledo continued its domina tion of MidAmerican Confer ence tennis today by winning three singles titles and one in doubles to gain its, sixth straight championship. The Rockets finished with 20 points, followed by Western Michigan with 13, Kent 9, Miami 6, Bowl ing Green 5 and host Ohio University 4.

title: CMSLC? It's AO.K.
description: THE second season of the Chamber Music Society of Lincoln Center, hereafter re ferred to as CMSLC, has come to a close, and already the third season's programs Are announced. In the two Years of its existence, CMSLC has made an appreciable con tribution to the New York musical scene. Patterned somewhat after the Music From Marlboro series, it has extended the concept by long er seasons of old and new chamber music in all combi nations, played by a perma nent group. Some of Ameri ca's finest musicians are in that group; they are Charles Treger, violin; Walter Tram pler, viola; Leslie Parnas, cello; Paula Robison, flute; Leonard Arner, oboe; Ger vase de Peyer, clarinet (and the one nonAmerican); and Richard Goode and Charles Wadsworth, pianists. To these is being added, next season, the bassoonist

title: England Beats Scotland For Soccer Crown, 31
description: LONDON, May 22 (AP) Two goals by Martin Chivers of Tottenham Hotspurs led England to a 31 victory over Scotland and the British soc cer championship today be fore a crowd of 100,000 at Wembley Stadium.

title: St. John's Runners Retain Crock 'o Cheese Track Title
6,000 L.I. Seniors To Seek Interviews On Annual Job Day
description: WESTBURY, L. I., May 22 Six thousand Nassau County students who will enter the job market in the fall will gather at, Roosevelt Raceway here next week for the third annual Employment Day on Long Is land.

title: Vasquez Answered the Bell in School
description: In the South Bronx, where Davey Vasquez, grew up, you either had to learn how to run or learn how to fight. Vasquez learned how to do the latter at a very early age.

title: A Harvard Man Named William and Mary Head
description: WILLIAMSBURG, Va., May 22 (AP)Dr. Thomas Ashley Graves Jr., a member of the faculty at Harvard Univer sity, was named tonight as president of the College of William and Mary.

title: PENN IS WINNER OF MADEIRA CUP
description: PHILADELPHIA, May 22 Pennsylvania's crew pulled away from Cornell in the final 500 meters today and won the Madeira Cup for the sixth con secutive year on the Schuylkill River.

title: ECOLOGY CALLED SOURCE OF JOBS
description: FARMINGDALE, L. I., May 22The increasing national at tention to the conservation and restoration of the environment could result in the doubling of the number of available jobs in environmental and related fields in the next decade, an ecological conference was told here.

title: LETTERS
description: To the Financial Editor:

title: Art
description: ODD how things happen. An error in the cap tion of a picture of the Hindu deity Han uman that appeared on this page just six weeks ago, reading Anonymous wall painting, street shrine, Jai pur, India, led last week to a room in Brooklyn and a cache of Indian paintings (originals and color photo graphs) that must be the only one of its kind in or out of India.

title: MRS. ABRAHAM OXMAN
description: HILLSIDE, N. J., May 22 Mrs. Nettie Rasnick Oxman of 845 Westminster Avenue, a lawyer here for many years and the widow of Dr. Abraham Ox man, died yesterday in Beth Israel Hospital, Newark. She was 68 years old.

title: LEWENTHAL PLAYS PIANO NOVELTIES
description: Andre Kostelanetz usually likes to spice his Philharmonic Promenade programs with off beat orchestral pieces, but Friday night he stayed with the tried and true, leaving the novelties to his soloist, Ray mond Lewenthal.

title: America the Dutiful
description: Every age has had its dissenters.  Rarely did they receive in a lifetime as much attention as a seventeenyearold now can obtain in a week.  the press covers their protests and virtually creates national figures by giving pageone attention to dissenters who in another time would have remained in obscurity.

title: At Downstate Center: Too Few Women Medical Students, Too Few Men in Nursing
description: The Downstate Medical Center in Brooklyn finds it self confronted with a prob lem these days that is typ ical of medical schools around the country: Some staff members believe it has too few women among its medical students and too few men among its nursing stu dents.

title: A Parade of Steam and Sail, Liners and Garbage Scows Celebrates National Maritime Day in Hudson
description: A flotilla of 40 vessels, from garbage scows to ocean liners, moved down the Hud son River in flagdecked pro cession yesterday to celebrate National Maritime Day.

title: Crown Heights to Mark Its Cultural Contribution
description: More than 30 organiza tions will take part today in an allday celebration of the Crown Heights section of Brooklyn as the cultural capital of Brooklyn.

title: Olympic Games Boycott Looms As World Ski Group Convenes
description: OPATIJA, Yugoslavia, May 22More than 400 delegates of 39 national skiing federations assembled here today for the 28th Congress of the Interna tional Skiing Federation. The conclave is expected to produce a showdown with the Interna tional Olympic Committee over the amateurismprofessionalism issue.

title: The World
description: A NixonBrezhnev dtente? Transmutation of PingPong dip lomacy into threecushion Wash ingtonMoscowPeking billiards? The beginning of an end to the arms race? Or just a big head line propaganda gambit?

title: Motive for A Mission
description: Op the evening of May 11, 1941, the Duke of Hamilton hurried to London where he found the Prime Minister in the middle of a party and informed him that Rudolf Hess, the dep uty of the Ftihrer, had just parachuted down near his es tate in Lanarkshire. Whereupon Churchill, in true style, told his old friend: Well, Hess or no Hess, I am going to see the Marx Brothers.

title: Letters:
description: To THE EDITOR:

title: POINT OF VIEW
description: It is alleged that some sec tors have fared unfavorably from the market allocation of credit. Such sectors include housing, state and local gov ernments, small business, low income groups and agricul ture.

title: Mrs. Lissau Has Son
description: A son was born to Mr. and Mrs. Robert Lissau of Wan tagh, L. I., and New York on May 11 in the North Shore Hospital in Manhasset, L. I. Mrs. Lissau is the former Miss Marcy Cohen of New York. The child, whose father is assistant controller of Paris Boutiques, Inc., of East Newark, N. J., is named Russell Warren.

title: U.S. ALPINE TEAMS NAMED FOR '71'72
description: DENVER, May 22 (AP) Nine men and seven women have been named to the A squads of the U.S. Alpine ski team for the 7172 season.

title: Wood, Field and Stream: Shad Story
description: ENFIELD, ConnFed by heavy runoff from latemelt ing snows in northern New England and from recent heavy rains, the Connecticut River was high and fast when Oliver (Bud) Beckley of Bran ford put out in his small Boston Whaler for a few hours of shad fishing below the old Enfield dam.

title: London's City: It's Not the Same
description: LONDONThe number of American banks with their own branch in London has more than doubled in the last three years  from l.5 at the end of 1967 to 37 today. There were eight new ar rivals in 1968, nine in 1969 and another five last year.

title: FOREIGN AFFAIRS
description: CAIROThis month produced in Egypt a series of shoddy Machiavel lian plots whose net result has, been to strengthen, President Anwar elSadat and to confound those opponents who sought to overthrow him,, The latter, hoping for the Support of a mob, dis covered Instead that they had only a meek flock.

title: Climbers Descend Everest
description: KATMANDU, Nepal, May 22 (Reuters)Four members of an international expedition made their way down Mount Everest today, after having abandoned their attempt to reach the sum mit. A radio message said the climbersDon Whillans and Douglas Heston of Britain and Naomi Uemura and Reizo Ito of Japanwere well but had lost considerable weight during the last three weeks.

title: Tourists Follow Where Klompen Lead
description: AMSTERDAMAfter arriving here from mod ernistic Schiphol Airport, most tourists lament: Where are all the wooden shoes?

title: Dance
description: ALTHOUGH I have not ac tually worked it out statistically, I would be prepared to make an informed guess that no ballet company in the world dances so frequently in one town as New York City Ballet dances in New York. It gives about 160 performances a year at the New York State Theater in Lincoln Center, and, as a result, it has be come a more than familiar part of the New York scene.

title: Soledad Brother
description: In his review of The Joint, William Styron states that, in our own time, save for the works of Jean Genet, writings by and about prisoners have not often surpassed in quality the level of the Sunday supplements.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: On May 12 a Tass dispatch reported that Vladimir Mogilever, who is cur rently on trial with eight other Lenin grad Jews in connection with their al leged participation in a plane hijacking attempt among other charges, had sup posedly admitted to having established contact through me with Israeli Gov ernment circles while I was a partici pant in the AmericanSoviet Exchange for Young Scholars at the chemistry department, Leningrad State Univer sity, during the 196970 academic year.

title: SWEENY BOWS, 1 UP, IN FRENCH AMATEUR
description: DEAUVILLE, France, May 22 (AP)Alexis Godillot eliminated the favorite, Reg Taylor of South Africa, from the French amateur golf tournament today, but lost to a fellow Frenchman in the semifinals.

title: Rebel With Harvard Degree
description: DALLASA Texas stock broker, Gaston A. Shumate, has gone to court to chal lenge some of the pillars supporting this nation's se curities trading system.

title: 2 FORMER ALLIES VIE IN KENTUCKY
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky., May 22 Two former political allies are acting like anything but old friends as Kentucky heads for its gubernatorial primary on Tuesday.

title: THE WEEK IN FINANCE
description: WITH the approaching first anniversary of the deepest decline in the stock market's bearish plunge of last year, investors have been re minded rather cogently this month that the market has entered a potentially vulnerable area.

title: Students in Indiana At Peace Assembly Register for Voting
description: INDIANAPOLIS, May 22 Hundreds of high school and college students stood in line under the oak trees of Military Park today to register to vote for the first time at a peace rally organized by Allard K. Lowenstein, the former Repre sentative from Nassau County.

title: U.S. BUSINESS ROUNDUP
description: National priorities, as re flected in Federal legislation and/or Washington edicts, on occasion may clash or at least fail to mesh readily with regional, state or local priorities. The turbulence currently surrounding envi ronmental safeguards is a case in point.

title: NEW YORK'S ABORTION LAW (CONT.)
description: I read the article written by Susan Edmiston, A Report on the Abortion Capital of the Country (April 11), with great dismay. While the infor mation contained in the ar ticle was generally factually correct, I question the amount of research done with regard to the nonprofit, nofee abor tion referral groups.

title: QUITTING SMOKING HARD FOR ADDICTS
description: LOS ANGELES, May 22It was much easier to quit heroin than cigarettes, said a new comer to Synanon.

title: Paschal's Javelin Paces Qualifying for Lanier 250
description: GAINESVILE, Ga., May 22 (UPI)  Jim Paschal pushed his red, white and blue Javelin to a 92.68 milesanhour lap to day to lead qualifiers for tomor row's Lanier 250 Grand Ameri can race at Road Atlanta.

title: Showdown in Egypt: How Sadat Prevailed
description: CAIRO, May 22The hour of revolution has struck!

title: Library Council Receives A Ford Foundation Grant
description: The Council on Library Re sources announced yesterday the receipt of a $5million grant from the Ford Foundation for general support in the next three years.

title: Soviet Concedes Outlawed Sect Persists Despite Official Attacks
description: MOSCOW, May 22A Soviet newspaper has conceded that an outlawed Baptist reform movement continues to operate in strength in Central Asia de spite efforts to break up illegal prayer meetings and disrupt the organization.

title: Their Eyes HalfClosed Against the Arizona Sun
description: TUCSON, Ariz.  Cockpit canopies are covered with an opaque latex skin, making the 4,200 aircraft here at DavisMonthan Air Force Base appear to be gigantic insects whose eyes are halfclosed against the dry Arizona sun. The rows and rows of out ?? warplanes, set in a motionless, soundless environment, seem to be ?? the return of their pilots to ?? them in still another crisis, or per haps even the real thing.

title: Cards Beat Padres, 74
description: ST. LOUIS, May 22 (AP) Ted Sizemore drove in three runs and Julian Javier two oth ers in powering the St. Louis Cardinals to a 74 victory over the San Diego Padres tonight.

title: Art
description: A FEW days before the big Art and Technol ogy exhibition opened at the Los Angeles County Museum of Art, The Wall Street Journal carried a news report describing Claes Oldenburg's Giant Icebag, the soft, 18foothigh kinetic sculpture that performs a 20 minute dance on the mu seum's openair plaza. The story immediately prompted two inquiries from business men in Houston and Phoenix eager to order replicas of the Icebag for the plazas of their shopping centers. The man in Houston, I under stand, had to be dissuaded from ordering two Icebags over the telephone. After some discussion, he finally agreed to come to Los An geles to take a look at the thing for himself.

title: Barbara Coyle Is Bride
description: GLENBROOK, Conn., May 22Miss Barbara Ann Coyle and William Gray Schaefer were married here this after noon in St. Maurice's Roman Catholic Church by the Rev. Cornelius Looney assisted by the Rev. Edward D. Halloran.

title: Donald Baer Marries Miss Janet Lovelock
description: The marriage of Miss Janet Evelyn Lovelock, who expects to graduate from Cornell Uni versity in September, to Don ald Ray Baer, a doctoral can didate in physics at Cornell, took place here yesterday afternoon. The ceremony was performed in St. George's Episcopal Church by the Rev. Edward O. Miller.

title: Miss Eastman Vermont Bride
description: WOODSTOCK, Vt., May 22 Miss Victoria Eastman and Wayne Douglas Ohlandt were married here today in the First Congregational Church by the Rev. David Johnston.

title: '31 Roadster Tops Auction
description: BROOKLINE, Mass., May 22 (AP)a 1931 Cadillac roadster went for the top price of $19,000 today at the fourth annual An tique Automobile Auction at tended by about 2,000 persons at the sponsoring Museum of Transportation at Larz Ander son Park. About 85 cars changed hands in slightly less than five hours and the gross receipts were put at $122,510.

title: Big Perfecta Returns $19,127 at Pownal, Vt.
description: POWNAL, Vt., May 22 (AP)The highest big per fecta payoff of the thorough bred meeting at Green Moun tain Park was recorded to night when an unidentified ticketholder won $19,127.20 for a $2 bet.

title: METS BEAT BRAVES, 87, IN 11; INDIANS TOP YANKS, 21;
description: In another chapter in their life and struggles against the Atlanta Braves, the New York Mets ground out an 87 victory in 11 innings yesterdaybut only after they had come back from the brink of defeat in the ninth and 10th before 53,182 persons in Shea Stadium.

title: Photography
description: A NEW model twin lens re flex camera that ac cepts either 120 or 220 films (12 exposures for 120, 24 exposures for 220) has just been introduced by Yashica, Inc. Called the Mat 124G, it is actually an im proved model of their earlier Mat124 and has an allblack body with a new type of pres sure plate which can be quickly slid from one position for 120 film to another posi tion for 220 film. Making this adjustment automatically sets the exposure load re minder that is visible on the side of the camera, so the user can tell how many ex posures he can make.

title: Letters
description: The open letter to Harold D. Uris (Welcome, Mr. Uris, to the RedTape Housing Jungle, April 25] tells it like it is. He and others of us in the business of build ing housing have learned to accommodate to this ball park and are playing accord ing to the home ground rules.

title: Where Am I Now
description: This helterskelter farce tries to make fun of best sellers and the motionpicture business, two difficult assignments. Would you believe that a call girl would reprocess the Mar quis de Sade into a work called Bedroom, with the aid of a mechanic from the Best Sell ing Writers' School? Sure. And that this collaboration evolves into a stag film that wins six Academy Awards? Why not? It is almost impossi ble to make comic extensions of an area without boundaries, but Mr. Axelrod gives it a good try.

title: HIGHLIGHTS OF THE WEEK
description: A.T.&T. plans to raise nearly $1.4billion in new cap ital through the sale of preferred stock. If successful, the offering would be the largest single stock sale in histoiy.  Treasury Secretary John B. Connally Jr. said there would be a complete change in the international situation of the dollar if the U.S. continued to hold down inflation.

title: MORE THAN 20 CREWS IN HOLIDAY REGATTA
description: More than 20 college, club and high school crews will compete in the 103d Memorial Day regatta of the New York Rowing Association next Sat urday on the Orchard Beach Lagoon. Races will be held at 400, 1,500 and 2,000 meters.

title: Letters:
description: TO THE EDITOR:

title: Chiefs Defeats Stars, 41, As Welch Scores 2 Goals
description: ATLANTA, Ga., May 22 (AP) Art Welch scored two goals is the Atlanta Chiefs beat the St. Louis Stars, 41, in a North American Soccer League game tonight.

title: WASHINGTON
description: WASHINGTON, May 22In the last few days, the French have finally ac cepted the idea of Britain joining Europe; the Chinese have turned a more genial face to the outside world; the United States and the Soviet Union have agreed on a new formula for discussing the $200billionayear arms race; the moderates in Israel and the Arab states have been making some progress toward peace, and even Presi dent Nixon and Lyndon Johnson have been meeting together in Texas and agreeing that, maybe after all, the course of history is more important than anything else.

title: Men on Patrol Shocked and Angry
description: Thousands of policemen throughout the city pasted or wrapped black tape across their shields as mourning hands yesterday and vowed, in the words of several pa trolmen, to redouble their ef forts to take care of our selves first.

title: Home Front Helicopters
description: Helicopters recently be gan to lift the huge concrete slabs that form the roofs of the CoOp City housing proj ect in the Bronx as part of new construction approach begun by the Department of Marine and Aviation.

title: News of Dogs
description: It is seven months since the New York State Federa tion of Hobby Fanciers, more familiarly known as Watch dogs United, was organized and its president, Dr. Arnold S. Orlander of Merrick, L.I., has reported steady progress.

title: French Reds Cool on Abortion
description: PARIS, May 22 (AP)The French Communist party has rejected calls from women's groups for support of legal abortion for any woman who wants one. The party's political bureau said that abortion, now illegal in France, should be per mitted only when the preg nancy endangers the woman's life, in case of pregnancy re sulting from rape or incest or if an investigation by a com mission of experts determines that the birth would cause grave social problems.

title: Education
description: Four New York City high schools with a national repu tation for academic excel lence became embroiled last week in a controversy that previously had applied only to highprestige colleges. The issues were whether the tra ditional entrance tests dis criminate against children of the disadvantaged minorities and whether the use of dif ferent admissions yardsticks for some of these youngsters would destroy the schools' standards.

title: G.O.P. Ethnic Council
description: WASHINGTON, May 22 (AP) The Republican party formed a new ethnic American organi zation today.

title: Martin Stolls Have Son
description: A son was born May 13 to Mr. and Mrs. Martin A. Stoll of New York at LyingIn Hospital. Mrs. Stoll is the former Miss Fredda Levin of Dallas. Mr. Stoll is a lawyer with the firm of Lovejoy, Wasson, Lundgren & Ashton. The child has been named Matthew Laurence.

title: Samara, Penn Ace, Takes Decathlon In U.S.T.F.F. Meet
description: PHILADELPHIA, May 22 Fred Samara, a Pennsylvania sophomore, won three of five events today and finished with 7,172 points to capture the first University by Pennsyl vania United States Track and Field Federation decathlon championship at Franklin Field.

title: Law
description: Trustworthy, loyal, helpful, friendly, courteous, kind, obedi ent, cheerful, thrifty, brave, clean, reverent. And nosey?

title: McDonald Says Service as Judge Has Made Dream a Nightmare
description: The portrait of a smiling man brightens a wall in Judge Miles F. McDonald's chambers in the State Supreme Court in Brook lyn.

title: Coins
description: BASED on the number of early reservations and queries received from many parts of this country and abroad, the 80th anniversary convention of the American Numismatic Assuciation, to be held in the nation's capital Aug. 1014, will be the largest in ANA history.

title: RHINE POLLUTION AT DANGER LEVEL
description: BONN, May 22  Two Rhine tributaries, the Necker and the Sieg, were so severely polluted this week that millions of fish died and several stretches of both streams were declared biologically dead.

title: Trudeau Takes Ilyushin For Unscheduled Spin
description: Prime Minister Pierre Elliott Trudeau of Canada took over the con trols of his Soviet touring plane Saturday and inadver tently sent it into a 2,200 foot drop.

title: C. O.'s Raising Deep Issues for Draft Boards
description: DENVER, May 22Members of the nation's 4,100 draft boards are wrestling these days with deep questions of ethics and philosophy, reading dis sertations on conscience and morality and debating with pacifists.

title: Pop
description: JAMES TAYLOR: Mud Slide Slim and the Blue Horizon (Warner Bros.). He is honest, He opens his album with the words: Don't come to me with your sorrows any more I don't need to know how bad you're feeling today.

title: OneMan Book Drive Sows Goodwill
description: MINEOLA, L. I., May 22 Walter B. Sysak, a 47year old surveyor who came to the United States from Russia 24 years ago to obtain freedom of thought, is running into difficulties in his oneman campaign to provide free schoolbooks to children throughout the world.

title: Holy Jumping Geronimo! It's London Bridge!
description: LAKE HAVASU CITY, Ariz.Here in America's Southwest, a hundred miles or so down the lower Colorado River from Hoover Dam, I am watching them put back together in the desert the London Bridge I saw being taken apart in England. Are they crazy? They're not even putting it across the Colorado Riverthe bulge in the river that is Lake Havasu is too wide at this point, So the bridge is going to span a waste of sand. Does Arizona really need a bridge here? Well, the builders, or rebuilders rather, contend it does. But not for the usual reason.

title: Drama Mailbag
description: To THE EDITOR:

title: Miss Margaret Henry Fiancee Of Thomas D. Cunningham 3d
description: GREENWICH, Conn., May 22Miss Margaret Riker Henry and Thomas Donald Cunningham 3d plan to be married in St. Barnabas Episcopal Church here on Sept. 11.

title: Cynthia Waters Lincoln Bride of Laurence C. Rand
description: GREENWICH, Conn., May 22Miss Cynthia Waters Lincoln, daughter of Mrs. Carolyn Ream Lincoln and Thomas Ridgely Lincoln, was married here this afternoon to Laurence Carrington Rand, on of Mrs. Ogden Brouwer of Fort Lauderdale, Fla., and Thorburn Rand of New York.

title: SENATE APPROVES CORONA MEASURE
description: ALBANY, May 22The State Senate today unanimously passed the compromise bill that would spare a group of con demned homes in the Corona area of Queens.

title: Movies
description: NOSTALGIA is spread ing, almost as rapid Iy as cancer. At the movies right now two thick, corny slices of Amer icana offer a little relief for everyonehardhat or tired demonstratorwho wants to ?? the frustrations of 1971. Summer of 42 and Red Sky at Morning are both about teenagers growing up ?? the Second World War: they are two of the first period films to treat the drab forties as an exotic, nestalgic wonderland. Even more tellingly, because they and with boys finding their manhood as a result of a death on the distant battle held, both films indirectly pay tribute to war as a powerful regenerative influ ence on the young still at home.

title: The World
description: WASHINGTONWASHINGTONThe state ment that I shall now read is be ing issued simultaneously in Moscow,, said President Nixon in his surprise television and radio broadcast at noon last Thursday. There followed the foursentence announcement that, deliberately vague though it was, gave hope that the missile race might be brought under control.

title: Pork Is Not The Kosherest Show in Town
description: LIKE Garbo talking after the silents, the notion of Andy Warhol writing is not an easy one to grasp. That may account for the snide rumor that Pork, the real, live roman a clef said to come from his pen, was actually turned out by a tape recorder.

title: The Nation
description: KEY BISCAYNE, Fla.  Rich ard Nixon spent part of yester day with Lyndon Johnson in Texas, the rest of the weekend in Florida, and on Tuesday he will hobnob with Southern gov ernors, editors and publishers in Birmingham and Mobile. A year ago, perhaps, this quickie South ern swing would have evoked all sorts of political analyses drawing explicit parallels be tween Mr. Nixon's itinerary and his political ambitions in 1972.

title: The World
description: NEW DELHI  The frightened refugees pouring into India from East Pakistan have posed for New Delhi a problem perhaps as serious as any it has faced since independence in 1947.

title: Schwartz CoChairman Of Israeli Youth Games
description: Arnold Schwartz, president of Brookdale Hospital Medi cal Center, has been named international cochairman of the second Israeli Interna tional Youth Athletic Festival.

title: CHARLES SCOTT, 63, BELL UNIT AUDITOR
description: TUCSON, Ariz., May 22 Charles E. Scott, the chief auditor for the Western Elec tric Company, the manufactur ing and supply unit of the Bell System, died yesterday after long illness. He was 63 years old and lived at 380 Darlington Avenue, Ramsey, N.J.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: Attorney General John Mitchell has little cause for selfcongratulations [news story May 11], as the battle he brags of winning was really lost.

title: Expatriate Chess On the Other Side Of the Wall
description: Communists are in duty bound not to gloss over the shortcomings in their movement, but to criticize them openly so as to remedy them the more speedily and radically.

title: Gimeno Reaches Final
description: HAMBURG, West Germany, May 22 (Reuters)Peter Szoeke of Hungary and Andres Gimeno of Spain gained the final of the West German open tennis championships today.

title: Miss Benachi Planning Geneva Nuptials June 13
description: Miss Marina Benachi, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Emmanuel Benachi of Geneva, plans to be married June 13 to Henry Tilford Mortimer Jr. of New York. He is the son of Mr. Mortimer of Tuxedo Park, N. Y., and Mrs. Pierre BordeauxGroult of Paris and a descendant of John Jay, first Chief Justice of the United States. The wedding will take place in Geneva.

title: Car Kills Riverhead Girl
description: RIVERHEAD, L. I., May 22 A 7yearold girl was killed here on East Main Street shortly after noon today. The police said the girl, Tina Louise Fon tana of 27 Melene Avenue, Riverhead, had darted across the street in front of a car driven by Jasper Trent, 47, of 75 Horton Avenue, Riverhead.

title: EVERS'S OPPONENT MAKES IT OFFICIAL
description: GREENVILLE, Miss., May 21 Mississippi was so engrossed in the spectacle of a black man, Charles Evers, running for Governor that it seemed mo mentarily to forget the white man who will probably win the election.

title: A Banker for Anaconda
description: BUTTE, Mont.If Central Park were not a park, if the middle of Manhattan were an openpit copper mine more than 1,000 feet deep, and if the city itself were more than a mile above sea level, in a valley between the mountain snows, a New Yorker might begin to get some hint of the flavor of Butte.

title: Go In Good Health
description: WHTETHER as a result of drinking polluted water, consuming too much of the local cuisine or jetting through time zones, most tourists usually return home with at least one unpleasant health tale to tell. But diarrhea, cul ture shock, timezone syn drome and other such cele brated ailments exist, accord ing to a recent study by the Council on Family Health, in all cultures and climates, in cluding, of course, our own. The tourist who most often avoids them is the one who carries a few common sense tips along with his luggage.

title: U.S. Hydrologists Concerned About the Nitrogen Rise in L. I. Water
description: PLAINVIEW, L. I., May 22 What we're finding is sub stantially contaminated wa ter, Philip Cohen said the other day as he watched the rising ink lines on the graph paper coming out of an auto mated water sampler.

title: Enemy Bombards Bases In Vietnam in Fourth Day
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, May 22  North Vietnamese forces tonight fired rockets and mortar shells into United States bases along the demilitarized zone for a fourth day. The Americans countered with artil lery barrages.

title: New Pilot for Air Force Five
description: AIR FORCE ACADEMY, Colo., May 22 (AP)Henry Egan, an Air Force Academy basketball scout and recruiter was named head basketball coach today to succeed Bob Spear, whose contract is not being renewed.

title: Headliners
description: Female Victory

title: 18,000 Plan on Fresh Air Vacations
description: For someone who is almost 11, and therefore exceedingly grownup in all respects, Mar cus Terry has been noticeably agitated of late.

title: The best and worst of her life
description: Iris Origo is a great scholar who also happens to write superbly well. This rare com bination has made her life of Leopardi already a classic; and her account of Lord Byron's love for Countess Teresa Guic cioli, The Last Attachment, based entirely on original let ters and other unpublished ma terial, is as amusing, tender, wry and unsentimental as the poet himself could have wished. in editing the records of Fran cesco Datini, a merchant of Prato, she has done for 14th century Tuscany what the Vic torian publishers of the Paston letters did for 14thcentury England.

title: Opera: Czechs Present a New Bartered Bride
description: PRAGUE, May 22Here it is called Prodana Nevesta, but we know it as The Bar tered Bride by Bedrich Smetana. It was composed in 1866, and is the Czech na tional opera.

title: BOROS PACES GOLF BY SHOT WITH 209
description: FORT WORTH, May 22 Julius Boros, the 51yearold national Seniors champion, calmly ignored swirling winds today and shot a threeunder par 67 to move into the third round lead in the $125,000 Colonial national invitation golf tournament.

title: The World
description: MOSCOW  On Thursday afternoon, Judge Nina Isakova and the other two members of the ruling tribunal entered the Leningrad courtroom to wind up the 10day trial. The spectators and the nine Jewish defendants  engineers, doctors and other professional people  rose to hear the verdicts.

title: Only 2 Women's Golf Teams Survive Club Challenge Round
description: The Women's Metropolitan Golf Association's interclub series that has been taking place since the end of April, were concluded last week with the playing of Challenge rounds. This means that the winners of series, challenge the series above for the right to play in a higher series next year.

title: David Frothingham Jr. Weds Pamela BurgessKerr, Teacher
description: PRINCETON, N. J., May 22 Miss Pamela Burgess Kerr and David Lydig Frothingham Jr., son of Mr. and Mrs. Frothingham of Princeton, were married this afternoon.

title: Assembly Passes Welfare Bill Requiring a Year's Residence
description: ALBANY, May 22After a prolonged and heated debate, the Assembly today approved by a 95to47 vote a bill spon sored by Governor Rockefeller to establish a oneyear residen cy requirement for welfare eli gibility.

title: Wedding Held For Miss Lee
description: WASHINGTON, May 22 Miss Joy Lee, a member of the treasurer's department of the International Monetary Fund here, and Harvey Taylor Clew, who is with the State Department, were mar ried in Georgetown this afternoon. The ceremony was performed in the Roman Catholic Church of the Epiphany by the Rev. John F. Burns.

title: Epitome of Knowledge (Brooklyn Bridge) Is 88;
description: The Brooklyn Bridge, an octogenarian of robust strength, will be 88 years old tomorrow. Those who test its responses say it betrays few signs of even middle age.

title: Letter to the Editor 2  No Title
description: To THE EDITOR:

title: Vintage Wines, a Precious Commodity
description: Black markets inevitably seem to spring up for com modities of great value, and so it is not surprising that fine wine has now achieved that dubious distinction. An underground market has ap parently formed for stolen bottles of rare vintages.

title: Wilson and Trilling to the contrary
description: Isabel Bolton's previous novels (Do I Wake or Sleep? The Christ mas Tree and Many Mansions) have elicited many words of praise, or so the blurbs on the dust jacket to this fourth novel claim. Edmund Wilson has said that Miss Bolton is a poet of the nobler kind who uses the compression and polish of her fiction to focus human insight and to concentrate moral passion. Diana Trilling has called Isabel Bolton the best woman writer of fiction in this country today.

title: Reder's Report
description: In the preFreudian era, par ents were sometimes callous and harsh and warped the per sonalities of their children. In the postFreudian era, parents are inclined to be sympathetic and tolerant and warp the per sonalities of their children. Conclusion? Well, you are left to draw your own from the delicately counterpoised hos tilities in this study in three generations.

title: David Rittenhouse Henderson Is Fiance of Cassandra Hyland
description: HAMILTON, Mass., May 22The engagement of Miss Cassandra Francesca Hyland, a student at Pitzer College in Claremont, Calif., to Da vid Rittenhouse Henderson, who attends Pomona College in Claremont, has been an nounced by Mr. and Mrs. Samuel Francis Hyland, par ents of the future bride. Her fianc is the son of Mr. and Mrs. S. Welles Henderson of Gladwyne, Pa.

title: Stamps
description: The Royal Australian Air Force is 50 years old this year, and on June 9 a mul ticolored 6c stamp will be released at Melbourne to commemorate the event. De signed by Ray Honisett, the stamp will show a DeHavilland DH 9a, one of the first air craft in the RAAF service, in a golden panel at the top. Below, a flight of Australia built Mirage (French) jet fighters is depicted.

title: Friday Night Fights
description: MadridPedro Carrasco, 137 pounds, Spain, outpointed Rene Roque, 139, France, 15 rounds. Carrasco won the European junior welterweight title.

title: South African Official to Urge Tour by U.S. Baseball Team
description: An official of the Government of South Africa said yesterday that he would suggest a visit there by a United States base ball teamwith both black and white playersas a means of improving relations between the countries.

title: Learson's Nepenthe Captures Larchrnont Club's Edlu Race
description: LARCHMONT, N. Y., May 22 The fastest of the Larchmont Yacht Club's 16 Ediu Trophy distance races on long Island Sound was won today on cor rected time by T. Vincent Lear son, president of International Business Machines, with his tallmasted 50foot sloop Ne penthe.

title: Miss Marilyn G. Schultz Wed To Edward S. Blackwell 3d
description: ESSEX FELLS, N. J., May 22Miss Marilyn Gilbert Schultz, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. George LaVie Schultz of Essex Fells and Bay Head, was married here this after noon to Edward Schenck Blackwell 3d son of Mr. and Mrs. Blackwell Jr. of Short Hills.

title: Letters:
description: TO THE EDITOR:

title: SlaughterHouse Five Barred From School List in Michigan
description: DETROIT, May 22 SlaughterHouse Five, the 1969 novel by Kurt Vonne gut Jr., has been banned from the suggested reading list of an elective high school literature course in the sub urban Rochester school dis trict.

title: The Nation
description: WASHINGTON  Sometime within the next month, the House of Representatives will come to grips with what is cer tainly the largest and possibly the most Significant piece of social legislation to come before Congress since the days of the New Deal.

title: BAR PANEL DRAFTS CODE FOR JUDGES
description: A comprehensive revision of the Canons of Judicial Ethics, designed to prevent conflicts of interest and improper conduct among judges throughout the country, was proposed yester day by a special committee of the American Bar Association.

title: CUBS' 4RUN FIFTH TOPS DODGERS, 52
description: CHICAGO, May 22 (AP) The Chicago Cubs picked away at Don Sutton, one of their fa vorite targets, for four runs in the fifth inning today and went on to defeat the Los Angeles.

title: Consecutive Tiger Homers Help Defeat Senators, 31
description: DETROIT, May 22 (AP) Aurelio Rodriguez and Jim Northrup hit consecutive hom ers in the first inning and Bill Zepp posted his first victory for Detroit today as the Tigers beat the Washington Senators, 31.

title: Jane didn't stay in a corner
description: In the beginning of Ernest J. Gaines's third novel the narratorhis torian approaches Jane Pittman for an interview:

title: Et Al.
description: Mr. Gross, a reporter here and abroad for 20 years and now West Coast editor for Look, is optimistic about mod ern man. His assignments have taken him far and wide, and he brings a refreshing worldliness to such topics as race, the Iron Curtain, sex and man's irration ality. No Pangloss, no deep thinker either, he has a jour nalist's sharp view of the sur face of things.

title: Sports of The Times
description: If it started out as something of a gag, it turns serious eventually. It already has supplied a matchless conversation piece to Billy Sullivan, president of the New England Patriots. This kisser of the Blarney Stone will have a beguiling story to offer at the WaldorfAstoria dinner of the Pro Football Writers Association tomorrow and at the meetings of the National Football League owners later in the week.

title: Linda Svigals Wed To Gary Martinelli
description: MONTCLAIR, N. J., May 22 Miss Linda Jane Svigals and Gary Elliot Martinelli were married here this morn ing in the Roman Catholic Church of the Immaculate Conception by the Rev. Wil liam J. Dowd.

title: 150 Arrested in 2 Nights of Rioting in Chattanooga
description: CHATTANOOGA, May 22 At least two persons were wounded by sniper fire here tonight in the second night of rioting, burning and looting touched off when three rock groups failed to appear at a cocert. Police said about 150 teenagers had been arrested.

title: Graham's 70 for 353 Wins 90Hole JapanAussie Golf
description: MIYAZAKI, Japan, May 22 (AP)David Graham of Aus tralia shot a twounderpar 70 today for a fiveround 90hole total of 353 to win the first JapanAustralia golf compe tion.

title: News of the Rialto
description: THE Circle in the Square is the theater's num ber one rescue sta tion. Remember how it pumped new blood into Tennessee Williams's Sum mer and Smoke after it had collapsed on Broad way and at the same time, launched the career of Ger aldine Page? And remember how only recently Jules Feif fer's Little Murders was revived and revitalized after being mugged on Broadway? And there have been others. Well, Circle is at it again, this time with Saul Bellow's The Last Analysis. Shown to Broadway in the fall of 1964, it was carried off for dead after 28 performances.

title: Julie von Sternberg Is Betrothed
description: GARDEN CITY, L. I., May 22  Mr. and Mrs. Jule Ro bert von Sternberg of Gar den City and Palm Beach, Fla., have announced the en gagement of their daughter, Miss Julie von Sternberg, to Henry Lafayette Collins 3d. son of Mrs. Charles Edward Pacaud of Berwyn, Pa., and Somerset Bridge, Bermuda, and the late Mr. Collins Jr. A September wedding is planned.

title: L. J. Ryder to Wed Miss Linda Drake
description: GREAT NECK, L. I., May 22  Mr. and Mrs. Ervin Drake have made known the engagement of their daugh ter, Miss Linda Shifra Drake, to Lawrence Joseph Ryder, son of Mrs. Joseph Vasquez of Merrick. The wedding is planned for the summer.

title: British Paris Bomb Targets
description: PARIS, May 22Three Brit ish businesses in Paris, includ ing a RollsRoyce dealership, were bomb targets early today, One person was slightly in jured.

title: Car Makers and Ecologists Are in Conflict on Auto's Role in Air Pollution
description: As pressures grow to clean up the nation's polluted air, one of the greatest conflicts is over the role of the automobile and especially of its major con tribution, carbon monoxidein contaminating the atmosphere.

title: Stamps
description: THE United Nations on June 14 will institute new slogan cancella tions and meter im prints commemorating the 25th anniversary of the Unit ed Nations Children's Fund. They will be of similar de sign, as illustrated below.

title: GROWING U.S.G.A. SHIFTING OFFICE
description: Growing pains will soon force the United States Golf Association to move its head quarters from New York City. A new site in a 60acre set ting at Liberty Corners, Bernards Township, N. J., is expected to be occupied by the golfing organization with in the next few months.

title: MRS. LOUISE JESSUP
description: WILTON, Conn., May 22 Mrs. Louise Foote Jessup, the mother of John K. Jessup, the former chief editorial writer of Life magazine, died yesterday in a Manchester nursing home. She was 93 years old and had made her home with her son in Wilton.

title: Art, in London
description: THE alleged Robert Mor ris retrospective exhi bition at the Tate Gallery was the most resoundingly successful dis aster I have ever attended. Fortunately, no one got killed, but a lot of people got fright ened (including the gallery) and those of us who got in during the five days before the temporary closing on May 3 can count ourselves a happy multitude.

title: Plan to Widen Jersey Turnpike Is Opposed in East Brunswick
description: EAST BRUNSWICK, N. J., May 22The New Jersey Turn pike Authority's plan to widen an eightmile stretch of the heavily traveled highway be tween Exit 9 at New Brunswick and Exit 10 at Edison, to the north, is being strenuously op posed by a homeowners' group.

title: Virginia Ferraro Wed
description: MAPLEWOOD, N.J., May 22  Miss Virginia Grace Ferraro, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Thomas J. Ferraro, was married here this morning to Specialist/4 James K. Franks of the Army, son of Mrs. Albert Sobek of Braddock, Pa., and the late Marling Franks. The Rev. Gustavus Warfield performed the cere mony in the Prospect Presby terian Church.

title: Ridley Beats St. Andrew's by Length After 7Hour Delay in School Rowing
description: LIVERPOOL, N.Y., May 22  Lake Onondaga's choppy waters, creating three  foot swells near the head of the mile course, caused a seven hour interruption today in the 37th annual national schoolboy rowing championships.

title: Brewers Rout Royals, 120
description: KANSAS CITY, May 22 (AP) Tommy Harper cracked four hits and drove in three runs today as the Milwaukee Brew ers struck for seven runs in the first four innings and trounced the Kansas City Royals, 120.

title: Nothing like a good w
description: When Carl von Clausewitz died cholera in November, 1831, he behind him a large number of n sonably interesting manuscripts de ing with military operations that h taken place in the last quarterc tury and one unfinished masterpie the study On War. This profo and original work has fascinated diers and statesmen ever since publication in 1832, and the numb of new editions and abridgemer that have appeared within the 1 dozen years indicates that its inf ence is not declining.

title: STERILIZATION BILL BLOCKED IN ILLINOIS
description: SPRINGFIELD, Ill., May 22 (UPI)  The executive commit tee of the Illinois House of Representatives has blocked legislation that would have forced welfare parents of three children to undergo steriliza tion as a condition for con tinued welfare aid.

title: SUYDAN TAKES LEAD AT GREAT SOUTH BAY
description: SAYVILLE, L. I., May 22  Relative calm with winds north to northwest and gusts to 18 knots made for smooth sailing as Great South Bay Racing As sociation competition for the singlehanded championship got under way today. The leader of the roundrobin series after thre events was Bryce Suydan of Bellport Yacht Club, who had a first: second and third place finish.

title: Free Lodging for Artists in MoroccoReally?
description: MARRAKESH, MoroccoExcited and breathless, we stumble off the Casablanca train into one of those horsedrawn carriages they use for taxis in Marrakesh. Quick, man! we shout to the astonished Mo roccan driver. Ten dirham if you get us to the Dar Si Said before sunset! We rattle off into the late afternoon.

title: WASHINGTON REPORT
description: WASHINGTONThe un expected tumultuous fight over the Administration's at tempt to liberalize deprecia tion allowances through ex excutive action is nearing its end in two of the three arenas where it has been fought.

title: Clothing Union to Hold Protests Against Rising Tide of Imports
description: Members of the Amalgam ated Clothing Workers of America, who are increasingly concerned about the flood of clothing imports, are planning a series of demonstrations throughout the nation to focus attention on the threat to American jobs.

title: M.T.A. Plans to Study Bus Needs in Nassau
description: MINEOLA, L. I., May 22 Nassau County Executive Ralph G. Caso has obtained a commitment from the Metropolitan Transportation Authority to do a comprehen sive study of the county's bus transportation needs.

title: Et Al.
description: Translation of a flavorless, very elementary history of Spanish lit that has reached twentytwo editions in Spain and Latin America. (As a stu dent's text?) The editor and translator have gone to some trouble to provide contempo rary renditions of the copious illustrative snippets from the texts discussed. No, not dis cussed: nothing is discussed, everything is mentioned.

title: Coast Rural Legal Aid Group Gains in Skirmishing With Reagan
description: LOS ANGELES, May 22The battle between Gov. Ronald Reagan and California Rural Legal Assistance raged up and down the state this week, with the legal aid program scoring most of the points.

title: L.I. Summer Rental Patterns Changing
description: SOUTHAMPTON, L. I., May 22The renter, the green blood of Long Island's resort areas, is returning.

title: Criminals At Large
description: How to disrupt the economy, topple nations, manipulate, use man against man, hate against hate:

title: MAN IN BUSINESS
description: MIDLAND, Mich.As did many other corporate finan cial officers, Paul F. Oreffice, the financial vice president of the Dow Chemical Com pany, found the early days of May particularly trying.

title: Swordfish Ban in Vermont
description: MONTPELIER, Vt., May 22 (UPI)A 120day ban on the commercial sale of swordfish began today in Vermont. The State Health Board said that testing by the state and the Federal Food and Drug Admin istration had showed that 95 per cent of swordfish samples had more than the allowable maximum limits of mercury contamination.

title: Art
description: THE decisions a sculptor makes about the scale of his workoften be fore he has even begun to execute it are apt to be among the most important formal issues he has to de cide. ?? predetermine, at the ?? the nature of the viewer's response. Will the piece, for example, be whale sized, dwarfing the viewer like some minor Jonah? Or will it be more accommodat ing, a work that the spectator meets on an equal footing, so to speak,one that he may walk around and ex plore without feeling intimi dated or overpowered? Or will it be small and intimate in scale, obliging the spec tator to draw closer to the work in order to examine it carefully? Any of these choices affects the viewer's initial engagement with the work, predisposing his ap preciation of its formal com plexities.

title: Letters:
