description: Considering the fact that he comes from a city that boasts of Central Park as one of its major attractions, it was the merest hyperbole for Leonard Sloane to refer to Sharm el Sheik as one of the most dangerous areas In the world in his article about his visit there (Travel section, May 2). Furthermore, the song about Sharm el Sheik (celebrating Israel's victory in the SixDay War and the capture of Sharm) which brought tears to his eyes is not only hopelessly maudlin but ridiculous to boot since it implies that Is raelis have always had an emotional, as opposed to po litical, attachment to the place.

title: 8 Women Dancers Give First Concert; Feminism Is Theme
description: The Women's Dance Project, a group of eight women dancers or choreographers who also de scribe themselves as feminists, held their first public concert Friday night in Martinson Hall at the Public Theater under the auspices of NOW (National Or ganization for Women).

title: Andretti Fails to Qualify for Monaco Race
description: MONTE CARLO, Monaco, May 22Mario Andretti was rained out of the Monaco Grand Prix today because the wet track prevented him from qualifying for the 29th running of the race around the houses.

title: Stuart, Chapman and Bostwicks Gain Semifinals in Travis Memorial Golf
description: GARDEN CITY, L.I., May 22 Mark Stuart Jr., whose father won the Walter J. Travis Memo rial golf tournament in 1930, gained the semifinals of the 60th annual Travis competition today by eliminating Bill Ed wards, the defending champion, 1up, at the Garden City Golf Club.

title: MRS. OLIVER B. CAPEN
description: BEDFORD VILLAGE, N. Y., May 22Mrs. Noreen Sheridan Capen, the widow of Oliver B. Capen, a publisher of McCall's Magazine, died Thursday at her home. She was in her eighties and lived on Harris Road. Her husband died in 1954.

title: Drysdale, Nastase Win
description: BRUSSELS, Belgium, May 22 (UPI)Cliff Drysdale of South Africa and Ilie Nastase of Ru mania triumphed today in the semifinals of the Belgian open tennis championships.

title: Jamaica Hospital Expands
description: Jamaica Hospital has pur chased the threestory Health Insurance Plan Building and property at Van Wyck Express way and 89th Avenue to use for expansion of its facilities. The airconditioned, fireproof building and adjacent property will provide 18,000 square feet of space and added parking fa cilities.

title: MITCHELL DECLINES HOUSE PANEL VISIT
description: WASHINGTON, May 22 (AP) Attorney General John N. Mitchell has turned down an invitation to testify before a House judiciary subcommittee investigating his enforcement of the Voting Rights Ace.

title: 600 Killed by Quake In Eastern Turkey
description: ISTANBUL, Turkey, Sunday, May 23 Officials said today that more than 600 bodies had been recovered from beneath buildings that collapsed when a severe earthquake struck last night in the eastern province of Bingol.

title: College President Switches
description: FREDERICK, Md., May 22 (AP)The president of Hood College, Dr. Randle Elliott, has submitted his resignation and accepted the same position at Bay Path Junior College in Longmeadow, Mass, it was an nounced today.

title: Johnson Says Errors In War Were His Own
description: AUSTIN, Tex., May 22 While moving the guests at a barbecue following the dedication of the new Lyn don B. Johnson Library, the former President encoun tered Gen. William C. West moreland, the Army, Chief of Staff, who commanded American forces for him in Vietnam.

title: Philanthropy on a Penthouse
description: LAST YEAR, Stewart Rawlings Mott gave away greenbacks; this year, it's green beans. The 33yearold son of GM's largest stockholder, a philanthropist whose lapel sports bachelorsbutton, has put aside stocks for phlox and is hard at work atop a Park Avenue coop creating what is surely New York's largest, and costliest truck farm.

title: DEBUT MADE HERE BY VERDA ERMAN
description: Since Verda Erman was one of the four pianists selected less than two weeks ago to share the 1971 Leventritt Com petition prize, it goes without saying that she is an instru mentalist and musician of su perior qualifications.

title: Should Junior See That Film by Himself?
description: Under the film industry's voluntary movierating system, viewers of all, ages can be admitted to a GP film: parental guidance is suggested. Last week the Protestant and Roman Catholic film agencies withdrew their support of the rating system Such GPrated films as those below, they said, merit only an R ratingjunior needs a parent on hand.

title: Letters
description: To THE EDITOR:

title: S. D. WAKEFIELD, BIBLIOGRAPHER, 76
description: Sherman Day Wakefield, author of works on Lincoln, editor and bibliographer, died yesterday in White Plains at the age of 76. He lived at 144 East 24th Street.

title: Contract for Postal Vehicles
description: DETROIT, May 22 (AP)The General Services Administra tion has awarded a $14million contract to the AM General Corporation, a subsidiary of American Motors Corporation, for 7,000 quarterton post of fice delivery vehicles.

title: OPERA EXPLORES RACIAL QUESTIONS
description: In his relatively brief and troubled lifetime, Charlie Parker, the jazz saxophonist, did not have much luck. Even in his grave, things are not much better for him. A jazz opera called All Cats Turn Gray When the Sun Goes Down, which was given three performances this weekend at the Henry Street Settlement Playhouse by the Opera Work shop of the Music School of the Henry Street Settlement Urban Life Center, is dedicated to Mr. Parker and involves him to the extent that his grave is part of the cemetery set on which the opera is performed.

title: PRISONERAID UNIT SEEKSOMBUDSMAN
description: PHILADELPHIA, May 22 Prisoners here will be getting an ombudsman soon.

title: Customs Unit Improving Search for Contraband
description: HEMPSTEAD, L. I., May 22 A tourist returning from a vacation abroad? Or a smug gler with contraband con cealed in a hollow shoe heel or the false bottom of a suit case?

title: The Joe Alsop Story
description: WASHINGTON. MRS. ALICE ROOSEVELT LONG WORTH, the most deadly 87yearold lady in the world, fretted all afternoon one day to come up with a nice story to tell me about Joseph Alsop, her dear cousin, who is the syndicated Washington political columnist.

title: Canadians Find Floating Dollar Easy to Live With
description: TORONTO  What West Germany and the Nether lands dared to dolet their currencies float, if only as a temporary relief measure Canada has been doing for a year.

title: Soft, clingingand pretty
description: Soft, feminine and very well bred that's the turn fashion has taken this springtime. (And it's about time, tool) Some of the prettiest  and softestdresses going are the matte jerseys, lightasair concoc tions that are elegant, beautiful and make a woman feel like woman once again.

title: Boston College Triumphs
description: BRUNSWICK, Maine, May 22 (AP)Boston College defended its regional title with a score of 51 points to win the 84th New England Intercollegiaate track and field meet today at Bow doin College. Massachusetts was second with 24 points, Rhode Island third with 24.

title: Barrels, Pyramids and Tubs
description: THERE'S still time to plant strawberries even in a little space. The strawberry lends itself well to spacesaving planting and thrives in any thing from a jar to a large pyramid planter or a straw berry barrel. It's too late to plant Junebearers now, but try the new and prolific Ge neva, or any of a number of everbearers that will produce all summer long.

title: BUSINESS BUREAUS WILL BE EXPANDED
description: MIAMI, May 22Hundreds of top corporate executives, concerned over a growing hos tility of consumers, have begun an effort to revitalize the Bet ter Business Bureaus to restore public confidence in the quality of products and services.

title: Ruckelshaus Persuasion
description: MILWAUKEE, May 22 (AP) William D. Ruckelshaus, ad ministrator of the Environ mental Protection Agency, said today that court action was not yet his favorite weapon for stimulating local government to curb pollution.

title: Oyster Bay Survey Paints a Composite Of Town Resident
description: OYSTER BAY, L. I., May 22 The typical resident of this town is a comfortable, well educated homeowner with two cars and a whitecollar job. He moved here 10 to 20 years ago and is glad he did.

title: It's a Way of Pretending to Be in the Country
description: Give or take a little water, and rather more light, the absence of a traditional green thumb is no longer a handicap for plant fanci ers. According to the experts, anyone can have a garden these days and many of the formerly timid do.

title: Police Force of Hundreds Hunts Comrades' Killers
description: Hundreds of policemen, stunned and angered by the murder of two patrolmen in Harlem Friday night, pressed a massive manhunt for two sus pects yesterday as Police Com missioner Patrick V. Murphy ordered strengthened patrols to protect the lives of policemen.

title: Allegheny's Hostesses To Wear Hot Pants
description: WASHINGTON, May 22 (AP)Allegheny Airlines has added hot pants to its stew ardess uniforms.

title: 15 Albatross Takes Messenger
description: WESTBURY, L. I., May 22 Looking every ounce the 1to5 favorite he was, Albatross paced away and virtually hid from seven sophomore rivals to win the $114,997.50 Messenger Stakes tonight at Roosevelt Raceway.

title: Residents and Politicians at Riverside Rally Oppose Truck Route Into Park
description: A campaign by West Siders to prevent construction of an eightlane truck route through Riverside Park was apparently successful yesterday.

title: Announcements
description: Anniversaries

title: Mara Connolly Is Bride
description: NORTHAMPTON, Mass., May 22Miss Mara Lawson Connolly and Bruce James Finley were married here this afternoon in the Helen Hills Chapel of Smith College by the Rev. Thomas Shea, a Roman Catholic priest. The parents of the couple are Mr. and Mrs. John T. Connolly of Port Chester, N. Y., and Mr. and Mrs. Charles H. Finley of St. Louis. Mr. Connolly is deputy chief probation officer for the Federal District Court, in New York City, and the bridegroom's father is chief reviewing appraiser for the Federal Land Bank, St. Louis.

title: T. L. Lawson Plans to Marry Judith Baldwin
description: GROSSE POINTE, Mich., May 22Miss Judith Anne Baldwin, assistant publicity manager at Tiffany & Co., New York, and Thomas Lati mer Lawson, a lawyer in New York, will be married here Aug. 21.

title: Big Swinger Wins by Nose
description: BOSTON, May 22 (AP)Sam uel Rome's Big Swinger re corded her third straight vic tory of the meeting as she beat five males in the $12,500 Con stitution Handicap today at Suffolk Downs.

title: Suzanne Arms Is Married to Pilot
description: SOUTHPORT, Conn., May 22Miss Suzanne Taylor Arms was married here this afternoon to Truman Winthrop Miller 2d of Edge water, N. J., a pilot with United Airlines. The bride is a stewardess with the airline.

title: For a While, the York Club Seemed Close to Extinction
description: The exclusive York Club, which came within a crossedhair's breadth of ex tinction just three years ago, has sur vived its personal urban crisis and seems well on its way to becoming what its president vows will be the snappiest, cutest women's club in New York.

title: No brutality was too obscene
description: One way of handling the problem of collective guilt for indefensible deeds that have enjoyed public sanc tion is to glorify the perpetrators or the institution through which they acted. Instances of such a solution can be found in the history of Amer ican Indian policy, AfroAmerican slavery and numerous war atroci ties, past and present. The glorifi cation of the Ku Klux Klan as the savior of white civilization has had few equals in this genre of legend and folklore.

title: Six Steps for the U. N.
description: These are my views regarding the new directions the world should take.

title: Laviano, Richardson Multihull Regatta Victors
description: SEA CLIFF, L. I., May 22 In a northwest breeze that grew from 10 to 20 knots, 36 sail boats raced today in the first half of the 10th annual Sea Cliff multihull regatta.

title: Post for Doc Blanchard
description: ROSWELL, N. M., May 22 (AP)New Mexico Military In stitute announced today that Felix (Doc) Blanchard, farmer AllAmerican football player at West Point, had been appointed commandant of cadets.

title: PUERTO RICO FACES A LANGUAGE TRIAL
description: SAN JUAN, P.R., May 22 The enrollment of thousands of Puerto Rican youths who have spent most of their lives in the United States and do not speak Spanish is posing a major problem for the 650,000stu dent Puerto Rican public school system.

title: MISS PALMER LEADS SUZUKI GOLF BY TWO
description: BUENA PARK, Calif., May 22 (AP)Sandra Palmer of Fort Worth had her fourstroke lead cut in half as she carded a 74 and continued to lead the Suzu ki Golf Internationale with a twoday total of 142.

title: City Renovation Of Canarsie Pier Area
description: Canarsie Pier, a popular area in Brooklyn for senior citizens and fishermen, is undergoing a major renova tion by the Parks, Recreation and Cultural Affairs Admin istration.

title: Et Al.
description: The title comes from a 1789 ordinance for the Northwest Territory, which begins: The utmost goof faith should al ways be observed towards the Indians.  That this direc tion was not followed is shown in this indispensable collection of treaties, laws, court deci sions, speeches, pleas dealing with Indianwhite relations in the U.S. What lawyer Deloria (author of Custer Died for Your Sins) has done is to build a casea legal brief for future Indian actionif the Indian movement continues to flex its muscles. IN

title: Brooklyn Happenings, Using Local Talent, Are Popular Events
description: As a lawyer was leaving the Supreme Court Building in Brooklyn the other day, he found a soccer demon stration by the New York Cosmos in progress on the small patches of grass that stretch back from Borough Hall along Cashmore Plaza.

title: Miss Sara Lawrence Fiancee Of Dr. Orlando B. Lightfoot Jr.
description: POMONA, N. Y., May 22 Miss Sara Morgan Lawrence, a doctoral candidate at the Harvard. University Graduate School of Education, and Dr. Orlando B. Lightfoot Jr., as sistant professor of psychi atry at the Boston Univer sity Medical School, plan to be married on July 24.

title: Letters:
description: Your fine articles on the current surge and interest in backpacking and on the Ap palachian Trail (Travel sec tion, May 9) prompt me to call attention to a conserva tion crisis problem threaten ing the trail. The A.T. is con tinually being menaced by uncontrolled development in various forms.

title: Stamps
description: ULSTER 71 is North ern Ireland's annual festival, a tourist and industrial fair which opened in Belfast earlier this month, and continues until the fall. The British Post Office will issue three stamps an June 16 to publicize Ulster 71.

title: 20 Youths Start Sail Training Cruise
description: Ten boys, from central Harlem and the Highbridge, section of the Bronx joined 10 other youths of varied backgrounds last Friday in beginning the first of a series of weekend sailtraining cruises at South Street Sea port.

title: Oosterhuis Wins by 2 Shots With 276 in British Golf
description: STOKE POGES, England, May 22 (UPI)  Peter Oosterhuis, winner of more than $10,000 on the South African circuit during the winter, won his first major event in Britain today, taking the $12,000 AgiaGevaert golf tournament.

title: Blount Names Postal Aide
description: WASHINGTON, May 22 (UPI) Postmaster General Winton M. Blount today announced the appointment of Adam G. Wen chel, former head of the Post Office's legislative division, as judicial officer of the new Postal Service. Mr. Wenchel, 54 years old, is a native of the District of Columbia. He is a graduate of Lafayette College in Easton, Pa., and the Univer sity of Pennsylvania Law School in Philadelphia.

title: The only real Indian is a dead Indian
description: Earl Shorris's book is about the American Indians of today and, as his title and subtitle imply, he has nothing very hopeful to say about them. The main theme of the book is that the oldtime, true, authentic Indian cultures are all dead and, therefore, contemporary Indian nativ ism is meaningless. This leads him (unbelievably but predictably) to the position that the right and only road to salvation, for the red man

title: Letter to the Editor 3  No Title
description: TO THE EDITOR:

title: Letters to the Editor
description: In discussing the future of the Na tionalist regime in Taiwan, American public opinion is ignorant of one huge blind spot in its thinking. It is una ware of one major alternativea re mote one, to be sure, but very logical. This is dangerous, as events may over take us again.

title: With Ghosts Befriended and Devils Appeased, Race Track Will Open in Jakarta
description: JAKARTA, Indonesia, May 22  First, a water buffalo was slaughtered and its head buried on the premises to appease any devils that might be around. Then in subsequent ceremonies, one local ghost was befriend ed with offerings of food on bronze platters and another was chased away.

title: Resor Voices Doubts on War And a Volunteer Army by '73
description: WASHINGTON, May 22 (UPI) The retiring Army Secretary, Stanley R. Resor, said today that he was leaving the Pen tagon with serious doubts about the wisdom of United States involvement in Vietnam and about whether the Administra tion can reach its goal of an allvolunteer Army. by mid 1973.

title: Environment
description: ROMEThe sea was spark ling , the old Neapolitan song went.

title: OLD GAELIC HEROES MEET HERE TODAY
description: The 10th annual Cardinal Cushing Charity Games, intro duced by the late Cardinal, will start today at Gaelic Park, 240th Street and Broadway. Outstand ing Gaelic football and hurling stars of yesteryear from Ireland and New York will return to the playing field for one more day in the sun.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: It is most astonishing that the United. States Government, which had sponsored the opendoor policy and the ninepower treaty advocating inter national respect for China's territorial integrity and national sovereignty, has now reopened the issue of the legal status of Taiwan and Penghu (the Pescadores). In a statement made at a press briefing on April 28, Charles W. Bray 3d, a State Department spokesman, said that as Taiwan and the Pescadores are not covered by any existing international disposition, sov ereignty over the area is an unsettled question subject to future international resolution.

title: Marian Wilson Bride
description: Miss Marian Kathleen Wil son, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Edward Dobbins Wilson of New York, was married here yesterday morning to Paul J. Mateuszczyk, son of Mr. and, Mrs. Joseph Mateuszczyk of Franklin, Mass. The Rev. Dr. Wilson W. Sneed performed the ceremony in the Episco pal Church of the Ascension. The bride's father is an exec utive vice president of the Irving Trust Company.

title: The Last Word: Creeping Secularism
description: After the heady and expansive 1950's and 1960's Ameri can religious life and American religious publishing are ex periencing what Wall Street would call a technical correction. Church membership gains have slowed; religiousbook sales and the number of titles published have declined. Why?

title: Donnie Allison Sets Pace in Indianapolis Trials
description: INDIANAPOLIS, May 22 (UPIDonnie Allison of Huey town, Ala., wellknown as a stock car driver, posted the fastest time of 13 qualifiers to day for the Indianapolis 500 auto race on May 29.

title: Front Page 1  No Title
description: TAXI DRIVERS WANTEDCitywide License available in to the previous time. CALL 7578171Advt.

title: Indoors, Outdoors, All Over
description: THE major new entrant in the summer festival sweepstakes is Filene Center at Wolf Trap Farm Park, a few miles south of Washington, D. C., in Vi enna, Va. It will have no res ident symphony orchestra in its first year, but it has a stage able to accommodate opera productions. Its initial season will have an impres sive variety of entertainment, Including concerts by visit ing orchestras, ballet, opera, a musical  comedy review, choral music and headlining pop artists.

title: Thyra Elizabeth Reed Is Married
description: Miss Thyra Elizabeth Reed, an investment  research of ficer of the Morgan Guar anty Trust Company, was married here yesterday to William M. Bramwell Jr., a senior counsel of the Inter national Telephone and Tele graph Corporation at its world headquarters here.

title: 69% in Poll Want More Data on War
description: WASHINGTON, May 22  More than twothirds of the people questioned in a recent survey said that they believed the Nixon Administration was failing to tell the American people all they should know about the conduct of the Viet nam war, the Gallup poll said today.

title: Ship Commissioned in Boston
description: BOSTON, May 22 (AP)The U.S.S. Bowen, a destroyer es cort, was commissioned today at the Boston Naval Shipyard. The 438foot ship, named for the late Vice Adm. Harold G. Bowen, is the Navy's second of a new class of ocean escort ships. Her home port will be Newport, R.I.

title: Dedication of Day Center
description: The New Dimensions Day Care Center, organized for chil dren of employes at Creedmore State Hospital in Queens Vil lage, will have its formal dedi cation Thursday. The center, in Building 71 (M) on the hos pital grounds, is open six days a week from 6 A.M. to 6 P.M. and has an enrollment of 55 preschool children.

title: Atlas I Leads Qualifiers in Miami Hydro Regatta
description: MIAMI, May 22 (AP)Seven unlimited hydroplanes qualified today for tomorrow's Champion Sparkplug regatta as the brand new Atlas Van Lines I led the way with the threetime na tional champion, Bill Muncey, at the wheel.

title: HARRIS SETS MARK IN HURDLES0:14.0
description: SCHENECTADY, N.Y., May 22Ken McBryde of Mount Vernon High School continued to flirt with 50 feet in the triple jump and Andre Harris of Bushwick won two hurdles racesone in record time to dayto highlight the 31st Eddy Memorial track games at Ithe Mount Pleasant allweather track.

title: HARD OF HEARING GET ADVICE FOR COLLEGE
description: Twenty high school graduates received advice from experts yesterday on how to cope with their mutual problems as they furthered their education in col leges and other institutions around the country.

title: WhoopUp Country: Where the Mounties Tamed the West
description: FORT MACLEOD, AlbertaAlberta is famous for Banff, Lake Louise, Jasper National Park and for its the rodeo from which Calgary annually re quires a full year to recover before taking off again on another whirl. But the subtler fascinations of the section of Alberta known as WhoopUp Country, stretching south from Calgary to the United States border, have somehow been neglected. Even many of the tour ists passing through on their way to the more celebrated places miss it.

title: Nixon Slip Gets a Laugh
description: AUSTIN, Tex., May 22 (AP) President Nixon, during his speech at the Johnson Library dedication today, made a slip that got a big laugh from the audience and former President Johnson. The President said: Just a few minutes ago, as President Johnson was throw ing me around the libraryI mean showing me around the library.

title: Law
description: NEW HAVEN  A cry of power came from the back of the courtroom, and Bobby G. Seale turned with a frown. That's kind of childish, he scolded. This isn't Chicago, which was a different kind of trial.

title: Television
description: THERE's a place somewhere, the song assures us, and there really must be a place somewhere in which David Frost can occasion ally Indulge in a spurt of screaming, ranting, raving and all those other ter rible things relished by ordinary mor tals. A soundproof closet in some hotel, perhaps, Or the men's room on a BOAC jet.

title: For Young Readers
description: The young are traditionally read ers of fiction. They inhabit a world too small, too tight for their internal drives and passions. The expanding self feels caged in the obsessive rou tine of bells and schedules, limits and chores, of pp. 2326, 11:30 bed time and 25minute lunch hours. When they read, they look for free dom. They literally need escape from the petty confines of everyday exis tence, and only fiction supplies an environment large enough for a ro manticizing ego.

title: Title Searches Illuminate L.I.'s History
description: HEMPSTEAD, L. I., May 22The Indian tribes of Long Island once sold the land that now comprises the Township of Hempstead to white men in 1643 and then they de manded additional payment in 1657. The documents per taining to these land trans actions and involvements that still have reverberations today, are among more than 1,000 historic papers in the collection of Cecil H. Beek man of Hempstead, the his torian for the Village of Hempstead and a consultant to the Nassau Museum for the Old Bethpage Restoration project.

title: A good word for squid;
description: 6 large squid (see note)

title: BARNARD WILL ADD WOMEN'S STUDIES
description: Barnard College plans to es tablish a women's center in September to administer pro grams in women's studies and to establish new disciplines specifically designed for women.

title: EARTH CRUST STUDY PLANNED IN PACIFIC
description: WASHINGTON, May 22 (UPI) The National Science Foun dation says that scientists of many nations will study the history of a huge slab of the earth's crust from its birth in the Pacific to its burial beneath a deep ocean trench off Peru and Chile.

title: About Pro Football
description: The official business will be light, but pro football's coaches, executives and own ers will be asking a lot of unofficial questions when they hold their annual spring meetings here this week.

title: Inland Port at Nuremberg to Link Waterways
description: NUREMBERG, West Ger many, May 20Hundreds of miles from the nearest sea, a new port is being built in West Germany to reforge an ancient trading link between the East and West in Europe.

title: Complaints About Brighton Line Create Threat to Transit Bonds
description: Many Brooklyn legislators will oppose Governor Rocke feller's new $2.5billion trans portation bond proposal unless he puts something in it that will improve service on the Brighton Beach subway lint, Assemblyman Brian Sharoff, Democrat of Sheepshead Bay, asserted last week.

title: TV Mailbag
description: To THE EDITOR:

title: Stars Get Seals' Hextall
description: BLOOMINGTON, Minn., May 22 (UPI)The Minnesota North Stars added power to their front line today when they ac quired a center, Dennis Hextall, from California. In exchange the North Stars sent two minor league centers, Joe Johnson and Walt McKechnie, to the Seals.

title: 4 JERSEY RACES TAKEN BY BLUM
description: CHERRY HILL, N. J., May 22 (UPI)Walter Blum won four races today, including both halves of the split $20,000 added Cherry Hill Handicap at Garden State.

title: Despite His Lead in the Gallup Poll, Kennedy Insists He Won't Run for President in '72
description: WASHINGTON, May 22 The numbers were the kind that Presidential dreams are made of.

title: Saigon Presidential Hopefuls Are Busy
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam May 23  The South Vietnamese presidential election is still more than four months away, but three men have already started their unofficial cam paigning.

title: Dance: Sheer Diversity Marks Weekend Offerings
description: The sheer diversity of New York dance is like a woman who never ceases to fasci nate you. There are so many moods, so many attitudes. This weekend, for example, I saw a scenic spectacular from the Stuttgart Ballet, a couple of perforrances of Spartan beauty from the sea green incorruptible New York City Ballet, and a zitherly wayout modern dance con cert in the East Village, which I caught on my way to a latenight play.

title: Littler's 3OverPar 283 Wins Golf by Shot
description: FORT WORTH, May 23 (AP)  Gene Littler fought fickle, swirling breezes with a 69 today and won the Col onial national invitation golf tournament with the highest winning tour total in eight years.

title: Black Caucus in House Scores Nixon Reply on Aid to Minorities
description: WASHINGTON, May 23The leader of the Black Caucus in the House, Representative Charles C. Diggs Jr. of Michi gan, today termed deeply dis appointing President Nixon's response last week to 60 pro posals by the group for aid to minority groups.

title: Four Nines in East Playoff
description: EASTON, Pa. May 23Four teams have been selected to participate in the National Col legiate Athletic Association District 2 baseball playoffs starting Thursday at Princeton University. The four are: St. Joseph's winner of the Middle Atlantic Conference; Penn State, an independent; Univer sity of Buffalo, an indepen dence Hall, champion of the Metropolitan Conference.

title: McCarthy Hints Readiness To Lead a 3d Party in '72
description: BLOOMINGTON, Minn., May 23Former Senator Eugene J. McCarthy ridiculed several of the leaders of the Democratic party in a major speech today and suggested that he might be ready to lead a third party in the 1972 Presidential cam paign.

title: Greaves Leaving Soccer
description: LONDON, May 23 (AP) Jimmy Greaves, the No. 1 goal scorer in English soccer his tory, is quitting the game at the age of 31. Greaves, who tallied 491 goals in 14 years 44 of them in 57 matches for Englandreportedly has told his West Ham club he won't be back next year.

title: DAYAN AND ARABS ARGUE ABOUT FISH
description: GAZA, May 23Israel's ?? fense Minister, Moshe D??, stood ankledeep in sand today and argued with Arabs about the price of fish.

title: Javits Unimpressed By Curb on Textiles
description: TOKYO, May 23Jacob K. Javits, visiting Republican Sen ator from New York, said here that the Japanese industry's vol untary curbs on its textile ex ports to the United States would not solve the vexing is sue and the tensions over it might endanger the two coun tries' relations.

title: Colleges Helping More Students Interrupt the Traditional FourYear Degree Pattern
description: Some of the country's col leges and universities are post ing detour signs along the tra ditional route to a college de gree, breaking with the lock step whereby a student en tered in the fall immediately following high school gradua tion, left campus only for va cations and got his degree in four years.

title: Advisers in Mekong Delta darned on Foe
description: CANTHO, South Vietnam, May 23Senior United States military and civilian officers here in the heart of the Mekong Delta have warned American pacification advisers that the enemy is engaged in a lowkey phase of political consolidation while waiting for the Ameri cans to leave.

title: 3 WORKS DANCED BY GUDDE TROUPE
description: The Gudde Dancers, a mod ern dance company that grew out of classes taught three years ago at Julia Richman High School by Lynda Gudde, formerly with Anna Sokolow's company presented three works by Miss Gudde at the school's auditorium Saturday night.

title: State Inspectors Seizing Swordfish Tainted by Mercury
description: ALBANY, May 23The state's Department of Agriculture and Markets disclosed today that more than 200 pounds of swordfish with mercury levels in excess of state standards had been seized throughout the state during April.

title: Heath Calls Aides in Drive To Win Support for Market
description: LONDON, May 23 (Reuters) Prime Minister Heath today called seven senior officials and ministers to a working dinner to discuss the political under standing reached with Presi dent Pompidou, and to prepare a strategy for winning support at home for possible British entry to the Common Market.

title: 89 REBELS IN CEYLON ARE SAID TO GIVE UP
description: COLOMBO, Ceylon, May 23 A battle between security forces and rebels yesterday in the Kurunegala District, 60 miles north of the capital, re sulted in the surrender of 89 insurgents, Government offi cials said.

title: Laviano Is Only Unbeaten Pilot In Sea Cliff's Multihull Regatta
description: SEA CLIFF, L. I., May 23 Ed Laviano of Heliport, L, I., posted two more victories today in the 10th Sea Cliff multihull regatta and became the only undefeated skipper in the two day event.

title: Steel Talks Fail to Spur Customers' Hedge Orders
description: PITTSBURGH, May 23The start of steel labor negotiations was not expected to revive strike hedge buying.

title: Hughes Wins Net Final
description: WESTPORT, Conn., May 23 John Hughes of Springfield, Mass., upset the East's 15th ranked player, Bob Barker of Sands Point, LI., 61, 64, to day and won the Westport ten nis championship. Earlier, Hughes scored a semifinal vic tory over Tony Vincent of New York, 64, 63, and Barker ousted topseeded Tom Roesch of Wilton, Conn., 63, 76.

title: Roundup: Red Sox Earn a Split, but Lose Tatum
description: The Boston Red Sox pre served their threegame lead over the Orioles yesterday, winning the second game at Baltimore after losing their top reliever and the first game

title: MORGANSTERN GIVES A RECITAL ON CELLO
description: Daniel Morganstern's last re cital visit to New York was as a member of the Reston Trio, and there is a quality of under statement in his performances that probably makes him fine ensemble player. Certainly the young cellist, at his for mal Tully Hall debut Saturday night, was most comfortable in music requiring only a modi cum of drama.

title: Technicolor Setting Deal With Movielab
description: Technicolor, Inc., and Movie lab, Inc., both motionpicture technology concerns, announced yesterday they had agreed in principle on a merger involving about $2.5million.

title: SALT at the Summit
description: President Nixon's effort starting in January to break the impasse in the strategic arms limitation talks (SALT) by direct correspondence with the Kremlin, a channel his predecessors used but he had neglected for two years, has led to a more hopeful phase in SovietAmerican relations.

title: A TOBACCO LEADER DECRIES AD STUDY
description: WASHINGTON, May 23An industry leader has attacked as misleading a recent study show ing that cigarette manufacturers doubled their advertising in 14 leading magazines since the Federal ban on radio and tele vision cigarette commercials went into effect.

title: Life in VISTA Called Radicalizing
description: WASHINGTON, May 23The exposure of thousands of young, middleclass Americans to pov erty through the volunteer program VISTA has sharply radicalized about onethird of them and moved most others toward a more left social and political posture, according to a littleknown Government study.

title: 1,500 Guardsmen Are Ordered To Chattanooga to Halt Unrest
description: CHATTANOOGA, Monday, May 24Two battalions of Na tional Guard troops were or dered into this city late last night after the third straight day of sporadic violence.

title: Prescription for Stagflation
description: Despite the persistence of unemployment at roughly 6 per cent since last November, inflation still dogs the American economy. The justreleased data of the Labor Department show that consumer prides increased nation ally by threetenths of 1 per cent last month, raising living costs 20.2 per cent above the 1967 level. In New York, the index rose slightly less last monthtwotenths of 1 per centbut, considering that living costs in this city have now climbed by 24,6 per cent since 1967, there was nothing to cheer about.

title: HUBERT J. HORAN JR.
description: PHILADELPHIA, May 23 Hubert J. Horan Jr., who retired in 1966 as chairman of the Con tinental Bank & Trust Company, died yesterday at the age of 81.

title: 3,145Day House Arrest Lifted by South Africans
description: CAPETOWN, May 23The South African Government has, after 3,145 days, tempo rarily set aside the house ar rest of Helen Joseph, a 65 yearold Britishborn widow who has never been convicted of a crime, sources in Johan nesburg said tonight.

title: Advertising:
description: When the Indianapolis 500 is broadcast on TV Saturday nightfor the first time on the day of a racethe spon sors will match the event. The American Oil Company will be in for six minutes and Goodyear tire and STP for four each.

title: Books of The Times
description: To understand the point of Larry L. King's Confessions of a White Racist, one need only reflett on its title. Why, it's pure puton, One thinks at first upon fin ishing the book, Mr. King isn't a racist at all, but an unusually sensitive writer who, for reasons that he still does not under stand, grew out of the racist milieu of Texas town and came to understand the pervasiveness in America of the bigotry he thought he escaped. Upon reflection, how ever one realizes that he is serious about his title after all, and that one's impulse to excuse him is really an attempt to excuse oneself.

title: Miss O'Brien Jersey Bride
description: PRINCETON, N.J., May 23Miss Charlotte O'Brien and John Joseph Kenney were married this afternoon in the Princeton University Chapel.

title: Darts, Metros Tie, 11
description: WASHINGTON, May 23 (AP) The Washington Darts and Toronto Metros played to a 11 tie today in a North American Soccer League game.

title: GIMENO CONQUERS SZOEKE IN 3 SETS
description: HAMBURG, West Germany, May 23 (UPI)Andres Gimeno, a 34yearold Spanish pro, won the men's singles title on the closing day of the 65th Ger man international tennis cham pionship today.

title: Parade Here Honors Dr. King's Memory
description: The sounds of fifes and drums and military instru ments reverberated along Fifth Avenue yesterday after noon as the fourth annual Rev. Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. Memorial Parade streamed uptown in honor of the civil rights leader who was mur dered four years ago.

title: Advertising:
description: Ted Bates & Co., will start doing advertising for ITT Gwaltney on July 1.

title: Bomb Threat Silences a Fire Transmitter
description: A telephoned bomb threat to the Brooklyn Museum yester day forced the borough's fire fighting units to transfer all communications to Staten Is land because the Brooklyn' transmitter is atop the museum.

title: MRS. MARY S. GRIFFITH
description: SCARSDALE, N.Y., May 23 Mrs. Mary S. Griffith, the author of Gardening on Noth ing a Year, died today in the Woodland Nursing Home, New Rochelle. She was 83 years old and was the widow of DeWitt Clinton Griffith, a tobacco broker.

title: Now She's in a Position to Make Some Changes
description: LOS ANGELESMrs. Wil liam H. Justice Jr., the first black woman to serve on this city's Police Commission, says that, as much as she cares about her new assign ment, she's a housewife first.

title: Japanese TugofBottle: Chivas vs. Johnny Black
description: Seagram & Sons of the United States goes according to the two companies' plans.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Notes on the Soviet Peace Program
description: MOSCOWThe peace program that Leonid Brezhnev outlined at the 24th Congress of the Communist Party of the Soviet Union16 days after the Soviet and American delegates resumed the SALT talks in Vienna  greatly, bolsters the hopes for a successful out come of the talks.

title: 18 HELD IN LOOTING BY BOULDER YOUTHS
description: BOULDER, Colo., May 23 (UPI)A windowbreaking and looting spree that the Mayor called the worst in the city's history left 18 persons in jail here today.

title: School Seeks New Answers To Old Problems of Youth
description: A good day here, said teacher at John Bowne High School in Queens, is one in which the kids seem fairly interested in what's going on in class, and everything is quiet, and you're glad you aren't in sonic bad school.

title: Stewart Captures Monaco Grand Prix in Auto He Wrecked Two Weeks Ago
description: MONTE CARLO, Monaco, May 23Jackie Stewart of Scot land, driving the V8 Tyrrell Ford that he wrecked two weeks ago at Silverstone, Eng land, captured the 29th Grand Prix of Monaco auto race today.

title: More Summer Court Sessions Are Urged to Cut Case Backlog
description: The backlog of cases clog ging the city's court calendars could be reduced if judges cut down on their long vacations and the courts gave up the tra ditional summer recess, the chairman of the city's Board of Correction said yesterday.

title: Columbia Award to Reporter
description: Richard Oliver, a reporter for The New York Daily News, won Columbia University's 1971 Paul Tobenkin memorial award for a series of articles that led to the release of an innocent black man convicted of rape by a Marine Corps courtmartial, it was announced yesterday. The award, announced by Colum bia's Graduate School of Jour nalism, carries a $250 cash prize and a certificate, to be presented Friday at the univer sity's Journalism Day.

title: JOHN G. FONTANA
description: John G. Fontana, a retired real estate man and building contractor, who was formerly a leader in ItalianAmerican ac tivities in Brooklyn, died Satur day at his home, 8757 96th Street, Woodhaven, Queens. He was 80 years old.

title: Earthquake Toll Now 800 In Ravaged Turkish Area
description: ISTANBUL, Turkey, May 23 Rescue workers continued to drag living and dead from the ruins of Bingol in eastern Tur key today as the death toll from yesterday's earthquake mounted toward 1,000.

title: VISTA Volunteers Battle to Save Their Program From Merger
description: WASHINGTON, May 23 Across the country this spring, more than 4,000 young idealists mostly white, middle class, straight college people who are far away from home  are quietly fighting what they see as a lifeanddeath battle for VISTA, the sixyearold Federal antipoverty program of Volun teers in Service to America.

title: LANDERS TRIUMPHS IN SCHOOL TENNIS
description: Dave Landers of Fordham Prep defeated Bill DiSesa of Iona Prep, 63, 61, in the var sity singles final of the Ford ham University invitation ten nis tournament yesterday on the Bronx campus.

title: Man in the News
description: JERUSALEM, May 23,A few days ago he was in Jerusalem jail, one of those arrested in the demonstration by Israel's Black Panthers.

title: Personal Finance: Mortgage Money
description: Bankers have been predict ing for quite some time that mortgage money is going to be much easier to get now.

title: Chinese Use Acupuncture Anesthetic in Heart Surgery
description: WUHAN, China, May 12 Dr. Chu Yukuang, a surgeon, had just spent 13 minutes re moving a tumor from the throat of a 54yearold won an. Seconds after the last suture was tied, she sat up and ate an orange. Then she put on her robe, thanked the doctor and walked out of the operating room. On the way she stopped to wave and smile at the amazed ob servers.

title: PODGORNY TO VISIT EGYPT THIS WEEK; WILL REVIEW TIES
description: CAIRO, May 23Nikolai V. Podgorny, the Soviet chief state, will arrive in Cairo with in a few days for an urgent re view of SovietEgyptian rela tions following the shakeup in the regime of President Anwar elSadat.

title: AT HOME ABROAD
description: Horse Show News

title: Chilean Envoy in Warsaw
description: WARSAW, May 23Chile's Foreign Minister, Clodomiro Al meyda, arrived in Warsaw to day on an eightnation tour of designed to increase ties with the socialist governments of Eastern Europe.

title: C.W.A. Asks Ranks To Sanction Strike Against Bell Units
description: WASHINGTON, May 23The executive board of the Com munications Workers of Amer ica, in an unusual televised union meeting, urged the membership today to authorize the leaders to call a strike against the Bell system, if necessary.

title: Unser Is Kept in Tow; Police Apply the Brakes
description: INDIANAPOLIS, May 23 (UPI)Bobby Unser, winner of the 1968 Indianapolis 500 auto race, was arrested for passing a red traffic light last night in the Indianapolis suburb of Speedway.

title: Killers of Israeli Consul Hunted By Police and Army in Istanbul
description: ISTANBUL, Turkey, May 23 All available troops and po licemen are being used in search here for the killers of Israel's Consul General in Is tanbul, Efraim Elrom, whose body was found in an apart ment building here early today.

title: OEN'S BOAT WINS IN SHIELDS CLASS
description: LARCHMONT, N. Y., May 23 Overtaking two boats that Were battling for the lead on the last leg of an 11.5mile Gold Cup course on Long Island Sound, Hans J. Oen sailed Pink Lady to a 1minute 8second Shields Class victory today in the season's second Yacht Rac ing Association championship regatta.

title: MEXICO IS PUSHING BORDER PROJECTS
description: MEXICO CITY, May 23 Mexico's industrialization pro gram along its 1,800mile bor der with the United States is continuing to grow despite the strong opposition of the Ameri can Federation of Labor and Congress of Industrial Organill zations.

title: RICHARD TAYLOR, LED NARCOTICS AGENCIES
description: WILTON, Conn., May 23  Dr. Richard Porter Taylor, ex ecutive director of the Associa tion of Voluntary Agencies on Narcotics Treatment, was killed yesterday in an automobile ac cident in Danby, Vt. He was 55 years old and lived at 33 Can non Road here.

title: Cranis Subdues Brosseau In HardCourt Tennis Final
description: WOODBURY, L.I., May 23 Paul Cranis of New York, seeded first, won the Eastern men's hardcourt tennis cham pionship today by defeating Don Brosseau of Los Angeles, 62, 62, 61, in 56 minutes at the Woodbury Country Club.

title: Office Complexto House An Old East Side Church
description: The congregation of St. Peter's Lutheran Church, which has dispensed tradition and innovation in the mid town area for 109 years, voted approval yesterday for a new adventure in the urban ministry.

title: Israelis Are Stunned
description: TEL AVIV, May 23Israelis were stunned by the slaying of Mr. Elrom. The Cabinet at its weekly meeting in Jerusalem stood solemnly in tribute to the official.

title: SelfProtection
description: A savings program is one of the most accepted forms of selfprotection. The Federal Govern ment, in co operation with employ ers, organized labor and banks, offers two of the most popular fi nancial selfprotection pro grams. These programs are the Payroll Savings and the BondAMonth Plans for the ownership of United States Savings Bonds.

title: COSMOS SET BACK BY OLYMPICS 32
description: The Montreal Olympics had been scoreless for six hours and 32 minutes in North American Soccer League play, but in 58 minutes they scored three times at Yankee Stadium yesterday to defeat the New York Cosmos, 32, before 2,893 fans.

title: Saigon Will Retry Student for Treason
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, May 23The Government has decided to retry on charges of treason a young medical stu dent whose trial last year end ed when the Supreme Court ruled that the military field court judging his case was un constitutional.

title: JULIUS C. SCHOR
description: Julius C. Schor, a lawyer with offices at 18 East 41st Street, died yesterday in Doctors Hos pital. He was 67 years old and lived at 152 East 94th Street.

title: Wolstenholme Golf Victor
description: OSAKA, Japan, May 23 (AP) Guy Wolstenholme of Aus tralia shot a par 71 in the first round and a 68 in the second today to win the oneclay Ku zuha international golf cham pionship by one stroke.

title: Lawyer Weds Anita Finston
description: Miss Anita Louise Finston, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Arthur Finston of New York, was married yesterday after nocin to Warren Belmar, son of Mr. and Mrs. Aron Belmar of Brooklyn. Rabbi Judah Nadich performed the cere mony at the Pierre.

title: Teacher Shows the Way
description: John McDonald, a school teacher from New Providence, N. J., captured the Road Run ners 10mile run by 600 yards yesterday at Van Cortlandt Park, the Bronx.

title: Week's Votes in Congress
description: WASHINGTON, May 23 Following are the votes of dele gations from New York, New Jersey and Connecticut on the major rollcalls in Congress during the week ended yester day.

title: ROOKY BROWN, 46, OF GLOBETROTTERS
description: NEPTUNE, N.J., May 23 (AP) William (Rooky) Brown of Neptune, who played with the famed Harlem Globetrotters basketball team from 1947 to 1958, died of cancer at Jersey Shore Medical Center here yes terday. He was 46 years old and lived here at 2 Sussex Road.

title: RONAN UNCERTAIN ON RISE IN FARES
description: Dr. William J. Ronan, chair man of the Metropolitan Trans portation Authority, said yes terday that the fare subsidy bills now before the State Legislature could not, of them selves, guarantee the 30cent fare for any length of time.

title: LINDSAY ACCUSED OF EXAGGERATING CITY'S BUDGET GAP
description: ALBANY, May 23  High sources in the Rockefeller ad ministration said today that Mayor Lindsay was exaggerat ing New York City's budget gap by at least $400million.

title: 10,000 Suffolk Scouts Romp, Show Skills and Boy Power
description: EAST ISLIP, L.I., May 23 The sprawling Heckscher State Park here was taken over this weekend by thousands of ker chiefed youths who paraded, picnicked and promenaded, boasting of boy power.

title: Yesterday's Air Called Cleanest of the Century
description: We had the cleanest air Sunday in Manhattan of any day in this century, Air Re sources Commissioner Robert N. Rickles said yesterday. And we had the lowest air pollution levels since the de partment began its daily, measurements in 1952.

title: The CanadianSoviet Pact
description: The signing of an agreement for regular, highlevel consultations between Canada and the Soviet Union on the second day of Prime Minister Trudeau's visit Moscow may have come as a surprise but it is not cause for alarm. However the Kremlin may view it, Mr. Trudeau clearly sees the agreement as a logical exten sion; of Canada's effort to diversify and expand its roreign contacts, in part as a counterweight to what he calls the overpowering presence of the United States.

title: Molloy Takes Team Title In BrooklynQueens Meet
description: Archbishop Molloy High School, winner of the Private Schools track title Thursday, added another crown yesterday in winning in the Brooklyn Queens sectional meet of the Association.

title: Ross, Brosseau Advance In Brooklyn Title Tennis
description: Don Brosseau, who earlier had lost in the final of the Eastern hardcourt tennis tour nament at Woodbury, LI., played in a second tournament yesterday, the Brooklyn cham pionship, and advanced to the second round with a 64, 63 victory over Lou Sager.

title: A SPECIAL TARIFF ON JAPAN WEIGHED
description: WASHINGTON, May 23The seemingly radical idea of im posing a special tariff on all goods from Japan unless the yen is revalued upward is now being taken seriously in the United States Government.

title: Pets Star at Ethel Kennedy's
description: McLEAN, Va., May 23 When Mrs. Robert F. Ken nedy walked out on the lawn at Hickory Hill yesterday, she found 2,000 children and adults and uncounted num bers of dogs, cats, gerbils, chickens and guppies.

title: LOUIS HOISCHUH, MOODY'S EXHEAD
description: ELIZABETH, N. J., May 23 Louis W. Holschuh, who retired as chairman of Moody's Invest ment Service in 1959, died to night in his home at 814 Park Avenue. He was 89 years old.

title: Strategic Alternatives: I
description: American strategic nuclear policy has been, dominated in recent years by an idea called assured destruc tion. This concept is that the domi nant task of the U.S. strategic forces is to be able to mount a nuclear attack that would reliably destroy a substan tial fraction of the Soviet society, even after a major Soviet strike on Amer ican forces. Recent public statements of the Nixon Administration have em phasized a doctrine called strategic sufficiency. Although published for mulations of this doctrine are am biguous, it is clear that something like the concept of assured destiuotion still dominates American strategic pol icy, even if the terminology itself is no longer used in official statements.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
Public Employes' Strike Put Up to Legislature
description: The president of District Council 37 of the State, County and Municipal Employes, said yesterday there would be a se lective strike by members of his union if the State Legisla ture failed to approve a pen sion agreement the union reached last year with the city.

title: Clark Calls Nixon Lawless In Moves on War Protests
description: WASHINGTON, May 23 (AP) Ramsey Clark, the former Attorney General, said today that it was lawless for the Nixon Administration to obtain a court order to evict antiwar veterans from the Capitol grounds during the April pro tests and then to refuse to en force the order.

title: 'TWAS A GREAT DAY FOR THE OULD FOLKS
description: The game just isn't what used to be, lamented Dan Fitz gerald, a retired Rockaway Beach cafe owner, yesterday. It isn't rough enough. They've gone and made the good old game too scientific.

title: How to Franchise Electronics
description: In 1920, when Abraham Pletman, a Cooper Union trained engineer, opened his first radio supply store at 6 Church Street in Manhattan, only the more affluent house holds owned radios. Today, with the twin explosion of technology and consumer buying power, there are very few households in the coun try that own fewer than half a dozen radios or related items, such as television sets tape recorders and highfi delity stereo systems.

title: MRS. JULIUS DE KEYSER
description: Mrs. Lenore Ullman De Key ser, a social worker for 50 years with the Red Cross, Jew ish Family Service and National Federation of Jewish Women, died yesterday at her home, 1329 Lexington Avenue. She was 73 years old.

title: GREENBERG SCORES WITH ETCHELLS22
description: PORT WASHINGTON, L. I., May 23  Woody Greenberg beat Bill Murphy for Etchells 22 honors today as 45 boats sailed in the Cow Bay area, Yacht Racing Association of Long Island Sound competition.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Drysdale Brussels Winner
description: BRUSSELS, May 23 (UPI) Cliff Drysdale of South Africa won the men's singles title in the Belgian open tennis cham pionship today by beating Ilie Nastase of Rumania, 6.0, 61, 75.

title: Bhutto Urges Political Solution for East Pakistan
description: KARACHI, Pakistan, May 23 Zulfikar Ali Bhutto, leader of West Pakistan's majority party, warned today that Pakis tan was in danger of disinte gration unless a quick political solution was found for the crisis in East Pakistan.

title: Hawaii G.O.P. Elects Woman
description: KAHULUI, Hawaii, May 23 (UPI)Mrs. Carla W. Goray has been elected as the first woman state chairman of the Hawaii Republican party. She was chosen by acclamation at the party convention, which con cluded yesterday.

title: Space Shot Off Again
description: WASHINGTON, May 23 (AP)  Cloudy skies over Wallops Island, Va., to night caused postponement once again of the launching of a GermanAmeri can space shot, originally set for April 20. The launching of the rocket, containing barium crystals, has been delayed at least a dozen times.

title: Chicagoan Is Double Victor As A.B.C. Tournament Ends
description: DETROIT, May 23 (AP)  Al Cohn, a 43yearold furniture salesman from Chicago won the regular singles and all events titles today in the 68th American Bowling Congress tournament, which ended after a 79day run.

title: Crime Wave an Election Issue in Italy
description: ROME, May 23A crime wave that is afflicting Italy has almost overnight turned into a major political issue.

title: HEBREW SCHOOLS HELD IN DIRE NEED
description: The head of a major Jewish! Orthodox organization called on the Federation of Jewish Philanthropies of New York last night to establish a mini mum of 10,000 scholarships for Hebrew day schools.

title: HERBERT M. BOWLBY, NEUROLOGIST, WAS 89
description: DARIEN, Conn., May 23Dr. Herbert Mead Bowlby, a retired neurologist, died Thursday at his home, 141 Christie Hill Road. His age was 89.

title: BALLOTING STARTS FOR P.B.A. LEADER
description: A spirited election campaign for leadership of the Patrol men's Benevolent Association will near a climax today when ballots are mailed out to about 30,000 policemen. The results will be tallied June 5.

title: ARGENTINE LEFTISTS KIDNAP BRITISH AIDE
description: BUENOS AIRES, May 23?? Guerrillas kidnapped the British honorary consul in Rosario Stanley M. Sylvester, today and said he would be tried before a people's court of justice.

title: J. E. Sag Weds Marna Rothenberg
description: ROSLYN, L. I., May 23 Miss Mama Lois Rothenberg, a Boston University graduate with the Edwin Gould Serv ices for Children in New York, was married here this after noon to Jerome Edward Sag, who is an alumnus of Queens College and a thirdyear stu dent at the New York Medi cal College.

title: Miss Nicholson Wed To R. L. Harrison
description: WESTBURY, L. I., May 23 The marriage of Miss Eliz abeth Louise Nicholson, who will be graduated from Jack son College of Tufts Uni versity on June 6, to Richard Leon Harrison, a student at Boston University, took place in the gardens at Westbury Manor at noon today.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: U.S. BASE NEAR DMZ SHELLED BY ENEMY
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Men day, May 24 (AP)North Viet namese units fired rockets into an allied base near the demili tarized zone last night for the fifth successive night of shell ings along the DMZ.

title: ULOZAS SHOOTS 73 AND WINS WITH 283
description: NORTH LITTLE ROCK, Ark., May 23 (AP)Tom Ulozas of Edison, NJ., won the $25,000 Maumelle open, a satellite golf tournament, by four strokes to day, carding a finalround 73 for a 72hole total of 283. First place was worth $5,000.

title: Vasquez and Borges Meet In Bout at Forum Tonight
description: Davey Vasquez will face Ar lindo Borges of Brazil in a 12 round bantamweight bout at the Felt Forum in Madison Square Garden.

title: ARTHUR FLEISCHMAN
description: Arthur Fleischman, president of Fleischman Burd Metals, Inc., dealers in precious metals here, died Friday at his home, 5400 Fieldston Road, Riverdale, the Bronx. He was 70 years old.

title: Desbordes Wins, 4 and 3. In French Amateur Golf
description: DEAUVILLE, France, May 23 (AP)JeanCharles Desbordes defeated a fellow Frenchman, Didier Charmat, 4 and 3, in the 36hole final of the French amateur golf championship to day.

title: Nancy Florence Westheimer Bride
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo., May 23  Miss Nancy Florence Westheimer was married here this morning to Stephen Michael Rossen of New York, a writer for television and films and son of the late Rob ert Rossen, the motion pic ture producer, writer and di rector.

title: YUGOSLAV ENTRY HAILED AT CANNES
description: CANNES, France, May 23 Somewhere along in every film festival there comes that one film that electrifies everyone, that sets everyone from the man in the street to critics to the president of a major Amer ican company talking about it with the same passionate enthu siasm. This year that film is Wilhelm Reich: Mysteries of Orgasm, directed by Yugosla via's Dusan Makavejev, shown last midnight in the counter festival to a standingroomonly audience that cheered and screamed and applauded for a good quarter of an hour at 2 o'clock in the morning.

title: Relief Is Not Enough
description: The tidal wave of refugees from East Pakistan into India, which is reported nearing the threemillion mark and growing by tens of thousands each day, presents humanitarian and political problems of staggering pro portions to India and to the world.

title: SEALE JURY RETIRES FOR 5TH DAY IN ROW
description: NEW HAVEN, May 23For the fifth day in a row the jury in the murder trial of Bobby G. Seale, the chairman of the Black Panther Party, and Mrs. Ericka Huggins retired without reaching a verdict.

title: Petrosian and Larsen Win In World Chess Tourney
description: Grandmasters Tigran Petro sian of the Soviet Union and Bent Larsen of Denmark re corded victories yesterday in quarterfinals play of the World Chess Championships, but ill ness forced postponement of the Bobby FischerMark Tai manov elimination match, ac cording to The Associated Press.

title: Hanoi Aide, in Interview, Links Pullout Date and P.O.W. Issue
description: PARIS, May 22Xuan Thuy, North Vietnam's chief negotia tor in the Paris peace talks, said yesterday that the question of American prisoners could be rapidly and easily settled it President Nixon set a date for total United States with drawal.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Sports of The Times
description: Ballplayers have the world by the tail if they do right; said Eddie Mathews, who didn't. But, how are you going to tell some young players that it's ever going to end, that people aren't going to be hanging around, that the offers are ever going to stop coming in, Hell, I never even thought about it. I was unprepared. Four months before quit baseball I didn't have anything lined up..

title: FIRST YEAR ENDS AT NEW COLLEGE
description: AMHERST, Mass., May 22 Hampshire College, the experi mental school that opened here last September, held its first commencement this weekend even though it had only 17 transfer students to graduate.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Billiard Films Postponed
description: Films of the 1965 and 1970 national billiard champion ships, scheduled to be shown tonight at Broadway Billiards, 52d Street and Broadway, have been postponed until next Mon day at 6 P.M. because of the strike affecting United Parcel Service deliveries.

title: F.C.C. AIDE URGES FIGHT ON THE RIGS
description: WASHINGTON, May 23 Nicholas Johnson, a commis sioner of the Federal Communi cations Commission, urged the nation's youth today to help right the wrongs of what he termed the big businessbig axis.

title: Gordon Setter Scores 2d Triumph in Row
description: LOCUST VALLEY, L. I., May 23Ch. Legend of Gael, C. D., the Gordon setter owned by Mrs. Cheever Porter of New York, is beginning to be legend in the dog, show world.

title: Youth Against Drugs
description: The action by five students at William Howard Taft High School which led to the arrest of a school security guard on charges of selling heroin represented a dramatic episode in an encouraging trend. High school and college students appear increasingly alert to the dangers of drugs and the heartbreak which addiction has brought to many of their contemporaries. A studentsponsored cam paign against pushers at Manhattan Community College offers added confirmation of changing attitudes  from defiant permissiveness to active opposition.

title: MISS WHITWORTH WINS SUZUKI GOLF
description: BUENA PARK, Calif., May 23 (AP) Kathy Whitworth shot birdies on the final two holes today to eke out her second victory on the women's profes sional golf tour by two strokes in the Suzuki Internationale.

title: CHILE TAKES OVER COPPER COMPANY
description: RANCAGUA, Chile, May 23 The Chilean Government has seized operational and financia control of the El Teniente Min ing Company, one of the three big copper enterprises here in which United States companies have interests.

title: Oh to Be in England Indeed
description: LONDONTo those Americans who think that all they have to do to escape their many problems, to achieve a life of comfort, abundance and peace is to emigrate to England, we say Stop, Look and Listen before you leap.

title: From the AvantGarde of the Thirties, Djuna Barnes
description: Almost 35 years ago a new novel about tormented love and sexual aberration written in mordant English elegance and playing with macabre, Poelike plots took avant garde literary circles by storm.

title: REPORT CRITICIZES HOUSINGLAW USE
description: A citysponsored study of housingcode enforcement, made public yesterday, found that many of the inspection, complaint and punishment pro cedures were wasted effort and that prosecution had neg ligible impact.

title: Parks Council Fights Fiscal Cuts
description: Slum children create their own adventure playground in the Bronx. A bank on Park Avenue converts its lob by into a miniature park. A colloquium on polluted environ ment is held in the Ethical Cul ture Society and a kiteflying contest is staged in Battery Park. There is a fiesta in Brook lyn and a walking tour in Cen tral Park.

title: Endre Balogh, Violinist, Makes Highly Impressive Debut at 16
description: To get right to the point, En dre Balogh is a major new tal ent.

title: Four Bills Seek Aid for Addicted G.I.'s
description: WASHINGTON, May 23  Apprehension that a deluge of drugaddicted former service men may be released into American society is reflected in four bills coming up in Con gress to require the armed services to keep such men in uniform until they are cured.

title: OTB ACTION SHIFTS TO YONKERS TODAY
description: A New York track other than Roosevelt Raceway will occupy the time of offtrackbetting pat rons as they place wagers on Yonkers Raceway events start ing today. There still will be no betting on thoroughbreds, ex cept for the Belmont Stakes, who will be competing at Bel mont Park for the next 30 days after running at Aqueduct.

title: Trudeau Appear on Jews
description: SAMARKAND, U.S.S.R:, May 23 (AP)Prime Minlstet Pierre Elliott Trudeau of Canada, visit ing here, said today he appealed to Premier Aleksei N. Kcisygin, last week on behalf of Soviet Jews who wanted to emigrate but that Mr. Kosygin said the Soviet Union would continue to follow its own internal policies.

title: Bondholders' Council Elects
description: George D. Woods, former president of the World Bank, has been elected president of the Foreign Bondholders Pro tective Council, succeeding Donald R. Heath, who will be chairman of the executive com mittee and executive officer. The council had completed 38 agreements with foreign gov ernments for resumption of payment on $3.5billion of their defaulted dollar bonds.

title: Agnew as Listener: He's WellBriefed
description: WASHINGTON, May 23 Vice President Agnew listens.

title: Tornado Slashes Town in Texas
description: WHITNEY, Tex., May 23 (UPI) A tornado slashed through Whitney tonight, causing 35 injuries, one death and extensive property dam age.

title: ENTERPRISE GAINS OF MINORITIES LAG
description: Minority enterprise  the target of much Government support and fanfare in the last decadehas at best advanced only modestly, the Conference Board said yesterday.

title: Yanks Down Indians, 63, Then Lose, 21, Amid Fighting
description: CLEVELAND, May 23The Cleveland Indians were forced to resort to Harold (Gomer) Hodge, their rustic pinchhitting artist, to gain a split of doubleheader with the Yankees today at Municipal Stadium be fore 19,014 fans.

title: North American Rockwell: Back to Earth
description: The prime contractor on the Apollo Space exploration pro gram has a problem.

title: Susan Reed Makes Folk Comeback at the Cookery
description: In 1944 a 16yearold girl with red hair streaming down her shoulders skipped out onto the floor of Cafe Society Down town, held up a stringed instru ment and said ingenuously, This is a zither. The girl was Susan Reed, fresh out of Dal ton School and with some idea of being a painter. Instead, after the audience heard her, she be came one of the most celebrated of the early wave of folksingers in the postwar years of the 1940's.

title: Montreal Again Captures Field Hockey Tournament
description: GREENWICH, Conn., May 23 For the second straght year, the Montreal Ambassadors cap tured the Field Hockey Associ ation of America spring tour nament today with a 20 vic tory over Westchester.

title: Stuart Takes Travis Golf by Beating Bostwicks in Last Two Rounds
description: GARDEN CITY, LI., May 23 Mark Stuart Jr. took on the Bostwick brothers in succes sive rounds today and beat both to win the 60th annual Walter J. Travis amateur invita tion golf tournament 41 years after his father had won it.

title: Chess: Unified Principle Is Needed When Compiling Anthology
description: To compile a useful an tliology of chess games (as distinct from a game col lectiongames all played at a single tournament, or by single player) it is necessary to adhere to some unifying principle. Some governing idea is needed that will help the editor to decide which games to put in, and which to leave out.

title: Schools' Examining Board in Fight for Life
description: Miss Donna Margolies went home from work one afternoon last week, changed her clothes, and took a subway to Brook lyn Technical High School. There, she filled in a series of forms, was fingerprinted and spent 90 minutes answering 150 multiplechoice questions and writing an essay of at least 350 words.

title: ...And the Food Was Plentiful
description: AUSTIN, Texas, May 23 Richard Nixon accepted the Lyndon Baines Johnson Li brary for America, but he did not accept the University of Texas's invitation to a mammoth barbecue held af ter the, dedication ceremony on campus here yesterday. Instead he had some of the chicken and ribs fixed up as a sort of carryout order and ate them on Air Force One en route to Key Biscayne, Fla.

title: Muted Class Strife Is Erupting in Israel
description: JERUSALEM, May 23The guns on the borders have been silent for 10 months, and ten sions within Israeli society long muffled by the threat of war are breaking into the open.

title: Murder in the Streets
description: The recent rash of murderous attacks on police officers has shocked New York. Whether or not there is any connection between these cowardly acts, the common pattern is one of inexcusable violence.

title: MRS. LESLIE S. BAKER
description: ARLINGTON, Va., May 23 Mrs. Jane King Baker, wife of Leslie S. Baker, who was direc tor of exhibits for the 1939 New York World's Fair and earlier Deputy Commissioner of Sanitation, died today at their home. She was 75 years old.

title: 78 Killed in Crash Of Yugoslav Plane
description: BELGRADE, Yugoslavia, May 23Seventyeight of 83 persons abroad a Sovietbuilt Yugoslav plane died tonight when it crashed at Rijeka Air port in northwest Yugoslavia, the Belgrade radio reported.

title: Muskie Leads Nixon in Poll
description: BOSTON, May 23 (AP)Sen ator Edmund S. Muskie, Demo crat of Maine, leads President Nixon, 49 per cent to 41 per cent, in a preference poll con ducted in New Hampshire for The Boston Globe. The Globe said today that Mr. Muskie topped Mayor Lindsay of New York, 56 per cent to 21 per cent, in the poll conducted by the Becker Research Corpora tion with questions sent to 1,986 persons.

title: 5Day Week Scheduled For Brooklyn Museum
description: The Brooklyn. Museum will be open Wednesday through Sundays and closed Mondays and Tuesday starting July 1.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Amsterdam: Dancing to Drums of Java
description: Arts Abroad

title: Stephen Remp of Travel Firm Marries Ann Sellett Tweedy
description: BREWSTER, N. Y., May 23 Miss Ann Sellett Tweedy, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Gordon Bradford Tweedy of New York and Brewster, was married here this afternoon to Stephen Edward Remp, son of Mr. and Mrs. Thomas Edward Remp Jr. of London, formerly of Houston.

title: Walkathon Aids Farm Union
description: MINEOLA, L.I., May 23 Thirteen hundred Nassau Coun ty teenagers walked 20 miles today to collect what they ex pected to be $10,000 for strik ing members of the United Farm Workers in Delano, Calif.

title: A U.N. Role Is Envisioned In Global Pollution Drive
description: RENSSELAERVILLE, N. Y.. May 23  After a long period of hesitancy, the great powers appear to have decided that some sort of machinery must be created within the United Nations to coordinate the growing global effort to keep the world habitable.

title: BONDPRICE RISE FAILS TO PERSIST
description: The bond market's recovery last week did not last long, and prices were heading downward again Friday.

title: N.Y.A.C. Sabermen on Top
description: The New York Athletic ?? won the metropolitan ?? title yesterday for the ?? straight year in a four?? roundrobin at the Fen?? ?? Club. The Fencers Club ?? second and New York Uni?? city third. All three quali ?? for the national champ ?? ships in San Franccisco ?? month.

title: Phyllis Malkin, Barry F. Cohen Married on L. I.
description: GREAT NECK, L. I., May 23Miss Phyllis Malkin and Barry F. Cohen were married here this afternoon. Rabbi Jacob Rudin performed the ceremony at the home of the bride's parents, Mr. and Mrs. Henry Malkin.

title: U.S. Biologists in China Tell of Scientific Gains
description: SHANGHAI, May 23  Two American biologists who are completing a unique tour of Chinese Conimunist research establishments said today that they had become convinced that China had developed a lot of important scientific in formation of which we are un aware.

title: KENYON QUALIFIES, HURTUBISE FAILS
description: INDIANAPOLIS, May 23 (AP) Two of the most courageous men in sports, Mel Kenyon and Jim Hurtubise, tried today to put cars into Saturday's 55th Indianapolis 500mile race at the Indianapolis Motor Speed way. One succeeded and one failed in the final qualifying session.

title: YOUTHS ON COAST SWELL VOTER LIST
description: BEVERLY HILLS, Calif., May 23The conventional political wisdom says that many 18 yearolds will not bother to vote next year, and that, if they do, they will vote mainly as their parents do.

title: Congress Is Asked To End Financing Of Radio by C.I.A.
description: WASHINGTON, May 23 President Nixon has asked Con gress to create a taxexempt nonprofit corporation to finance and supervise Radio Free Eu rope and Radio Liberty.

title: Harlem Police Cars Get Escorts Alter Two Killings
description: Plainclothes policemen in un marked cars backed up uni formed patrols in Harlem yes terday as detectives sifted leads and questioned scores of peo ple in the intensive hunt for the men who shot and killed two patrolmen Friday night.

title: 5Day Week Scheduled For Brooklyn Museum
description: The Brooklyn. Museum will be open Wednesday through Sundays and closed Mondays and Tuesday starting July 1.

title: Arts School Gets $250,000 for Dance
description: The Rockefeller Foundation has awarded a $250,000 match ing grant to the North Carolina School of the Arts for establish ing a new professional dance company to serve the south eastern United States.

title: Record Numbers of Gypsy Moths Seen
description: NEW HAVEN, May 23 Gypsy moth caterpillars are ap pearing in record strength this spring, raising fears that a mil lion acres of trees will be de nuded of leaves in Connecticut, New York and New Jersey by midJuly.

title: Coffey Tallies on the Turf
description: RENTON, Wash., May 23 (AP)Junior Coffey, New York Giant offensive back, saddled his first winner as an appren tice race horse trainer yester day. Coffey's Alice's Heart won the second race at the Long acres track at 54 odds.

title: RICHARD E. LAWRENCE
description: Richard E. Lawrence, found er and president of the Harmet Manufacturing Corporation of Corona, Queens, a maker of exhaustgas disposal systems, died Saturday of a heart at tack in Syosset, L.I. He lived at 22 Glenwood Road, Roslyn Harbor, L.I.

title: Orders of Machine Tools Declined 34.8% in April
description: New orders for American ma chine tools, a closely watched indicator of the spending plans of businessmen, dropped in April by 34.8 per cent, com pared with those of the 1970 month.

title: MISS BUDWEISER WINNER IN MIAMI
description: MIAMI, May 23 (AP)Dean Chenoweth drove Miss Bud weiser to first place and $10, 000 in prize money today in the Champion Sparkplug un limited hydroplane regatta at Miami Marine Stadium.

title: Everybody Was There...
description: AUSTIN, Texas, May 23 When Vice President Spiro T. Agnew was asked, How do you like the barbecue? he looked up from his heaping platter of food behind a dotted line of Secret Service men and said:

title: Chilean Envoy in Cuba
description: MIAMI, May 23 (AP)The first Chilean ambassador io Cuba since diplomatic ties he tween the two countries were severed in 1964 has arrived Havana, the Cuban radio re ports. The Ambasador, Juan, Enrique Vega, is the youthfu?? leader of a leftist group that forms part of Chile's governing.

title: Albany Tightens DrunkDriving Laws In Day Mostly Devoted to Minor Bills
description: ALBANY, May 23A bill to tighten the state's drunken driving regulations by slowing down the bibulous motorist by two or three drinks at a party received final approval today in the State Assembly.

title: Soviet Sets War Games
description: MOSCOW, May 23 (Reuters) Military exercises involving all types of armed forces will be conducted in the south of the Soviet Union in midJune, the Soviet press agency Tass said today.

title: DAVID E. DAMON
description: SUMMIT, N. J., May 23 David. E. Damon, who retired two years ago as marketing manager for the Standard Oil Company (N.J.) in the Kingston area, Jamaica, West Indies, after 28 years with the con cern, died yesterday of a heart ailment in Overlook Hospital. He was 53 years old and lived at 14 Twombley Drive.

title: Carleton H. Palmer Dies at 80; Was Squibb's Head for 37 Years
description: OYSTER BAY, L. I., May 23 Carleton H. Palmer, who headed E. R. Squibb & Sons, the pharmaceutical concern, from 1915 to 1952, died today at his honag here. He was 80 years old, and also lived at 435 East 52d Street in Manhattan.

title: 20 IN THE HOUSE ASK U.S. INQUIRY ON KENT
description: WASHINGTON, May 24 (AP) Twenty Representatives asked Attorney General John N. Mitchell today to begin a Fed eral grand jury investigation of the killing of four Kent State University students by Ohio Na tional Guardsmen on May 4, 1970.

title: Bill Is Filed in House to Ban Sale of a Cheap Gun
description: Representative John M. Mur phy said yesterday that he had submitted a bill to stop the sale of a cheap snubnosed pis tol being manufactured and sold in the United States and called the Saturday Night Special.

title: Cornfeld Gets $225,000
description: GENEVA, May 24Bernard Cornfeld, founder of Investors Overseas Services, received a golden handshake worth $225,000 when he severed all connections with the ailing mutual fund complex last Jan uary, according to an I.O.S. statement today.

title: NEW STUDY COURSES. AT CITY U. APPROVED
description: Several new program of studyincluding one that will lead to the City University of New York's first bachelor's de gree in environmental health science  were approved last night by the City Board of Higher Education.

title: Strategic Alternatives: II
description: Yesterday I explained that many people regard a posture of Mutual Assured DestructionMADas a de sirable objective of our armscontrol policy. I also explained that a mined city system was obviously the most efficient way of achieving a MAD posture, and, since the minedcity sys tern was clearly absurd, it followed that a MAD posture itself. must be absurd.

title: Who Would Want to Be a Cop?
description: There was a time when policemen didn't like to be called cops. They pre ferred the dignified appellation, po lice officers. Theirs was a profession. Many may still feel that way, but they'll settle for cop. Compared to pig it sounds like a compliment.

title: Coron Home Owners Clash in Albany
description: ALBANY, May 24  Two angry groups of owners of con demned homes in Corona, Queens, clashed here today over the tactics needed to al low them to retain their prop erty.

title: Amex Prices Decline Steadily; Trading Hits a 4Month Low
