description: The American Stock Ex change finished lower yesterday in the lightest trading in four, and a half months.

title: Hudson & Manhattan Corp. Sets Payout to Stockholders
description: The Hudson & Manhattan Corporation announced yester day plans to distribute $41 million to stockholders, repre senting a partial liquidation of the company's holdings.

title: Economist Expects InterestRate Rise In 2d Half of Year
description: If interest rates continue to move higher, the rise will set in motion a series of financial events that eventually will abort the current economic re covery, Henry Kaufman, part ner and economist at Salomon Brothers, warned yesterday.

title: OnceElegant Gulf Hotel Closes
description: BILOXI, Miss., May 23 The Edgewater Gulf, once the grandest of the Mississippi Gulf Coast resort hotels, and still the most imposing, has closed its doors.

title: Books of The Times
description: MEMORIES. By Julian Huxley. 296 pages. Har per & Row. $8,95.

title: DeMartinos and Baby Lenore Move Out of the State
description: Mr. and Mrs. Nicholas De Martino, who have been wag ing a losing battle since last October to retain the custody of their year  old adoptive daughter, Lenore, have left the state with the child, their attorney said yesterday. The disclosure that the young Brooklyn couple had left New York State  and thus the jurisdiction of the state courts that have ordered them to return the child to her natural mother  was made by Jacob D. Fuchsberg, their lawyer. He made the statement during a discussion with State Supreme Court Justice Charles A. Loreto, concerning a transitional plan for easing the return to Olga Scarpetta, her natural mother.

title: 3 STUDENTS HELD IN SCHOOL SITIN
description: Security guards arrested three students yesterday at the High School of Music and Art as an aftermath of a demon stration Friday by black stu dents.

title: FOOTBALL TOASTED BY LOCAL WRITERS
description: The top management echelons of pro football convened here yesterday for meetings and a ceremonial dinner. The first gathering was that of the 26 coaches.

title: JERSEY KICKBACK DETAILED AT TRIAL
description: NEWARK, May 24A Penn sylvania swimming pool manu facturer told a Federal jury here today that he paid a $6,000 kickback to a Jersey City of ficial because, he said, I felt it was the price of doing busi ness in Jersey City and we were going along with it.

title: MURDERER GETS 25 YEARS TO LIFE
description: A 22yearold unemployed laborer, convicted of murder ing an offduty policeman in an attempted holdup in Brooklyn, was sentenced yesterday to 25 years to life in prison.

title: U.S. SUES TO BLOCK GEORGIA BANK DEAL
description: WASHINGTON, May 24The Justice Department, in the sec ond recent case of its kind in volving Georgia banks, tiled suit today to prevent the acqui sition of the Peachtree Bank and Trust Company of Cham blee, Ga., by the Trust Company of Georgia.

title: A Summary of Supreme Court Actions
description: WASHINGTON, May 24 The Supreme Court tools the following actions today:

title: LOCKHEED FILES. BANK AGREEMENT
description: BURBANK, Calif., May 24 (UPI)The Lockheed Aircraft Corporation has advised the Securities and Exchange Corn Mission that its creditor banks pave agreed to allow it to cut its net worth to $225million from $340million.

title: Buddhist Immolates Himself In Antiwar Protest in Hue
description: HUE, South Vietnam, Tues day, May 25 (UPI)A 16year old South Vietnamese tailor ac tive in Buddhist student affairs burned himself to death here early today in an antiwar pro test, the police said.

title: Two London Banks Robbed
description: LONDON, May 24 (AP) Armed gangs held up two branch banks of the National Westminster Bank today and got away with $57,600.

title: U.S. Seeks Jobs for Professionals Laid Off in Aerospace and Defense Work
description: WASHINGTON, May 24 The Labor Department report ed today that a Government program to find jobs for scien tists, engineers and technicians laid off by the aerospace and defense industries was now in full operation.

title: SITES ARE SELECTED FOR FOUR PROJECTS
description: The Site Selection Board picked locations yesterday for a new school and a police station in Staten Island, for the future East Flatbush branch library in Brooklyn and for a new electri cal substation to improve serv ice on the IRT Flushing sub way line in Queens.

title: Prague Revives a Noble 1750 Mass
description: PRAGUE, May 24It has not been all opera at the Prague Spring. Two other as pects of music in Czechoslo vakia, representing a span of about 200 years, provided an interesting contrast over the weekend.

title: PAKISTANI STRIFE SAID TO CONTINUE
description: NEW DELHI, May 24De spite official descriptions of normality in East Pakistan, guerrilla activity and the army crackdown continue according to reports from the area,

title: ...the 18YearOld Vote...
description: Is the Republican leadership in Albany afraid of the 18yearold vote?

title: Weather Chief Here Shifted
description: Charles G. Knudsen, chief of the New York City Weather Office for the last seven years, was named yesterday to head the National Weather Service's central region office in Kansas City, the Department of Com merce announced. A native of New York City, Mr. Knudsen, 56 years old, has been in the service since 1941 and worked at the city's three jetports, Rockefeller Center, and the Weather Service's downtown office, before heading the re gional headquarters in Garden City.

title: Administration Rejects Gallup Poll on Vietnam
description: KEY BISCAYNE, Fla., May 24 (UP)The Nixon Adminis tration said today that the American people understand its Vietnam policies, although a Gallup poll indicated that 67 per cent believed they were not being told all that was known on the subject.

title: Kennedy Says Nixon Tried To Provoke Coast Students
description: WASHINGTON, May 24 (Reu ters)Senator Edward M. Ken nedy said today that President Nixon deliberately attempted to, provoke students in San Jose, Calif., just one month after the Presidential Commission on Campus Unrest urged officials to exercise restraint in dealing with students.

title: BOMBERS HUNTED BY SCOTLAND YARD
description: LONDON, May 24Britain's Angry Brigade, a group of rev olutionaries similar to the Weathermen in the United States, was the object today of an intensified hunt by Scotland Yard.

title: 12 JOYFUL METS IN SHEA FUNFEST
description: The threegame sweep of the Atlanta Braves, following fivegame loshig streak, has done wonders for the Mets' morale. That was evident dur ing a relaxed workout Joe Pignatano, one of the club's coaches, held yesterday for 12 players at Shea Stadium.

title: Colonel Says Every Large Combat Unit in Vietnam Has a Mylai
description: FORT MEADE, Md., May 24 (UPI)Col. Oran K. Hender son, the highest ranking officer still charged in the Mylai mas sacre, said today that every large American combat unit in Vietnam had committed similar atrocities.

title: Actions by Mills Hint He Has '72 Objective
description: RALEIGH, N. C., May 24  Can a 62yearold smalltown Arkansas lawyer convert a powerful position in Congress into a pivotal role in Demo cratic Presidential policies next year?

title: Two Democratic Assemblymen File Suit Over Censored Mail
description: ALBANY, May 24  Two Democratic Assemblymen charged today that letters they were sending to their constit uents at state expense were censored by workers in the Republicancontrolled Assem bly's mailroom.

title: Dean Acheson: On Winding Down
description: The present debate about the Presi dent's intentions regarding troop with drawals from Vietnam arises from what he has said rather than from what he has done. The logic of the facts is plain. When Mr. Nixon an nounced the beginning of troop with drawals, the authorized troop strength in Vietnam was 549,000; actual troop strength probably a few thousand less. Withdrawals actually made since that time, plus the 100,000 announced by the President to be made by December 31, 1971, will amount to 365,000, leav ing a remainder from authorized. strength of about 185,000 in Vietnam. The average withdrawal rate over the thirty months of the operation has been 12,000 per month.

title: TRUST SUIT NAMES UNITED AIRCRAFT
description: WASHINGTON, May 24The Justice Department charged to day that United Aircraft Corpo ration had attempted illegally to monopolize the research and development of fuel cells, such as those used in the Gemini and Apollo Spacecraft.

title: S.E.C. Bids Brokers Study 3 Planned Rule Changes
description: WASHINGTON, May 24The Securities and Exchange Commission urged leaders of the securities industry today to study and consider the combined impact of three major planned changes in the rules that brokerage firms live by stricter net capital require ments; carrying mandatory reserves against customers' cash and segregation of their securities, and the anticipated change in sales commission. Chairman William J. Casey, in particular, emphasized the combined impact of the three changes in two separate meet ings with securities industry leaders that took the entire day.

title: SCHOOLS IN NEWARK SHORT $2.1MILLION
description: NEWARK, May 24  The Newark Board of Education said today it was short $2.1 million to complete the fiscal year ending June 30.

title: Consul Buried hi Tel Aviv
description: TEL AVIV, May 24Efraim Elrom, the Israeli ConsulGen eral in Istanbul who was kid napped and murdered by gun men of the Turkish People's Liberation Army, was buried here today in a military ceme tery with full honors.

title: CATHRYN BALLINGER GIVES SONG RECITAL
description: There were a few songs on Cathryn Ballinger's Carnegie Recital Hall debut program Sun day night  a charming folk carol by Eric Thiman called The Birds, for instance, and several spirituals  that the young California mezzo per formed with complete convic tion. She has a dark, naturally appealing voice, she sings on pitch and with good diction and in comparatively unde manding pieces she can make a pleasant impression.

title: Macy's Increases Profit In Quarter on Peak Sales
description: A sharp pickup in consumer buying over the April quarter of 1970 was responsible for increased earnings reported yesterday by three major re tail chains, including R. H. Macy & Co. Inc.

title: Nixon Aide in Albany
description: ALBANY, May 24In an ef fort to determine whether the state and New York City would reecive additional Federal funds this year, Governor Rockefeller met tonight with a representa tive of President Nixon and four members of the New York Con gressional delegation.

title: Centennial of Commune Is Nearing End in Paris
description: PARIS, May 24The centen nial of the Paris Commune is coming to an end this week with the embers of ancient class hatreds still glowing.

title: Amex Seat Price Down
description: A membership on the Ameri can Stock Exchange yesterday was sold for $130,000, down $5,000 from the previous sale. Seats on the exchange current ly are quoted at $105,000 bid and $135,000 asked.

title: INSPECTION UNIT FOR POLICE URGED
description: Charging that the greatest failure of the police is to police themselves, a Yale sociologist recommended yesterday the for mation of a national inspection service to prosecute corrupt and criminal policemen.

title: Agencies Get Protest
description: PRAGUE, May 24 (Reuters) Western news agencies here received a protest letter today charging that delegates to the congress had not been demo cratically chosen and that they could not represent Czecho slovak Communists or the pub lic at large.

title: TV: 3 Programs Stress the Consequences of Change
description: Among the better television fare in the past several days, a familiar theme weaving through several very differ ent presentations has been changephysical in the de cay of a magnificent city, sociological change in the lives of coal miners and tech nological change in the art of a choreographer. It's a theme obviously wellsuited to the TV documentary.

title: Engelhard Charged in Suit
description: NEWARK, May 24A $200 million suit against the Engel hard Minerals and Chemicals Corporation, a major proces sor of precious metals, was filed here today by a New Jer sey commodities dealer and two Investors.

title: Shop Talk
description: Provocative clothes are what Lederer de Paris has labeled its new French and Italian imports and they ob viously are designed to pro voke both comment and second glances. The clothes, in a bitter chocolate shade of suede, or in various tones of brown leather, are shaped for the young and lithe but will un doubtedly be worn by the un inhibited of all ages. Perhaps the most eyecatching of the de signs is what most people would refer to as an acces sory. It is, in fact, a wide, nailheadstudded leather belt decorated with petalshaped silver pendants. Lederer calls it a gladiator skirt and sug gests it he worn over a black body stocking. Either way, it's $49.50.

title: OBSERVER
description: WASHINGTON, May 24The great American failure is known to all of us. We Iive with it every day of our lives and accept it as such an inescapable curse of American life that we do not even think to complain about it. I refer, of course, to our national failure, des pite nearly 400 years of living on this continent, to solve the question of what to drink with a meal.

title: RICHFIELD TO SELL STATIONS IN SOUTH
description: The Atlantic Richfield Coni pany said yesterday that it in tends to sell some of its mar keting properties in the South and Southwest. The company said the move was one of sev eral it would make in an effort toward increasing profitabil ity.

title: Hoover Praises Mrs. Mitchell And Comments on Critics, Too
description: WASHINGTON, May 24  J. Edgar Hoover, the director of the Federal Bureau of In vestigation, made one of his rare public appearances tonight in honor of Mrs. John N. Mitch ell, the wife of his boss and one of the most lovable girls' I've ever met.

title: Mopac Orders Rail Cars
description: ST. LOUIS, May 24 (UPI) The Missouri Pacific Railroad said today it had ordered 335 freight cars costing more than $6million. The order is being handled by a unit of Pullman, Inc:, and the Pacific Car and Foundry Company. The railroad also ordered 30 cabooses from International Car Company.

title: James Cox Brady Dead at 63; Led State Racing Association
description: SUMMIT, N. J., May 24  James Cox Brady, the financier and horseman who served as chairman of the New York Rac ing Association for eight years, died today in Overlook Hospital here. His age was 63. He lived in Far Hills.

title: City's Business Role Stressed; Printing Industries Unit Elects
description: New York's continuing pro gram to increase its industrial and commercial facilities, to improve transportation and to attend to the housing problem will keep the city as the prime business center of the world, Ralph C. Gross, president of the Commerce and Industry Associ ation, said here last night.

title: JUSTICES REJECT A BID BY DE SAPIO
description: WASHINGTON, May 24 (AP)  The Supreme Court rejected, 6 to 2, today an appeal by Car mine G. De Sapio, the former Tammany Hall leader, on his bribery conspiracy conviction.

title: Chrysler to Close Plant
description: DETROIT, May 24 (AP)  Chrysler Corporation an nounced today that it would close its Los Angeles assembly plant permanently at the end of the current model year. The 39yearold plant employs 1,200 workers. Chrysler said the plant was being closed because changes in the shipping of new cars had made the Los Angeles uneconomical.

title: News Analysis
description: ALBANY, May 24One plus one equals two. But not neces sarily when politicians start adding and subtracting budg ets. The current haggling be tween the Rockefeller and Lind say administrations over the size of the city's budget gap is a case in point. The Lindsay administration has been insist ing that the pro posed city budget for the fiscal year starting July 1 has a gap between out go and income of $1,1billion. The Rockefeller ad ministration contends, with lit tle public substantiation, that the Mayor is fudging and that the gap is really $400million less than he says it is.

title: JAMES HORNBECK, WROTE ON DESIGN
description: DARIEN, Conn., May 24 James S. Hornbeck, an archi tect and a former senior editor of Architectural Record, a pro fessional magazine, died yes terday at his home, 18 Grana ston Lane, after a long illness. He was 63 years old.

title: MRS. HENRY BRADY
description: Mrs. Gertrude M. Donohue Brady, widow of Henry Brady, a prominent real estate man and appraiser, died yesterday in Columbus Hospital. She was 85 years old and lived at 610 Park Avenue.

title: Celestial Choral Ensemble Offers The Magic Flute
description: The Celestial Choral En semble of the Blind, led by Hilda Murray, gave a special English version of Mozart's The Magic Flute Sunday night at Town Hall.

title: Associated Press Writer Wins 1970 Medical Award
description: CHICAGO, May 21 (AP)  Frank Carey of The Associated Press has berm named winner of the 1970 Medical Journalism Award in the newspaper field by the American Medical Asso ciation for his fivepart series on Man's Common Ills.

title: Article 4  No Title
description: WASHINGTON, May 24 State Department officials said today they doubted that Mr. Trezise had expressed any for mal United States desire for an upward revaluation of the yen. Apart from that, they had no comment. There is no doubt of the belief held in the Govern ment, including at the highest levels, that the yen is under valued.

title: Suit Is Filed to Force Ban on Bridge on L.I.
description: The city of Rye filed suit yesterday charging Governor Rockefeller and state legisla tors with illegally blocking enactment of a bill to pre vent construction of the con troversial RyeOyster Bay Bridge across Long Island Sound.

title: Belgian Violin Competition Is Won by Miriam Fried
description: Miriam Fried, a 23yearold Israeli violinist who has been studying and performing in this country since 1965, won first prize in the finals of the Queen Elisabeth of Belgium violin competition in Brussels Satur day night.

title: VASQUEZ DEFEATS BORGES AT FORUM
description: Davey Vasquez of the Bronx, unleashing a strong, sharp at tack, cut both of Arlindo Borges's eyes to score a techni cal knockout over the Brazilian in defending his North Amer ican bantamweight champion ship in a scheduled 12rounder last night in the Felt Forum.

title: Renault Strike Ending
description: PARIS, May 24 (Reuters)  A strike that has crippled France's biggest car manufacturer for more than three weeks ended today with a returntowork vote by employes at the big Renault plant at Le Mans, west of here.

title: Industry Fails to Blight Chinese Paradise
description: HANGCHOW, China, May 22 This lovely garden city em bracing the ethereal West Lake has been transformed into a major industrial complex.

title: COCOA FUTURES DECLINE IN PRICE
description: Prices of cocoa futures were the lowest yesterday for any session since November, 1966, when prices ranged as low as 2.1.50 cents a pound. Yester day's low was 21.75 cents a pound on the July contract.

title: William Lawlor Jr. Named Channel 11 News Director
description: William T. Lawlor Jr, man ager of news and news opera tions for WPIXTV since March, 1970, has been named the sta tion's news director, it was an nounced yesterday by Lewis W. Brown, Channel 11's vice presi dent of news.

title: ExSenator Dodd Is Dead at 64; Censured in 1967 by Colleagues
description: Thomas J. Dodd, former Democratic Senator from Con necticut and one of six men in the Senate's history to be cen sured by that body, died at his home in Old Lyme, Conn., yesterday, apparently of a heart attack. He was 64 years old.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Drumtop Wins on Belmont Turf
description: A decisive triumph by James B. Moseley's Drumtop in the $32,600 Edgemere Handicap and an Uncle Sam daily dou ble payoff of $815 marked the start of the 30day Belmont Park spring meeting yesterday.

title: City Says a Cooperative Barred Applicant Because He Was Jew
description: The city's Commission on Hu man Rights charged in State Supreme Court yesterday that a prospective buyer of a co operative apartment on East 72d Street was barred from making the purchase because he is a Jew.

title: CITY AGENCY SUED ON A HOUSING PLAN
description: A suit was filed yesterday challenging the city's refusal to approve plans to build a hous ing development that would include apartments for lowin come families in the Riverdale section of the Bronx.

title: Davis Case Is Delayed Again as CoDefendant Challenges Judge as Prejudiced
description: SAN RAFAEL, Calif., May 24  Pretrial hearings involving, Angela Davis, the black activist who is charge with murder, kidnapping and criminal con spiracy, were halted again to day by Ruchell Magee, her Co defendant.

title: 4 Jews, All Zionists, Go on Trial in Riga for AntiSoviet Activity
description: MOSCOW, May 24Four So viet Jews went on trial today in Riga, the capital of Soviet Latvia, They were charged with organized antiSoviet activity and transmitting antiSoviet propaganda to Israel.

title: Podgorny Due in Cairo Today
description: CAIRO, May 24  Vcolai V. Podgorny, the Soviet thief of state, is to arrive in Cairo to morrow afternoon for talks with President Anwar elSadat and other Egyptian officials, it was announced here today.

title: Navy's F14 Program Gets Back in Air
description: CALVERTON, L. I., May 24 Five months after a crash de stroyed the Navy's first F14 fighter on its second flight, a sister plane got the program back in the air today.

title: SPENDING CUT ASKED BY URBAN COALITION
description: WASHINGTON, May 24 (UPI)  The Urban Coalition, saying the best way to im prove relations abroad was by providing a model of democ racy at home, called today for cutting military spending by up to $25billion a year over the next five years.

title: Advertising:
description: Doyle Dane Bernbach of West 43d Street acquired yesterday Cargill, Wilson & Acree of Atlanta, Birming ham, Charlotte and Rich mond. The publicly held, 22 yearold company has had five domestic offices and five in ternational offices but none in the Southeast, where C. W. & A., a $20million shop, has its strength.

title: Screen: Pink Narcissus
description: Pink Narcissus is a frag ile antique, a passive, tackily decorated surreal fantasy out of that preGayActivist era when homosexuals hid in closets and read novels about sensitive young men who committed suicide because they could not go on.

title: Article 3  No Title
description: RYE, N. Y., May 24Mrs. M. Stuart Roesler of Stanwich and Mrs. Allan V. Becker of West chester Country Club teamed for a 39, 3776 today at the 5,779yard, par36, 3874 Apa wamis Club course. It gave them a threestroke lead in the 36hole betterball tournament of the Women's Westchester and Fairfield Golf Association.

title: Turkey Hunts 9 in Murder of Israeli
description: ISTANBUL, Turkey, May 24 (AP)Martiallaw authorities put up posters throughout Is tanbul today with pictures of eight young men and a woman wanted in connection with the slaying of ConsulGeneral Efraim Elrom of Israel.

title: S.B.C. and BrokerDealer Will File a Consent Decree
description: BOSTON, June 29 (AP)The Securities and Exchange Com mission and a Boston broker dealer firm and its president agreed in United States District Court today to file a consent decree concerning an S.E.C. suit charging violations of the commission's net capital rule.

title: NEW MEXICO ASKS DELAY ON POWER
description: ALBUQUERQUE, N. M., May 24New Mexico state officials proposed today that there be a moratorium on controver sial Southwestern power devel opment because of attendant environmental problems.

title: OUTPUT OF STEEL SHOWS 0.6% DIP
description: Steel production dipped last week by 0.6 per cent, compared to output the week before, the American Iron and Steel Insti tute reported yesterday in Washington.

title: I.C.C. REJECTS PLEA OF BOSTON & MAINE
description: The Interstate Commerce Com mission announced yesterday that it had denied a petition by the trustees of the bankrupt Boston & Maine Railroad for in clusion in the Norfolk & West ern Railway system.

title: fetters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Murder of a Hostage
description: It is clear that the selfappointed Turkish People's Liberation Army, which murdered Israel's Consul Gen eral in Istanbul, has no support whatever from the Turkish people. And there is no evidence that the Revolutionary Army of the People, which abducted Britain's honorary consul in Rosario, gets any backing from the people Argentina.

title: Lava From Mount Etna Perils Another Village
description: SANT'ALFIO, Italy, May 24 (AP)Flaming boulders broke from a lava front today and rolled through orchards toward the village of For nazzo.

title: Bell System Prices Issue Of Bonds for 8.20% Yield
description: A Bell System bond issue was priced late yesterday afternoon to yield 8.20 per cent, the high est return on such an invest ment since midNovember.

title: Wood, Field and Stream
description: A short time ago in Costa Rica, an 80pound tarpon at tacked Lamar Underwood, editorinchief of Sports Afield magazine, and toppled him into the murky, fastflowing waters of the Parisimina River.

title: Obituary 2  No Title
description: GIVE FUN FOR SOMEONE. GIVE TO FRESH AIR FUND.

title: Planned Auto Union in Japan Is Hailed
description: DETROIT, May 24Leonard Woodcock, the president of they United Automobile Workers, said today that a planned merger of Japanese auto work ers into one big union in 1972 was the main hope of stopping the growth in the number of imported cars in the United States.

title: Notes on People
description: Dr. Richard Elliott Neu stadt is stepping down as the founding director of the John F. Kennedy Institute of Poli tics at Harvard, and will be replaced by Dr. Ernest R. Maly, dean of Harvard Col lege.

title: The Architect Knew the Needs Of Both ClientsHis Parents
description: BEAR CREEK, Pa.The first view of the Eric Q. Bohlins' house gives no hint of how it slopes down a ridge, curves to match a line of trees and hugs the land in an animallike sprawl. All that's visible from the road and driveway is a pair of handsome garage doors.

title: BOX MAKERS SUE PAPER COMPANIES
description: A $24million antitrust suit was filed yesterday in New York against a group of large paper manufacturers, alleging restraint of trade and monop oly in the field of corrugated containers.

title: MANTON COPELAND, BOWDOIN PROFESSOR
description: BRUNSWICK, Me., May 24 Dr. Manton Copeland, who re tired as Josiah Little Professor of Natural Science at Bowdoin College in 1947, died Saturday at the age of 89.

title: YAHYA AGAIN SAYS AIM IS CIVIL RULE
description: KARACHI, Pakistan, May 24 President Agha Mohammad Yahya Khan said today that he was determined to bring about an orderly transfer of power to a civilian government.

title: Yugoslavs Link Blowout To Jet Crash That Killed 78
description: BELGRADE, Yugoslavia, May 24 (Reuters)A commission in vestigating the crash last night of a chartered airliner in which 78 persons died said today the possible cause of the Crash was a tire blowout.

title: FLAG SHOW ARTISTS FINED $100 APIECE
description: Three artists who helped sponsor The People's Flag Show at Judson Memorial Church last November were sentenced yesterday to pay fines of $100 each or serve 30 days in jail for violating the state's flag desecration law.

title: Diplomatic Notes
description: WASHINGTON, May 24 The warming breezes from abroad are treating the Nixon Administration to its first big diplomatic thaw and causing the men around the President to toy with the immodest thought that they must he do ing something rightin rela tions with Moscow and Pe king, in promot ing ceasefire in the Middle East and perhaps even in managing the withdrawal from Southeast Asia. The pol iticians around the White House are especially pleased with the news about arms control and troop negotia tions and PingPong, which lets their President shine in his favorite role of statesman and should leave the Demo crats doubting that they can ever steal the peace issue from an incumbent.

title: U.S. Plans Borrowing In Eurodollar Market
description: WASHINGTON, May 24 The Treasury announced to day that it would borrow up to $500million of Eurodol lars held by foreign branches of United States banks to re place a maturing ExportIm port Bank issue of that amount.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Man in the News
description: President Agha Mohammad Yahya Khan seldom ventures out in public without a swag ger stick tucked under his arm, even when wearing business suit.

title: CHARLES C. WOODSON SR.
description: DEL RIO, Tex., May 24 (UPI) Charles Craig Woodson Sr., who owned newspapers in Oklahoma and Texas, died yes terday in the home of a son here. He was 74 years old.

title: Court Dismisses Vesco's S.E.C. Suit
description: NEWARK, May 24United States District Court Judge Reynier J. Wortendyke cleared the way here today for the Se curities and Exchange Commis sion to delve further into the intricate financial dealings of the International Control Cor poration, Robert L. Vesco, its 35yearold chairman, and In vestors Overseas Services, the giant mutualfund complex. Mr. Vesco is also chairman of I.O.S.

title: Sasson Khdouri Is Dead at 91; Iraq's AntiZionist Grand Rabbi
description: BAGHDAD, Iraq, May 24 (Reuters)  Rabbi Sasson Kh douri, spiritual leader of the Jewish community in Iraq for nearly half a century, died here today. He was 91 years old.

title: Japanese Volunteers in Borneo Town Strive to Aid Malaysian Development
description: KOTA BELUD, Sabah, Ma laysia, May 8If we Japanese take something away from a countrycopper or lumber or whatever  I think we should also give something back, said Yasuo Todo. That's one reason why I'm here.

title: A.C.F.L. Lists Four Clubs
description: The Atlantic Coast Football League will operate this year with clubs in four cities, Hart ford, Bridgeport, Conn., Nor folk, Va., and Roanoke, Va., league officials announced yes terday.

title: Dierking of 76ers Retires After 10 Seasons in N.B.A.
description: PHILADELPHIA, May 24 (UPI)Connie Dierking, who had played 10 years in the Na tional Basketball Association, announced his retirement today to devote more time to his busi ness and family in Cincinnati.

title: Perelman, Gone 80 Days, A Foggy Memory at Club
description: LONDON, May 24  S. J. Perelman, concluding his trip around the world in just 80 days, arrived back at Lon don's Reform Club in a chill ing rain and to a chillier re ception.

title: IN THE NATION
description: WASHINGTON, May 24An inter view with Xuan Thuy, North Vietnam's chief negotiator in Paris, by Anthony Lewis of The New, York Times, has made plain the essential illogic of Pres ident Nixon's stand on the socalled P.O.W. issue.

title: DURYEA PROPOSES $563MILLION CUT IN CITY'S BUDGET
description: Assembly Speaker Perry B. Duryea has offered a plan to cut $563million in expenditures from the Mayor's proposed $9.1billion budget and to im pose $162million in new city taxes, it was learned last night.

title: ANTA Plans Subsidies For Shows in Trouble
description: The American National Theater and Academy, the organization chartered by Congress that primarily has served as a theaterinforma tion service, is planning to come up with hard cash for financially troubled shows of artistic merit next season.

title: STRIKE CURB LAW URGED BY HODGSON
description: Secretary of Labor James D. Hodgson said yesterday that collective bargaining had been failing in transportation dis putes and urged Congress to take speedy action on President Nixon's emergency strike pro posals.

title: MRS. CHARLES BRODEK
description: Mrs. Hortense Brodek, wid ow of Charles A. Brodek, a New York lawyer, died Sunday at her home, 419 East 57th Street. She was 91 years old.

title: Bridge: Filipino Women Strike Blow For One Type of Liberation
description: MANILA, May 24  Al though the Precision Club in ternational touring team won its exhibition match against the Philippines here yester day by 105 international match points, the result was entirely satisfactory to some of the local players.

title: MORALES TRIUMPHS OVER TYLER ON MAT
description: Pedro Morales pinned Tarzan Tyler's shoulders last night in the featured heavyweight wres tling exhibition before 18,527 fans at Madison Square Garden. But Morales' victory was not the real highlight of the night, which marked the return of the Pretty Boy to wrestling in New York.

title: OTB Total at Yonkers' Opening Exceeds $270,000
description: Offtrack bettors had their first fling at picking horses at Yonkers Raceway yesterday. After a slow start they moved into high gear and bet more than they had a week before at Roosevelt Raceway.

title: Accounting Rule Hearing Opens Today
description: At 10 o'clock this morning, in the Hilton Room of the WaldorfAstoria Hotel, a two day public hearing is due to begin thatover the long run could produce a revolution in financial reporting by Ameri can business.

title: Roundup: Phils Beat Slumping Reds, 21 With Only 2 Hits
description: Sparky Anderson of the Cin cinnati Reds, addressing a sports forum in Philadelphia last week, said that there was nothing wrong with his team that a few victories wouldn't cure.

title: Reading Between Lines on Food Labels
description: WASHINGTONIf the con sumer movement gains as much momentum as its pro ponents wish, the supermar ket aisle may someday be as popular for reading as is the library.

title: ...and Balance on Pensions
description: An increasingly consequential element in New York City's fiscal squeeze is the cost of municipal pensions, now climbing toward onequarter of basic payroll. The expiring city budget provides $625 million for pensions, but the total would be at least $200 million greater it reflected funded benefits to which the city already has committed itself for teachers, clerks and other groups. The bill will be bigger still when the uniformed services complete negotiations for the higher pensions they seek.

title: Black Company Will Be Set Up for Kennedy Center
description: WASHINGTON, May 24 A national black repertory theater company will be es tablished here and housed in the new John F. Kennedy Center for the Performing Arts.

title: Laotian Positions Attacked
description: VIENTIANE, Loas, May 24 (AP)The Defense Ministry an nounced today that North Viet namese forces attacked two Government positions in the northern part of the country over the weekend.

title: Arms Race in Latin America?
description: President Nixon's bid to increase arms aid to Latin America will no doubt be welcomed by military men in the Latin capitals and in the Pentagon and by private American arms merchants. But it is not at all clear that the President's reversal of a fouryearold policy of restraint in providing arms to the southern hemisphere will advance American interests, as the Administration claims.

title: Article 2  No Title
description: RAVENNA, Ohio, May 24 (AP) Twenty persons arrested dur ing disturbances in Kent early Saturday pleaded not guilty to day in Ravenna Municipal Court and were freed on bonds of up to $100. Kent was quiet Satur day night and last night follow ing five consecutive nights of disturbances.

title: Pinched Cities Slash Services; Education and Amenities Suffer
description: DETROIT, May 24At a time when urban America is crying out for a better quality of life, city services of all kinds are be ing cut back and residents are being asked to pay more but get by with less.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Higgins Paces L.I. Bidders for U.S. Open Roles
description: EAST NORWICH, L. I., May 24Don Michael Higgins, a slim Texan who has been an assistant professional for only three weeks in the metropoli tan area, led the local qualifiers on Long Island today for the United States Open golf cham pionship.

title: Urban Talks Held in Indianapolis, a City With Hope
description: INDIANAPOLISSo intoxi cated is Indianapolis by con current celebrations that Mayor Richard G. Lugar found it ex pedient the other day to deny publicly that after May 31 the city would turn back into a pumpkin.

title: Brooklyn Store Owner Slain
description: Two holdup men shot and killed the proprietor of a men's clothing store yesterday after noon at 11 Graham Avenue, in the Williamsburg district of Brooklyn. The dead man was identified as Gilbert Gash, 41 years old, of 10419 113th Street, Richmond Hill, Queens. He was coowner of The Mad ison Shop.

title: Brooklyn Bridge Birthday Marked With Champagne
description: A bottle of champagne was smashed on the stones of one of the gothic towers of the Brooklyn Bridge yester day.

title: P.S.C. MEMBER ASKS POWER RATIONING
description: ALBANY, May 24A mem ber of the Public Service Com mission recommended today that no electricity be provided for buildings put under con struction or substantial modifi cation after July 1 in New York City or Westchester until Con solidated Edison is assured of adequate supplies.

title: Kahane Agrees to Curtail Brooklyn College Activities
description: Rabbi Meir Kahane agreed yesterday that he and mem bers of his militant Jewish De fense League would refrain from disruptive activities at or near Brooklyn College. Trouble in volving black and white stu dents erupted on the campus there recently when Rabbi Ka hane and his followers visited the school.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: WASHINGTON, May 24 (AP) Senator William Proxmire, Democrat of Wisconsin, said today the Air Force was try ing to hoodwink the Ameri can people, into paying for a multibillion dollar fleet of new bombers when it could make existing bombers just as effective,

title: Reagan and Women On Welfare Trade Shouts on Award
description: SACRAMENTO, Calif., May 24 (UPI)Gov. Ronald Reagan engaged in a shouting match tonight with welfare recipients who tried to give him an award naming him the higest paid welfare recipient in the state.

title: Petrosian Gains in Chess As Huebner Withdraws
description: Robert Huebner of West Ger many, citing frayed nerves, withdrew yesterday from the quarterfinals to determine the challenger for the world chess championship. His opponent, Tigran Petrosian of the Soviet Union, was declared the win ner of the match, in Seville, Spain, The Associated Press re ported.

title: ASHE AND RICHEY VICTORS IN FRANCE
description: PARIS, May 24 (AP)Amer ica's three top hopesArthur Ashe, Stan Smith and Cliff Richey  won first  round matches today in the $95,000 French open tennis champion ships. Five United States men and five women advanced in the second tournment of the tennis grand slam.

title: Treasury Bill Rates Rise at Weekly Sale
description: WASHINGTON, May 24 Yields on United States Treasury bills rose in the Government's weekly com petitive sale today of these shortterm securities.

title: Garr, at. 379, Oli AllStar List; Needs WriteIn to Make Team
description: Ralph Garr not only has taken Rico Carty's place in left field for Atlanta, but also has succeeded him as the season's early sensation who must rely on writein ballots to make the AllStar team.

title: Duke's Wheeler Decides on 880, Deferring Challenge to Liguori
description: Bob Wheeler answered a series of multiplechoice ques tions during a final exam in economics yesterday, then said he had made another choke, the 880yard run over the mile, for the I. C. 4A track and field champion ships this weekend.

title: Peking Renews Advocacy of Revolution
description: HONG KONG, May 24Re cent Chinese moves for a thaw in relations with nonCommu nist countries have been ac companied in the last few days by a splurge of propaganda from Peking reaffirming its commitment to revolution, par ticularly in Southeast Asia.

title: Theater: Bad Play With Good Parts
description: Most bad plays are indel ibly bad. They have badness like a taint, and everything is touched by it. From the first curtain the sensitive soul starts to cringe and turn up at the edges. But there are some fewthat unlucky few bad plays that have a touch of good in them. This kind of bad play, written by El liott Caplin, opened last night at the Gate Theater. It was called, for some unfathomable reason, Any Resemblance to Persons Living or Dead . . . It is the kind of title danger ously easy for critics to make jokes about, but I desist.

title: Pressmen Elect Head
description: William J. Kennedy was elected president of the Press men's Union, Local 2, in ballot ing at the Times Square Motor Hotel last night. Other officers elected were: James M. Griffin, vice president; James J. Maho ney, secretarytreasurer; Patrick S. Loughlin, recording secre tary, and John O'Leary, ser geantatarms.

title: Advertising:
description: About the same time that Ed Spitzer was asked by Arnold Bakeries to give it some consultation on its ad vertising, Stan Bogan was getting the same kind of re quest from the Birmingham Arms Company, marketers of BSA and Triumph motorcy cles.

title: Sports of The Times
description: The owners, chief executive officers and other deep thinkers who handle the affairs of the 26 teams in the National Football League are currently in town for their spring meetings. There will be no scrimmaging or other heavy assignments because nothing of grave consequence is scheduled. Hence, the likelihood is that the only strain on any muscle will be lifting glasses for predinner cocktails.

title: Chrysler Sets Plant Closing
description: DETROIT, May 24 (UPI)  The Chrysler Corporation an nounced today plans to shut down its Los Angeles auto mobile assembly plant per manently at the end of the cur rent model year, probably some time in late July. Chrysler said the plant, which has 1,200 work ers, was obsolete.

title: Market Place: Market Advice For Little Man
description: Let's assume that you're in the market again and you've begun to worry a little about the possibility that the mar ket is topping out.

title: Finals for the Examiners?
description: The battle in Albany over the future of the Board Examiners once again follows a familiar script. Educa tional experts have warned for over twenty years that civil service rigidity in teacher licensing reinforces the status quo and reproduces the system in the image its most conservative practitioners. But in the end, the insiders' lobby has regularly defeated all recommenda tions for change by conjuring up a terrifying picture patronage, pork barrel and corruption as the only alter native to the examiners.

title: Executive Changes
description: The New York Soci ety of Security Analysts, Inc., announced yester day the election of Stan ley A. Nabi as president of the 4,850member or ganization. Mr. Nabi, a chartered financial ana lyst, is a general part ner of Schweikart & Co. and is the editor of The Analyst, his firm's finan cial publication. Five other officers were elect ed at the society's an nual business meeting, they are: David Norr, partner in charge of re search, First Manhattan Company, was named executive vice president; Sterling McKittrick Jr., special partner, Ingalls & Snyder and Peter J. De Angelis, partner in charge of research, Hornblower & WeeksHemphill, Noyes were appointed vice presidents. Arthur Carlson, vice president, Irving Trust Company to secretary and Eugene A. Levin son, office of the comptroller, City of New York, as treasurer.

title: COMMONS HEARS HEATH ON MARKET
description: LONDON, May 24Prime Minister Heath told the House of Commons today that the way was now open for a new era of unity, peace and prosperity in Western Europe.

title: Negro Is Killed on Fourth Night of Violence in Chattanooga After 2,000 National Guardsmen Move
description: CHATTANOOGA, Tuesday, May 25  A black man was killed last night as racial vio lence and civil disorders con tinued despite the presence of 2,000 National Guard troops and a rigidly enforced curfew.

title: Medina Rearing Delayed
description: FORT McPHERSON, Ga., May 24 (UPI)The pretrial hearing for Capt. Ernest L. Medina, charged with overall respon sibility in the Mylai massacre, was postponed today because the military judge was conduct ing a courtmartial in Hunts ville, Ala, The new tentative day for the hearing was set for June 16.

title: Miss Valerie Elbrick Wed in Paris
description: WASHINGTON, May 24 C. Burke Elbrick has an nounced the marriage of his daughter, Valerie Burke El brick, to Lawrence Byrne Hanlon. The ceremony took place Saturday afternoon in the Eglise de Saint Joseph in Paris.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Bangkok Repeats Denial Thai Troops Are in Laos
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, May 24 (AP)Deputy Foreign Minister SaNga Kittikachorn reiterated Thailand's official position to day that there are no Thai troops in Laos.

title: Italian Right's Flag Day Seems Failure
description: ROME, May 24A Flag Day sponsored by rightwing groups that say they support the armed forces passed almost un noticed today and, on the sur face, seemed a failure.

title: Communist Chiefs Gather For Prague Party Parley
description: PRAGUE, May 24 (AP)  Leonid I. Brezhnev of the Soviet, Union and other Communist party leaders assembled in Prague today for a Czecho slovak party congress that was postponed nearly three years by the Sovietled Invasion.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: R. KEITH CANNAN, MEDICAL CHEMIST
description: WASHINGTON, May 24Dr. R. Keith Cannan, former chair man of the chemistry depart ment at the New York Uni versity College of Medicine, died here today of cancer. He was 77 years old.

title: NICKLAUS ENROLLED FOR WORLD CUP GOLF
description: PALM BEACH GARDENS, Fla., May 24 (AP) Jack Nick laus, the Professional Golfers' Association champion, signed today to represent the United States in the 19th World Cup international golf tournament.

title: S.C.C. Orders Suspension Of A. L. Stamm Concern
description: WASHINGTON, May 24 (AP) The Securities and Exchange Commission ordered today a 30 day suspension of the registra tion of A.L. Stamm & Co. New York, for alleged violation of Federal securities laws.

title: City HomeRule Messages On Budget Sent to Albany
description: The City Council sent home rule messages yesterday to the Legislature asking it to em power Mayor Lindsay to bor row $370million to balance his current budget and to furlough employes in quasicity agencies over which he has no control.

title: Front Page 1  No Title
description: EVERY week, more than 26,000 Jobs are advertised in The New York Times. See the Employment Columns today. Advt.

title: Penn Central and Banks Reach Loan Pact
description: The trustees of the Penn Central Transportation Com pany yesterday reached agree ment in principle for settling a $300million loan that the rail road's own management nego liated with a group of 53 banks in April, 1969, 15 months be fore the railroad became bank rupt. The lead bank is the First National City Bank of New York.

title: KEY SUSPECT HELD IN 2 POLICE DEATHS
description: An informant in narcotics cases led the police yesterday to the capture of a man they called a prime suspect in the slaying of two patrolmen last Friday night.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Births
description: LEIGHMr. and Mrs. David Leigh (neo Irene Woltf) of New York announce the birth of their daughter, Serena Jean, at LyingIn Hospital, March 20,

title: Reaction to Movie by Nicholson Is Most Violent of Cannes Fete
description: CANNES, France, May 24 The third and final United States entry at the Cannes Fes tivalDrive, He Said, di rected by Jack Nicholsonset off the most violently negative reaction from an audience at the festival this year. As the lights came up, the people hooted, screamed and whistled. Some got to their feet and waved indignant fists toward where Nicholson and his two actors, William Tepper and Michael Margotta, were seated.

title: SANITATION WORKER ARRESTED IN INQUIRY
description: Robert K. Ruskin, Commis sioner of Investigation, an nounced the arrest yesterday of a 39yearold Department of Sanitation employe in connec tion with an inquiry into com plaints that some sanitation men were using their trucks for private carting in the Bronx.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
description: May 25, 1971 TRUSTEESHIP COUNCIL Meets at 11:00 A.M.

title: Dr. David Nunn Dies at 63; Aide of State Dental Society
description: Dr. David E. Hunn, treasurer of the Dental Society of the State of New York since 1957, died Sunday in Troy, N. Y., where he lived. His age was 63.

title: Geographic Names
description: WASHINGTON, May 24 (AP)  The Food and Drug Administration announced to day a truthinlabeling rule for foods with geographic names.

title: House Panel to Stress Pollution Fight
description: WASHINGTON, May 24 Representative John A. Blatnik pledged today that the House Public Works Committee would place more emphasis on the country's water pollution con trol problems.

title: Virginia Primary Delay
description: RICHMOND, May 24 (AP) A special fourjudge Federal court ordered today that Vir ginia's scheduled June 8 pri mary elections be delayed until Sept. 14. The state legislature was directed to redraw fed erally rejected legislature reapportionment plans by June 15.

title: JAPANESE SAY U.S. ASKS REVALUED YEN
description: TOKYO, May 24 (AP)The Kyodo News Service said Gov ernment sources reported today that the United States had asked Japan to revalue its yen currency apparently in an effort to decrease the American trade deficit with Japan.

title: Highway Bonds Approved Alter Changes in Albany
description: ALBANY, May 24  The Legislature approved today Governor Rockefeller's pro posed $2.5billion transporta tion bond issue after holdout members succeeded in altering some road plans and giving a slight edge to mass transporta tion over highways.

title: MISS CONNA ADIOS TRIUMPHS IN 2:00
description: YONKERS, May 24A 2 minute mile, ever welcome at a harness racing oval, marked tonight's opening of the second of three home stands at Yonk ers Raceway.

title: Equity Funding Corp. Says '71 Earnings Will Increase
description: The Equity Funding Corpo ration, a diversified financial services company, expects a substantial profit increase in 1971 over last year. I'm pre dicting a 15 to 20 per cent in crease, Stanley Goldblum, president and chairman, said yesterday at the annual meet ing in Los Angeles, where the company has Its headquarters.

title: DISMISSAL IS SOUGHT OF MAYDAY CHARGES
description: WASHINGTON, May 24 (UPI) The American Civil Liberties Union asked a United States District Court today to dismiss misdemeanor charges against thousands of persons arrested during antiwar demonstrations the first week of this month.

title: Air Operations Continue
description: SAIGON, May 24 (AP) United States aircraft carried on normal operations out of Camranh Bay today although fires burned more than 18 hours after the enemy attack.

title: F.D.A. Approves the Sale Of New Tuberculosis Drug
description: WASHINGTON, May 24 The Food and Drug Adminis tration has approved for pre scription sale a new antibiotic drug called rifampin to aid in the treatment of tuberculosis.

title: Reason's Role in Albany...
description: Behind closed doors in Albany, secluded even from representatives of the Lindsay administration, members of the State Legislature have been hammering out the details of New York City's tax package. None of the principal characters in this tightly curtained drama are from the city; in fact, they respond to upstate or anticity, suburban constituencies. None really know the city's budgetary requirements.

title: Reserve Is Viewed Studying Tightening On Dollar Outflow
description: PARIS, May 24The Federal Reserve Board is considering tightening controls over the outflow of dollars, qualified American sources said today.

title: Computer Suit Is Filed
description: Computer Synectics, Inc., a privatelyheld Californiabased computer products concern said it has filed an antitrust suit against the International Busi ness Machines Corporation charging I.B.M. with attempting to drive it out of business.

title: High Court Curbs Penalties for Uninsured Drivers
description: WASHINGTON, May 24The Supreme Court declared uncon stitutional today state finan cial responsibility statutes that revoke the drivers' licenses of unlinsured motorists who are involved in accidents, regard less of whether they were at fault.

title: Hoffa Suit Seeks Freedom
description: CHATTANOOGA, May 24 (AP)  An attorney for James R. Hoffa, president of the teamsters, filed a civil action today asking that Hoffa's jury tampering conviction be set aside because of what was termed false testimony by a key Government witness.

title: 30 Arrested After Outbreak At Coast Air Force Base
description: TRAVIS AIR FORCE BASE, Calif., May 24 (AP)About 500 persons were reported involved in a disturbance at this North ern California base tonight. A barracks was set afire and at least 30 persons were arrested.

title: ERIK H. HUNEKER
description: WASHINGTON, May 24 Erik H. Huneker, long active in the theatrical scenery business, died May 4 at his home here, after a long illness. He was 77 years old.

title: B.T.B. Meeting Told Divesting Of Drilling Unit Would Aid Net
description: Stockholders of the B.T.B. Corporation were told yester day that the ailing conglom erate would soon be doing nothing but making money.

title: Berrigan Case Called a Social Threat
description: HARRISBURG, Pa., May 24 The Justice Department attor ney who is prosecuting con spiracy charges against the Rev. Philip F. Berrigan and seven others, indicated today that the Government considered this case a more serious threat than the activities of organized crime.

title: NIXON SUPPORTED ON CAMPAIGN GIFTS
description: WASHINGTON, May 24  The Nixon Administration's campaign against any limit on the size of political contribu tions won some important con verts in the Senate today.

title: Israeli Reds' Move Defeated
description: JERUSALEM, May 24 (Reu ters)The Knesset today over whelmingly defeated a Com munist  sponsored motion of noconfidence on the police han dling of a demonstration here last week by youths who call themselves the Black Pan thers.

title: Girls Choose Humanities, Boys Physics in Soviet
description: MOSCOW, May 24An eight year study of career prefer ences among Soviet high school graduates has shown a marked trend in favor of engineering and the physical sciences a mong boys and the natural sci ences and humanities among girls.

title: Soviet Lofts Cosmos 422
description: MOSCOW, May 24 (UPI) The Soviet Union today launched Cosmos 422, an un manned earth satellite, into a wide elliptical orbit that car ried it as far as 633 miles from the earth. Tass, the Soviet press agency, said.

title: Murtaugh Switches Hospital for Tests
description: PITTSBURGH, May 24 (UPI) Danny Murtaugh, manager of the Pittsburgh Pirates, who must make another decision whether to continue his career, entered PresbyterianUniversity Hospital here today for inore tests.

title: GramblingMorgan Test Set
description: The New York Urban League announced yesterday that Sept. 11 had been set for the Gram bling CollegeMorgan College football game at Yankee Sta dium.

title: 4th Round of Missile Talks Will End Friday in Vienna
description: VIENNA, May 24The fourth round of the United States Soviet talks on the limitation of strategic arms, which began here March 15, will end Friday, it was announced today.

title: F.T.C. ASKED TO BACK HALEBERGDORF LINK
description: BroadwayHale Stores, Inc. the Los Angelesbased depart mentstore chain, announced yesterday that it had asked the Federal Trade Commission to approve the previously pro posed acquisition of the Berg dorf Goodman Company, a leading New York fashion spe cialty store.

title: Shavers Brings a Mellow Horn To New Series at the Hall Note
description: Charlie Shavers, whose jazz trumpet was the core of the memorable John Kirby Sextet and later sparked Tommy Dor sey's band in the 1940's, has been spending much of his time in Europe in recent years. Sun day he turned up at the Half Note, Hudson and Spring Streets, as the star of the first of a projected series of month ly Sunday afternoon jazz ses sions to be put on there by Oliver Jackson.

title: In Wake of Enemy Rocket Attack on Base Near DMZ
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Tuesday, May 25Enemy de molition experts crept into the huge American base at Cam rank Bay and blew up one and a half million gallons of avia tion fuel, the United States command announced yesterday.

title: MARKET ABSORBS ABROAD SETBACK
description: The stock market took it on the chin yesterday, absorbing a series of sharp jabs in another Blue Monday session.

title: All in the Family Takes First Place In Nielsen Ratings
description: Cinderella had nothing on Archie Bunker.

title: Cards Sign Pitcher, 19
description: ST. LOUIS, May 24 (AP)  The St. Louis Cardinals have signed Robert Kennedy, 19 years old, to a minor league contract. He is the son of Bob Kennedy, the club's director of player development, and a for mer major league infielder. The youngster, a righthanded pitch er, will be assigned to the Car dinals' Sarasota farm club in the Gulf Coast League.

title: Jobs Sought for Veterans
description: Mayor Lindsay announced yesterday the formation of a committee to help find jobs for veterans of the armed services, who, he said, were returning to the city at the rate of 50,000 a year. A joint Federal, state and local effort, the New York City Jobs for Veterans Committee, established a hot line tele phone number5632388for employers wishing to list jobs.

title: LINDSAY DEFENDS BUDGET ACCURACY
description: Mayor Lindsay scorned as utter nonsense yesterday an allegation by high sources in the Rockefeller administration that be was exaggerating the city's budget gap by at least $400million.

title: Black Panthers Are Sent Back to Cells After Mistrial
description: NEW HAVEN, May 24The sixmonth murder and kid napping trial of Bobby G. Seale and Mrs. Ericka Huggins ended in a mistrial for each of them today after a jury of seven whites and five blacks announced it was unable to reach a verdict on any of the nine charges in the case.

title: Drug Foes At Taft H.S. See Gains
description: The students who captured a Taft High School security guard who was allegedly pushing heroin have noticed a change in their school since the indictment of the guard by a Bronx County grand jury last week. Other youths whom they know to be sell ing heroin don't come around the school any more.

title: 15 Are Arrested and 11 Injured In FistSwinging City Hall Melee
description: A fistflailing, clubswinging, benchtoppling battle between demonstrators and policemen broke up a budget hearing yes terday at City Hall.

title: GTE SYLVANIA SETS COLOR TV PRICE RISE
description: The trend toward higher prices for color TV sets contin ued yesterday as GTE Sylvania, Inc., announced that prices on its new line would be up about 6 per cent over prices on com parable 1970 models.

title: BURGER TO APPEAR IN TV INTERVIEW
description: Chief Justice Warren E. Bur ger, who has been judiciously chary in his use of television, has agreed to an exclusive in terview with the American Broadcasting Company's Wil liam H. Lawrence.

title: PARK'S PARTY GETS BIG LEAD IN KOREA
description: SEOUL, South Korea, Wednesday, May 26President Chung Hee Park's Democratic Republican party was heading toward a stable majority in the new National Assembly today, according to early returns from yesterday's general elections.

title: Steel Falls On 6th Ave.; Man Killed
description: An eightton load of steel floor planks fell from a build ing under construction at the Avenue of the Americas and 42d Street yesterday, killing one construction worker and injuring another.

title: Spears, Amateur, Heads Open Qualifying With a 142
description: Local qualifying in the metro politan area for the United States Open golf championship was completed yesterday in Westchester and New Jersey. Monday's screening for the game's premier event resulted in 19 places being settled on Long Island.

title: Arias Predicts 2:27 for Canonero II
description: There was this horse gallop ing down the stretch yester day morning, and fans who had conic to the track to en joy Breakfast at Belmont walked to the rail and won dered. The boy riding the horse wasn't even using stir rups.

title: Fiscal PumpPriming
description: Economic Analysis

title: Kaunda Seeking to End Tribalism in Zambian Politics
description: LUSAKA, Zambia, May 19 President Kenneth D. Kaunda has moved vigorously to silence what he calls the dirty and cheap tribal Mafias that have brought four years of intense political infighting to this Cen tral African nation.

title: CRITICS SAY NIXON MISUSES JURIES
description: WASHINGTON, May 25  The antiwar movement intro duced a new tactic today as leaders of the militant May day Collective said that they were starting a concerted at tack on grand jury practices in the nation's judicial system.

title: Harlem School Will Honor A Reporter for The Times
description: Charlayne Hunter, Harlem bureau chief for The New York Times, has been named to re ceive a distinguished service award from Harlem Prepara tory School for her coverage of the school's activities.

title: 7 HELD AT TOMBS OVER SMUGGLING
description: Six persons accused of dis tributing narcotics and whisky inside the Manhattan House of Detention for Men were ar rested yesterday after author ities witnessed an alleged smug gling attempt outside the prison.

title: Notes on People
description: Senator Strom Thurmond has asked President Nixon to appoint Albert S. Watson, former Republican Represen tative from South Carolina, to the Court of Military Ap peals, and he has been told Mr. Watson would be ap pointed, subject to an F.B.I. sl.earance, a spokesman for Mr. Thurmond said yester day.

title: Sports of The Times
description: Tommy Prothro was serving as business manager of the Gadsden minor league baseball team and every fourth day he also took a regular turn on the pitching mound. By working in the front office he also could keep an eye on family investments, because Gadsden was one of four minor league clubs owned by his father, Doc Prothro, a onetime big league manager with the Phils.

title: Hill Fined $500 by P.G.A. For Actions at Fort Worth
description: MEMPHIS, May 25 (AP) Dave Hill has been fined $500 by the Tournament Players Di vision of the Professional Golf ers' Association for conduct unbecoming a professional golfer, The Associated Press learned today.

title: Novelist Conducts 57th Street Tour
description: The thin subterfuge by which Prof. Joseph Machlis had sought to hide his iden tity as the author of 57th Streela big novel about the concert industrywas perhaps only a little easier to penetrate than the identities in life of some of the char acters who people his fiction.

title: ExAide in Pentagon Lends His Support To Col. Henderson
description: FORT MEADE, Md., May 25 (AP)The Army colonel who made the first Pentagon inves tigation of the killings at Mylai 4 today questioned Col. Oran K. Henderson's ability to probe thoroughly the incident and carry out his normal duties as a combat brigade commander.

title: Italian Team Ends Strike to Oppose Cosmos Tonight
description: The Lanerossi soccer team of Italy will be at Yankee Stadium to play the New York Cosmos at 8 o'clock tonight, but only after a 30hour transAtlantic ordeal that involved a strike by its players for more money, sus pension of the team by the Italian Football Association and continuous negotiations.

title: The Troubled, Uneasy World of the Women in the Berrigan Case
description: Sister Elizabeth McAlister, 31, a mem ber of the Roman Catholic order of the Religious of the Sacred Heart of Mary, is under indictment with the Rev. Philip F. Berrigan and four others on Federal charges of plotting to kidnap Henry A. Kissinger, assistant to the President for national security affairs, and to blow up the heating system of Federal buildings in Washington, D. C. A member of the same order, Sister Jogues Egan, 52, was charged by the Government as being a coconspirator but was never indicted. Marjorie A. Shuman, 47, was a member of the Order of the Sisters of Notre Dame for more than 20 years and is also an unindicted alleged coconspira tor. All three women have been actively engaged in dialogues with college stu dents and alumni in New York in recent months.

title: J. BEN GOLDSMITH, L.I. ORTHODONTIST
description: LAWRENCE, L. I., May 25 Dr. J. Ben Goldsmith, an or thodontist here for many year until his retirement in 1966, died today in St. Joseph's Hos pital after a short illness. He was 8i years old and lived at 18 Holly Lane.

title: Dropped Passenger Trains Seen as Help to Santa Fe
description: Shareholders of the Santa Fe Industries, Inc., were told at the annual meeting yesterday that discontinuance of passen ger trains not included in the National Railroad Passenger Corporation will improve earn ings before extraordinary items by as much as 50 cents a share in 1971 and anywhere from 50 cents to $1 a share in 1972.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Market Place: Ecological Fight Hurting Holders
description: There is considerable con cern among shareholders who have been burned as a result of the leadfooted pace of administrative proceedings against widely held com panies.

title: judge Orders DeMartinos to Produce Lenore or Face Arrest
description: The adoptive parents of Baby Lenore were ordered yesterday by a State Supreme Court justice to produce the yearold child or face arrest for contempt.

title: Trinidad Leader's Party Wins All Parliament Seats in Election
description: PORT OF SPAIN, Trinidad, May 25 (Reuters)The Peo ple's National Movement of Prime Minister Eric Williams has won all 36 seats in Parlia ment for its fourth consecutive fiveyear term.

title: A Hobby to Some, Nostalgia to Others
description: The Collectors is an exhibition that will probably educate no one but will entertain practically everyone who has a taste for trivia. Nostalgia abounds in the collectionsfrom wellknown and not so wellknown per sonalitiesthat go on view today through July 14 at the Hallmark Gallery, Fifth Avenue at 56th Street. The show is open to the public, without charge, from 9:30 A.M. to 7 P.M. Monday through Saturday.

title: AUTO SALES DROP 3.9% FOR 10 DAYS
description: Newcar sales dipped 3.9 per cent in the midMay period de spite better showings by three of the nation's Big Four auto mobile makers, reports from Detroit yesterday indicated.

title: DR. CARL WITTKE, WROTE HISTORIES
description: CLEVELAND, May 25 (AP) Dr. Carl Frederick Wittice, dean emeritus of the graduate school of arts and sciences of Case Western Reserve Univer sity and author of 14 history books, died here yesterday. He was 78 years old.

title: Universal Studios Enters EducationalFilm Field
description: UNIVERSAL CITY, Calif. The enormous success of Kenneth Clark's Civilisa tion as a television series, as a subscription film series, and as a bestselling book has inspired a major effort at Universal City Studios to en ter the educational film busi ness with an ambitious pro gram of documentary movies on the history of the visual arts.

title: SENATE BARS CURB ON VIETNAM DUTY
description: WASHINGTON, May 25The Senate rejected today, 52 to 21, a proposal that would have pro hibited the assignment of draft ees to combat in Vietnam after the end of the year without their assent.

title: As Legislature Nears an End
description: The State Senate's resolution calling for its adjourn ment yesterday has been overrun by bitter budgetary disputes involving state and city officials and by a large amount of other unfinished business. The end of the 1971 session of the New York State Legislature, however, cannot be far away.

title: WASHINGTON
description: WASHINGTON, May 25For the time being the United States Govern ment is visibly pleased and the Soviet Government is obviously troubled by the political upheaval in Cairo and the emergence of President Sadat as the dominant figure in Egypt, but the struggle for power there is far from over.

title: Walker Cup Golf Begins Today in Scotland
description: ST. ANDREWS, Scotland, May 25A glance at the rec ord books would indicate no contest. Over the 50 years of Walker Cup history, the British golf team has only one victory in. 23 meetings with the United States.

title: Utility's Bonds Sell Well;
description: The New England Telephone and Telegraph Company's pace setting $200mill ion debenture issue, priced late Monday to yield 8.20 per cent, appeared pretty well sold to investors late yesterday afternoon.

title: Local School Units Get Power to Cat Experimental Plan
description: The city's Corporation Coun sel has ruled that decentralized community school districts can decide for themselves whether they want to continue the More Effective Schools project and certain other experimental school programs.

title: CAMPAIGN CURBS ON RICH FAVORED
description: WASHINGTON, May 25 The Senate Rules Committee struggled today with the prob lem of how to limit the amount of money a millionaire can in vest in his own campaign for public office without limiting the amount he can put into someone else's.

title: Silverprice Manipulation Denied by Engelhard Corp.
description: NEWARK, May 25 (AP)An official of the Engelhard Min erals and Chemical Corporation said today that a court suit alleging the company had at tempted to manipulate the price of silver was patently absurd and false.

title: Overseas Press Club Moving; May Go to TimeLife Building
description: The Overseas Press Club, long troubled by financial dif ficulties and dwindling mem bership, is moving from its 11 story building at 54 West 40th Street to smaller and less costly quarters.

title: Javits, in Saigon, Sees Need for $2Billion in Aid Yearly After Pullout
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, May 25Senator Jacob K. Dav its said today that South Viet nam would need at least $2 billion a year in economic and military support from the Unit ed States after American troops withdrew.

title: Court Upholds Conviction Of Fiedler and His Wife
description: BUFFALO, May 25 (AP)A judge upheld today the nar cotics convictions of Leslie A. Fiedler, author and literary critic, and his wife.

title: Waverly Hostess Tins Hudson Trot at Yonkers
description: YONKERS, May 25There never has been a winner of the triple crown for trotting fillies, nor will one be crowned this season. Egyptian Jody, having captured the first leg, the Lady Suffolk Trot at Roosevelt Race way, had no chance to add the Hudson Filly Trot at Yonkers Raceway tonight because of a lastminute scratch, traced to an accident during an earlier warmup.

title: City Is Planning Housing Over Bronx Rail Tracks
description: The city announced plans yesterday to build its largest public housing project in 10 years over railroad tracks in the Bronx, using a new steel construction technique devised at the Massachusetts Institute of Technology.

title: 2d Mafia RoundUp in Italy
description: MESSINA, Sicily, May 25 (Reuters)  The police today rounded up 16 more suspected Mafia bosses and said that they would be exiled immediately to the tiny island of Filicudi 25 miles off Sicily's northern coast. On May 17, the police shipped 16 to the island of Linosa, off the southern Sicilian coast sending two more later.

title: STOCK SURCHARGE MAY STAY IN PART
description: The Securities and Exchange Commission and the New York Stock Exchange appear to be working independently toward some of the same conclusions about the new level of sales commissions on stock transac tions that is in prospect for Wall Street.

title: Credithrift Financial Pact for Marian Pacific Among Acquisition Steps Taken by Variety of Companies
description: Merger News

title: SLAYING NEEDLESS, BLACK COURT TOLD
description: Seven witnesses testified last night that it had not been neces sary for two white policemen to kill a black knifewielder in ?? BedfordStuyvesant section of Brooklyn last week.

title: PRICES OF STOCKS CONTINUE TO WILT
description: Stock prices continued to wilt yesterday under the shadow of higher interest rates.

title: MORTON EXAIDE WINS HOUSE RACE
description: ANNAPOLIS, Ms., May 25 (AP)William O. Mills, a Re publican who is a former aide to Rogers C. B. Morton, was elected today to fill the House seat vacated by Mr. Morton when he became Secretary of the Interior.

title: Chinese City Greets First Foreigners in 20 Years
description: FANCHENG, China, May 19 Five gray cars with horns rasping drove right onto the platform of the railroad station here early today to pick up the first foreigners to visit this area deep in the Chinese in terior in more than 20 years.

title: Bertha Schaefer, an Art Dea?? And Interior Designer, 76, Dies
description: Bertha Schaefer, art dealer ??d interior designer, died of ??ncer Monday at Lenox Hill ??ospital. She was 76 years old ad lived at 400 East 58th reet.

title: Hartford Vote on Penalty
description: HARTFORD, May 25 (UPI) The Connecticut House of Rep resentatives today defeated bill to abolish capital punish ment on a rollcall vote of 71 91. An amendment to retain the death penalty for persons convicted of slaying policemen had been defeated earlier, 7988.

title: BLACKS ASK CALM FOR CHATTANOOGA
description: CHATTANOOGA, May 25 Squads of young Negroes, some of whom may have been in volved in previous disorders, filtered through housing proj ects in slum areas here tonight trying to restore calm after four night of racial violence.

title: What They'll Wear
description: Sketch released by White House yesterday of gowns to be worn by attendants at June 12 wedding of Tricia Nixon and Edward F. Cox. Designed by Priscilla of Boston, the gowns are of silk organdy in mint green and lilac, with hats in matching colors.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Eastman Chemical Plastic
description: Eastman Chemical Products, Inc., a unit of the Eastman Kodak Company, introduced a new line of high performance thermoplastic materials yester day designed for use in the ap pliance, automotive, consumer household, machinery and hard ware industries.

title: BRITISH SOLDIER DIES IN BELFAST BOMBING
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, May 25A British soldier died after a bombing attack tonight a few hours after Prime Min ister Brian Faulkner warned in the Parliament that soldiers could shoot on sight anyone acting suspiciously.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: ISTANBUL, May 25 (Reuters)  A strong new tremor was registered today near Gediz, where 1,000 people died in an earthquake last year. No infor mation on the tremor was avail able from the town, about 155 miles southeast of Istanbul.

title: Last Chance on the Adirondacks
description: How long does Governor Rockefeller plan to wait be fore letting his party leaders in the Legislature know that he wants action on the bill to create a State Adirondack Park Agency? His Temporary Commission on the Future of the Adirondacks made an irrefutable case for such an agency. The session may be over before the end of the week and the bill to establish it will get nowhere unless the Governor speaks up today.

title: GEORGE L. ABBOTT
description: PALMYRA, N. Y., May 25 (AP)George L. Abbott, former director of Garlock, Inc., in dustrial manufacturer, died to day in a nursing home at Nor wood, Mass. He was 81 years old.

title: Baseball Draft Dates Set
description: Baseball's free  agent draft will be conducted here June 8 and 9, Commissioner Bowie Kuhn said yesterday.

title: Student, 17, Confesses Setting a Fatal Fire in Jamaica
description: A 17yearold high school Student who sounded the alarm and then aided victims after a fire and explosion destroyed an apartment house in Ja maica, Queens, on May 14 has confessed to starting the blaze, the Fire Department reported last night.

title: 2 Shot in Bronx Tied to Atlanta Robbery
description: Two men shot to death two and a half weeks ago in the Bronx have been identified by the police as part of the gang that took at least $100,000 in cash and jewelry from boxing fans at a party after the Muhammad Ali Jerry Quarry fight last fall in Atlanta.

title: ARGENTINE GROUP PLAYS IN CAPITAL
description: WASHINGTON, May 25 Following the Louisville Or chestra's Constitution Hall con cert in the Fifth InterAmeri can Music Festival currently in progress here, a perplexed middleaged woman explained somewhat apologetically to a friend with her, Well, I had thought that since the com posers were LatinAmerican the music would be livelyyou know, like the things we heard when we were on the cruise.

title: Scribner Gives Plan to Assist Students Who Are Turned Off
description: The city school system is planning to open at least 10 alternative high schools this fall for youngsters who are turned off by regular pro grams, Chancellor Harvey B. Scribner announced yesterday.

title: Townsend of Business Week Is Given Louis Stark Award
description: Edward Townsend, an asso ciate editor of Business Week, was presented with the Louis Stark Memorial Award yester day for his contributions to public understanding of the col lectivebargaining process.

title: PROXMIRE URGES BAN ON CATTLE HORMONE
description: WASHINGTON, May 25 (AP)The Food and Drug Ad ministration is violating Fed eral law by allowing residues of a cancerinducing hormone to reach consumers, Senator William Proxmire, Democrat of Wisconsin, charged today.

title: Boat Basin Decked In Splendor for Gala
description: Everyone said Christina, don't do it! So, of course, Christina, who was the Countess Christina Paolozzi, is now Mrs. Howard Bellin, and has never been known to listen to advice under either name, went ahead and did it. A charity benefit.

title: Troops Parade in Amman
description: AMMAN, Jordan, May 25 (AP)Thousands of soldiers paradedthrough the streets of Amman today in Jordan's big gest military display since the 1967 war with Israel. The pa rade marked the end of month long celebrations of the 50th anniversary of the founding of Hashemite kingdom.

title: Talk of New Haven
description: NEW HAVEN  From the railroad station, past the neatly designed industrial parks, the most startling site is the Knights of Columbus Building.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: U.S. Denies It Urged Japan To Revalue the Yen Upward
description: WASHINGTON, May 25 (AP) A State Department spokes man said today reports that the United States had urged Japan to revalue the yen up ward were absolutely without foundation of any kind.

title: OBJECTIONS BY S.E.C. BALK VESCO LAWYER
description: NEWARK, May 25  The Securities and Exchange Com mission pursued its efforts in the Federal District Court here today to compel the Interna tional Controls Corporation and Robert L. Vesco, its 35yearold chairman, to tell what they know about their dealings with Investors Overseas Services, Ltd., the giant offshore mutual fund of which Mr. Vesco is also board chairman.

title: Advertising:
description: Starting Oct. 1 the seven TV stations operated by the Taft Broadcasting Company will allow only three prod ucts to be advertised on their 90second primetime com mercial breaks.

title: Other Side of the Dollar: Europeans Describe View
