Jones. The two men were shot down from behind while on patrol in Harlem. The con quest of hatred by love was the theme of the funeral serv ice here in the Roman Catho lic Church of St. Cyril and St. Methodius. Mayor Lindsay and Police Commissioner Patrick J. Murphy flew to gether by helicopter to this Suffolk County community for the hourlong service. A sixlane highway in front of the church became a river of blue and brass and silver as 3,700 uniformed men stood in the sun for, 90 minutes, their ranks stretching along 1,000 feet of pavement. Near ly 1,200 policemen and 40 friends and members of the slain man's family entered the church for a Mass of the Resur rection.

title: Chelsea Flower Show Blooms for 50th Time
description: LONDON, May 26For the 50th time, hordes of garden enthusiasts invaded the grounds of the Royal Hos pital in Chelsea yesterday for an annual tribute to the Brit ish national pastime.

title: Vietnam Pharmacies Barred to G.I.'s in Drug Fight
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, May 26  The U. S. military command has declared all Viet namese pharmacies off limits to American servicemen in South Vietnam.

title: Drug Manufacturers Accused Of Deceptions in Advertising
description: WASHINGTON, May 26 (AP) The Food and Drug Adminis tration says the same medicine frequently is advertised to con sumers as new to increase sales but is described to the F.D.A. as old to sidestep Fed eral clearance.

title: She Just Got Her Degree in History but the Waits Job as Cook
description: PITTSBURGHThousands of college students are getting their B.A.'s at this time of yearand having a devil of a time finding their first fulltime job. Rachel Schwartz, 21, whose spanking new history degree comes from Pitts burgh's CarnegieMellon University, is looking for work, but not in anything remotely connected with history. She wants to be hired as a cook.

title: A Reagan Welfare Cut Is Prohibited by Court
description: SACRAMENTO, Calif., May 26 (UPI)A Superior Court judge has prohibited the ad ministration of Gov. Ronald Reagan from cutting 27,500 families from the California welfare rolls.

title: Top South African Air Officers Among 11 Dead as 3 Jets Crash
description: JOHANNESBURG, South Af rica, May 26Several of South Africa's top Air Force officers were killed today when three jet planes crashed on the slopes of Table Mountain at Capetown.

title: POLLUTION LAWS WORRY INDUSTRY
description: WASHINGTON, May 26  American industry's increasing concern with the growing body of Federal antipollution laws and the need for better Govern ment and industry cooperation emerged today in a conference on pollution.

title: HANKER WARNS OF SCHOOL STRIKE
description: Albert Shanker, president of the United Federation of Teach ers, said yesterday that his union would have to use the ultimate weapon in Septem ber if class sizes were in creased and the $21million More Effective Schools pro gram was dropped.

title: Notes on People
description: First Leonard Bernstein was severely criticized for having held a fundraising gala for the Black Panthers. That got him in so much hot water that when he decided to hold a similar affair for the Rev. Philip F. Berrigan, the antiwar priest, he did it so decorously that it took two days for the public to find out.

title: Nixon Accused of Not Vigorously Enforcing Voting Rights Law
description: WASHINGTON, May 26 The Nixon Administration was accused by House Demo crats today of failing to pro vide vigorous enforcement of the Voting Rights Act and per mitting Southern states to di minish black political strength as a result.

title: SENATE REJECTS BIG PAY INCREASE FOR THE MILITARY
description: WASHINGTON, May 26  The Nixon Administration won a major victory today when the Senate rejected a massive increase in military pay and allowances.

title: Theater: Lenny Evokes Memory of an Angry Man
description: Lenny Bruce made obscen ity into a fine art and it killed him. What is obscenity: Loose and vulgar talk about human genitalia, or kids starving in ghettos, humorous celebrations of sexual inter course or men getting blown to pieces by grenades? Ob scenity is usually in the mouth of the listener.

title: Albany Passes Decontrol For Vacated Flats Here
description: ALBANY, May 26As angry city Democrats charged Gov ernor Rockefeller and Repub lican legislative leaders with doubledealing, the State Legis lature gave final approval to night to a bill that would end rent control on apartments in New York City when present tenants voluntarily vacated them.

title: REALTORS ACCUSE CITY RIGHTS CHIEF
description: Rexford E. Tompkins, presi dent of the New York City Real Estate Board, asserted yester day that continuous efforts by the real estate Industry to increase integration in housing had been blocked by the City Commission on Human Rights.

title: Front Page 1  No Title
description: EVERY week, more than 20,000 jobs are advertised In The New York Times. See the Employment Columms today. Advt.

title: F.B.I. Arrests 22 Accused of Helping Big Gambling Ring
description: Two women and 20 men were arrested by the Federal Bureau of Investigation yesterday on charges of participating in a gambling operation believed to have handled more than $45 million a year.

title: TV: Methadone May Hold the Key
description: Tonight at 10 o'clock WORTV (Channel 9) will present a halfhour documen tary called Methadone: Es cape From Heroin. Written and produced by Stanley Friedman, public affairs pro ducer for the station, the program ticks off various ob jections to the controversial question of methadone but its general approach strongly impies an endorsement of the drugtreatment program. In many of its parts, the docu mentary is good. Overall, unfortuiately, it's not good enough.

title: CHRYSLER'S OPTIONS CUT, AND PRICES RISE
description: DETROIT, May 26 (AP)The Chrysler Corporation, following the lead of the General Motors Corporation and the Ford Motor Company, announced today that it was making power steering and automatic transmissions standard on all its fullsized cars.

title: Advertising:
description: The president of the N.B.C. Television Network said yes terday that he sees an end to agency commissions on network television buys during this decade.

title: ' Barefoot Executive'
description: Clean is one thingit's a lot now, in factbut funny is another. And the Walt Disney outfit only gets medium mileage out of a live-action satire titled "The Barefoot Executive." In this genial but strained and arch frolic, the one real joke is not only "in" but it wears thin and even frantic. Does anybody out front really care about television-program ratingshow many people watch what?At any rate, not the chimpanzee who causes all the commotion here. He's a house pet, an avid TV fan who does wonders with pilot series, immediately spotting a stinker and a smash hit. A shrewd television company mail boy uses Raffles, the hairy wonder, in his climb up the executive ladder.Slapstick and downright infantile dialogue flatten the fun, with such people as young Kurt Russell, Joe Flynn, Heather North and Wally Cox striving mightily. We liked Raffles, especially draining a beer during commercials, giving a lippy raspberry to "Swan Lake" and jubilantly switching on a rootin'-tootin' Western. Say, who's behind all that programing anyway?

title: Hein and Yovicsin Get Awards
description: Undefeated Harvard's 2929 victory over Yale in 1968 and the 1931 Rose Bowl game, which Alabama won, 240, from Washington State were among the remember ances invoked yesterday as the Touchdown Club of New York honored John Yovicsin, retired Harvard coach, and Mel Hein, supervisor of of ficials for the National Foot ball League.

title: The Wine World's Velasquez: One Bottle Is Sold for $5,000
description: SAN FRANCISCO, May 26  Laurence H. Bender, 25 years old, went to his first wine auction today and came away one bottle heavier  and $5,000 lighter.

title: OLIVER WILLITS, 79, OF CAMPBELL SOUP
description: PHILADELPHIA, May 26 Oliver G. Willits, former board chairman of the Campbell Soup Company, died today, ap parently of a heart attack, at the Barclay Hotel, where he lived. He was 79 years old.

title: Western Union Strike Set
description: WASHINGTON, May 26 (AP) The United Telegraph Work ers said today the union had scheduled a nationwide strike for Monday against the West ern Union Telegraph Company in a wage dispute. I don't see any chance of getting it set tled. We don't think it can be settled, said the union's presi dent, E. L. Hageman.

title: Named in '70 Suit
description: YUBA CITY, Calif., May 26 (UPI)Court records in Marys ville showed that a year ago Mr. Corona and his brother Nat iividad were named in an $800, 000 damage suit filed by Jose R. Raya. Mr. Raya charged that he was severely beaten in Feb ruary, 1970, in Natividad's bar in a slum section.

title: F. C. C. Will Permit Competition In Microwave and Cable Fields
description: WASHINGTON, May 26  The Federal Communications Commission opened today new competitive era in he grow ing business of specialized mi ocrwave and cable services, field that the American Tele phone and Telegraph Company and the Western Union Cor poration have long monopol ized.

title: Ulster Chief Urges Catholics to Back Drive on Terrorism
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, May 26Prime Minister Brian Faulkner pleaded today with Roman Catholics in Belfast to break the pact of silence that has protected terrorists of the outlawed Irish Republican Army.

title: Births
description: LEIGHMr. and Mrs. David Leigh (nee Irene Wolff) of New York announce the birth of their daughter, serene Jean, at Lyingin Hosaital, May 20.

title: Wood, Field and Stream
description: Tournament time for big game fishing along the north ern reaches of the East Coast is near at hand.

title: CON EDISON LEASES NUCLEAR FUEL CORES
description: The Consolidated Edison Company announced yesterday the signing of an agreement to ease two nuclear fuel cores totaling $26.3million from C.N.A. Nuclear Leasing, Inc., a subsidiary of the C.N.A. Finan; cial Corporation of Chicago. This was the second major nuc learfuel lease made by C.N.A. Nuclear Leasing In two days.

title: Arrest in Turkey Denied
description: ISTANBUL, Turkey, May 26 (Reuters)  The martiallaw! command denied today that a suspect in the kidnapping and murder of Efraim Elrom, the Israeli Consul General, had been arrested, as announced yester day by Justice Minister Ismail Arar.

title: $2.25 MINIMUM PAY OPPOSED BY HODGSON
description: WASHINGTON, May 26 (UPI)  Labor Secretary James D. Hodgson told Congress today that a Democratic proposal to raise the minimum wage to $2.25 an hour was so drastic it could add to unemployment and damage the economy.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Some warprotester tactics employed in Washington, D.C., during and since the Mayday weekend seemed wholly incompatible with the public well being. The official reaction appeared to include many elements which were infinitely worse  which were, in fact, a flagrant threat to free government in this country.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Your May 15 editorial urging the rejection by the New York State Senate of an Assemblyapproved bill requiring state agents, public authorities and local governments to refuse bids in excess of $2,000 from any foreign com pany contains all the familiar shib boleths of protectionism, retaliatory action, etc.

title: Books of The Times
description: It is just as easy to ridicule Norman Mailer as it is to admire him. In his unself conscious way, he advises us to do both: it is good advice. He is at once more primi tive and more sophisticated than most writ ers, and the reader has to keep this in mind. Even in print, he is usually speaking off the record, confiding halfformed feel ings that should not be taken too literally, but tasted, so to speak. The beginnings of his bookswhen he is clearing his throat of his egoare likely to put readers off. He seems to be daring us to misunderstand or underestimate him. The Prisoner of Sex is no exception. It begins as if Mailer had just woke up from a night of disas trous drinking and staggered over to his desk to scrabble blindly among his papers, muttering Where am I?

title: OBSERVER
description: WASHINGTON, May 26This is the season when people write to news papers about their gardening problems and when newspapers respond with unintelligible, confusing or terribly bad advice. Here, for example, is a man writing from Chadd's Ford, Pa. He has a very large shrub, which he thinks is a yew, and he wants advice about pruning it.

title: U.S. Captures Golf Lead
description: ST. ANDREWS, Scotland, May 26Shut out by a vastly underrated British side in four morning foursomes, the United States came on strong in the afternoon today to take a 6 5 lead as the Walker Cup matches for amateur players opened at this shrine of golf.

title: IN THE NATION
description: WASHINGTON, May 26It was pointed out in this space on Nov. 11, 1970and as early as April 30, 1969, by Neil Sheehan in The New York Timesthat the 1968 Gun Control Act was being to some extent thwart ed because domestic firms were im porting and reassembling the individ ual parts of cheap handguns, which were themselves barred by the act from importation.

title: CAMBODIAN FORAYS BY SPIES REPORTED
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, May 26 (AP)Twelveman teams of Cambodian troops, trained by Central Intelligence Agency per sonnel at a base in Laos, suc cessfully infiltrated deep into Communistheld territory in Cambodia two months ago, ac cording to Western sources here.

title: One Dead, 34 Hurt As IRT Trains Stall 2 Hours With 8,000
description: More than 8,000 rushhour subway riders were trapped be neath the East River for nearly two hours last evening after a short circuit cut off power to five IRT Flushing line trains in the tunnel.

title: Nixon Assails Slayings of Policemen
description: WASHINGTON, May 26 President Nixon summoned his senior advisers on law enforce ment to a meeting today to dis cuss what he called the tragic and reprehensible slayings of policemen in New York and Washington.

title: Islanders Clash with Police
description: FILICUDI, Italy, May 26 (AP)This sleepy fishing is land, which has been seeking tourists, got a bunch of big spenders today.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: I wholeheartedly support most of your recent editorial criticizing Gov ernor Rockefeller's rent proposals. However, I strongly disagree with your support for decontrol of apartments not used as primary residence.

title: AID S.E.C. ON I.O.S., VESCO IS ORDERED
description: NEWARK, May 26Robert L. Vesco, chairman of the In ternational Controls Corpora tion, was ordered in the Federal District Court here to day to appear before the Se curities and Exchange Commis sion to tell the Government what he knows about his and other companies' dealings with Investors Overseas Services, Ltd., an offshore mutual fund complex of which he is chair man.

title: FAIR NOW FAVORED IN PHILADELPHIA
description: PHILADELPHIA, May 26  The Philadelphia 1976 Bicen tennial Corporation decided to day that the city wants to host an international exposition for the nation's 200th birthday after all.

title: Phils Defeat Mets in 12th, 32
description: The New York Mets were one outin fact, one pitch away from a 20 victory over the Philadelphia Phillies last night in Shea Stadium. But they got neither the pitch nor the out and, one hour later, were defeated by the Phillies in 12 innings, 32.

title: Nevin, Rangers' Captain, Is Traded to North Stars
description: Bob Nevin has heard his last boos as a Ranger.

title: Trial Told of $15,000 Whelan Payoff
description: NEWARK, May 26John J. Kenny, former Hudson County Democratic chairman, testified today that he had turned over to Mayor Thomas J. Whelan of Jersey City $15,000 collected from a gambler as protection money.

title: Frank Conniff, Pulitzer Winner, Dead
description: Frank Conniff, former na tional editor of Hearst News papers and a cowinner of a Pulitzer Prize for 1955, died of a heart attack Tuesday night at the Mary Manning Walsh Home here, where he had been under care for several months. He was 57 years old and lived at 180 East End Avenue.

title: Prosecutor Asks Mild Sentences for Four Jews in Riga
description: MOSCOW, May 26The Lat vian prosecutor today asked for relatively mild sentences ranging from one to four years for the four Soviet Jews on trial in Riga for antiSoviet activity.

title: Burton Portrays 'The Villain' of the London Underworld
description: "The Villain" is a sadistic London mob chief who loves his Mum and remains faithful to her by sleeping with his boyfriend, the mob's pimp, who doesn't mind being occasionally beaten upwhich probably makes this otherwise conventional underworld movie sound more interesting than it ever is.The film, which opened yesterday at the Trans-Lux East and West Theaters, is the first theatrical feature of Michael Tuchner, a television director who seems to have learned his craft by studying the films of Henri Verneuil, the French director who seems to have learned his craft by imitating (badly) good American gangster films of the thirties. In its payroll heists, its car chases, its beatings and in its final confrontation, the movie employs gestures that in other, better films, such as "Get Carter," seemed classic, but here are only second-hand.In the title role, Richard Burton, grown somewhat fat and soft, like a potato that's been left too long on the vine, reads his lines well while keeping himself at a safe remove from them, as if he didn't want to be identified with the part. Ian McShane, looking lean and handsome and ratty, all at the same time, has good moments as the ambivalent pimp, a man who will do just about anything to survive, and Cathleen Nesbitt is the East End Mum, who spends most of her time in bed, sipping tea and looking unnaturally regal. It's an awful movie, really.

title: Moral Problems of Technology Cited
description: At a seminar on how tech nology can help the police, courts and jails fight crime, a high police official urged scientists and city managers yesterday to go beyond the question of whether the new technology works and find out whether its use is morally proper.

title: 5 ARE INDICTED HERE IN 2 AIRPORT KILLINGS
description: Two Queens grand juries have indicted five men in two separate murders at Kennedy International Airport in 1970, the Queens District Attorney announced yesterday.

title: Gernreich Designs for Men: This Time World Is Ready
description: Six months ago when Rudi Gernreich showed his spring collection, he had his mannequins carry guns. They looked like street fighters. Yesterday, with his fall col lection for women, he intro duced men's clothes. There's always something going on at Gernreich.

title: FORRESTAL IS NAMED TO NEW OPERA POST
description: Michael V. Forrestal was elected chairman of the board of the Metropolitan Opera Guild and Laurence D. Lovett was elected to succeed him as presi dent at the guild's annual hoard of directors meeting held this week. Mr. Forrestal, who suc ceeds Langdon Van Norden, held the office of president for four years.

title: AUSTRALIA IS SEEKING PEKING DIALOGUE
description: CANBERRA, Australia, May 26Australia is preparing to seek informal contacts with Chinese diplomats as a step toward improved relations, ac cording to authoritative infor mation here.

title: DEMOCRATS OFFER NEW U.S. AID PLAN
description: WASHINGTON, May 26  After being criticized in the past for not enthusiastically embracing the idea of sharing Federal tax revenues with the states and cities, a majority of the Democratic Representatives from New York rallied today behind a revised revenueshar ing proposal they said would provide the greatest benefit to New York City and State.

title: A Polish Seaman Who Jumped Ship Asks for Asylum
description: PHILADELPHIA, May 26 (AP)A Polish seaman who jumped ship in Camden, N.J., was released today in the cus tody of Philadelphia's Polish American Society.

title: S.E.C. PENALIZES VALUE LINE HEAD
description: WASHINGTON, May 26Ar nold Bernhard, head of the Value Line investment complex, was penalized by the Securi ties and Exchange Commission today for one group of alleged violations of the securities laws and made the subject of a Fed eral court injunction for an other group.

title: BREZHNEV LINKS CZECH TRIDIPH TO UNITY OF REDS
description: PRAGUE, May 26  The Brezhnev Doctrine was reen dorsed here today by its au thor Leonid I. Brezhnev, the Soviet Communist party leader, as an essential element in Czechoslovakia's triumph over the enemies of socialism.

title: Sato, Barring a Revaluation of the Yen, Criticizes Comments by Americans
description: TOKYO, May 26  Premier Eisaku Sato today described comments by Americans that the Japanese yen was under valued as interference to the nth degree in our domestic affairs.

title: SOYBEANS SLUMP IN PROFIT TAKING
description: Profit taking on the heels of recent advances sent soybeans and soybean oil prices down yesterday on the Chicago Board of Trade.

title: 22 Indicted in City On Varied Charges In CreditCard Ring
description: District Attorney Eugene Gold of Brooklyn reported yes terday the indictment of 22 persons accused of 63 counts of conspiracy, forgery and other charges for allegedly cheating three major credit card companies out of $1mil lion since October, 1969.

title: Antismuggling Accord Due
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, May 26 (Reuters)The South Viet namese Premier, Tran Thien Khiem, said today that his Gov ernment and Cambodia were ready to sign an agreement aimed at controlling smuggling, including that of heroin and other narcotics, into South Viet nam.

title: Coop City, Home to 40,000, Is Given Tempered Praise
description: Sometimes we're above the fog, said Mrs. Albert Sanchez with a touch of ex citement in her voice as she stood on the balcony of her 33dfloor apartment and gestured at the viewpinlike masts of sailboats at City Island, a hazesoftened Long Island Sound, the grayish building sprawl of the north Bronx and, nearby, the rest of Coop City.

title: S. C. REYNOLDS JR., 64, INVESTMENT BANKER
description: Stephen Clark Reynolds Jr., a partner in Hornblower & WeeksHemphill, Noyes, invest ment bankers, died yesterday at Roosevelt Hospital after a long illness. He was 64 years old and lived at 75 East End Ave nue.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Sooner or later we must decide who Is to run our lives ourselves, or selfappointed social theoreticians.

title: Advertising:
description: In what its ad agency con siders the sign of a brighten ing financial picture, Shear son, Hammill & Co., the brokerage and investment banking concern, is popping $250,000 into an insert in the June 7 Time.

title: HOUSE UNIT CALLS C.B.S. PRESIDENT
description: WASHINGTON, May 26  A House subcommittee issued a new subpoena to the Colum bia Broadcasting System today demanding the appearance of the network's president, Dr. Frank Stanton, and key mate rials that went into making the documentary The Selling of the Pentagon.

title: Exports to Soviet Up
description: WASHINGTON, May 26 United States exports to the Soviet Union and other Com munist countries of Eastern Eu rope rose last year by slightly more than $100million to $3 53.3million, the Commerce De partment reported today.

title: Electronic Gadgets Making Security a Big Business
description: CHICAGO, May 26 Thieves beware: The tech nology of the second half of the 20th century, the detec tion devices of Vietnam and the modern miracles of com munication are zeroing in on you.

title: Negro Girl Is Slain; Whites Held in South
description: DREW, Miss., May 26  A Negro girl was shot to death from a passing car last night on her way home from high school graduation exercises, and three white men were charged today with her murder.

title: N.F.L. Owners Agree to Three Changes in Rules
description: The team owners of the Na tional Football League agreed yesterday to three rules changes and an improved method for breaking ties in the standings.The association holds its an nual meeting in Chicago on June 26. At that time the play ers will consider their tactics for the training season. The idea is to tell the owners a pre season game will be struck but not to designate the game in advance.

title: COAST MAN SEIZED IN DOZEN KILLINGS
description: YUBA CITY, Calif., May 26  A stocky farm labor con tractor was being held here to day on charges of murdering 12 itinerant workers whose bod ies were uncovered from the rich loam of peach orchards in this peaceful Sacramento Valley agricultural city.

title: Miss Hogan is Upset
description: SURBITON, England, May 26 (Reuters)Eliza Pande of. Palo Alto, Calif., an 18yearold on her first European tour, upset Patti Hogan of La. Jolla, Calif., the fifthranked United State:s player, 75, 46, 64; in the third round of the Surrey tennis tournament today. Miss Pande ranks 14th.

title: EDDIE NELOY DIES; TOP RACE TRAINER
description: Eddie Nelroy, trainer of Buck passer and other famous thor oughbred race horses owned by the Phipps family, died yester day morning at Belmont Park, apparently of a heart attack. He was 50 years old.

title: City Shuts Down a Musty Reservoir
description: Virtually all of the water from one of the city's major reservoirs has been shut off for the last three weeks be cause of a contaminant that makes the water taste musty.

title: Cowles Is Named to Times Board
description: The election of Gardner Cowles as a director was an nounced yesterday by The New York Times Company.

title: Panelists Glum at Steel Forum
description: Two economists who fre gently differ in public appeared on the same platform here yes terday and offered remarkably similar and generally gloomy forecasts of the business cli mate for the rest of 1971.

title: Evening News of Newark Shut In Strike by Newspaper Guild
description: NEWARK, May 26A strike by news department employes forced The Evening News of Newark, the state's second larg est daily newspaper, to shut down today.

title: U. S. Court Orders Washington to Limit Protest Prosecution
description: WASHINGTON, May 26 The United States Court of Appeals for the District of Co lumbia ordered city officials tonight to suspend prosecution of demonstrators arrested in the capital earlier this month in those cases where they did not have adequate evidence to support probable cause for arrest and charge.

title: Dayan Analyzes Situation
description: TEL AVIV, May 26Defense Minister Moshe Dayan said last night the political situation in Cairo made it unlikely that President Sadat would meet Israel's conditions for a partial pullback from the Suez Canal to permit the waterway to be cleared for international ship ping.

title: Eurodollar Borrowings Up
description: WASHINGTON, May 26 (Reu ters)  Eurodollar borrowings by United States banks from their overseas branches rose $29million in the week ended May 19, the Federal Reserve reported today. The gain, which followed five consecutive de clines, brought gross liabilities to foreign branches to $1.62 billion.

title: Australian Airline Pays $560,000 in Bomb Hoax
description: SYDNEY, Australia, Thurs day, May 27Qantas, the Aus tralian international airline, paid $560,000 in cash yesterday to a hoaxer who had convinced airline officials that there was a bomb on a plane bound for Hong Kong with 116 passengers and 12 crew members.

title: Vonnegut, at Arts Academy, Recounts Early Joys
description: Kurt Vonnegut Jr., the mad cap scientist of American let ters, addressed a gathering of renowned artists and writers yesterday and confronted a crucial question: Where is the happiness that used to come from riding the cowcatcher of an Indiana locomotive?

title: FRANK C. L. MERRITT
description: ORADELL, N.J., May 26  Frank C. L. Merritt, mayor of Oradell from 1956 to 1960, died at his home here today, appar ently of a heart attack. He was 60 years old.

title: TOP LOTTERY PRIZE IS SHARED BY FOUR
description: A Queens garment worker, his wife and their soninlaw and daughter will share $25,000 a year for life as a re sult of the state lottery draw ing yesterday.

title: Text of the Treaty of Friendship and Cooperation Signed by Soviet and Egypt
description: Following, as transmitted in English by Tass, the Soviet press agency, is the text of the SovietEgyptian treaty of friendship signed in Cairo yesterday:

title: Americans Sweep Prizes at Cannes Fete
description: CANNES, France, May 27 American talent, American films and American stories, even in the hands of foreign directors, swept the awards at the Cannes Film Festival today in a way unprecedented in the festival's history.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: In reply to Naseer Aruri's May 2 letter, it is a clear indication of Israel's exceptionally fine record in her treat ment of Arabs bent on her destruc tion that those wishing to defame her must dig, in desperation, all the way back to 1948 and Deir Yassin to try to find some example of alleged Jew ish brutality, and even this example is not valid.

title: Screen: Femme Douce
description: Une Femme Douce is the ninth film of the 62 yearold French director Robert Bresson. Of the pre vious eight, the last three (The Trial of Joan of Arc, 1962; Au Hazard Balthazar, 1966; Mouchette, 1967) have had their premieres in this country at the New York Film Festival. If the festival had no other justification, merely showing the works of Bresson, and of a few other great and not very popular directors, would be justifica tion enough.

title: Unofficial Tally Indicates Lead for Fox Management
description: The Twentieth CenturyFox Film Corporation said yester day that an unofficial tally of the shareholder vote on May 18 indicated a lead for manage ment over a dissident group of more than 1.5 million votes out of 6.4 million cast.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
SOVIET AND EGYPT SIGN 15YEAR PACT; AID WILL CONTINUE
description: Text of the SovietEgyptian treaty is on Page 2.CAIRO, Friday, May 28  President Nikolai V. Podgorny of the Soviet Union and Presi dent Anwar elSadat of Egypt signed a 15year treaty of friendship and cooperation yes terday after two days of in tensive consultations on Soviet Egyptian relations. The treaty barred interference in the in ternal affairs of the other country.

title: City's Criminal Courts Cutting Backlog
description: For the first time in recent years, the criminal courts of New York City have begun to dispose of more cases than they receive and to make inroads on the backlog of cases.

title: Blood Cell Sickling Is Inhibited in Laboratory Tests
description: Two Rockefeller University scientists have reported that they have successfully inhibited the sickling of red blood cells taken from patients with sickle cell anemia, the incurable, hereditary blood disorder that affects blacks almost exclu sively.

title: MARK BRUNSWICK, COMPOSER, IS DEAD
description: Mark Brunswick, a composer, who headed the music depart ment of City College from 1946, to 1965, died Wednesday in London, apparently of a heart attack, while on a tour of Europe. He was 69 years old and lived at 7 Evelyn Place, Princeton, N. J.

title: $45OMILLION RISE IN CITY TAXES DUE, ROCKEFELLER SAYS
description: ALBANY, May 27Governor Rockefeller acknowledged to day that he and Republican legislative leaders had decided on a $450million tax package for New York City.

title: U.S. Court Orders Release Of Data on Suspected Meat
description: WASHINGTON, May 27  A Federal appeals court ordered the Department of Agriculture today to make public its rec ords on companies it has sus pected of violating meat inspec tion laws.

title: Phyllis M. Lintott Is Dead; A British Information Aide
description: Phyllis M. Lintott, who was named a member of the Order of the British Empire upon her retirement last year as an in formation officer of the British Information Services here, died Wednesday in Northern West chester Hospital, Mount Kisco, N. Y. She lived here at 10 Mitchell Place.

title: 4 RIGA JEWS GIVEN TERMS TO 3 YEARS
description: MOSCOW, May 27The Lat vian Supreme Court today Mound four Riga Jews guilty of antiSoviet activity and sen tenced them to terms ranging from one to three years in prison camps.

title: Author of Study on G.I. Addiction
description: Man in the News

title: My Mother, the Doctor, the Children Can Now Say
description: They were welleducated, in their 30's, and mothers whose children were in school. They began to feel bored. So they did something they'd been dreaming about since childhood: They went to medical school.

title: Britain's Golfers Take Walker Cup
description: ST. ANDREWS, SCOTLAND, May 27  Britain won the Walker Cup today for the first time since 1938 and for only the second time in the 50year history of the competition.

title: Faisal, in U.S., Asks Pressure on Israelis
description: WASHINGTON, May 27  King Faisal of Saudi Arabia arrived here today for a brief official visit and suggested that his host, President Nixon, con tinue to apply pressure on Is rael to withdraw from terri tories occupied in the sixday war of 1967.

title: Director of Waterfront Body Resigns Law Practice
description: William P. Sirlgnano, execu Live director of the Waterfront Commission of New York Har bor, said yesterday that he had resigned as a partner in a Mount Vernon law firm to avoid any possible embarrass ment of conflictofinterest complaints.

title: CLOTHING MAKERS APPROVE PAY RISE
description: The Amalgamated Clothing Workers of America and the Clothing Manufacturers Asso ciation of the U. S. A. reached agreement yesterday on a three year contract providing a 60 centanhour wage increase.

title: Roundup: Borrowed Bat Puts Brock's Streak at 23
description: Lou Brock's consecutive game hitting streak reached 23 games last night, the long est in the major leagues this season, and Dick Schofield, his teammate, has to be credited with a major assist.

title: New Member of Congress
description: WASHINGTON, May 27 (UPI William O. Mills, a former Congressional staff assitant, became the newest member of Congress today. Mr. Mills, a Republican, succeeded his for mer boss, Rogers C. B. Morton, who was Maryland first District Representative before re signing to become Interior Sec retary. Mr. Mills took the oath at a brief House ceremony. He won a special election Tuesday to complete the remainder of Mr. Morton's twoyear term.

title: Horspfal Weaves an Operatic Tapestry of Indians
description: The decline and fall of the American Indian, that ruth less, shameful chapter in American history, would hard ly seem to be the subject for a bright, entertaining new opera.

title: SETON HALL WINS, 31, IN N.C.A.A. PLAYOFFS
description: PRINCETON, May 27Jim Lammers rapped out three hits in four times at bat and drove in all the runs for Seton Hall today as the Pirates defeated Buffalo, 31, in the first of two openinground games of the National College Athletic Asso ciation District 2 baseball play off.

title: Train Collision Kills 47 in West Germany
description: WUPPERTAL, West Germany, Friday, May 28At least 47 persons, most of them school children between the ages of 15 and 16, were killed last night in a headon collision between freight train and a twocar pas senger train five miles south east of this Ruhr Valley town.

title: A Kimberly Has a Style All its Own
description: I don't know what I'd do if Kimberly ever went out of business, a fan murmured during the knitwear com pany's fall showing yester day. 'Of course, I could keep going for quite a while, she said, her face brightening. I own quite a few of them.

title: Nixon Says U.S. Won't Pull Out Of I. L.O. at This Point in Time
description: WASHINGTON May 27  President Nixon said today that his Administration had de cided not to withdraw from the International Labor Organi zation at this point in time.

title: 1925 Winner Tuning Up for Indy 500
description: INDIANAPOLIS, May 27 Depend on it, Back Home Again in Indiana, the senti mental song that character izes the flavor of the pre race festivities of the Indi anapolis 500, can be messed up by the best professional tenors, domestic or imported. One of them, some years ago, mixed up the lyrics with The Banks of the Wabash.

title: NINE ARE INDICTED AS STOCK RIGGERS
description: A Federal grand jury charged yesterday that nine men, in cluding John Dioguardi, created an elaborate stock manipula tion scheme to inflate the mar ket price of an overthecounter stock from $5 to $42 a share.

title: Rise Is Forecast for Consumer Buying
description: Optimism in the consumer sector of the economy is sup ported by the latest survey of The Conference Board, which reveals a sharp rise in consumer intentions to buy homes, cars and major appliances.

title: MUSKIE PROPOSES MEDICAL RIGHTS
description: Senator Edmund S. Muskie, in his first comprehensive state ment on health care, called upon Congress yesterday to enact a medical bill of rights to put total health care within the reach of all Americans.

title: Gain of 17% Listed for All Projects
description: Reflecting a substantial im provement in construction starts since the beginning of the year, the value of contracts awarded for all kinds of building projects throughout the country reached a total of $7,742,956,000 in April, the F. W. Dodge division of the McGrawHill Information Systems Company reported yes terday.

title: VILLANOVA SEEKS 3D TRACK CROWN
description: PHILADELPHIA, May 27 Marty Liguori returns to the site of his finest track and field triumph tomorrow and Satur day in the 95th annual I.C. 4A outdoor championships at Franklin Field.

title: REDITORS RATED ON LENDING LAW
description: WASHINGTON, May 27  ??ewelry stores and used car ??ealers have compiled the worst ??ecords among major install ??entsales creditors for compli ??nce with the truthinlending ??ct, the Federal Trade Commis ??ion reported today.

title: Debs Myers Honored
description: In view of the window next to the desk where the late Debs Myers sat as press secretary to Mayor Wagner, a 12foot flowering crab apple tree was planted in his honor yesterday. Forty friends joined his widow, Nellie, at the ceremony at the south end of City Hall Park. Mr. Myers died on Feb. 2 at the age of 59.

title: Ford Calls CleanAir Goal Impossible Task in Cities
description: DETROIT, May 27  Henry Ford 2d said today that the Federal Government had set an impossible task in pro posing that the air in the na tion's cities must be cleaned up by 1975 even if this required restrictions on the use of auto mobiles.

title: Report Criticizes F.D.A. Over Its Scientific Effort
description: WASHINGTON, May 27The Food and Drug Administration made public today a report that was harshly critical of the agency's performance in man aging its scientific effort, the substandard conditions in some of its offices and the productivi ty of some of its scientists.

title: JACK KROLL, LED C.I.O. IN POLITICS
description: CINCINNATI, May 27Jack Kroll, who rose from working as a clothing cutter in Roches ter and Chicago to the vice presidency of one of America's most powerful labor unions, died here yesterday. He was 85 years old.

title: COOP ON EAST SIDE DENIES SALES BIAS
description: The directors and managers of an East Side cooperative apartment house denied in State Supreme Court yesterday that antiSemitism had played a role in the failure of a lawyer to buy an apartment for $150, 000.

title: Thousands of Dollars Pouring In For Families of Slain Policemen
description: While the police continue their hunt for the killers of two patrolmen here, letters of sympathy, money and mass cards are arriving at the 32d Precinct station in Harlem in memory of the two menone black, one whitewho were shot dead Friday night.

title: Fund for Pakistanis Gains
description: GENEVA, May 27Pledges of $2.5million by the United States and of $2.4million by Britain are the first by Govern ments for a fund for East Pak istani refugees in India, the Of fice of the United Nations High Commission for Refugees an nounced today.

title: Penn Hires Massimino
description: PHILADELPHIA, May 27 (UPI)The University of Penn sylvania named Ronald Mas simino, head basketball coach at Stony Brook (N. Y.) State, as an assistant basketball coach today.

title: The Screen
description: The supernatural, usually as believable in films as the reality of dragons, is handled with sincerity and a good deal of conviction by Kaneto Shindo, writerdirector of Kuroneko (Black Cat) the 1968 Japanese import that began a threeday stand yesterday at the Bijou. Its English subtitles are a neces sity for an Occidental, but its brooding, mystic qualities are universal and captivating enough to hold a viewer most of the way.

title: Defection Hearing Set
description: QUANTICO, Va., May 27 (AP)A preliminary hearing in the case of Marine Sgt. Jon M. Sweeney, an accused defector charged with aiding the enemy in Vietnam, will be held June 15, the Marine Corps said today.

title: Front Page 3  No Title
description: NEW WEEKLY BIOGRAPHICAL SERVICE. The New York Times Biographical Service. Write: The New York Times, Library Serv lees, Box FP480, 220 West 43d Street, New York, N. Y. 10036.Advl.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: In its story of May 25 and its edi torial of May 26, The Times comments on my proposals for dealing with the city's power crisis. Unfortunately, both the news story and the editorial miss the main thrust of my report.

title: Guilty in Heroin Case
description: A Bronx Criminal Court jury yesterday found Robert Norton, a 42yearold musician of 820 Boyton Avenue in the Bronx, guilty of heroin possession and related charges. Judge William Kappelman set sentencing for June 18, when he faces a mandatory sentence of 15 years to life.

title: No Mention of Taiwan
description: VIENNA, May 27The agree ment by which Austria and China established relations con tains no specific mention of Taiwan, unlike documents of recognition signed by Canada and Italy.

title: Bridge: Eastern Regional Title Play Gets Under Way Here Today
description: The Eastern Regional Championships, which have great significance in the his tory of the game, begin today at the New York Hilton Hotel with a modernized schedule. The number of events has been reduced, and all but one are to be played during the Memorial Day weekend.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: The basic reasons for our payments deficit are the Vietnam war and the loss of competitive power by American business. The Vietnam war has caused an enormous drain of dollars from productive use at home to complete futility abroad.

title: Watson Comments
description: COLUMBIA, S. C., May 27 (UPI)Mr. Watson said in a statement tonight that he would not accept the appointment even if it were offered to him. Mr. Watson referred to Sena tors Bayh and McGovern as Northern liberal racists who are falling all over themselves to see who can hit this South ern Republican the hardest.

title: Tricia Nixon to Shun Secret Exit
description: WASHINGTON, May 27 (AP)  Tricia Nixon has de cided to depart from the White House in her wedding gown, with her bridegroom, Edward Cox, in cutaway, in stead of making a secret exit from the White House as the Johnson brides did, Press Secretary Constance Stuart told reporters today.

title: A BargainIf You Don't Eat
description: The restaurants reviewed on this page on Friday are rated both for their food (four stars to none) and for their service, atmosphere and decor (four triangles to none).

title: $284,969 GRANTED FOR 3 TV SERIES
description: The Corporation for Public Broadcasting has received $284,969 from a Government agency, to distribute public tele vision's nationwide drug educa tion campaign this fall and to evaluate its impact on selected target audiences.

title: McGovern Faces Surgery
description: WASHINGTON, May 27 (AP) Senator George S. McGovern, Democrat of South Dakota, an nounced today that he would enter Georgetown University Hospital on Monday for a her nia operation. He said he ex pected to be back in the Senate next Friday to take part in scheduled votes on the draft bill.

title: The Legal Battle in California
description: WASHINGTONIn California, the poor are pawns in a political chess game between Governor Reagan and President Nixon, involving the Cali fornia Rural Legal Assistance program.

title: Changes in Reserve Act
description: WASHINGTON, May 27  Legislation was introduced in the Senate today to carry out several longstanding recom mendations of the Federal Re serve Board for important changes in the Federal Reserve Act.

title: Albany Democrats Rebel At G.D.P. Necessity Bill
description: ALBANY, May 27Angrily charging that Governor Rocke feller and the Republican lead ers were depriving them of their constitutional rights, the Democratic members of the As sembly rebelled today and took the unusual step by refusing to vote yes or no on a bill being hurried through the Legisla ture.

title: Bomb Explodes in Car Carrying 4 Men and $60,000 to Airport
description: A bomb exploded under the front seat of a car carrying four guards and $60,000 to a check cashing service at Kennedy In tional Airport yesterday morn ing seriously injuring one of the men and charring much of the money.

title: Turkey Barbecue On Memorial Day
description: In the menu below, dish marked with an asterisk is followed by a recipe.

title: An Oregonian at Columbia: A Story of Changes
description: In September, 1967, a ra diant freshman named Calvin Sumner walked wideeyed across the Columbia Univer sity campus, a beanie over his closecropped brown hair and a blazer on his back, of fering an eager smile and a handshake to everyone.

title: U.S. War Toll Put at 38 in Week
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, May 27 (AP)The United States command reported to day that 38 Americans died in combat in Indochina last week. It was the highest total in three weeks, but it did not include all of the 30 men killed in three North Vietnamese shelling attacks last Friday.

title: Legislature Votes to Restrict Cost of Civil Service Pensions
description: ALBANY, May 27The Leg islature passed and sent to the Governor today revisions of the Taylor Law aimed at restricting the growing costs of Civil Serv ice pensions.

title: Nixon Reportedly Drops Plans To Nominate Watson as Judge
description: WASHINGTON, May 27  President Nixon has reportedly dropped plans to nominate former Representative Albert W. Watson of South Carolina to the United States Court of Military Appeals after Senate Republican leaders warned Mr. Nixon that the nomination would be met with bitter Sen ate opposition.

title: Reserve Clears 7 Added Roles For Bank Holding Corporations
description: WASHINGTON, May 27 (UPI)  The Federal Reserve Board today adopted rules out lining seven activities other than banking that can be pur sued by bank holding com panies.

title: U.S. Policy Shift Urged at Steel Forum
description: William J. Stephens, chair man and chief executive officer of the Jones & Laughlin Steel Corporation, said here yester day that the American economy would slowly and surely self destruct, unless Government policy changed, especially with regard to international trade, taxation and antitrust rules.

title: Groton, Conn., G.I. Killed
description: WASHINGTON, May 27 (AP) The Defense Department an nounced today that Pfc. Karl J. La Vallee of Groton, Conn., of the Army, had been killed in action in Southeast Asia.

title: Anaconda Votes Dividend; Sets Executive Changes
description: Directors of the Anaconda Company voted yesterday a quarterly dividend of 25 cents a share  unchanged from the firstquarter rate  payable June 30 to stockholders of rec ord June 8.

title: Sports Program for Poor
description: WASHINGTON, May 29 (UPPPresident Nixon has al located $3million dollars to fi nance a summer sports pro gram for underprivileged youngsters. The program will be conducted on 110 college campuses in or near 64 cities in 33 states. It will be admin istered by the National Col legiate Athletic Association under the supervision of the President's Council on Physical Fitness and Sports.

title: Brooklyn Park Named
description: Mayor Lindsay signed a law yesterday naming a small Brooklyn park after the late John J. Carty, a native of Brooklyn, who was for many years first deputy city control ler. The park is between Fort Hamilton Parkway and the Ver razanoNarrows Bridge.

title: 15th Body Uncovered in Coast Slayings
description: YUBA CITY, Calif., May 27 Sutter County sheriff's deputies unearthed three more bodies to day, bringing to 15 the number found buried to peach orchards on the outskirts of this quiets farming community.

title: Governor Advised Mayor To Drop Appointees First
description: Governor Rockefeller has told Mayor Lindsay that before he reduces the police, fire and sanitation forces as economy measures, he should first dis miss the thousands of employes in appointive jobs.

title: THE NEWS IN NEWARK STRUCK FOR 2D DAY
description: NEWARK, May 27 (AP) The Evening News of Newark, New Jersey's largest evening newspaper, suspended publica tion today because of a strike by the North Jersey Newspaper Guild.

title: STUDEBAKER MAKES HIGH PROMOTIONS
description: Two top officers of Stude bakerWorthington, Inc., moved up a notch yesterday as Leslie T. Welsh was promoted from senior vice president to presi dent, and Derald H. Rutten berg from president to chair man.

title: BREZHNEV HINTS AT CZECH TRIALS
description: PRAGUE, May 27Leonid I. Brezhnev, the Soviet Commu nist party chief, raised the possibility of political trials in Czechoslovakia today by warn ing the purged leaders of the Dubcek reform movement that they had broken Czechoslovak laws.

title: RICHEY TRIUMPHS IN STRAIGHT SETS
description: PARIS, May 27 (AP)  Cliff Richey and his sister, Mrs. Nancy Gunter, each seeded fourth, routed Australians to lead a contingent of 10 Amer icans into the third round of the $95,000 French open tennis tournament today.

title: WASHINGTON
description: The most momentous fact about the pattern of American politics, the late Clinton Rossiter wrote at the be ginning of the sixties, is that we live under a persistent, obdurate, one might almost say tyrannical twoparty system. We have the Republicans, and we have the Democrats, and we have almost no one else. ...

title: DEMARTINOS MAKE HOME IN FLORIDA
description: A State Supreme Court just ice ordered a 30day jail term yesterday for Mr. and Mrs. Nicholas DeMartino for their refusal to return their adoptive daughter, known as Baby Le more, to her natural mother.

title: Hodges Denies Any Dissension With Mets
description: The Mets flew west yes terday for nine games in California, but Manager Gil Hodges said they had left behind any recriminations from the brief fight that broke out Wednesday night between Ed Kranepool and Tim Foli.

title: Prominent Greeks Facing Trial as Conspirators
description: ATHENS, May 27The Gov ernment is preparing to try more than a score of prominent Greeks who are said to have been involved in the organiza tion of an underground anti Government network.

title: Silvermine College To Close in June; Funds Exhausted
description: NEW CANAAN, Conn., May 27The Silvennine College of Art, a small twoyear college here, disclosed today that it would close after this year's graduation ceremonies on June 6.

title: The Screen
description: THE HOLY OUTLAW, by Don Lenzer and Lee Lockwood; released by Impact Films, Inc. At the Bleecker Street Cinema, 144 Bleecker Street. Running time: 59 minutes. (Not submitted at this lime to the Motion Picture As sociation of America's Production Code and Rating Administration for rating as to audience suitability.)

title: LABOR IN BRITAIN WINS BYELECTION; Victory Likely to Encourage Opposition to Market
description: LONDON, Friday, May 28 The Labor Party won an upset victory early today in a parlia mentary byelection, dealing a political blow to Prime Minister Heath.

title: The $5,000 Bottle of Wine
description: PARIS, May 27 (AP)Sale of a 125yearold bottle of red wine at a San Francisco auction yesterday stirred up a conflict today among connoisseurs. Can you drink the stuff? they wanted to know.

title: Foe Repulsed in Cambodia, Saigon Says
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Fri day, May 28 (AP)In a surge of heavy fighting reported yes terday in eastern Cambodia, North Vietnamese troops stormed into the town of Snoul but were repelled by South Vietnamese forces with the aid of American airpower.

title: LINDSAY PROPOSES NATIONAL CITIES
description: INDIANAPOLIS, May 27  Mayor Lindsay proposed to night that the Federal Govern ment charter at least 25 na tional cities that would be granted special powers on mat ters of trade, finance and so cial welfare and would occupy a distinct place in the Federal system.

title: TV: Chatter Quotient of Talk Shows
description: There are talk shows and there are interview pro grams. Dick Cavett and Mery Griffin offer shows, with the emphasis on entertainment. David Susskind and William F. Buckley Jr. offer pro grams, dealing with weightier matters and geared toward informing the viewer. And at this point my neat distinc tions begin to disintegrate.

title: Nassau Bar Honors Fuld
description: GARDEN CITY, LI, May 27 Stanley H. Fuld, chief judge of the State Court of Appeals, received the distinguished sery medallion of the Bar Asso ciation of Nassau County at its 72d annual dinner at the Garden City Hotel this evening.

title: Slim Maple Crop Expected
description: MONTPELIER, Vt., May 27 (AP)  Vermont's 1971 maple syrup crop is expected to total only about 240,000 gallons, a 21 per cent decline from last year's harvest and substantially below the 400,000 gallon peak of the mid1960's

title: Lindsay Protests Passage Of VacantFlat Decontrol
description: The Lindsay administration sharply protested yesterday the passage in Albany of Governor Rockefeller's bill to end rent control in all vacated apart ments here and said it was weighing legal challenges to block it.

title: HARRY MORGAN,41, C. B. S. PRODUCER
description: Harry Morgan, Columbia Broadcasting System news documentary producer, who won important awards for his work, died Wednesday of can cer at a nursing home in Cress kill, N.J. He was 41 years old and lived at 3 Haight Place in Cresskill.

title: Two Daily News Drivers Guilty of Stealing Papers
description: Two former deliverytruck drivers for The Daily News were convicted in State Su preme Court in the Bronx yes terday on nine counts of petit larceny for stealing bundles of the Sunday issue of the paper.

title: PRESIDENT SHUNS 1972 BALLOT ROLE
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio, May 27 The White House has apparent ly decided to use standin can didates for President Nixon, rather than to put his name on the ballot, in most of next year's primary races against Administration opponents.

title: SEALE TO BE FREED ON $25,000 BOND
description: CHICAGO, May 27 (AP)A Federal court granted bond to day to Bobby G. Seale pending his appeal of a fouryear con tempt sentence imposed during the Chicago conspiracy trial. It will permit him to be freed for the first time in almost two years.

title: Books of The Times
description: AMERICA, MC. Who Owns and Operates the United States. By Morton Mintz & Jerry S. Cohen. 424 pages. Dial. $10.

title: FAS COUNTER TRADES ARE BARRED BY S.E.C.
description: WASHINGTON, May 27The Securities and Exchange Com mission suspended trading to day in the stock of FAS Inter national, Inc., which had been suspended a week ago by the New York Stock Exchange.

title: 5 PEACE ACTIVISTS ASK AID ON TAXES
description: WASHINGTON, May 27 Five young peace activists are making an appeal for contribu tions to enable them to pay off a $15,000 debt to the Inter nal Revenue Service and avoid seizure of their automobiles and other property.

title: Screen: Films by Women
description: If anybody arrives from Mars and wants to know the who, why and what of Wom en's Lib, the Whitney Museum has a good, sturdy answer on the screen. This candidcam era documentary, titled The Woman's Film and running 45 minutes, is a ripe eyeful and earful of personal testi monies and interviews that brooks no nonsense and abso lutely no male interference. Assembled by a unit called Newsreel Films, this movie and three other entries com prise the new program at the Whitney Museum from female screen craftsmen. And no body said the weaker sex. So there.

title: LongHaired Policeman Sentenced by Department
description: John Bal, the longhaired po liceman formerly assigned to Central Park, has been found guilty of 12 charges of violat ing department rules.

title: Six Securities Dealers Are Expelled by N.A.S.D.
description: WASHINGTON, May 27 (UPI) The National Association of Securities Dealers today ex pelled six securities dealers and suspended three others for vari ous violations of rules.

title: Foreign Policy Association Elects 3 New Directors
description: The election of three new directors to the board of the Foreign Policy Association, 345 East 46th Street, was an nounced yesterday by William A. Lydgate, the board chair man.

title: BIG BOARD SCORED BY EXAMEX CHIEF
description: STORRS, Conn., May 27A former American Stock Ex change president said here to day that he had become con vinced that an overhaul in the policymaking structure of the New York Stock Exchange was long overdue.

title: Connecticut Acting on Phosphate Ban
description: HARTFORD, May 27 Con necticut's Department of Con sumer Protection today began planning ways to implement a state law passed earlier this week that bans all phosphates in detergents.

title: Hazards Cited in Rescuing Stranded IRT Passengers
description: Transit Authority officials said yesterday that they were forced to leave passengers for almost two hours in a disabled, smokefilled subway train under the East River Wednesday be cause of the difficulty and hazards of evacuating them, through several stalled trains and along the tracks.

title: Monmouth Invites Canonero
description: OCEANPORT, N. J., May 27 (UPI)  Canonero II, the Ken tucky Derby and Preakness winner, has been invited to run in the $100,000 Monmouth Handicap Aug. 7 at Monmouth Park.

title: InflationUnemployment Curb
description: President Nixon continues to hope that inflation will fade away and the economy return to something close to full employment before the 1972 election. But if the Administration does not adopt a more effective incomes policy to restrain excessive wage boosts and climbing prices, it is unlikely to achieve either full employment or a stable dollar.

title: ARBITRATOR DRAWS OFFBROADWAY PACT
description: An award in the labor dis pute between Off Broadway actors and producers was handed down Wednesday five, months after it was submitted to binding arbitration.

title: Suit by King Seeks Billion From I.O.S., Which Is Suing Him
description: John M. King, the Denver oil man and former chairman of the King Resources Company, filed suit in San Francisco yes terday against Investors Over seas Services, Ltd., and Robert L. Vesco, its 35yearold chair man, for more than $1billion. He is being represented by Melvin M. Belli, the California lawyer.

title: Job Crisis Afflicts ExConvicts
description: I'm not a good enough liar yet, but I'm getting bet ter ...

title: Ziegler Cards 8UnderPar 62 for 2Shot Edge in Thomas Memphis Golf
description: MEMPHIS, May 27 (AP) Larry Ziegler matched the best round on the pro tour this year with an eightunderpar 62 to day and took the firstround lead in the $175,000 Danny Thomas Memphis Golf Classic.

title: DAVIS CASE LAWYER KICKED BY MAGEE
description: SAN RAFAEL, Calif., May 27 Angela Davis's codefendant, Ruchell Magee, kicked and spat on his attorney today and called the new judge in the case a Ku Klux Klan man in disguise.

title: Subway Safety
description: The breakdown on Wednesday night of two Queens bound IRT subway trainsone inside the tunnel under the East River and the other between stationsonce again dramatizes the urgent necessity for improvement of the system's equipment and its emergency procedures. The tragedy of one death and scores of minor injuries resulting from smoke inhalation and exhaustion is one more reminder of the constant risk of disaster when mass transit deteriorates in both efficiency and safety.

title: Experts Think SST Of Russians Meets U.S. Noise Standard
description: PARIS, May 27The builders of the BritishFrench supersonic airliner Concorde conceded to day that their Soviet competitor was a quieter and cleaner air craft.

title: 661871 Wins in Jersey
description: WILLINGBORO, N. J., May 27 (AP)The week's winning number in the New Jersey state lottery, drawn here today, was 661871 and there were five winners of the $50,000 top prize. Lottery Commissioner Ralph Balch said the first six months of ticket sales totaled $60million, double the initial estimate for annual sales.

title: FOREIGN AFFAIRS
description: JERUSALEM Israel has now, skeptically and slowly, come around to the United States view that an in terim settlement of the Palestine war is both desirable and probably feasible and that such an interim settlement could logically be expected to pave the way for definitive peace.

title: CONTRACT AWARDS
description: The Lockheed Aircraft Cor poration has received a $123.6 million Navy contract for Posei don submarine ballistic missiles, it was announced yesterday. The amount is an addition to $120million awarded in July, 1970.

title: Tigers Beat Yanks, 43, as Lolich Notches 8th Victory
description: DETROIT, May 27  The Yankees concluded one of their worst trips in recent years to night by losing to Detroit, 43, at Tiger Stadium for their sev enth defeat in nine games since leaving New York eight days ago.

title: British Quietly Shifting Tactics in Drive on Ulster Terrorists
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, May 27The British Army, anx ious about a new phase of major guerrilla violence over the next few months, is quietly shifting tactics in the six coun ties of Northern Ireland.

title: Golf Writers Cite Borek
description: GROSSINGER, N. Y., May 27 (AP)Gene Borek, Metropoli tan and Long Island open champion, was honored tonight as metropolitan golfer of the year at the dinner of the Metropolitan Golf Writers As sociation.

title: COL. PARKER HITT, 93, CRYPTOLOGY EXPERT
description: Col. Parker Hitt, a pioneer American military cryptog rapher, died March 2 in Front Royal, Va., at the age of 93, according to word received here yesterday by David. Kahn, a friend and fellow cipher expert.

title: Wood, Field and Stream
description: Housewives are now won dering whether they should continue to serve their fami ly various species of fish believed or known to be mercurycontaminated.

title: MORTON REFUSES POWER PLAT STAY
description: WASHINGTON, May 27  Secretary of the Interior Rogers C. B. Morton declined today to call a moratorium on the con struction of power plants to meet the growing needs for electricity in Southwestern states.

title: Judge Chides U.S. and LTV on Okonite
description: Merger News

title: Scores of Notables Attend Preview of Kennedy Center
description: WASHINGTON, May 27 Only five days after the opening of L. B. J. West, Washington had its own titanic party tonight in a titanic building and more celebrities than could be taken in all together on the Potomac's banks.

title: ISIDOR SFINRAD, 77, EXH. & M. OFFICIAL
description: MIAMI BEACH, Fla., May 27 Isidor Spinrad, former chief accountant of the Board of Transportation and earlier of the Transit Commission in New York, died here yesterday. He was 77 years old.

title: German Trade Surplus Dips
description: WEISBADEN, West Ger many, May 27 (Reuters)West Germany's trade surplus nar rowed to 1.067billion marks in April from 1.885billion in March and 1.121billion in April, 1970, the Federal Statis tics Office reported today.

title: AUSTRALIA SEEKING PLANE BOMB HOAXER
description: SYDNEY, Australia, May 27 An extensive hunt is under way for the man who extorted $550, 000 from Qantas, the Australians international airline, in a bomb hoax yesterday.

title: Department Store Sales Up
description: WASHINGTON, May 27  The Department of Commerce reported today that department store sales for the week ended May 22 was an estimated $773, 000,000, an increase of II per cent above the $697,000,000 sales for the corresponding week last year. Total retail store sales for the week was an estimated $7,467,000,000, an increase of 6 per cent above the $7,069,000,000 for the same period last year.

title: Two Given 90 Days For Trying to Seize Computer at N.Y.U.
description: Two former faculty members at New York University were sentenced to 90 days in jail yesterday for the attempted seizure of a $3.5million com puter at the school last May.

title: Nuremberg Has Not FailedYet
description: MILWAUKEEBurke Marshall's positive assertion that the Nuremberg experiment has failed may he an understandable reaction of revulsion against the Mylai incident and frus tration at the Calley verdict. But to dismiss the principles of Nuremberg because of these feelings Is to invite a reversion to what, in the early years of this century, were regarded as ac ceptable legal doctrines concerning war.

title: U.S. Judge Orders Garrison to Stop Prosecuting Shaw
description: NEW ORLEANS, May 27 (UPI)A Federal judge ordered District Attorney Jim Garrison today to stop prosecuting Clay L. Shaw because Mr. Garrison had a significant financial in terest in continued prosecu tion and in his Kennedy assas sination investigation.

title: Angkor Shelling Laid to Foe
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, May 27 (Agence FrancePresse)A Vietcong officer who defected to the Cambodian Army said at a news conference here today that the historic temple at Ang kor had been damaged by Viet cong artillery.

title: What Must the University Be?
description: BERKELEY, Calif.It is already dif ficult to recall the very great esteem in which the university was held in all parts of the political spectrumif for diverse reasonsas recently as the midsixties. As with the university, so with America: The bitterness sug gested by Amerika is held by a minority, one gathers; but the enthu siasm that leapt from America! also seems less than a majority view.

title: Mariner Shot Tomorrow
description: WASHINGTON, May 27 (AP) The National Aeronautics and Space Administration re scheduled its planned Mariner spacecraft launching toward Mars for Saturday at 6:21 P.M.

title: Horn Music By Tillotson At Festival
description: A Late Spring Festival of Horn Music with Brooks Til lotson was the accurate title of the concert in Tully Hall Wednesday night.

title: Power Plants Resented in Colorado
description: DURANGO, Colo., May 27 We in Colorado won't stand idly by while our environment is damaged for the sake of people in Los Angeles.

title: KENNY IS GUARDED BY U.S. MARSHALS
description: NEWARK, May 27The Gov ernment's key witness in the extortionconspiracy trial in Federal Court here of nine Jer sey City and Hudson County leaders was placed this morn ing under the protective cus tody of United States mar shals.

title: U.S. Women Stand Vigil At Peace Talks in Paris
description: PARIS, May 27More than 100 American women whose husbands or sons are missing in action in Southeast Asia stood silently outside the building where peace in Vietnam was be ing discussed today.

title: Market Place: New Fund Aims For Tax Break
description: It is probably one of the more unusual investment ve hicles to reach Wall Street in some time.

title: Dollar Challenged
description: MUNICH, West Germany, May 27A high West German official said today that the de cision of his country and the Netherlands to stop supporting the dollar represented the first step in the creation of a new world monetary order.

title: Berlin Remains the Test
description: The NATO alliance could not in good conscience demand a solution of the Berlin problem as a condition for commencing negotiations with the Warsaw Pact on mutual and balanced force reductions in Europe. NATO has been proposing such talks unconditionally for three years and could be charged with bad faith if it now tried to link their beginning with a Berlin settlement.

title: Hope Lingers for Belmont Stakes OTB
description: Hope is still held out for a combined ontrackofftrack betting pool on the Belmont Stakes, but the odds are against it.

title: 2 Amendments on Perot Approved by Big Board
description: The New York Stock Ex change announced yesterday that its members had ap proved, by a vote of 720 to 98, two constitutional amend ments permitting H. Ross Perot and a group of his as sociates to receive indemni fication of a maximum of $15million in connection with the recapitalization of du Pont Glore Forgan, Inc.

title: Laverne Hanover Takes Dan Patch Pace Section
description: YONKERS, May 27  New York City, which is hardly in a position to afford it, lost $115.06 and $87.30 tonight as its share of place and minus pools in the $25,000 Dan Patch I tonight at Yonkers Raceway.

title: Front Page 2  No Title
description: EVERY WEEK, more than 26,000 Jobs are advertised in The New York Times. See the Employment. Columns today.Advt.

title: A Raid Against Freedom
description: A group of radical students made a destructive foray last month against the Stanford University hospital. Armed with a search warrant obtained from a municipal court, the Palo Alto police thereupon invaded the edi torial office of The Stanford Daily in order to gather photographic evidence of the disorders. Officers ran sacked the premises of the student newspaper, examined files, checked the content of desk drawers and even scrutinized the editor's personal correspondence. The newspaper, which is independent of the university, has now filed suit in Federal court, charging violation of the First, Fourth and Fourteenth Amendments.

title: Dispute in Wording Bill Blocks Compromise on Corona Homes
description: ALBANY, May 27Attempts to work out a compromise bill to save a group of Corona, Queens, homes threatened by a new high school were en meshed here today in a mixture of legalities and personalities.

title: Commodity Price Index Off 0.4 From WeekAgo Level
description: The commodity spot market price index of foodstuffs and industrial materials slipped to 108.4 from 108.8 last week.

title: Krulicki, 23, Quits Hockey
description: KITCHENER, Ontario, May 27 (AP)Jim Krulicki, 23year old Detroit Red Wing forward, announced his retirement from professional hockey today, say ing it was ruthless business and the fun is gone out of the game.

title: R.O.T.C. Officials Look to Small Colleges to Offset Cuts in East
description: MONTGOMERY, Ala., May 16  As prestigious Eastern universities are dropping their Reserve Officers Training Corps programs under strong student pressure, Alabama State Uni versity, a small, black institu tion, is preparing to open next fall for the first time a two year compulsory Air Force R.O.T.C. program.

title: Protest Mars Start of Final City Hall Budget, Hearing
description: Public hearings on the pro posed city budget, disrupted again briefly by Marxist demon strators, strators, ended yesterday with a somber warning by the City Council's Finance Committee chairman of an imminent dras tic cutback in essential jobs and services.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: James Reston is right onto bor row the newgeneration phrasein his explanation of the decline in popular support for education. Money is indeed secondary to philosophy.

title: Black Youths Vent Anger at Scene of Mississippi Girl's Slaying
description: DREW, Miss., May 27Until the night before last, this little cotton town was known mainly, and almost solely, as the home town of Mississippi's most fa mous football player.

title: FORGERY CHARGED TO JOB PLAN HEADS
description: CHICAGO, May 27Alderman Fred D. Hubbard, project direc tor of the Chicago Plan for Equal Opportunity, was charged today with forging a $20,009 check drawn on the plan's ac count.

title: Advertising:
description: Just seven years since its debut, VentureThe Trav eler's World Magazine, will fold. The announcement was made yesterday by Marvin C. Whatmore, president of Cowles Communications, which will be left with one con sumer magazine, Look.

title: Advertising:
description: In the biggest account move so far this quiet year, AlbertoCulver and N. W. Ayer & Son announced they are ending their fouryear relationship. Both agree that the billings involved are about $11million.

title: Curbs on Pep Pills Sought In Plan by Justice Agency
description: WASHINGTON, May 27The Justice Department moved to day to crack down on amphet aminetype of stimulants, drugs that are illicitly used by the hundreds of millions of doses in the United States each year.

title: Cliff Gorman Reflects on Role as Lenny
description: Lenny, the new Broad way play based on the life and work of the late, litigious Leny Bruce, seemed, before its opening Wednesday, to be headed on a Bruce course through the law courts. Ac cording to one of the show's aides, the afternoon before opening eight lawyers were closeted in various corners of the Brooks Atkinson Theater discussing possible legal ac tion.

title: Books of The Times
description: WEIRD AND TRAGIC SHORES. The Story Charles Francis Hall, Explorer. By Chaun cey C. Loomis. 367 pages. Knopf. $8.95.

title: Peekskill Police Fired On
description: PEEKSKILL, N.Y., Friday, May 28 (UPI)Four shots were fired at the Peekskill police headquarters late last night. There were no injuries and the police said no one had been arrested.

title: Occidental Petroleum Earnings For Quarter Are 64c a Share
description: The Occidental Petroleum Corporation announced yester day net income of $39,301,000, or 64 cents a share, for the first quarter of 1971.

title: Brass Society Performs Presidio 27
description: Richard Bunch, a 19year old soldier who was shot to death while attempting to es cape from a work detail at the San Francisco Presidio stockade in 1968, seems to have been a latterday Woz zeck. Mentally unable to function within a morally in sane system, he was inevita bly destroyed by it.

title: Nader Turns to Canada for First Time
description: OTTAWA, May 27  Ralph Nader, the consumer advocate, has turned his attention to Can ada for the first time, with mixed results.

title: Rozelle Feels Labor Discord Will Not Block Season's Start
description: Pete Rozelle, commissioner of the National Football League, declared yesterday that he was confident that the 1971 sea son will be played despite continuing labor problems be tween the players and the owners.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: It is with concern that I watch a newspaper which normally deals in truth and facts take such trouble to pervert both, in your battle to prevent a European aircraft entering the Unit ed States. [Editorial May 11.] Threats about the value to Europe of American tourists do not add subtlety to your case.

title: Wednesday's Fights
description: New York (Sunnyside Garden) Willie Burton, 191 pounds, New York, knocked out Charlie (Em peror) Harris, 218, Jersey City, N. J., 4 rounds.

title: House Team Asks Army to Cure Addicts
description: WASHINGTON, May 27A Congressional investigating team urged in a report made public today that the Army be required to identify and re habilitate the 26,000 to 39,000 American heroin addicts in South Vietnam before returning them to civilian life.

title: Okada Keeps Orient Title
description: UTSUNOMIYA, Japan, May 27 (AP)  The Orient junior featherweight champion, Koichi Okada of Japan, scored unanimous decision over a South Korean challenger, Park Chung, tonight. Okada weighed 121 pounds and Park 121.

title: Nixon Memorial Day Plea
description: WASHINGTON, May 27 (AP)  President Nixon asked the American people today to make Monday, Memorial Day, a prayer for permanent peace. In his annual Memorial Day proclamation, Mr. Nixon direct ed that the flag be flown at halfstaff throughout the day over all Federal properties and suggested II A.M., local time, as an appropriate hour for pub lic or private prayer in the na tion's communities.

title: Beck Files Action Under Chapter X; 2 Trustees Named
description: Beck Industries, Inc., the financially troubled operator of a diversified group of retail stores, filed a petition yester day for financial reorganization under the Chapter X provisions of the Federal Bankruptcy Act. The New, Yorkbased concern listed assets of $45,477,000 and liabilities of $58,775,000.

title: ExCongresswoman Set To Head Tariff Agency
description: WASHINGTON, May 27 President Nixon named for mer Republican Representative Catherine May Bedell today to be a member and new chairman of the Tariff Commission. The post pays $38,000 a year.

title: Newsboy Moriarty Tortured; Says Three Sought Millions
description: JERSEY CITY, May 27 Joseph (Newsboy) Moriarty, the former reputed Hudson County numbers kingpin, told, the police today that he was kidnapped, tortured and beaten last night in an attempt to force him to tell where he had hid den the rest of his millions.

title: Argentine Leader Reshuffles Cabinet
description: BUENOS AIRES, May 27  President Alejandro Agustin Lanusse, trapped between the increasingly angry and power ful forces of the military and labor, has abolished the Minis try of Economy and granted large pay raises to the lower ranks of the armed forces and police.

title: Notes on People
description: In keeping with plans to merge with Pembroke Col lege, its women's coordinate institution, Brown University has named Dr. Jacquelyn A. Mattfeld to the highest post ever to be held by a woman at an Ivy League university.

title: Chile Quickens Pace of State Ownership
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, May 27 Chile's leftwing Government has put new speed and harsh ness into its drive to extend state ownership over all import ant sectors of the private econ omy.

title: Copper Trading Halted in Heavy ProfitTaking
description: Profit taking following sharp price increases this month, caused such heavy selling of cotton futures yesterday, that a halt in trading was ordered at 11:42 A.M. Business was so confused when the market started to reopen at 1:30 P.M. that exchange officials decided thereafter to close again for the rest of the day.

title: AMEX PRICES OFF AS VOLUME DROPS
description: The American Stock Ex change finished lower yester day in much slower trading as institutional activity slackened.

title: Executive Changes
description: Fieldcrest Mills, Inc., has announced that F. W. Green, president of the Fieldcrest Divi sion and senior vice president of the com pany, has been named president and chief op erating officer of the parent company. Mr. Green was also elected a director. G. W. Moore who had been president continues as chairman and chief executive of ficer. D. M. Tracy, cor porate vice president and director of sales of the division, has been named to succeed Mr. Green. 0. G. Grubbs, vice presi dent and general sales manager of the Fieldcrest Division, was made di rector of sales and assumes the duties of Mr. Tracy.

title: Allred Wright Jr., an Editor For Sports Illustrated, Dead
description: SAGAPONUCK, L. I., May 27  Alfred Wright Jr., a senior editor of Sports Illustrated, died of a stroke at his home here early today. He was 55 years old.

title: STASIUK DROPPED AS FIXERS' COACH
